comment: Female, alone. Waited for 45 min, had a sign A5 - A7. Lots of local traffic, you might try and hitch to the A5 first and then find another ride.

name: Cighir Victor (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good place to hitchhike to Salzburg Graz and South Europe. If I were to go to Vienna one more time, I'd go to Nurnberg, then Passau and not through Salzburg.
great place to hike, we waited only 5 minutes ... went to vienna (A8)

name: SuperFreaky (Hitchwiki)
comment: Great place. There is a big bus stop and the cars could stop easily. Only think is, that thera are three lines. So some cars could not stop, because they have only a short time to see you. Next so the spot there is a traffic light, so many drivers see you.

actually it should be a perfect place, but for some reason, i stood there for 1,5 h. I recommend you to have a big sign (so the guys at the traffic light can see you). Lots of drivers apparently go to Rosenheim, my lift told me, so maybe rather write that on your sign than Salzburg. From there you can continue easily.

we stood there more than 1,5 h. we get than a lift to the next gasolinestation in
 holzkirchen

name: Kidp3 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited about 2hr30 mins with a "Vienna" sign on a Thursday afternoon. A few minutes after I started using a "Rosenheim", I got a ride to Salzburg.

name: Hagnesta (Hitchwiki)
comment: two guys, Waited 1h with a Salzburg Sign on 21.Dec, Sat. got a ride to a big Gas station near Rosenheim.

We stood there about 2hr 
than we get a lift to the next gasolinestation and there we get a lift after 5 minuter

Basicaly good spot, because cars see you and have space to stop. We were two people (m+w), and waited 1h30min on a Sunday morning with very low traffic. First used a Salzburg sign, then switched to a Rosenheim sign, which seemed to work better.

name: Arno Nuem (Hitchwiki)
comment: I live near salzburg and always when i want to get home from munich i use this spot. i think its a great spot. people are waiting at the traffic lights and see you long before they pass by you and when they do they are relatively slow. most of the times im not waiting longer than 15/30 minutes to get a ride

name: Yooks (Hitchwiki)
comment: This spot has been categorized as an "official hitchhiking spot" by Tramprennen.org. In my opinion it's a good spot and very easy to reach with public transportation. Take the U-Bahn line U2 to "Karl-Preis-Platz" then walk a few minutes to reach the spot.

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: perfect place! Got on a ride to the first gas station on the Autobahn and from there it was easy to to to Hungary!

name: Shaun 04 (Hitchwiki)
comment: With a sign to Salzburg, it still took 3hours to get a ride, and that wasn't even all the way. Arrived at spot around 12 noon. Maybe chances would be improved if you get there earlier.

name: Maxim1110 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Pointless. Stood with a sign "Rosenheim" for 2 hours on a Tuesday morning and then gave up and went to the first gas station on the Autobahn.

a BIG SIGN is good for the drivers to read at the traffic light Wed 1410, 1500 a driver stopped.
 Wanted Vienna, but he adviced and brought me to the Holzbrück petrol station. The driver drive fast if they had green, so have a big sign. The traffic itself is quite far from the bus, so again, a big sign. Much stopping space.

name: AdrianB (Hitchwiki)
comment: Was standing here in the bus stop today and after 1 MINUTE 2 guys took me to the A8 motorway around the 25th km stone, so I was on my way to Austria, Salzburg! :)
Right now not an option because of a construction site
An offer to Salzburg after 10 min, an offer to Kufstein (which were on my sign) after 15 min

name: Santa klaus (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited here on an Wednesday noon more than an hour trying to get a ride to Nürnberg or Augsburg. Ended up going to the next gas station in valley, which was worse because less traffic. Lot of international traffic, especially for the skiing season. Maybe a nice hop-off for far-way travels (Netherlands e. g.), although most of the cars are full.

name: Robbel (Hitchwiki)
comment: I asked my previous driver to drop me here. Then I made a sign for "Salzburg" and got a ride to this city in 10 minutes

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Hitched just before the roundabout in direction Munich, took only 10min for a ride to Nurnberg :)

name: Krassberd (Hitchwiki)
comment: tried to get south towards italy for 1,5 hours. It was school holiday time and it was Italy so I think we did average.

name: Mat (Hitchwiki)
comment: many traffic,cool place. 2 men at 8 am, waited around 30min  (with several short rides refuses) for a direct ride to Schladming (austria), perfect on our way to Graz, with a crazy italian driver.

name: GregGM (Hitchwiki)
comment: m+f, early August, afternoon. Many cars, big rest station. We were too lazy to walk around and just sat down and waved our sign. After around 30 minutes we got a ride to Salzburg.

name: Mochilero (Hitchwiki)
comment: If you're going towards Austria it's easy going. Took me not even 15mins to find a ride till Linz.

name: LaZubi (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Dont get dropped of here if u want to go further towards Munich!!!
If so, then dont wait at the petrol station. Go to the roundabout on the other side of the bridge.
If its late u can slepp here easily either in McD or in ur tent ;)
Amazing place. I went here two times. The first time, I was with my girlfriend and we got a ride to Budapest in 30min. Second time I got a ride to Ljubjana in 20min.

name: Railway (Hitchwiki)
comment:
J'ai essaye de faire du stop ici avec un carton MUNICH, j'ai arrete au bout d'une heure force de constate que personne ne pourrait s'arreter la...

I tried to hich-hick here with a sign MUNCHEN. I understood quicly it's a bad place and go to other place.

name: Longhaul (Hitchwiki)
comment: I hitchhiked from here to Köln; found a ride in about 15 minutes. This is a good spot! :)

name: Amauryfraise (Hitchwiki)
comment: Try to hitchike from here to koblenz (A61) for almost two hour, then change my plan and found easyly a ride to koln.....

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Long rides everywhere! :D
After 1 minute a Belgian car stopped and the friendly couple took me all the way to Antwerp, right where my bike stood. Thank you very much!

name: Quarim (Hitchwiki)
comment: No Problem to Cologne, hard to find someone to go on A48 to the West. Maybe you can find someone for A61 and change direction in Mendig for A48

name: Emanuele19956 (Hitchwiki)
comment: This place is not very busy... only few cars going by. It was worth the wait though and I got a direct ride to Amsterdam after 1 and a half hours.
just possible to go south...for going north no possibility to stop safely...

Wanted to go on A61 direction Koblenz on a saturday in May. Good place for cars to stop but they didn't stop. In the end people who walked in the nature park and parked over there took me away a little bit further on the A61.

name: Ilmer (Hitchwiki)
comment: Fuel station and restaurant with a reasonable amount of traffic (cars and trucks) stopping. Had to wait a bit for a reasonable ride but got a ride from here South to Stuttgart.
Saturday in May - good place to hitch heading south on A61. Had after 15 min a Dutch car all the way to Worms tankstation (near Mannheim).

name: IsntThatIllegal? (Hitchwiki)
comment: Stayed here overnight in July after arriving at dark.  Slept inside restaurant need the kids play area and none of the staff bothered me.  Hitched north towards Eindhoven in the morning. Took 1 hour. For anyone heading to Calais/UK I would suggest turning off onto the A4 West to Aachen - much easier to get to Antwerp etc this way.

IMO there's too little space for cars to stop here. Better option would be to walk back the road B19 300m towards Ulm to bus stop at the small crossroads. Most cars going towards München come from Ulm anyway.
Take bus no 58 from Ulm ZOB to get here.
schwierig Richtung Köln, perfekt für den Norden

name: Anninassi (Hitchwiki)
comment: did that 4 times until now. it's the perfect place. it's warm, nice music and you can ask the people personally

name: Flasher702 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Seems to mostly be people with full cars. I tried it for about an hour with no luck. On the upside it is warm and people are friendly. Try instead the road by the departure gates.

When I start from Mainz, I always take the train to the airport and ask people when they pay for parking. I found lifts in every direction on the A3 and A5 from here, but usually there are more people going direction Köln or Karlsruhe.
OK Spot, many drivers are already too fast though

name: Besto (Hitchwiki)
comment: Used to be the best spot in former times, but cars became faster, so they don't stop as easily anymore ...

name: Dorni (Hitchwiki)
comment: This spot is ok in the direction of Hannover, but not to Hamburg.

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: very good place with very nice drivers, they were very helpful. Took me 5 min asking the riders to take me south. Don't wait on the exit with the thumb up
Very good spot, we have waited for 20 minutes to get a ride to Munich.

name: Couleurmate (Hitchwiki)
comment: From there, a postcard panorama of the city !!
take a tram nr 5 to Rottenbauer or nr 3 to Athener Ring, get off at Berner Straße and walk for ca.25 min

name: Fverhart (Hitchwiki)
comment: Scenic and relaxed.

name: Ostkreuz (Hitchwiki)
comment: Found a ride to Arnhem (NL) in about 40 min on Tue morning in July.  The driver was going further onward to Amsterdam. Loads of Dutch drivers.

name: Dorearendil (Hitchwiki)
comment: Nice parking, plenty of space to walk around and speak to people. And the nice view as a cherry on the cake.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Should've waited longer for an even better ride I guess. Wonderful spot.
Got a ride to Pilsen in about 15 minutes. Not recommended if you're going to the north of Germany (e.g. Dresden/Berlin)

name: Emanuele19956 (Hitchwiki)
comment: got a ride to Frankfurt after 15 mins!

There's a desolate sitting area in the restaurant building (first one on the right after entering, the one with a TV and slot machines) with comfy, cushioned chairs which makes a great napping spot; only downside is that it closes for the night. Fell asleep with a "Nederland" sign in the early morning and got woken up by a driver who took me to a petrol station just before Bonn a few hours later. Nice and crowded spot for the other part.
nice place, but never try to go south to Stuttgart or similar. I had a hard walk and 8 hours waiting for not even a lift to the A81!

name: Joschi (Hitchwiki)
comment: Few cars take you to the highway. We accepted a lift to the Kaufpark at least to continue from there.

name: Mileagainst (Hitchwiki)
comment: Quite easy to find a ride to Kassel
I got a ride to Kassel in 10 min...
big ramp, even trucks can stop here. worth to go there
Good spot - took me 5 minutes for a car to Kassel.
1 min
Female, alone. Got a ride to Kassel in less than 1 minute.

name: Phidias81 (Hitchwiki)
comment: There is a traffic light, I just went asking people, and the first persona picked me up! He wa not going far, to the airport, but it was something
Perfect for direction west. For Hamburg get a car past Rostock because the first fuel station is Fuchsberg behind Rostock!

name: Naysayr (Hitchwiki)
comment: waited here for about 40 mins and gave up, the bus stop is not regularly used by local transport, so the location is perfect, but cars just didn't stop

name: Thebohemian (Hitchwiki)
comment: Indeed, this place looks perfect but a big deal of cars stay in the city. Just walk a few hundred meters along the Hansastrasse and wait near the McDonalds store.
Best place to leave Dresden direction West/South.

name: FlinkerElch (Hitchwiki)
comment: don't be afraid if there aren't many cars around the gas station...most of them will head west/south and can take you at least to Chemnitz.

name: Dr.Keith (Hitchwiki)
comment: A personal favorite because there is an apple tree right next to it!  There's space for cars to pull over, but they can only stop if there's nobody directly behind them, so don't use this spot in very heavy traffic.

name: Kovacspetyesz (Hitchwiki)
comment: okay, its a great spot, but cars can not stop easily

name: DasSchöneBiest (Hitchwiki)
comment: "Dreieck Kassel-Süd". The highway splits up here. It seems that more people go to the west on A44. Nevertheless there is much traffic so you will find a lift to the south with some patience.

The fuelstation has closed in southern direction(northern it's as it was). There is still a parking lot and I had luck with a truck driver, but, coming from Göttingen, you better ignore this station imho. (next on A7 is Hasselberg).

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Can confirm the above comment, our driver told us the same. If you come from the A44 it's better to get off at Bühleck.

name: Winnipeg01 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Generally ok if you want to catch a ride south but not ideal if you want to want to go west on the A44. Rather get out a station before..
More people to Bremen (A1) than to Hannover (A7) but there are so many cars that it's really easy to get anywhere.
Poor traffic on saturday evenings. Althought it was already dark and very few drivers I got a lift within 10 minutes towards Bremen

name: Pite (Hitchwiki)
comment: it wasn't that easy on sunday morning, but worked anyway. loved how easy to reach the place.

name: Paczix (Hitchwiki)
comment: We were here on Friday at 7 am. It's easy to reach by public transport. After 30 mins a woman offered us a ride to Bremen.

name: Onioncat (Hitchwiki)
comment: met another fellow HHer there, together we got a lift to Bremen-Cologne in 3 mins. M&F, working day, 3pm
Bad for going south via A7, most of the cars were on the way to Bremen. waited for 1,5h and gave up, I went to the Harburger Rasthof Bege which I feel like is a better spot to get a ride south.
Managed to get a lift south via A7 in about 20 Minutes for already two times. Also, Stillhorn ist very easy to reach. I like this spot a lot!
Couldn't get a ride there for about 2 hours, probably cause there isn't much space to stop a car, so i found my ride at IKEA parking lot, which is right next to that spot.

name: Santa klaus (Hitchwiki)
comment: Difficult to stop, but a lot of cars. Only place which worked for us towards Hamburg.

name: Wukk (Hitchwiki)
comment: best spot direction Hamburg. Hitched around 50x from that place and usually got a ride between 30 minutes.

name: Francesc4052 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Me and a buddy tried to hitch to Denmark border late afternoon for 2 hours but had no luck, tried agan the morning after, caught a ride after 1 hour and half to Hamburg 'cause we decided to try to go to the ferry.

name: Mileagainst (Hitchwiki)
comment: Well, it is officially illegal, but when you get to this spot then it seems perfect with lots of place for cars to stop and everyone is going to the highway direction north

name: Kai (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got just before dusk. Was very very hard to get a ride. Had to wait 2 hours to get a truck driver take me to Koblenz Hbf. The store with restrooms and a BurgerKing is opened 24/7 so waiting wasnt that much of a problem.

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: I waited 55 min for a lift onto the A48 direction to Trier.
direction dresden, i got after 30mins a lift to the service station "rüblingsheide" (50km outside of berlin).

name: Pite (Hitchwiki)
comment: saturday morning waited an hour and than decided to go back and take the train. low traffic and no cars going out from the city.

name: Bennet (Hitchwiki)
comment: got a lift to dresden after 20mins asking people

name: RWhite (Hitchwiki)
comment: maybe you'd try a boat hike? :)
haha cool joke.
Shouldn't be a joke - I'd have given someone a lift when I was there with boat.

name: MartiMarti (Hitchwiki)
comment: Less than 10 min for a direct ride to Amersfoort/Utrecht in the Nederlands (we were there with a Hannover sign). Amazing spot.

name: Nkdamn (Hitchwiki)
comment: Really amazing spot! Many trucks and cars going through petrol station. There's a good spot to hitching near the end of the station. You can get here by S-Buhn which is cheap, I guess. But after that remember to go from Michendorf S-Bahn Station to the bridge (highway A10) and walk under it. Then you have to walk around this station (there's a tiny path...) and here you are. In hitchhiker's heaven! ;)

name: Gagelmeister (Hitchwiki)
comment: Best spot! I just went to the fuel station right away to ask for people heading to Hannover - basically no waiting time!

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: I arrived on Wednesday about 10 am and waited 50 min for a lift direction to Hannover.
was asking almost every driver for a ride to hannover. finally catch one after 5 hours of asking. average spot for me.
Useless for going to the north (Rostock), cars go only to A2 and A9

Sunday Morning, around 10:00,
got a lift from the first car that passed.
If you walk a bit in the direction of the McDonnalds there is a lane where cars can stop

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: I waited 25 min for a car changing on the A2 to Hanover. I think there are more cars continuing on the A1 to Bremen.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Have a different experience: Needed to go to Münster, but first I got ride offers to Magdeburg, Hannover, Soest etc. If you need to hitch down the A2 the spot is perfect!

name: Paczix (Hitchwiki)
comment: It's a very good spot if you are going in direction of Hamburg.
First car I asked took me to Hamburg!

name: ManuelW (Hitchwiki)
comment: The first person I asked took me to Kassel!

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: many many cars going to hamburg/hannover but almost nobody going direction Berlin. Took me 1 hour to find 2 rides at the same time (for me and to my friends, 4 in total) to go to berlin.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Once again, ride offers to Hannover, Kassel, etc. before I found my ride direction Bremen. Small warning: I was standing at the end of the station and police stopped telling me I can't stand there. I think it's bullshit since he didn't reply to my question if it's illegal. Still be careful ;)

name: RuslanShchuchkin (Hitchwiki)
comment: We stopped there on our way from Paris to Berlin and got a car directly to Berlin after 45 minutes of waiting. The traffic was quite intense, a great stop and not hard to reach with transportation.

Please just note: To get to the gas station you have to cross (illegaly) a field. On rainy days (so was mine) you may look dirty and full of mud. Well, I had to change my clothes, otherwise nobody would have taken me :D

Why cross a field, when there´s a road to each side of the service-area? I saw also someone crossing the motorway by foot to go on the other side but there´s a tunnel a little bit south which you can easy reach by foot.

name: Matt567 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited for half an hour, not getting any lifts to the east. Then I got a lift all the way to Berlin. Theres a good flow of people and the staff are friendly enough. Could have waited here longer quite happily.

name: Redjo27 (Hitchwiki)
comment: One hour, then direct ride to Berlin

name: Zweifeln (Hitchwiki)
comment:
DO NOT TRY TO HITCH FROM HERE!
The gas station is permanently closed.
There shall be a new one around Ahmsen (a little further to Bielefeld) but I didn't find it on the map. (Maybe it isn't on OSM yet)

name: Willochrome (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was dropped off here from Munster as there is a campsite a very short distance away as you can see on the map. In the morning it took 2 hours to get a hitch to Berlin.

Instead of waiting at the busstop, where people look at you wierdly and you have to move often because of the coming buses, walk around the roundabout to the highway entry. there is a spot there the cars can stop. someone stopped for me there in 5mins after waiting 25 at the busstop.
mid july 2011, i waited 1 hour then had someone take me straight to Münich... definitely good spot

name: Robbel (Hitchwiki)
comment: HH spot direction Saarbrucken/south of Germany. Best to have sign
3 differents personns stops in 1h but not in my direction, then one lift to kaiserslautern, with a sign.
Lots of trucks, couldn't find a car with space or going the right direction. In the end the former car took me after they had dinner.

name: Peymora (Hitchwiki)
comment: August 2013 - Lots of holiday traffic (full cars). Many going to the Netherlands (Venlo crossing). Took me over an hour to find a ride to turn the corner towards Belgium (to gasstation at Aachen)

name: Fossilhitchhiker (Hitchwiki)
comment: good spot, was gone within 30 minutes, although the gasstationemployee told me that it was a bad spot 9some people even stood here 2 days) got a ride to tilburg, netherlands with lituanian trucker
Good place for going to the netherlands, took me 5 minutes, look for dutch cars!
Lots of Dutch, Belgian and British traffic going to vacation so you have to be lucky to get a car with space in it. Nice spot anyhow.

name: Xkomczax (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good spot, with one exception - Maastricht. There is almost impossible to find someone going to this city. I better went in the direction Liege and then in Belgium on A3 I switched on the gas station to the car going in the south-north direction (means trough Maastricht).

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very few Dutch cars stopping here (dec 2012), much less than I expected. Like said before, most were full too because they are returning from a vacation.
April 2013: A lot of cars with Belgian lincence plates (most of them with only one or two people in them). Got a direct lift to Antwerpen in no time.

name: Amauryfraise (Hitchwiki)
comment: may 2013 found a lift to belgium in 5 min on a wensday afternoon, not much traffic but still okay
after 1 hour, i got a ride with my friend on a sunny friday at 10:00 AM during the summer to bruxels.

name: Fverhart (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Easiest way to get to Maastricht is to find a driver going to Belgium or Eindhoven over the A76 in the Netherlands, then get out at A76 exit Geleen and hitch with sign Maastricht.

To get to Maastricht you can also find here any driver going to Heerlen-Eindhoven-Antwerpen, after crossing the border let the driver take the exit N281. Parallel road, the N281 has an exit Maastricht (with a petrol station at the beginning of the A79!). Then driver goes on on N281 towards his destination. This costs driver about 5 minutes extra driving time.

name: Huguerl (Hitchwiki)
comment: August 2016: Good spot, lots of trucks and cars passing by. After 30 minutes waiting I got a lift direct to Paris.
I wait there one hour and got a lift to Bruxelles thanks to a nice family
Saturday in May going to Stuttgart was really great. Got out of the car, asked the people next to us and they took me all the way to Lorch - so even futher than they had to go.
Wanted to go southwest (A5 dir. Freiburg) on Friday afternoon. 2 people, waited for approx. 3h. Most of the cars were driving north (dir. Bruchsal).

name: LaZubi (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Good place to go to Karlsruhe. Good also for north.
Was dropped of in the night, so I sept in my tent near the restaurant.
In the morning I slept in (I dont ask truck drivers to get a ride) so when I started asking people, I got a ride within 20 minutes in the morning at 8 am

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was with my girlfriend in the evening and we wanted to go north. After 40 min a guy took us near Frankfurt. I don't have problems asking truck drivers. Most of the people said that they were going south. I think they just say they're going to the other direction just to give an excuse to not give a ride to you
Only a few cars, and a long waiting time to go to Stuttgart
you can catch here only police, worst place to hitchhiking
not good, police told me to go to the truck lane. 3h for a lift to Breslau / Wroclaw

name: LaZubi (Hitchwiki)
comment: Police everywhere, just few cars stopping. Wanted to go to Wroclaw/Breslau but took the first car after 1 hour to get away from this place to get just some kilometers behind the border. Much better place there!!
good to get direction Erfurt... tuesday afternoon we met another HHer. we found a ride for all us 3 guys within 30minutes.
in august 2014 two girls; were easy to LEipzig, got a direct lift  =)

name: Jeltje (Hitchwiki)
comment: We just got out of our previous ride and we already found a new one, who brought us all the way to a gasstation near Osnabrück.

name: Resa (Hitchwiki)
comment: I managed to get a perfect lift from here all the wy to Hessen, after asking only a few drivers. I felt very lucky, because it was already after dark (winter - 6pm).

name: Cardinal (Hitchwiki)
comment:
We asked people for some 20 min til getting a rige directly to Leipzig.

On a Sunday evening there were much more cars heading South than towards Leipzig...

name: Quarim (Hitchwiki)
comment: I write this for the other side of the road. Easy for hitching south Frankfurt, Darmstadt, Karlsruhe. Harder to hitch to the West - Koblenz Trier and Average for hitching to Siegen or Cologne (North West)

name: European Ant (Hitchwiki)
comment:
bus takes nearly 1h
it was a sunday morning, which is probs why it took me 4h to get a ride
eventually got one til 100km before Leipzig
good place for going further the A4 heading Erfurt or further and even more cars which stopped to go north the A7 to Kassel
waited for <30min for a >300km ride.

name: Resa (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited on a Friday morning circa 30 mins. Got a ride by asking around next to the petrol station.
Good spot, got a lift to Münster within a short time of asking people at the parking slots.
Quite a steep ascent from the station though... (albeit the beautiful view over the dill valley)

name: DerZyklop (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not that much traffic at this place
Awesome place to start or get dropped off. Just ask people at the gas station if they go north or south.
Found a ride to Nürnberg from here, most people went to Würzberg or Heidelberg though

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride to the gas station on the Autobahn south of stuttgart. Took me 5 min asking. Don't wait on the exit with the thumb up
never try to hitchtike to direction Karlsruhe/Pforzheim from here!
It took me about one hour to take a car to Dortmund.

name: Wilhelmus (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride within a minute, to Jena (further East). Excellent place.

name: Maxim1110 (Hitchwiki)
comment: We waited about two hours to get a ride farther east (direction Leipzig), but it seems like a pretty good place, so we were probably just unlucky.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Still not that bad, there's some long distance traffic here because of the nearby Autohof.
Not too bad, but sometimes not too easy for vehicles to stiop on the ramp.

name: Rdoc101 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Better to go to the mcdonalds or gas station 100m to the north and ask for a ride as not much room for cars to pull over.

name: Platschi (Hitchwiki)
comment: well, there's some room if you walk up the ramp a few meters. just be aware of the trucks. in general, horrible on-ramp with lots of traffic but annoying construction design.

name: Bernardo (Hitchwiki)
comment: This is also the place to change cars if you're going south to A7 (Göttingen) via A39.

name: Chuckamuck (Hitchwiki)
comment: Tried to get a ride southwards to A7. Waited more than 2 hours. All people went westwards. At least I decided to leave the autobahn.
I waited about 25 minutes before getting a lift to A7 in direction of Göttingen.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: On weekends also ask Polish drivers  who are most likely returning to the Netherlands!

name: Kriechstrom (Hitchwiki)
comment: Plenty of traffic at the fuel station, recommended. Most dutch people go for the A30 but you can find lifts towards Cologne and Belgium as well.

name: Palihitcher (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good for getting in direction of Netherlands.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Don't understand the bad ratings... Stood with sign DD and got offered a ride to Wroclaw.

name: Koekjestrommel1 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Was looking for a ride to Nurnberg with a sign. Got offered a ride to Prague instead, so I just decided to go to Prague instead.

name: Housetier84 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Get a ride here quickly to DD Neustadt with a nice Couple

name: Kai (Hitchwiki)
comment: Had to wait 20min to get a great lift to Koblenz!

name: Schworze (Hitchwiki)
comment: perfect place to get out of dortmund. you can get pretty close to this station with the public transport
Stop there to go to the south and had to ask many people but it was only after 1h 40min that I got a ride. An other guy just stand there with the thump out and get a car 5min before.

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: I had to wait 85 min to get a lift into Cologne.

name: Paczix (Hitchwiki)
comment: We were here by accident, going to Netherlands, but this is definietely not a good spot to go to Netherlands. But apart from that it's a good spot, it has restaurant, big parking and petrol station and a lot of traffic.
Nice place to Koln
Extremely good spot if you want to get to Cologne but it is difficult to get a lift to A45 and Frankfurt.

name: Miercoles.mittwoch (Hitchwiki)
comment: very good spot in my opinion because there's a burger king restaurant - lots of cars during lunch time

This is a great spot to get out of Cologne, and it’s directly at the Autobahn already! Going through the forest takes a bit longer than you imagine, also on the way there are signs to not veer off the path because there are military leftovers. The station is directly at the path so that’s no problem. Climbing the fence is a bit tricky because it’s pointy, but if you walk past the station there is a spot where a tree is bent over the fence (maybe not anymore).

name: Fraughtwithsounds (Hitchwiki)
comment: How to get there from Berlin: Take S-train 5 in direction "Strausberg Bhf" Get off the train at "Hoppegarten". Continue with bus 944 in direction "Altlandsberg, Nord" Get off the bus at "Umspannwerk Neuenhagen" Cross the street, walk along the highway and circle the fence of the gas station until you see a metal door. It shouldn't be locked (Nov 2012).

Easy enough to get to, metal door still unlocked. Great to go to Szczecin or to enter Berlin, difficult to go to Hamburg. I ended up hitching towards the busy parking area at 52.676760, 13.394251, a great spot to go north.
Not that much traffic. Most of it goes up to Rügen.

if you want to go in direction kiel, its even better to go here than to the petrol-station "holmmoor". stood here approx. 70 times and always got a ride. even in a foggy night!

also good to go in direction hamburg!
HAVE A SIGN WITH YOU

name: Bikepunk (Hitchwiki)
comment: I got a ride to Salzburg in less than 5 minutes !

name: Longhaul (Hitchwiki)
comment:
I hitchhiked towards Nürnberg from here in a foggy October night, around 01h00 in the morning. I found a ride in about 30 minutes.

From the very same place, Vaterstetten, but from the other side of the road, I hitchhiked towards Salzburg/Innsbruck during daytime in the afternoon and I found a ride in about 2 hours. I got here around 14h30 and I left around 16h30.

Globally, my rating for Vaterstetten is "Good" ;)
Don't wait at the road. Go to the nearby gas station and ask people directly. You have to get at least past Landsberg to the next gas station.
first guy i asked gave me a lift to zurich. lucky me:)

name: Hydra supertramp (Hitchwiki)
comment: Definitely a good place! The first car took us past Landsberg, from there we found someone getting us directly into Lindau. Equally easy for getting into Switzerland.

name: Ada.pernik (Hitchwiki)
comment: We were waiting next to the gas station, because of it was closed. And we caught ride to some gas station on the highway, where we caught ride to Lindau.

name: AdrianB (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was hitchhiking on the corner with a big LINDAU sign and after 10 minutes a girl took me to the road 96, Landsberg rast station!

name: Dynamo (Hitchwiki)
comment:
From Lahmburger Straße you have to walk 10 minutes uphill. Better is the bus station "Haarhausen" with bus 618. (only 5 minutes to walk)
Got directly a ride to the next rast station Lichtendorf (sunday).

name: Onefinger (Hitchwiki)
comment: On that spot you can also change the side of the highway if you need so. (Throught the graveyard and under the highway). This is very useful in this part of Germany where the highway density is so high.
Tried to hitchhike north (Hamburg) two times and had to wait more than one hour. If you want change to A1 maybe you can manage to get to the first parking place on A1 (10km from this spot).

I got there by the evening, shortly before the dark. The spot itself is good - cars go slow, there is a place to hide from the rain too. Traffic was not too good, very few cars. Got a lift within one hour.

name: Jeny (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride within 5 minutes! It's an easy spot to get to from the centre of Aachen.
most traffic is local...

name: Santa klaus (Hitchwiki)
comment: Okay for going west - Braunschweig, Hannover... Not too much traffic here though.

came here a tuesday at 7.30 am. Not too much traffic. Most of the drivers go far  from here. Shouldn´t be thatt hard to find someone to Hannover (to "Leehrter See" Service Station, where you can swith to the A7). Some drivers even go further to Holland. A lot of Polish and Dutch Drivers here.

name: Erick.blanchard (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very good place lot of space to pull out and lot of trafic going slowly

name: Chimbo (Hitchwiki)
comment:
[to go to the west]:
Not a bad pleace - actually there are lso works on the streets, so the hole traffic is very slowly - but in feb 13 there were very very few cars leaving the parking place (although its big) - better in the city at the street going to the autobahn!

name: (Hitchwiki)
comment:
it was a sunday. i tried to go to dijon or to limoges
didnt work at all. just in the very afternoon i found someone to paris. but that was not south.
so it was a bad day...
The place looks quite OK, but we waited 4h here (after waiting no more than 15min for our last 3 lifts)

name: SuperRoger (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good looking place but it isn´t, a lot of local traffic.Few cars going far.I tried it 2 times...Best option is  going to Metz.. Maybe its the better option to use the GasStation at Metzer Strasse..

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: Little traffic, but immediately found a lift to next service area Longeville.
Terribly little traffic in either direction and mostly local, ended up taking local on-ramps to hop exits to the nearest highway rest areas

name: Bohua (Hitchwiki)
comment: i was kind of lucky to get something, 'cause the polish guys didn't dare to ask neither to look. i got a ride, after this, but just for a couple of kms, till the next petrol station. anyway, heaps loads of cars and trucks going over. If you get a ride, and need to goo further than Magdeburg, this station is better than the next one, that is a little bit out of the way. this is just straight on the highway.
I often hitchike from here going to Denmark, its a good spot. I normally wait between 15 minutes and 40 minutes..
Direction Hamburk , waited 1 minute then 2 ladies in a van came and took me halfway to Hamburk dropped onto gas station :)
Wednesday Afternoon 1 person: 30 min to get a ride towards Rostock. There is a lot of city trafic, but a lot of people are going further.

name: Soshial (Hitchwiki)
comment: I tried to hitchhike to Munchen on a weekday at 17:00 for 75 minutes. There was A LOT of traffic but very few cars had Munchen plates. 3 cars stopped, but niether went even in the direction of Munchen. Then, I just went and took a bus to Munchen for 8 euros.

I tried it on a friday, 15:00. Destination: Muenchen. Lots of cars, most of the with number plates of Stuttgart, Esslingen, Waiblingen. I had to waite 1,5 h, but the person that finally picked me up said, that this is the point where she always passes driving to Muenchen.

name: CrazyKenny (Hitchwiki)
comment: nah... waited 45mins for a lift to A4 west, even though I had a sign. Not a good place for cars to stop, except when traffic light is red ^^
through the week, in the morning ~0900, standing on the B248, direction A2/A39, after like 10min a buisnessman picked us (2) up

place yourself with a sign at the exit of the gasstation, so you'll process the fueled cars and the ones passing by; especially for those not in this askingtaining mood - there's enough space for the third, the waiting row

name: Dunia (Hitchwiki)
comment: To my luck, saw a polish cargo car there as soon as I arrived. Waved with my "Hamburg/Denmark" cardboard and he took me to HH. There is much more local traffic usually though.
About one month ago (Nov. '11) I tried to hitchhike from here but there was a building site so the cars couldn't stop there.

name: Annieant (Hitchwiki)
comment: Had a sign "Hanover - A1" and managed to be picked up fairly quickly and dropped off in Melle.

name: GuterMensch (Hitchwiki)
comment: I never waited longer than maybe half an hour. In my opinion, it's the best place to get south from Düsseldorf.

name: Schworze (Hitchwiki)
comment: what to say about a raststätte? always the perfect spot to hitchike
maybe i was unfortunate, mostly found people going on to the A1, but still found a ride on the A3 pretty fast.

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: A girl took me and my friend after 10-15 min waiting on a sunny summer day up to karlsruhe

name: Paczix (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very good spot if you are going in direction of Frankfurt. We found two dutch boys on a parking who took us to petrol station close to Stuttgart.

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: went just to köln. The guy left me close to the entrance/exit of the autobahn in the traffic lights and the i found a ride directly to frankfurt after 5 min. I was with another girl. We met 2 guys also doing hitchhiking there. They said they were waiting for 3 hours (i don't know if it was true)

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: got a ride to stuttgart. Asking the drivers took me 3 min to find a ride. Normally it took me 20 min when I was waiting at the exit with the thumb up

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: got a ride to Karlsruhe in 20 min after asking people at the gas station
Took me 15min of actively approaching drivers to find a ride on a sunny friday.

This is the best place If you wanna go north (Lübeck, Kiel) or east towards Berlin. Alone I never waited longer than 20 min. Best spot is directly before the circle starts. There is a bus station which allows rides to pull over without interrupting the traffic. I recommend using a sign.
Awesome messages from other hitchhikers on a pillar... I wrote mine and a car stops. Life is great...

name: MartiMarti (Hitchwiki)
comment: Awesome spot. I got a drive till the center of Berlin. Using sign recommended!

name: Ulrik (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Waited for 1 minutes or less, i didn't even had time to put up my sign!
Got a ride halfway to Berlin to a truck-stop where it what easy to g
et a ride for the final part.

I prefer the spot right beside the traffic light (the one before you enter the highway). So you can get into the car when they are waiting for green or some times they stop at the beginning of the autobahn. I recommend to use a sign. Usually I have a sign with a close destination to get to the next truckstop on highway and look there for another ride.

name: Kriechstrom (Hitchwiki)
comment: Always easy to get a ride from here. Recommended.

name: Bernardo (Hitchwiki)
comment: There's no gas-station at this place, that's why I avoid it and, going East, rather choose Eichelborn, which is between Erfurt and Weimar.

Many drivers are using the restaurant and burger king to take a meal or a coffee before they go again on their travel to directions berlin (a9) or dresden (a4). good station at daytime, forget it at nighttime.

i also got good experiences (5 to 60 minutes) for Berlin and Dresden

bad place for Munich - for munich. i would plan a long time of walking to the service station hermsdorfer kreuz (3km)
Been there on a saturday afternoon and waited for about 40 minutes to get a lift to dresden ! Almost no cars where passing through...no gas station !!!

name: Tigerente (Hitchwiki)
comment: almost no cars....!

name: Bence16 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Me and my gf wanted to go to Berlin (A9) but had to wait like 2hours 30mins on a sunday morning (7am- 10:30am). No gas station here.

name: Lukas (Hitchwiki)
comment: Most of the traffic goes either north or south on the A9 took me 30 min to find somebody who could take me past the Hermsdorfer Kreuz. The people in the Café are really friendly though. I stayed there for the night and they didn't bother me when I was sleeping with my sleepingbag inside on the chairs. So good job.
i waite here 45min until i had a lift to Chemnitz,

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not that much cars, but still a reasonable place to find a last long ride into the Netherlands.

name: Jeltje (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good for a ride into the Netherlands, even two cars at the same time who offered us a ride.
really few cars

name: Brunolimaam (Hitchwiki)
comment: There were only a few cars but a lot of LKW's (trucks). it was dark and i asked only cars, it took me 4 hours to find a ride straight to amsterdam, but i got offered 2 for cities in between.

Reconstruction work (August 2012), cars are not really willing to stop (first thing) because they are just able to pick you up if they are driving into kentucky fried chicken (very small entrance and not easy to realize that quickly especially when drivers are on the left lane ) and secondly mainly local traffic...

name: AdrianB (Hitchwiki)
comment: yes, they are working on the road, so pretty hard to hitchhike there. I was lucky on the 14th of August (2012). because at that day they were just doing the other side YET. I got a ride in 1.5 hour, it was a 220 km long ride. :)

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: On November 2012 they almost finished the construction. When I got there the first car from the first green light stopped for me, less than 30 seconds waiting!!!

name: AdrianB (Hitchwiki)
comment: I got a ride to Raststatte Denkendorf after 25 minutes, again! :) Great place, traffic goes slowly!
have a sign with you! way much easier then there. we've been three guys in a costume and it took us 20 minutes till we got o ride to dresden. good spot!

name: Rumpel2116 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Perfect to get into the city center, save some money for the bus

name: Platschi (Hitchwiki)
comment: Though there is a lot of traffic, and a lot of space for cars to stop (just behind the bridge or arond the corner, whatever one prefers), people seem not to be too friendly over here to stop. Dozens of times hitched here, a lot of times waited >30 min

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Still the best option eastbound I guess.
I wait there on a Monday from 10:00 to 13:00 a clock. There i find no lift to the east
takes a bit to get out there but reliable take off point

name: Santa klaus (Hitchwiki)
comment: takes a while to get there, but nice point. Walk is through nice nature as well...

name: EggDestroyer (Hitchwiki)
comment: Really an excellent spot !
A lot of people going only to Hildesheim or Göttingen, but in the end got a ride more south.

name: Alexan (Hitchwiki)
comment: great spot and sescription.exactly 30 min walking. thank you

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Great for rides south or north on the A7 (Hamburg!), but a bit harder to get onto the A2.
used this spot 3 times hitching both north and south! great spot!
have been waiting here a long time. few cars stop. many leave the autobahn few km behind the border.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not that many cars here, but then again there was almost nobody on the highway neither. I do believe this is a good spot because it's already in Germany so cheaper fuel. We decided to hitch cars on the highway too, but  managed to get a ride to Zgorzelec (PL) from the gas station after a little over half an hour.
took almost 5 hours for a ride to Oldenburg but it was mainly because their where 6 other hitchhikers

name: Propek (Hitchwiki)
comment: Difficult to hitchhike. Lots of hitchhikers, you will usually meet someone, you need luck beacause traffic is small and cars are usually going somewhere in near.

The worst one so far ( im Ctualy in latvia already done all the way from london to her ) 10h waiting only few cars alot of bus and truck , most of them dont car ! To finaly have a truck driver who toke me but wass leaving nest days at 4am , so he let me spend the night in the cabin ! Really nice guy !

name: Marouan ben (Hitchwiki)
comment: Same here , previous message mine too !
bad point to get to the A14 diriction wismar. best expiriensces with taking the B106 (next exit A24 direction Hamburg) crossing schwerin.

name: ZulZul (Hitchwiki)
comment: A lot of cars going south to Bavaria or west to the Frankfurt area.

name: Guidoz (Hitchwiki)
comment: Many cars and trucks stop. I got a lift almost all the way to Munich from here.

name: Kriechstrom (Hitchwiki)
comment: Lots of cars going long distances towards south and west.

name: CuleXus (Hitchwiki)
comment: Quite a nice spot for going north or east. There is a bus stop where drivers can pull over safely. Waited 15 min

name: Dynamo (Hitchwiki)
comment: Sehr guter Spot! Bin oft von Haltestelle Hellerberge nach Berlin gefahren und habe meist nicht länger als 30 Minuten gebraucht.

name: DerSchnecke (Hitchwiki)
comment: we (female-male) waited for 45 minutes to get a lift to görlitz/poland. i think its smarter to get off the bus a few stations earlier and ask people directly at the gas stations, that are also at thies road
To Berlin is this a very good place... did it three times and always got a lift
Best place for going to the direction of Berlin!

February, was cold. Standing just like that. You have no one to ask, but just standing. I got a ride to Bautzen (on the way to Wroclaw) fast. In 15min someone stopped. But I still would consider hiking from the shell station (more back in the city) better.
Regards, Lukas

name: Onioncat (Hitchwiki)
comment: 1 hour 20 min waiting in the evening time 20.00-21.20 for a lone female.

i (female) went in july, friday morning around 9 or 10 to poland. had a "görlitz"-sign and waited for 1 hour til someone stopped and brought me to a big gas station.
still a very good spot. maybe it's better to have a sign saying only "east"?

name: LaZubi (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good spot. Got a sign "A4 Poland" and got a ride to the german-polish border within 10 minutes.

name: Tutus (Hitchwiki)
comment: I recommend this spot. Cars are going slowly because of lights and the traffic is huge. Easy way to get into motorway. For a couple 5min
To Leipzig, was Easy, cause people can stop at bus stop....5-10 min waiting..

name: Kili (Hitchwiki)
comment: The main problem here is that cars go too fast and there is almost no place for them to stop, unless you only ask gas station drivers (there were too few when I hitched). But eventually you should get a ride.

name: Lukas (Hitchwiki)
comment: They have cardboard and markers if needed.

the first time I hitchhiked from here it took me about 1 1/2 houres to get a ride, but only because eventually I stepped onto the road to stop a car to take me to the next filling station along the A3. The two other times were much better, had to wait about half an houre each time.

name: Gareth SA (Hitchwiki)
comment: I followed the instruction on the main page for Cologne and caught the Tram U9 to Königsforst, then after looking at the map at the train station there walked about 1km to the onramp, found an ok place to hitch from and held up a sign for the Siegburg Bahnhof - only later did I realise my error, I should have written Siegburg Raststätte, to get dropped off at the rest stop about 15km south along the A3. I was dropped off in the Middle of Siegburg and had to walk the 3-4km through the town to get to the rest stop.
Good spot, started early in the morning, waited 25 minutes to get a ride to Raststätte Siegburg. We put "A3 Rasthof" on our sign.

name: The hydrA (Hitchwiki)
comment: This is simply the best spot available eastwards. It might seem tricky if you want to hitch towards Berlin, but it will work out, eventually. Stay along the A2, it's worth it!

If youre heading Berlin first ask for getting out of this area because a lot of people will leave the road soon. Later it is much more easier to find a lift to Berlin or Hannover. For Hamburg get off "Hannover Garbsen"
Great place for a lift to the east.  Got a lift all the way to Warsaw

name: Agatalech (Hitchwiki)
comment: awesome place, I couldnt get there, but when i found stairs to this station i took me 5 minutes to get out from there. I asked first polish lorry, and went straight to Poland :)
asked for a lift to Hamburg, the third car took me directly there

name: Matt567 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a lift to Ham after about 30 minutes of asking people at the door. Many people were going north (or atleast said they were). Lots of people moving through.
We wanted to go to Hannover and we were in 3 ppl, maybe that's why it took us more than 3 hours to find a car going there

name: Maxdubi (Hitchwiki)
comment: I also say for the ppl going eastwards: Stay on the A2!!!

name: Prino (Hitchwiki)
comment: This Raststaette is only useful for getting northbound rides.
it`s realy got for getting to direction nürnberg. much harder to regensburg
I had a different experience. Waited about 30mins and then got a ride towards Regensburg instead of Nurnberg where I was going with my panel.

name: Schworze (Hitchwiki)
comment: perfect spot for hiking nord. you can get there either by foot from eching or you take the bus from eching to fürholzen (but the bus is very unfrequent).

name: Pablo.gelato (Hitchwiki)
comment: good place, got there by hitchhiking to Günzenhausen from Karl-Käsmeier-Straße which is close to S-Bahn station "Eching"

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: a bit difficult to get there on a sunday (there is no bus to fürholzen from eching on the weekends). We started to walk to the gas station and a woman took us to the gas station. It's very big and a lot of people stopped for us but we wanted to get a ride for a long distance direction frankfurt after the oktoberfest but the maximum that we got was to nurmberg.

name: Tomasmarc (Hitchwiki)
comment: A bit difficult to get there (I personally walked 6 km or more from Eching, asking people on the way for directions), but a perfect place with lots of traffic towards Nurnberg, Regensburg and even Prague. Waited for 20 mins and then this former-punk Czech guy with a van stopped for me.

name: Thejourneyramino (Hitchwiki)
comment: We were heading towards Czech Republic - got a ride in 10min - asked just the second car...
august 2014; we were heading to Berlin and waited 20 min; losts of cars heading towards the North or North West.

name: Martinsltopf (Hitchwiki)
comment: A lot of cars from Denmark, Netherlands and northern Germany here.
10 minutes to Regensburg.
Under construction at the time (January 2017). See http://maps.rast.de/?location=cTVnehLvJ1bt9lkjTlpQ5vqboE8 for details.

This is a great spot to get out of Cologne, and it’s directly at the Autobahn already! Going through the forest takes a bit longer than you imagine, also on the way there are signs to not veer off the path because there are military leftovers. The station is directly at the path so that’s no problem. Climbing the fence is a bit tricky because it’s pointy, but if you walk past the station there is a spot where a tree is bent over the fence (maybe not anymore).
we used this spot around 3 or 4 times now and it seems to be the best spot to get out of cologne in the direction of frankfurt/south. really really can recommend it!
very busy place, found a Polish guy willing to take me to Frankfurt after around 30min.

name: Fverhart (Hitchwiki)
comment: Finding a lift to Frankfurt and Aachen took my patience at these petrol stations!
we waited for ten minutes at the road onto the highway, then went to the trafficlight and somebody directly picked us up. its still hard for cars to stop.
we waited at the traffic lightswith a sign to go düsseldorf. took only 30 min until we got a ride. still hard to stop for cars.

I can highly recommend this place, especially if you're only one person and/or have light luggage. I waited 30 minutes at the traffic light with a sign to go to A1 in the direction Wuppertal. True, it's hard for cars to stop but a lot of cars stop at the traffic light anyway, so you can ask the drivers.

name: Radu122 (Hitchwiki)
comment: When I was on the S-Bahn, I saw 2 other hikers in this spot, when I arrived in 5 minutes they were gone. Unfortunately for me it didn't go that well, I used a sign that said "Hamburg", then switched to just using my finger - then several cars stopped and offered me rides close by, such as Düsseldorf and Dortmund. Waited about 1h 1/2 - 2h before I quit.
Waited for about 10/15 minutes before a car stopped that brought me to Bremen.

name: Platschi (Hitchwiki)
comment: Rebuilding of the ramp resulted in even worse possibility for cars to stop, but they do nevertheless. Good for Rheine and further.

name: Platschi (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got straight rides to Aarhus (DK), Vilnius (LT) and literally everywhere in Poland from here.

name: Yayael (Hitchwiki)
comment: waited here for 3 hours with no traffic whats so ever. Finally lucked out with a ride straight to berlin, don't know if i can recommend it because i don't know how often those miracle rides happen, even though we know pretty often... :)

name: Maxim1110 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Didn't expect this place to be very good, but it was better than we expected. Even though there's no gas station and just a small restaurant there are least about 4-5 cars every 10 minutes. Took us about 30-40 minutes to find a ride all the way to Berlin eventually.

name: Mrm1985 (Hitchwiki)
comment: no service station, restaurant closes at 9pm - you don't want to get here late.
Many cars go to Poland but they are terribly full or dont want to take you along

name: Longhaul (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was heading to Wroclaw and found a ride in 10 minutes.

name: Ans (Hitchwiki)
comment: The place is called "Rastplatz Oberlausitz" (South). Perfect for Poland. Ask Polish drivers first. On my way to Krakow, I only had to ask one Polish driver and got a lift to Wroclaw (but left the car at MOP Krasnik Dolny because it's the biggest truck parking before Wroclaw). It was 5:30 in the morning.

name: Nyca (Hitchwiki)
comment: Except sundays, many Polish truck drivers stop here on their way east.

name: Dynamo (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got direct lift to Wroclaw. (2 people)
got lift to wroclaw directly to the center for 3 people within 1h. just ask the drivers at the gas station or the parking lots

name: Dynamo (Hitchwiki)
comment: I hitchhiked twice from this place. First time to Wroclaw (10 min) and second time to Görlitz (20 minutes). Both times I asked at the fuel station.

name: Hydra supertramp (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Depending on your direction it's a pretty good place to either get to Mannheim or North towards Frankfurt.
I tried making it to France (via K'lautern and Saarbrücken) and failed miserably. I definitely wouldn't recommend hitching from here, but rather trying to get south on the A5 towards Strasbourg, that worked fine.

name: Zenit (Hitchwiki)
comment: not much stopping space... but it's germany, bitches!

name: Micho (Hitchwiki)
comment: People do not see this little stopping space from their cars even when they stay on the red light, because it is a little bit higher than both streets are.I recommend to stay on  traffic lights, then if someone want to take you, he will just stop on the Mannheimer Strasse.

name: Davies (Hitchwiki)
comment: Seems like a poor place, especially as the traffic light system is so damn efficient meaning the cars generally flow through. But you shouldn't be waiting more than an hour for a lift.

name: Quarim (Hitchwiki)
comment: traffic to frankfurt or würzburg. good spot

very good spot to go south - lots of cars, surprisingly many scandinavian tourists (july 2013). Not so good to go east, although the intersection with the a4 is close almost noone is going there. waited for about 2hrs before a local took me to kirchheimer dreieck (from there it was really easy)
good to north and south, to the east i needed 15 minutes, you can change your direction very easily

name: Emanuele19956 (Hitchwiki)
comment: I asked people around the gas station and got a ride to Wurzburg pretty easily!

name: Mileagainst (Hitchwiki)
comment: Lots of local transport, gas station is not so busy, but there is a traffic light before it where you can also ask the drivers. It took a bit more time, other than that it's ok place
good spot to go south! ask people at the gas station, but cars can stop at the roadside as well.

name: Grinsolt (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good stop to anywhere... you can stand right next to the gas station, so you can ask drivers while hitching with your thumb. Best Spot in Flensburg!

name: Daemmi (Hitchwiki)
comment: In direction of Hamburg you could also use a Rendsburg sign. Before Rendsburg is the first petrol station and there are a lot of cars going to Hamburg and further or even Berlin!

Easily one of the worst locations I've ever waited at. Nobody seemed interested to pick you up. The station also doesn't get much traffic. A local car every few minutes on a Saturday afternoon.

One guy who passed by and smiled returned 15 min later and stopped and said that he never had any luck there and recommended to walk a few 100 meters further on to stand by the traffic light, where he eventually always had success.

We gave up as Flensburg was just so demotivating after coming for a great HH country (Denmark).

name: Lachim (Hitchwiki)
comment:
First of all - it was Sunday 28.04, 8:30am (so no commuters, no lorries), I was traveling with a girl. 
We were trying to find a lift to first gas station on A30 towards Hannover (name: Grönegau). None out of ca. 40 asked drivers were heading toward that direction, most of them were going to the north. 
Finally, a reeealy nice guy had changed his route specially for us and went 140 km out of his way (precisely: went 280 km instead of 140 km) and dropped us before Hanover. Thank's God for him!

name: Qrisss (Hitchwiki)
comment: You don´t wanna even try to hitchhike towards Bielefeld or Hannover. Every drivers stays on the A1. Best solution: hitchhike back to Hamm and then follow the A2.

name: Pawel.wita (Hitchwiki)
comment: So I confirm that it's hard, but not immposible. It just takes more time than usually.

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: It was a sunny day, easter holiday (not so much traffic) at around 16:00. I asked the first couple at the door of the restaurant and they took me. It depends on your luck
even to find a ride inside to osnabrück was very hard ! even that it was RUSH HOUR -:. was so hard to get from there to find a way to osnabrück

name: Maxdubi (Hitchwiki)
comment: Wanted to go (Me+girl) to Berlin (over Hannover) on a Tuesday 15:00. Waited 3 h. Then changed plans to Hamburg because everyone was driving there and waited till 20:00. Then we sadly drove back (over Osnabrück) to Essen. Really bad for East over Hannover. Definitely okay for further north.
waited for 40min to get a ride to Osnabrück.
Huge gas-station/rest area with loads of cars. Cars from Germany/Holland/Belgium to be found here. Don't get lost on this one :)

name: RedFox (Hitchwiki)
comment: Stopped twice here going north, always found a ride easily.
Quite good spot, even on quiet days. Girl alone took me around 20-30 minutes. Both asking people and just standing around with a sign.

name: (Hitchwiki)
comment: first car hit to hannover (a27 south)

name: (Hitchwiki)
comment: I experienced very much local traffic [north-south] on a Sunday and decided to change the spot.
hitchhiked towards Belgium twice from here. both times, I found cars pretty fast!

To get there you need to ask people around, it's a bit mess with a roads liding there. It is a big parking+cafe, so you can talk to people or stay on the exit with a sign. We traveled to Paris, so we asked tracks-drtivers and finally found one. Most of the people who stopped drive not far than Aachen. It's a pity.
The location is not too much effort to get to. The 3rd person I asked took me to Gent, Belgium. There were a moderate flow of cars and some being of many different nationalities.
found a ride to brussels (directly) in about 5minuts!
April 2013: was trying to get to Belgium. Third driver I asked took me to the Raststätte Aachener Land Nord, where a lot of Belgian drivers stop.

name: Amauryfraise (Hitchwiki)
comment: Found a lift direction aachen in 5 min, not much traffic but still okay, on a wensday afternoon may 2013

name: PaoloCaracol (Hitchwiki)
comment: I HH from Koln to Brussels, to Louvain-la-Neuve and to Namur several times ! all of them on Friday or Sunday. I just love HH in that place! The best is to ask directly.

name: Maxim1110 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Hitchhiked several times to get to The Netherlands from here. Usually rides less than an hour to get a ride (mostly to southern Limburg (Maastricht/Heerlen), but sometimes also towards Venlo).

name: Maxim1110 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Great place on weekdays, and still good on a Sunday: caught a ride for two here to Liege on a Sunday morning in October. Also: the view is pretty good. :)
Super good to take the S-bahn to Koningsdorf and then walk to this Gasstation done it like 10 times now, never more then 15 minutes wait

name: TheKylling (Hitchwiki)
comment: Direct ride to Hamburg in just 15 min.

name: Liftegreven (Hitchwiki)
comment: Epic, although traffic never immense in itself. Aim for rides around 12-15:00

name: Wolak (Hitchwiki)
comment: Most of the cars here are going towards Berlin. There's also great deal of locals. We wanted to get out of the city towards Rostock, and after 2,5h guy driving to Hamburg took us about 90km away.

name: Exchange (Hitchwiki)
comment: Many cars with Hamburg plates and others heading there. Within 15 minutes I could have hitched a ride there. Unfortunately a lot fewer were heading for Rostock but after about 1 hour and 10 minutes I managed to fetch a ride there.
First car I asked at the petrol station took me to Hamburg.

name: Hakimouse (Hitchwiki)
comment:
first car I asked too !!!
best spot ever

name: Fetergent (Hitchwiki)
comment: It's a bit tricky and takes some time to get there if your starting point is Berlin. But it's the best spot ever, the thrid car I asked took me to Rostock.

name: Witowitold (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good place. Please don't make the same mistake that I did reaching this place from S-Bahn station. When you go along the highway stay on the side of the fence that is closer to highway. Don't count that later there will be another whole.

name: Onioncat (Hitchwiki)
comment:
5 min waiting and got a lift to Hamburg from a Norwegian car. Cool, but same mistake with the green fence, had to jump over it and wounded palms deeply. 
Girl, solo.

name: AdrianB (Hitchwiki)
comment: I just checked it last week and the fence is ,,trodden,, now, so everybody can easily walk through over it... But be careful in the woods alone!:]

name: Housetier84 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Nice Spot a little walk do not have to mutch stuff on your side. 10 min waiting and a nice car direktly in the City of Hamburg
Good spot to hitchhike to Hamburg but hard to reach this spot.

name: LeoCarona (Hitchwiki)
comment: Most of the cars going to Hamburg. I planned to go through Rostock on my way to Denmark, but this guy who looked really helpful offered me a ride to Kiel, so I changed my mind. On the way I have seen some other gas stations before the roads going to Kiel and Rostock split. So maybe you can accept a ride to Hamburg or Kiel at this gas station here, and you just ask for the driver to drop you off at one of the next gas stations where you still might find people going to Rostock, if that's what you want.
Fifth person I asked took me to the centre of Hamburg.
If you want to go to the north you better walk then try to hitchhike. It is a nice place to get in touch with the Brandenburg Mafia, but not a single average car-driver will stop at this station
Most cars were continuing on A1 and I wanted to get on A43 to Oberhausen at least on my way to Eindhoven.
you can get there easily by bus and foot. take a bus to "roxel" and then you will get there in less than 10 minutes
good place to ask many people
Good place to go to the south. Try to find a car wich go in direction Siegen (A1-A45) to pass Dortmund.

name: Paczix (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Good place to go to the south. 
We were here at 6 pm, asking drivers to go to Netherlands, but we didn't manage and finally we caught a guy to go to Recklinghausen.

name: Meikel (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got stuck here twice trying to find a ride to The Netherlands, most people go south to Köln/Aachen.

name: Maxim1110 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited for about 1,5 hours here on a  Sunday morning going to Cologne. A lot of local traffic, but eventually someone took me to Remscheid (40 km from Cologne).
After 1 hour of waiting another guy and me got a ride to Kassel. Quite a good one. Loads of cars going south!
Extremely good spot if you want to get to Cologne but very difficult if you want to continue towards A45 and Frankfurt.

name: Quarim (Hitchwiki)
comment: possibilty to change the side of the motorway

name: Urbanekto (Hitchwiki)
comment: Easy to get to Seesen

name: Bernardo (Hitchwiki)
comment: Instead of a bus you can also take the local train to Reiskirchen from Gießen and walk back to the motorway in ~15 min.
I'm a local, the tag is wrong; Köschinger Forst is further up north between Hepberg and Stammham; however a really good spot!

name: Mochilero (Hitchwiki)
comment: Unfortunately I had not that much luck with catching a ride. It took me approx. 1,5h to catch a ride in the direction of Munich. There are a lot of people going towards the south, but didn't take me with them as they were mostly in business suits and told me they were not allowed. So I was pretty lucky to catch a ride in a truck.

name: SuperFreaky (Hitchwiki)
comment: It is hard to find the place, because you need to walk through a living area because on the direct street is no sidewalk. It works, but it is hard to disdinguish which car goes/comes from the motorway, and which comes from the town.

name: Santa klaus (Hitchwiki)
comment: Hard to ride north of HH. Very few traffic. Maybe its better to find somebody who goes beyond Hamburg on the stop before?

name: Andreasgamlau (Hitchwiki)
comment: Many going to Hamburg early in the morning, but found car after 1 hour at 8 in the morning. Also a fine place to put up a tent in the night.

name: Andreasgamlau (Hitchwiki)
comment: and it is possible to get there and get away with a bus if necessary, or you can easily get there by foot.

name: RobertoCarlos (Hitchwiki)
comment: Instant pick-up to Kiel. There is a Burger King at the station and many people seem to stop there before entering Kiel.

After 1,5h got a lift to Kolding (DK) 
few traffic towards Denmark, mostly cars going to Kiel, but its possible to get to Denmark from here.
Vierwenden gas station avoid during summer months,full cars and only station in region,local rides mostly.
We began our trip here as we live in Freiburg.  We found a ride to Basel within 45 minutes.  Too easy.
very good place, we also began our first hitchhiking-trip there and found a ride straight to milano after 45 minutes!
I ended up here to go to Freiburg first guy I asked bring me to the central station in 5min.
if you coming from north and going to france it's very difficult. many cars to switzerland
got there on Tuesday meeting two hitch-hikers. they told us they've ended up there waiting 24hrs for a lift to France.
but anyways NO problem at all to catch a ride towards Switzerland

name: Mangoldmajo (Hitchwiki)
comment: We agree, no problems to get a ride to italy
Many cars going to the south! Depending on holidays, wehether they can take you or not...

i made three times from there to france
it was never more then 3 or 4 hours

name: Fossilhitchhiker (Hitchwiki)
comment:
arrived here at 2 o'clock in the night and put up my tent in the village just outside the Rastsstatte here, did some cheap shopping in the village and started the next morning but stood here with a couple of other hitchies some 3-4 h, but having fun
got a ride tot Besançon, France with a teacher on the French School at Frankfurt
I (27 years old, male) got a ride towards Zurich on the 6th of August at 10 pm after 1 hour. Most of cars going to Switzerland. Few towards France. Looots of hitchhikers :)

name: Julia L. (Hitchwiki)
comment: ALSO works towards France if not so well as going South... I mostly had to wait around an hour to get a ride over to France.

name: Michaeln (Hitchwiki)
comment: On a friday evening (20:00) this gas station was almost abandoned. When we finally got a ride it brought us to our final destination Basel (CH)
We (2 guys) just asked (no hitchhiking with a sign) and first car (not truck - they ignored us) was success. He took us to French borders.
On a normal workday morning, most traffic drove to Switzerland. Had to take a lorry to get to into France
Too bad for going to France... after 3 hours I got a lift
in case someone else ends up here, don't walk to rieselfeld, walk to paduaallee, it's shorter and better to walk. just follow the road crossing the river.

good he highwayspot to hitch out of town on the A5 in both directions!
wait in the middle of the road while cars are turning left onto the highway. stood there for 20 minutes while it was raining. easy!!

name: Achi (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was standing on the pedestrian walk next to the on-ramp with a sign. Didn't even wait for more then 5-10 min 'till the first car stopped and took me onto the A5

name: Rokz (Hitchwiki)
comment: Easily got a ride on the A5! Very good spot!

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Don't really like the spot, people can't stop anywhere and it seems there's mostly local traffic. We changed for a spot directly along the Dreisam road.
don't like this spot but still the best option for going south. Gas Station owner usually forbids hitchhikers to ask around at the gas station but u can stand next to the road using a sign
Hard for cars to stop since cars are fast in corner.

name: Kriechstrom (Hitchwiki)
comment: I agree, the cars from the opposite direction can hardly stop if the haven't been waiting at the traffic lights. However the spot is okay.

name: Kriechstrom (Hitchwiki)
comment: How to get here: take Bus 94 until "Zschonergrundstraße" or local railway to "Dresden Kemnitz" (not to confuse with the town Chemnitz 100 km away)

name: Guidoz (Hitchwiki)
comment: easily got a lift to Chemnitz (65km away) even if it was winter, raining and still darkish as it was early morning. Should work fine.
Perfect to go west. You will get fast a ride to Chemnitz. There is a big gas station called "Auerswalder Blick". You can keep going there.

name: Hartigan (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was waiting bit more then half an hour on Thrusday and got a jump with the direction to Leipzig ...

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited more than 1hr, but then had a ride of ~150km :) Didn't use a sign, maybe would be better to use it on this spot.

name: Longhaul (Hitchwiki)
comment: This is good spot; just after the crosslights, near the bridge, at the entrance in the highway there is place for the cars on the outer lane to stop. I got a ride from here in 15 minutes :)

name: Dynamo (Hitchwiki)
comment: I prefer this spot for going west. Waitingtime between ~30-45 minutes.

Waited here for an average 5 or 10 minutes, getting a direct lift to Chemnitz is easy. You may need to stop at "Auerswalder Blick" near Chemnitz for a lift to Leipzig or Zwickau / Plauen. Havent tried direction Berlin or Prague
just ask people to get to the petrolstation "dresdner Tor", which is just 5 mins from there. there you can ask people to go to leipzig chemnitz or erfurt

name: Yooks (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not the best spot ever. The sharp turn from both sides makes it hard for drivers to notice you and stop in time.

As most people not the best stop because of the sharp turn which makes it hard for drivers to notice and stop in time.... but still a good to average place... I got a lift to straight leipzig within 20-30 minutes on a thursday around 5:30 in the morning

name: Micho (Hitchwiki)
comment: Tracks can't stop here (too less space) and at the morning  (6 am) there are only locals (DD). Probably it is easier to catch a car to Leipzig that to Chemnitz.

name: Dynamo (Hitchwiki)
comment: Took me 10 minutes for a ride to Zwickau (sign Zwickau).
Was here for just 5 minutes, getting a direct lift to Chemnitz

name: Platschi (Hitchwiki)
comment: Best is to stand on the island in the middle, people normally don't hesitate to stop on the road as traffic is low anyway.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: No hard shoulder, but cars will just stop in the grass. Lots of traffic.
Easy!

name: Cha (Hitchwiki)
comment: Stood there for almost 2 hours but very early sunday morning, maybe more the time than the spot...

I stayed in one of the parking places for cars near the sidewalk but it must have a place for a car to park for you. I stayed on this street Schwarzwaldstraße 20, right before the turn near the bridge. Got a ride in 5 min to Villinden Schwenningen

name: Hydra supertramp (Hitchwiki)
comment: Easy to get North. We took a train from Freiburg to Schallstadt (without paying), then walked over the villages and past the cornfields - lovely in summer, maybe nasty in winter. Anyway, it was fun: took us one car to Heidelberg.
No problem at all, to get north. Also longer distances possible (Mainz, Darmstadt...)
easy to go north, a bit difficult to go east, but I found a place to stay in Freiburg at the end of the city just befor the tunnel to keep going east

name: N0id (Hitchwiki)
comment: If you go towards Aachen, you need a bit of luck or patience!

name: Santa klaus (Hitchwiki)
comment: I needed a lot of luck and a lot of patience for Aachen. Everybody is going into Cologne...

name: Adamiksen (Hitchwiki)
comment: A tiny Shell station, but quite a lot of cars. Got a ride in 5 min to Heidelberg ona  sunday afternoon!

name: Maxim1110 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Reasonably good towards Cologne on a Sunday, but probably great for that direction on weekdays. I waited for little over half an hour for someone to take me to Cologne Deutz.

name: Jens7885 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Just look or number plates other than SFA, HK and CE and you will be fine. :)

name: Djianfrev (Hitchwiki)
comment: To Dresden, it's safer to stay on the "southern" part of the crossroad: There are less cars, but drivers have time to see you and can stop easily.
no real possibility for cars to stop, you have to ask the driver at the stoplight. quite uncomfortable, but it worked somehow.

name: Efim x (Hitchwiki)
comment: a very bad place. there is nowhere to stop the car, do not recommend this place. better find something else.a very bad place. there is nowhere to stop the car, do not recommend this place. better find something else.

I come from Berlin and regularly drive with my car by this place in order to go to the autobahn. I sometimes see hitchhikers but, although I would be willing to give a lift, it is almost impossible to stop there.

name: Vivianerose (Hitchwiki)
comment: Was difficult place. But guy stopped after red light later and took me to first gasstation on the way.

its a decent spot. enough place for cars to stop, a small gas station and cars are not too fast. 
there are mostly local people but not exclusivly.
after 20 minutes someone took me to an autohof at the a2 (male tuesday 12 o'clock)

ein guter platz, gehnug nplatz zum halten, autos sind nicht zu schnell und man wird gut gesehen. die meisten fahren nur nach braunschweig, aber auch welche zur a2

name: GuterMensch (Hitchwiki)
comment: Depends on where you want to go. Most people drive only short distances.
a highly frequented highway restaurant with a lot of people going to the East. so it shouldn't take too long to get a lift.
It was very easy to find somebody who is drifing to Berlin. It is a very good Spot!

name: Sroomer (Hitchwiki)
comment: At the end of the spring break I waited here for three hours. About every 15 minutes there was ONE car passing. When you hitchhike toward Stuttgart, try to get a ride at least to Ulm.

name: Mateo (Hitchwiki)
comment:
A seemingly good place to find a car (there are many) turned out to be a very bad spot. We asked maybe 50-75 people and "Thumb"  the exit non stop until found somebody to take us to Stuttgart (there were heading to Heliborn). Meanwhile we heard many strange excuses and almost lost our mind. Very hard work!
But, we did see a single female hitchhiker with no beg finding a ride to France in just 20 minutes. For us it was a lot harder and we got a lot of rude responses. Overall a bad expirince.

name: Jan (Hitchwiki)
comment: Insa and Jan found it ok to hitch from here in middle of May. Ask people at the service station and also have a sign to indicate you’re a hitchhiker. Feasible is to get a ride to Ulm or a little further.

name: Chirimuyu (Hitchwiki)
comment: I asked people at the station, where they are already out of their cars and rejecting communication with me is more difficult ;) Just took me 10minutes

name: Kristian (Hitchwiki)
comment: OK if you ask drivers. Best results if you ask for a nearby destination, p.e. Ulm.
I am originally from Augsburg and this is my favourite spot to start hitchhiking westwards. Ask people and you get a ride to Pforzheim, Stuttgart or Ulm in 10-40 min.
Good spot if you're asking people directly.
A very nice german truckdriver who was heading to Nordrhein Westfalen took me to my Destination Würzburg and drove me in the Citycenter with his 40to Truck.

Sehr gut, um aus Braunschweig richtung süden weg zukommen!
Ruhig kleinere lifts bis bis zur nächsten Raststätte (harz west) bei seesen nehmen, dort ist man direkt auf der A7

name: Rytis9 (Hitchwiki)
comment: I arrived late at night, slept in the nearby wood and got a ride in the morning easily.

name: Mannheim67 (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Northbound direction is closed. Date of post: November 2015.
The service area is under reconstruction and not working.

name: Jackortega (Hitchwiki)
comment: Also good for Flensburg/Danmark.

name: Santa klaus (Hitchwiki)
comment: Had some Problems here. Not easy to find a place to stop, most of cars are locals who go as far as Pinneberg. In my opinion no good place for Kiel.

name: Wukk (Hitchwiki)
comment: top spot for Kiel. wait at the second bus stop with a big Kiel-sign. usually you find a ride after 30 minutes, especially between 3 and 7 pm, because people drive home from work

name: RobertoCarlos (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited for 2 min on a friday at 1pm and got a lift as far as the last service station before Kiel (Brokenlande). Instant pick-up to Kiel from there.

name: Anninassi (Hitchwiki)
comment: we did it to flensburg from there after waiting for about an hour :)

name: AlessandroCivisMundi (Hitchwiki)
