comment: Many cars were going in Hamburg's surroundings. I finally managed to get out, but I wasn't that lucky.
Waited 1h, got a direct lift to Kiel

Good spot with a lot of traffic, but had to wait quite a bit (50min) for someone to pick me up going north. As mentioned, a lot of local traffic makes it tougher than what the spot promises. Still worked! ;)

name: Binbash (Hitchwiki)
comment: tried to get to hamburg (downtown) from there. took like 10min and we got a mercedes coupé.

name: Emanuele19956 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride all the way down to Nuremberg early in the morning!

name: Francesc4052 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Worked good. Asked a guy if we could go with him to Hamburg, he accepted!

name: Joemaro (Hitchwiki)
comment: i guess i'll use this place when i go north to switch from A7 to A1.

name: Santa klaus (Hitchwiki)
comment: Gas Station. We had to cope with few traffic northways.
Hitched here for an hour in the evening and got picked up by a polish truck driver, who drove me north of Hamburg, good spot

name: Kai (Hitchwiki)
comment: I experienced almost the same. Its almost impossible to get a ride to the A7 southwards. I waited for 2 hours, trying to get a ride with a sign and talked to people directly, nothing. I then decided to change my route and go west on A2 and got a life within 5-10min.

name: Quarim (Hitchwiki)
comment: I Don't know what is wrong with Lehrter See nowerdays, i just want to go straight the A2 to Bielefeld but my last 3 waiting times all exceeded 60 minutes, thats why i decreased my rating to average

name: Koekjestrommel1 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Second car I asked went to Amsterdam and wanted to take me. First car I asked also went in that direction but had no place left. Note that this was on the end of a Dutch holliday though

name: Talliknalli (Hitchwiki)
comment: had no difficulties to get to the A7 to the north, waited only 15 minutes, but it's true that the majority goes to the west (A2).
ok to cath someone going north wit direction Hamburg or Bremen. Nott so much traffic but quite okay to go West/North or to get a direct lift to Hannover

If you want to go to the north, just write Bremen/ Hamburg on your sign and let yourself dropped of at Rasthof Allertal at the A7 if you want to go to Hamburg and your driver goes to Bremen or vice versa. Big Station for Truck Drivers to rest.

name: N0id (Hitchwiki)
comment: average on weekends
Me and my brother needed about an hour to get away in direction bremen. most people were going to nearby cities in the area so it's quite difficult to get a ride for long distances
asdacdasccsacsascas

name: Ilovefahrtwind (Hitchwiki)
comment: arrived here on a sunday, very bad to get to koblenz. but the petrol station was open overnight, so i had a good resting place.

name: Cighir Victor (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Actually you can buy vignette right when you cross the border. 

Maybe hitchhiking to the east depends on the season: in the summer was very hard to get to Wien, mainly because people go on holiday down South.

name: Sam iam (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very small station and not many people stop here because they prefer going into Austria (see the next big petrol station east) where fuel is cheaper. Nobody that stops here is going to Italy btw, so don't waste your time with that.

Arrived here when it was getting dark and cold, couldn't get a ride. Tried to find a place to sleep by just asking people in the village, but the onces I asked were not so friendly. Slept in a hotel. Got a ride the next morning on the on-ramp, just behind the petrol station

name: Phidias81 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very compact gas station, we waiting 3 hours to get a ride to Salzburg 12 km away!

name: Challenge (Hitchwiki)
comment: Thought it was a good idea since it was the last station before the border to get vignette, but it's a really small station with less traffic than expected. Got a ride after 30 min to Ljubljana, but that was pure luck. You might want to consider the next petrol station.

name: Vert5 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Really small gas station and waited for a hour or more just to ride to Salzburg. We had to ask at the gas station. Despite the lot of traffic, not so many cars at the gas station...

name: Sabx (Hitchwiki)
comment: great place to get a hitch. many people going to Prag and they have place to stop.

name: AntonG (Hitchwiki)
comment: Great place, just go to the road through the bushes. There are indeed lots of ants, so keep your pack on your back.
I got a ride straight to berlin within 15 minutes, without a sign on a sunday. The place also seems perfect for hitchhiking. There's already a little path through the bushes ;-)
not a bad spot but it is not legal to hitch from there so i got a lift with a cop car.....

name: Baptiste (Hitchwiki)
comment:
i waited 1h10 with a paper for Nürnberg.
I changed the paper for Ingolstadt and i just waited 35 sec ( 4 cars)
i think it's a good place but most of the car come from Munich and don't go far away

name: Agril Szanak (Hitchwiki)
comment: I got a ride in less than 5 minutes to Regensburg, very good spot but in fact - you have to watch your steps because of the ants ;)
we got a ride within 30 min. to Nürnberg.

name: C.zebitz (Hitchwiki)
comment: I got a lift to Nürnberg (Feucht) from here and waited 5 minutes.

name: Megaemce (Hitchwiki)
comment: 2012 - still a lot of ants! Try spill some salted water around you - it might help!

I met another hitch hiker here last Friday. The two of us didn't get a ride for for about half an hour. Then she got picked up alone after about ten minutes and I got a lift after five. Luckily, we met in Nürnberg and went all the way to Berlin together :) Also... The spot is right in front of the entrance to the Autobahn - a police car went by and didn't warn or ask us to leave!

name: Vonbawherk (Hitchwiki)
comment: 3/2012. No ants! Good place cause the cars can stop at the end of the tunnel. A woman picked us up after waiting 30 minutes - try to do a little choreography to attract the attention of cars  ;)

name: Kidsam (Hitchwiki)
comment: August 2013. There are ants but they weren't so bad. I waited 40 minutes to find a car going in the right direction. 4 other cars stopped in this time. This is a good spot!

name: Schworze (Hitchwiki)
comment: waited for 15min with a sign to nürnberg. think it is the fastest stop to leave munich towards the north

name: Micha (Hitchwiki)
comment: bad place to start.. lot of cars going by but either they were unfriendly or didn't go to nuremberg. sign highly recommended, because people can still go everywhere from there. hard to focus on drivers with so much traffic zooming by, and I think quite some people didn't stop because it's not a good place to stop, although there is some space. I'll try a different spot next time. PS: lots of ants here!

name: Yorick (Hitchwiki)
comment: Super good place, you will maybe need a little to find a car ( max. 1-2h ), but will get out of the city for sure. My fastest lift was straight to berlin in 5min, and the longest I had to wait 1:30h-2h something like that. My best experience is to only show your thumb, people will stop and you can ask them where they go. Signs like "Berlin" or "Direction Berlin" will only confuse them, since they think they can only take you if they go directly to Berlin.

name: Challenge (Hitchwiki)
comment: August 2014. Really good place. If you're going far north, it's better to have a sign that says A9 than your final destination. I waited for 30 min with a sign for Berlin, but got a ride after 15 min after switching to A9. The warning about the ants is legit. :D
august 2014; we had lots of stops for Augsburg or Stuttgart but our destination were Berlin; we finally took a car to the next gas station on A9, Fürholzen.
august 2014. i waited quite a long time here (1,5), but most people who stopped weren't going my way. Probably it's better to get out to the gas station in Eching.

name: Dyse (Hitchwiki)
comment: A place of great hitch-hiking history. Fight with the ants and make your way through the bushes to discover a real hh-sight!

name: Sattleryan (Hitchwiki)
comment: May 2015, on a Saturday, 10am, no ants and rain, waited hilarious 2min to get the most epic lift in my life, directly to North-West Germany! I will come back here, for sure!
Perfect spot to A9 north. Beware of the people going to the airport or Augsburg, then you will end up on a different Autobahn.

name: ESko (Hitchwiki)
comment: June 2016, plenty of ants, but this is one of the best spots I've even been to. Two guys, a car stopped after 5 mins, going to Stuttgart (although we had a sign Nür), and then after next 10 mins a guy took us to Nuremberg. Get a sign!
We hitched from this spot today and it went really well. First car stopped after a few minutes. A car going our direction ( A9, North), stopped 15 minutes later. great spot!
shit ramp, pull-over space between ramp and traffic light. gas station should work for both directions, very busy.

name: Dersoeren (Hitchwiki)
comment: Many locals, but also some cars going to osnabrück and also direction netherlands. The spot near the traffic lights worked good for me. I was very lucky, got a lift direct to the border germany/netherland (A33-A30).
Perfect for going north since many Danish people come here to shop for liquor.

name: Fossilhitchhiker (Hitchwiki)
comment: good place for going south with truckdrivers, they stop here to drink coffe and to eat or repair their trucks

name: Grinsolt (Hitchwiki)
comment: A very good place to go to the north sea or into Flensburg as well. If you walk down the road for about 300m, there will be a perfect Bus Stop.
Great place to enter Denmark by asking the Danes leaving the supermarket. Took no more then 30min even though it was sunday morning and the market had just opened.

Excellent spot direction Hannover.
Bad spot direction Dortmund.
very bad to go to paderborn/kassel, me and my freind waited more than 4 hours until we gave up.
Wanted to go south direction Paderborn and München, but after 3 hours had to drive to Hannover to get to the A7 there and head south.

name: Mbm (Hitchwiki)
comment: in Richtung Dortmund zweimal Glück gehabt.
walked around and asked 3 or 4 people, the last one took got me a ride, no stress!

name: Lenny (Hitchwiki)
comment: in the middle of roadworks at the moment. but still works fairly good
maybe i was unlucky, but i waited for one and a half hour at 7 am to get a ride towards basel. they brought me to the first gas station after basel.

name: Johnjomowfen (Hitchwiki)
comment:
sucks if you want to get to france!
ok if you want to go south to swizerland

name: Quarim (Hitchwiki)
comment: very good for south - basel. a bit harder for going east onto the A8 direction munich. Very hard to get to france.

name: SuperRoger (Hitchwiki)
comment: Direction Munich is hard... We waited 2 hours 2 Persons..Direction Basel should work out very well

name: Redjo27 (Hitchwiki)
comment: On a Wednesday in January, i went to Nürnberg and waited about 2,5h till a French business man offered me a direct ride. Nobody else did.
Good place to go south. I ask one guy who drive me to Freiburg.

name: Jan (Hitchwiki)
comment: Great place to get south! Insa and Jan got a ride to near the Swiss border, without even asking, just because we walked around with a sign saying »CH«.

name: Janpa (Hitchwiki)
comment: perfect place to find long distance rides. if you want to go to Cologne/Ruhr-Area try to already find a lift to A3 here and dont go further up to Frankfurt.

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: many people offered to us (2 ppl) a ride but none of them would go to Baden-Baden (south). after 15 min a couple took us. It was a sunny summer day and many ppl around. no road works

name: Amb45 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very difficult to get a ride to Nürnberg A6. Waited for hours.  Perfect place for Heidelberg, Frankfurt, Köln, Hamburg.

name: RedFox (Hitchwiki)
comment: Stopped 2x here, once towards heillbronn/east, once towars Köln/NW. Quite hard to get rides even during busy hours.

name: Fossilhitchhiker (Hitchwiki)
comment:
stood here at Bruchsal West direction south
got a ride from 3 German guys in Volkswagen all the way to Freiburg at 23 h and arrived in Freiburg at 2 o'clock in the night
they had the music way to loud for an old man like me

name: Michaeln (Hitchwiki)
comment: Most of the southward traffic goes to Stuttgart/Karlsruhe, but not much towards Freiburg/Basel
I asked a few people and got a ride to Darmstadt (direction to Frankfurt) within 10 minutes.
I got an very nice lift to Basel. I think, its better to ask on the gasstation and on the parking spot!

name: Kb (Hitchwiki)
comment: It's not true, I know that people are hitching from this place. The cars have to stop at an illegal spot though.
i waited for half an hour and it worked. it's right that the possibilities for cars to stop are not perfect, but ok enough i guess...
its possible to hitch from here - BUT i recommend to walk like 500 meters along on the 'Faulerstraße' till it crosses the 'Schnewlinstraße'. Way much easier here!!!
20 seconds at the traffic light!

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: This is not a nice spot, just walk a bit further east to find nicer ones...
Falkensteig is a perfect place for hitchhiking,I waited less than a minute here.

A sign with "A95" or "GAP" is useful.
Good spot to go the mountains or further to Innsbruck.

name: N0id (Hitchwiki)
comment: second day of christmas, we gave up after 3h

name: Kriechstrom (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride from here to Paris within minutes but I feel like I was lucky. Lots of foreign traffic, also from eastern Europe.
senseless for going in direction of Germany. Better walking 10 minutes and hitch at the entrance of the mothorway (the spot is on the map)

name: (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not a very busy place, good to ask drivers actively

name: Laurencebxl (Hitchwiki)
comment: Begin september, we waited there 3 hours. We're 3 and wanted to go to Köln (and further). A lot of people stop in Aachen and there is not so much a big trafic.

name: Couleurmate (Hitchwiki)
comment: The previous driver dropped me there and I even didn't try a thing. A car directly stopped and brought me to Köln. I guess luck was waiting for me there !
Took some time but was ok! A lot of traffic...

name: Hydra supertramp (Hitchwiki)
comment: We were four people - hitching home to Berlin - and got a lift on a beautiful summer afternoon one rest area further (Schlackendorf), directly onto the A24 with the next car.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Agree...

name: Joschi (Hitchwiki)
comment: Free ferry: The ferry charges by car not by passengers (max. 5 persons) so that your lift won't have to pay extra for you!

name: Angrybanana (Hitchwiki)
comment: Just do it! Wait at the far end where cars come into the waiting area.

name: Kwy1200 (Hitchwiki)
comment: I got a ride to Hannover from a nice truck driver in 15 minutes NOT in the ferry rush.

name: Elokuu (Hitchwiki)
comment: every half an hour (when the ferry arrives) there is a rush of cars. then you can chill again.

name: Xhikerx (Hitchwiki)
comment: had to wait for some time but got a good ride, stand at the other side of the crossing though becouse there is trafic comming from the k49 as well.
You can also ask for rides on the ferry!

name: Frixge (Hitchwiki)
comment: When you got the opportunity take a ride to the drive-up in Burg. There I had much more luck than at this busy spot.

name: Couleurmate (Hitchwiki)
comment: Try to talk to everybody in the ferry, because after getting land, cars just won't stop !!! The drivers who took me in Copenhagen told me it was better to stop there as they were going to Oldenburg. I guess if it's possible, don't get drop after the ferry because there are some rush and then nothing and most cars won't stop again. Plus, I was there in the evening, I tried for one hour. Then I decided I'll spend the night in the trainstation. It isn't the worst place for an overnight : it's covered, warm, you can hide, there is a train at 5am going to Lübeck. And it's a nice place to meet some frustrated HH :D

name: Bipkip (Hitchwiki)
comment: I experienced that the closer you get to the ferry exit, the less speed the cars have (and thus the easier they can read your sign). This is much more to your advantage IMO than standing further, trying to catch traffic from the K49.

name: Riddergraniet (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride to the next gas station. Fast pick up, but for me not a ride to the next city.
I completely agree! Nice spot to go south! I wait 15min until I got a lift to rest stop Münsterland.
sorry to spoil the good rating, but this place SUCKS! no stopping space, dense traffic and cars that might be going north, west or south. no likee.

my usual spot to start for south and west. almost no way to get east, better start for this direction at os-nahne.
i had different experiences from 10 to 60 minutes waiting for a lift with a big sign. best to stand directly at the lights so cars can stop on the side of the bike line or go to the petrol station.
dont wait directly at the exit!

name: Ruub (Hitchwiki)
comment: Gasstations are a good hitchhiking spot because you can ask the people directly. There are several options on the Hansastr. and the Bramscher Str.

name: NoaJou (Hitchwiki)
comment: I waited at the crossroads and the gasstation in pouring rain, I am guessing that must've been the reason that people didn't want to take me. In good weather I imagine that this spot is pretty good for hitch hiking!

Don't use the fuel station at the Kirchheimer Kreuz if you're going west towards Gießen or Cologne. It is not indicated in the signs if you arrive from the A4 from east, so nobody will stop from there.
the autohof is a bad place to get a ride. almost every car is local. not enough traffic. we waited for 3 hours.

name: ManuelW (Hitchwiki)
comment: It was quite difficult to get southern from here into the direction of Würzburg (A7). It didn't work at the Shell station at all, and took quite some time at the Esso-station.
seems legit
works well, use a sign!

name: Fraughtwithsounds (Hitchwiki)
comment:
It's much easier to get on the A72 towards Chemnitz/Dresden than towards Hof/Nürnberg. During one hour of waiting there were only 6 cars with Bavarian license plates. 

To get there from Zwickau take a train to Voigtsgrün (€3,30 )

well it's ok also get more north on a5 or at least to frankfurt. on that point there r cars direction Köln and so on, Rhein-Main-Area .... many dirction might be sometimes difficult to have an ov
erview.
Switch rides here if your driver is heading in Cologne/Holland direction and you are trying to stay on A5 to go Frankfurt/Berlin/Hamburg/anywhere else really.

name: Samsi (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not a good idea to change here to get into Darmstadt itself if your drive wants to stay on A5 and not head into the city.

ServiceStation
I asked 5 people in 10 minutes for a ride as they filled up. 3 were to germany, 1 was to england, and 1 was the ride I wanted: to the netherlands. 
towards direction = netherlands
to = amsterdam
facilities = fuel, food, WC 
hitch = very good

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not as crowded as Ohligser Heide and Siegburg which are just before on the A3. Still good though.
A lot of local cars only going to Offenburg.

name: MlleLunatique (Hitchwiki)
comment: Just asked a quite young guy who looked sporty for a ride to Munich and he offered me Augsburg. Many cars there!

name: Vonbawherk (Hitchwiki)
comment: Nice for go to Munich, loads of cars go there. Burger King area is the best point for asking. Time waiting: 15 minutes aprox. on Sunday!

name: MlleLunatique (Hitchwiki)
comment: The second guy I asked, took me to Nuremberg, which was my destination. The gas station is kinda small, but it's not that hard to get a ride here.
Lots of cars going towards Austria, just wait at the end near trucks, or ask at petrol station.
The first guy we asked at the gas station took us right away to Vienna.
not good to travel down the A92 to Munich, nearly any car came, waited for like 3 hours at night, most cars go further the A3 to Nuremberg
same happened to us. we wanted to go to munich, ended up on a car to regensburg and then took the train from there, because we found noone going to munich.

AVOID if you want to hh to MUNICH!!! most likely people wont head there because the ones coming from Vienna already took an other route. If you are willing to wait you might be lucky after a while. Try and ask people for Landshut or maybe even Deggendorf (and ask them kindly if they could drop you at the highway A92 to Munich). No petrol stations on this route though, only parking lots!
the busstop is called Hoffeldweg by the way

name: Yooks (Hitchwiki)
comment: It took us two tries to hitch a ride, so we would say it was a good experience. A gas station is almost always a good place to hitchhike and so is this one.
after standing at the two gasstations southwest from here for to long, i went here and instantly got a lift

name: Timsen (Hitchwiki)
comment: Love this spot...very good to get to the south...
great for going southeast! Regensburg, Passau, Austria,...

name: Kundrt (Hitchwiki)
comment: I have different experience. We stand there 3 hours and nobody to Czech Republic. Everyone only to München and also lot of people to Berlin.

name: Xkomczax (Hitchwiki)
comment: A lot of cars going to the south direction (München, Regensburg), but almost nobody to the Czech republic. This is not only my experience, but I read a lot of messages saying the same on the  traffic signs and traffic barrier on this spot.

name: Upi4kumaterinu (Hitchwiki)
comment: 2 of us waited for about 2 hours to get a lift towards the Czech Republic- we got very lucky. It was not a good spot, not much traffic, not many cars going that way. (It was Thursday evening, 5-7pm)
perfect spot to go to munich; first guy we asked at the gas station went there!!!

name: Spiritsxxi (Hitchwiki)
comment: Had to wait a surprisingly long time (30 mins plus) on a Saturday morning Sept 2012, going towards Passau. Maybe not such a good weekend spot.
in february 2013 there was almost nobody going in direction of the czech republic. got stuck here for 6 hours. traffic is good to munich!

monday night at 5/6 pm:
many going to czech republic, munich, austria. i needed A9 north (berlin) - no chance! but it's easy to get a lift to A9 southwards and then be dropped off at an "autohof" (the gas stations with mcdonalds and such by the exits, so can be reached from both ways of the highway) 2 exits south of nuremberg. from there it was easy to get up north. half an hour detour i would say, so definitely easier than waiting for cars going north here!

name: Prochy (Hitchwiki)
comment: Just asked around and a Slovak guy took us to Prague (5 mins max.)

name: Dan the man (Hitchwiki)
comment:
A lot of the cars are going south. Got my lift to Austria after asking people at the gas station for about 15min.
Got from here directly to Salzburg
Direct Ride to Maribor (Slowenia) - wie were Lucky!
We waited 3h for a ride to Passau on a Monday at noon time. But it was holiday season. Lots of cars going to Munich !

name: AdrianB (Hitchwiki)
comment: It is a really frequent and amazing spot. It was easy to find a ride towards Austria [direction Regensburg and Passau]. I got here by walking/hitchhiking from Fürth through Hüttendorf and Kriegenbrunn small villages, and in the end I crossed this magic forest, and then just walked into the resting area. Good luck!
5 minute wait to Passau on a Friday-evening
Perfect spot to go to munich.
I got a ride to Augsburg from here by standing with a sign at the gas station entrance. Sees mostly local traffic though.
For every one car to direction Munich, you'll get 10 to Stuttgart. Not a good place at all for Munich, but excellent for Stuttgart.

name: OrdnaS (Hitchwiki)
comment:
I went to Karlsruhe on a Saturday 10am with a friend.
We didn't wait 5 minutes 'til someone picked us.

name: Kristian (Hitchwiki)
comment: Easy towards Stuttgart if you ask drivers.

name: Railway (Hitchwiki)
comment: I wait less of 5 minutes before someone invit me to come with him.

name: Anawesomesummer (Hitchwiki)
comment:
worked very well for 2 people. we got to Karlsruhe in one lift! further would have been possible. 
happy hitching.

Couple with a panel indicating Stuttgart/Karlsruhe. Not many cars stopping at the gas station. We changed place to go more in the city (before the bridge over the railways) and finally get caught after waiting more than one hour.

name: Santa klaus (Hitchwiki)
comment: Didn´t have any luck here - very few cars, and most of those went to the north or were locals...
Took this Point to get from the Highway into Freiburg. It took around 15mins. The Parking Lane on this Side is long and so easy to park for you

name: Adamiksen (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was lucky to get a ride to Basel, just 5 min after getting off from the previous car. Was standing ca.100 m before the parking place.The parking place itself didnt have any cars saturday morning.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Took me only 4min to get away.

name: Platschi (Hitchwiki)
comment: Same here, 5min maximum on a Saturday afternoon. Driver told me that from Ochtrup, people going east most likely use this on-ramp, not the one before (westwards)

name: Rebhuhn (Hitchwiki)
comment: Approach the people waiting for the ferry! Got a lift to Zurich after 10 min of asking.

name: Dan Vertígo (Hitchwiki)
comment: I didn´t to waste my time going around the lake so I took a ferry to Meersburg (direction Munich), it was only 2.9 EUR and it was a great view from a boat :)

name: Luc (Hitchwiki)
comment: Ferry now costs 3€ for pedestrians.

name: Alagosnir (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got lucky and immediately found a driver to Luxembourg.
When in need of food don't forget to go to the nearest Lidl just about the roundabout - much cheaper than on the gas station! Ask lorry drivers if you can't find it.

name: Fikret sohlberg (Hitchwiki)
comment: When you are travelling west, it is best to ask drivers to take you to the next station in hockenheim.

name: AdrianB (Hitchwiki)
comment: I got a ride a little bit after Kaiserslautern. Not so high traffic, but can work!
Good place if you want to go north or south on the A5.

name: CK (Hitchwiki)
comment: Cars go slow and see you from far. Not too many cars, though.
not good for the highway

name: Wolak (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not a good place to get out from Berlin. There's a little traffic and almost all of it is local.

I waited for a car in the petrol station two times, both with my girlfriend. First one in November of 2012 to go to Hamburg, we waited one hour. Second one in August of 2015, to go to Lübeck (but with a sign for Lübeck or Hamburg). It also took one hour

name: MlleLunatique (Hitchwiki)
comment: A really nice lady took me to Ulm (I had a MUNICH-sign) after 15 minutes of waiting.
Its a good spot for going east or south, but not for going direction Karlsruhe. Senseless.

name: Mat (Hitchwiki)
comment: Just before the double lane starts, there's a  cool  spot (bus stop) where cars are still going slow. Waited 1 hour to Ulm (with a Munich sign) a sunday morning
Waited 40 min. with a "MÜNCHEN / AUGSBURG" sign and got a ride directly to Augsburg where I wanted to go. Only good to get a ride south (B27) or east (A8).

Not in direction West! For that I suggest the other motorway entrances in Western Stuttgart (e.g. Vaihingen) Local people told us the same, too. But all in all, a good spot with many local cars which go about 50 km from here to South or East (on the highway). We got a ride in 15 minutes even on Saturday evening 11:30pm! 2 persons (me and my girlfriend), Saturday, 15 mins

I tried one time to hitch close to the highway southwards, nearby the gasoline station. But it didn't work. Only after asking several drivers on the gasoline station, I got a car heading into my direction. Better ask there.

name: Sebbo (Hitchwiki)
comment: Stood here once, going south, in summer, vacation/traveltime, most cars were full familycars, heading north or to Leipzig.
ask people at the gas station/McDonalds

not the best place to start, waited there for hours with asking the people frequently. most oft them were going to leipzig or the country nearby. after 5 hours I decided to sleep behind the gas station and get a car by 'mitfahrgelegenheit' the next day to get away from that shitty spot. friends experienced the same there. better go to leipzig/merseburger straße!!!
We waited for 2 hours at the petrol station but most cars are local traffic going back to Leipzig so we tried our luck at the traffic light across the road and got a ride in less than 5 minutes.
I started once at the Aral-gasstation and I got away from there after 15 minutes in southern direction to Erfurt. So in my case it was very good and I just can recommend it!

name: Filip.bartek (Hitchwiki)
comment: A good place to get from the highway to a city train to Leipzig. The train stop is about 500 m away and easily accessible on foot.

A lot of traffic goes south here, some are going west (A4) direction of Erfurt. Very few go north-west with direction Magdeburg. Anyway i found a direct lift to Magdeburg after 45 minutes of asking people at the gas station.
You also might find some drivers going west to Halle (B6)
A Decent amount of people going north and south on A9. Not so many people heading onto the A14. I found someone quickly for going towards Halle ~Lukas

got dropped at the petrol station also and wanted to go to salzburg(with a sign!!). thought i was stuck here. but on the side of the roundabout where the traffic from rosenburg comes from i finally got a ride. might have been lucky though. was a friday afternoon, maybe then getting onto the autobahn again works better(?)
end july 2011, on the onramp to the motorway headed to Austria ; worked well, with rain and it looked like nothing...
Got dropped off here to go to Salzburg, there were a lot of people but we were hitchhiking for 1,5 day before we got a ride.
happened to me as well, but if you do not enter the gas station it worked a couple of times. :-)

name: Upi4kumaterinu (Hitchwiki)
comment: Two of us did not get thrown away from there for a while, but waited with no success(travelling towards Nuernberg). Spent more time at the restaurant talking to people going out- again with no success. Eventually got a ride by talking to people on the parking.
Don't try it from there to the A7, nearly no car driving this direction, waited for 2.5h until decided to go somewhere else
Got a lift to Nürnberg in less than 30 min.

name: Onefinger (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good spot just a bit far from the city center. Take the tram until Berner Straße.

name: Dan the man (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got my lift after asking people at the  Parking for about 20min

Waited long time to find no one going to Nurmberg ... Finally a police car stopped, taked me to the police station for a control. Looking at the comments, i am pretty sure that it's the guy from the station who called them. Fuck this spot, seriously.
I started hiking there to Berlin and a Truckdriver took me directly there. didnt had to wait very long.

name: Tramper (Hitchwiki)
comment: after 20 minutes of waiting, we decided to look at the Aral gas station nearby. There we were more successful.
really not much sense hitchhiking to netherlands from this spot, it's much better to try to catch someone coming from Bremen (a1) above osnabrück. got stuck here for quite some time.
No sense to go to NL. Their were almost no cars. I had to go to the next gas station on A1 (near to damme), pass the bridge and hitchike to catch people coming from Bremen to NL.

perfect to go north,
A2 is crossing less than 100km to the South so nobody going East will stop here
good to get south/north

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride directly to Berlin from here, perfect.

name: Wilhelmus (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good for going East. A bit tricky cause after the gas station there is another restaurant with more people! Got a ride standing at the end.

name: Krassberd (Hitchwiki)
comment: Going towards Leipzig didn't take long.
best spot to go to a9 (north/south), because most people going a9 stop here instead of hermsdorf (directly at the autobahnkreuz).

name: Wurzelkoch (Hitchwiki)
comment: At sunday after a long weekend very crowdy. I could have got a lift to Berlin in about 5min (One third of all cars were from Berlin and I was even asked by people before I could ask). To Nossen it was a bit more difficult, but still 15-20 min.
great sport point!
Not possible anymore as the highway was recontsructed!
Very good to find a lift to A4. Big gas-station and big restaurant.

name: Incogitatus (Hitchwiki)
comment: Even when it's dark out, it's quite possible, as long as there isn't a hitchhiking queue :)  Took me about 1.5 hours to get a lift directly to Hamburg.

name: Xume (Hitchwiki)
comment: they start a construction 21st may 2013 there (for a month or two)

name: NoaJou (Hitchwiki)
comment: Fantastic spot, managed to get a ride in a few minutes nearly all the way to Osnabrueck which was my destination. This was in the cold winter months so this spot is definitely recommendable.

name: TheKylling (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited 45 min and got a ride to Hannover. Great gasstation.
Perfect place. You can talk to the drivers near the gas station or position yourself with a sign by the exit road

name: Rory (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Very good spot for going east-Poland, Leipzig etc.
Good to go north to A1 (Osnabrück, Bremen, Dortmund,...) or to the netherlands even
after 30 minutes I and my girlfriend got lift to Erfurt
Perfect spot

name: Jsmith (Hitchwiki)
comment: Intention was Dortmund but settled for a gas station direction Duesseldorf which ended up working well.  Found many people, if not most, were headed south from cologne.  Hitched Friday mid-day.

name: Wild (Hitchwiki)
comment: A lot of people, going North and South as well. Good point, but it will be better not just to stay, but talk with refilling people.

name: Pusha89 (Hitchwiki)
comment: The only problem I found is that most of the people doesn't speak english. Also What I did was wait before the petrol station with a sign "D-Dorf" (Dusseldorf) so people could enter to the gas station to pick me up.
Waiting before the gas station with a sign "Pott (GE / E)" (greater Gelsenkirchen/Essen area) made me wait not longer than 3 minutes. Hitchhiked mid-day on a Friday.
if you have problem with going to Berlin directly you can ask for the next Petrol station: it's Osterfeld just between Weißenfels and Naumburg (approx. 30km)

A second gas station has been built serving the cars going to Freiburg. Cars going to direction Stuttgart, Konstanz or Tuttlingen can be found in a reasonable time. I am from Löffingen so it's perfect for me to have such an amazing hitching spot right in front of my door.

name: Cha (Hitchwiki)
comment: Roundabout is better!

name: Dan Vertígo (Hitchwiki)
comment: on roundabout is no space for cars to stop, I tried it.. Gas station is better I think..
Stay at "Bundesstraße" the big roads with orange signs, not "Autobahn". From Freiberg it's better to go first short distance to a bigger city, after you try stopping@ Autobahn.

Not the best place in direction of Dresden, but you will get picked up anyway. Sign "Dresden" (or "Grimma" where close is a gasstation to switch cars) cause a lot of cars will stop, but going in other direction. 
To get there take tram 2 or 15 to last station and walk a few hundred meters to the gas station.
I was staying at the bus station and got a ride in 20 minutes

name: Elokuu (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride from the bus station all the way to Cottbus after around 40mins (on a saturday afternoon)

name: W-o-l-l-e (Hitchwiki)
comment: With a good visable sign I had no troubles getting away from there. Moreover, there is a gas-station about 50m south of this spot where you might ask people directly.
Had to wait one and a half our till i found a truck-driver to direction frankfurt. Most people here are going to west (saarbrücken) or to mannheim.

name: Tommy90 (Hitchwiki)
comment: It is a good spot to get a quick lift during the rush hour in direction to Saarbrucken/Metz or Frankfurt/Karlsruhe...so many drivers filling up their cars!! In the weekend or at a holiday it could be a little bit difficult. Depending on the traffic, my waiting time was: 15 minuts till 2 hours.

name: Fikret sohlberg (Hitchwiki)
comment: This place is awful if you are going east to nurmberg.

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a lift into Saarbrucken after approx. 30 mins.

name: Tommy90 (Hitchwiki)
comment: I got lifts to Saarbrücken or at least to the Rasthof RAMSTEIN or Raststätte WALDMOHR. Looks calm, but absolutely easy-going.

name: Incogitatus (Hitchwiki)
comment:
I anticipated a fast pick-up ... however, it took over an hour to get a lift. To begin, there was a hitchhiking queue with a guy that didn't know hitchwiki!  That is awesome!  His sign that said 'A35 Bonn' was small, so when I made him a new sign, he got a lift in 10 minutes.

It took me another 15 minutes to get a lift from here.  Super easy since there's a lot of traffic.  I believe our wait time was just due to midday local traffic and a hitchhiking queue.  So, 4 stars.

name: Binbash (Hitchwiki)
comment: better have a sign...

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: We accepted a short ride to Stillhorn petrol station, just south of Hamburg centre. Seems better to stay at this one tough, more traffic. Needed to get to Hannover but we got offered a ride all the way to Belgium :)
2 people, waited only 5–10 minutes on a Friday afternoon.
we were two people going towards switzerland and got a ride in a couple of minutes to Herrenberg, Nurfringen (which is a really good spot to continue)

name: Yhtam (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got offered a ride to Basel withing 30 mins and a ride to Zürich within one hour. Monday morning in june.
Good spot for leaving Salzbourg - I reached Brussels the same day:)

Towards Karlsruhe. One of the spots with the biggest chance towards West in Stuttgart, I think. Though, it is not easy to get here by public transport from the city centre. 2 persons (me and my girlfriend), Sunday morning, Karlsruhe, 15 mins.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: The only problem here is that the parked cars are spread out over an area of about 500m. Try not to walk up and down too much ;)

name: Achi (Hitchwiki)
comment: This might be the best spot for the direction Passau / Austria / Vienna, although there aren't that many cars leaving. I wasn't lucky at the actual truck stop, but had to walk down to the on-ramp in order to get a lift.
in general long rides. many dutch people on their way to the south make here their first break :)

name: Kriechstrom (Hitchwiki)
comment: Also nice to go back in the direction of Netherlands or Aachen.
not a good place to go to northeast (dortmund, hannover) tried two times and didn't work, everybody is going to the northwest...

name: Spiritsxxi (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a lift very quickly all the way to Nurmberg (SE-wards), on a Friday afternoon, Sept 2012.
Can confirm. Went to the south once. Had to wait 1 hour, but only because many stuffed tourist cars. another time about 30 (?) minutes, but definately OK. Much traffic in both directions.
Sorry, just read the first comment to the end. It were dutch cars :-). It was in the summer holidays.

name: Fverhart (Hitchwiki)
comment: Finding rides towards A4/Aachen or A61/Monchengladbach/Venlo is harder in my experience as most drivers go further on A3 or into Koln or Ruhrgebiet.
Can confirm that. If you want to go to the A4 (Aachen) direction Netherlands or Belgium it's handy to use a sign for "Aachen", most of cars go to Köln or Ruhrgebiet

name: Amauryfraise (Hitchwiki)
comment: It was easy to find a lift ( asking the driver) there was a lot off traffic ( wensday afternoon) who bring me to the next petrol station direction aachen...
On an early monday evening during summer it took me 15min of asking half a dozen peeps to find a ride north towards Düsseldorf.

name: Dynamo (Hitchwiki)
comment: I use this place when I´m comming from Berlin and the driver isn`t going to Dresden. Even in the dark (winter 9pm) you can find people there.

name: Hiiamfrompoland (Hitchwiki)
comment: Because of the date, there was not thut much traffic, but still great place where you can catch really long-distance hitch.

name: Pletter (Hitchwiki)
comment: Easy to get to Poland.

name: Feo (Hitchwiki)
comment: A good amount of cars on a monday afternoon I was there. Waited 10-20 minutes, walking around asking. Eventually someone asked me if I wanted a ride.

name: TeeTramp (Hitchwiki)
comment: its dont seems that bad that spot, but i waited on a saturday more then 3 hours for a lift behind dresden....

name: Yooks (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not the best spot ever. The sharp turn from both sides makes it hard for drivers to notice you and stop in time.

name: Arno Nuem (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Good spot, cars can stop easily. A truck picked us up after just a few minutes. Also it's an official hitchhiking spot authorized by Tramprennen :)
Although we wanted to go to Munich (via Chemnitz) we got in a truck going to Leipzig and got off a few km later on the service station Dresdner Tor.

name: Az-alcmar (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very good place for cars to stop before the highway. There is a traffic lights, not fast speed

name: CrazyKenny (Hitchwiki)
comment: we were 2 people, found an italian lift to Rosenheim (100km southeast of munich) within 15min. Easy to get to Nürnberg or Munich. watch out for itialan / austrian / slowenian / croatian license plates for going far south, even to Italy or Croatia
had a lift to Hof, i waite 15min, this rest area is perfect

On a monday morning i found a ride to Nuremberg (rest area Feucht).
Its the best Spot Point to get to Nuremberg or Munich (or with little luck further).
I agree, don't wait at the bus stop "Blutenburg" but continue until Kentucky Fried Chicken, excellent to go to A8 Ulm/Stuttgart...
Take S2 (from centre to Dachau/Petershausen) to stop Obermenzig and walk 1-2km west to get here.

name: Prochy (Hitchwiki)
comment: Should be excellent for Ulm, but we wanted to get to Deggendorf and no one stopped in one hour, then we went to the petrol station on the other side and a random Polish guy brought us to the other side of the city.

name: Flo1990 (Hitchwiki)
comment:
coming by the tram 17 to Amalienburgstrasse then take the bus 143 to Blutenburg station.

get off and walk 200 metres until you see a KFC (fast food).
direction north-west : AUGSBURG-STUTTGART.
started to hh together with a german who wants to be in Augsburg.
the second driver take us both.
i was with a sign: AUGSBURG-STUTTGART.
time of waiting: 7 minutes.
give me the ride for 218 km
the road it was under construction on other side-first half of July 2012.

name: Chris1337 (Hitchwiki)
comment: perfect spot to go west. Lots of traffic. Nevertheless I had to wait 50 mins to find a ride out. Still the best place to go west. Probably better to have a sign
go to the KFC and ask people directly!

name: LaZubi (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Oct 15; Agree with the others.
easy spot...u can be seen in the dark. If its late and cold get a bucket of chicken. Good place :D

name: Tabea (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good spot, but sometimes there are travel busses blocking the spot but you can always ask at the carpark of KFC

name: Dadzios (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Good spot. 
We waited there only for 20 minutes and getting a lift to the Ulm.

Great place, next to the KFC, stand after the corner, long space for the cars to stop. Easy to get here by bus from the centre. But this spot is not for the "bus stop" spot nearby. Nevertheless, I think this onne is better. Direction: A8. 2 persons (me and my girlfriend), Saturday, 10 mins

Quite busy station with resting area and McDonald's. Works well for both directions on the motorway but yes, maybe better for East, as mentioned in the descripiton. Although we managed to get a lift to Stuttgart in 5 mins on Saturday evening after sunset. I suggest to wait not exactly at the gas station exit but 20 m after that, under a big street lamp (so you are visible at night as well) because by doing so more cars will be within your reach. (On the map: Shell -> Robert-Bosch-Strasse, ~20 m to the North there's a loop, then a turn towards to big roundabout. Go straight and the first turn, which is the nearest to the highway, is the one I'm talking about)
2 persons (me and my girlfriend), Saturday, dir Stuttgart 5 mins.
Friedrichsdorf is the S5, not 6. greetings

name: Niklas (Hitchwiki)
comment: Found somebody who was willing to give me a lift all the way to berlin in less than 15 minutes. But I wouldn't expect to be that lucky all the time :)

name: Rory (Hitchwiki)
comment:
S5 Frankfurt-Friedrichsdorf is a little expensive (4,65€) 
But spot's great!

After trying all day to get out of Frankfurt we spent the ~€5 to get to Friedrichsdorf and got to this spot at about 20:00. The 2nd person we asked gave us a ride to Kassel. In my experience the best way to get out of Frankfurt.
A bad place to hitchhike, because the petrol station is really low frequented
A small gas station with low frequency of cars, but much better than Schoenefeld. You can got there by foot from the willage, going along the highway through the forrest. It takes about 45 mins.

name: Khorporative (Hitchwiki)
comment: When I saw the place, I did not even try to start hitch-hiking there.
I use this place every week. Average waiting time: 30 min. I have to admit that this place is quite dangerous because some drivers are using the right lane illegally for driving.
5 minutes to dresden
Building site till 2021 - avoid this place
hm... there shuld be a vote limit!

name: Mikael (Hitchwiki)
comment: Yeah, will do soon.

friday, 3.12.2010, i waited 9mins and get a lift for 450kms to my destination.
(-10 degrees, and a lot of snow n' ice.

name: Tawax (Hitchwiki)
comment: The best is to ask the people there.
perfect spot. trainstation nikolassee easy reachable, talk to people refueling their cars, you can't go easier as this spot
with sign "leipzig" after 15min on way.
I waited may be 10 min and asked about three people till I found somebody
We just asked people and after about 3 minutes we got a lift to Dresden. Chances are pretty good if you ask people at the gas station.
11.11.11, with a sign "a9, leipzig" after 15min on way to koeckern (150km).
a Dutch couple took us all the way back to the Netherlands. Waited around 20 min.

name: Sebbo (Hitchwiki)
comment:
August, 2012:
there is a construction on the Highway A115, thats why u cant access the petrol station from the highway going south. If u wanna go south, or west, try the petrol station on the A10, called Michendorf.
actually it´s worse...waited nearly 10 hours!!!

construction work is done^^
got a lift within 2min :-D

name: AlexxMakedon (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waiting here 40 minutes, with the sign of Hannover. No result. Went to Michendorf.
Waited 50 minutes and got a good lift!

name: Moritz0711 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Arrived and hitchhikers were even making a cue, I was already hopeless as more and more arrived, but then it all went really fast. Probably people were losing their fear when they saw that so many people are looking for a ride. After half hour I got a lift down south on the A9.
bought a coffee and had a sign, took me less than 1 minute to get a lift...

name: Edithv (Hitchwiki)
comment: Too crowded during summer (7 hitchhikers !) but most cars go to Michedorf so that's an option, otherwise patience and it works - got a lift to Amsterdam straight after 1h15 min. waiting
We went to Leipzig from the gasstation and got a direct lift after about 20 minutes although there were not many people and cars (around 4 pm).

name: Hannes1993 (Hitchwiki)
comment: far to many hitchiker there.. but all in all a nice spot!

name: Bohua (Hitchwiki)
comment: It's a very cool spot to hitchhike, but dont expect to get anything with a sign. you'll have to invade people's privacy and ask. That's te way it is! :) First asked took us via Leipzig to Erfurt, in the south. :)))

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Stood at the on-ramp and asked cars at the traffic light. Love the hitch messages on the lamp post!

name: Talliknalli (Hitchwiki)
comment: good spot, many hitchhikers - actually that wasn't a problem but really nice to get in contact :)

name: Gangrelito (Hitchwiki)
comment: Tuesday morning in August, 40 minutes and I found drive to Hannover. A lot of hitchhikers here, popular place I guess. I stood near exit, across Burger King.
2 hours. Nothing. Neither road or had station

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Perfect place for going into Poland with lots of cars!

name: Fverhart (Hitchwiki)
comment: Frankfurt-Oder / Warsaw or to Cottbus / Wroclaw.
If you are alone and going to Poland, lots of polish trucks to ask.
waited quite long to get a ride to Poland. maybe because it was monday and most polish went from poland to germany that day to work. not much traffic that day

name: Megaemce (Hitchwiki)
comment: Great place if you are going outside Berlin. Harder to get some lift to Berlin (but possible).

name: Schworze (Hitchwiki)
comment: the discription to get here is really good. thanks. you don´t need to climb up to the service station. there are some steps to get there. for me it was not a good spot, because i wanted to head to the north and i thought this service station is used for both sides, but its not. i had to reach the next station in the south and switch the side of the highway:D. but i think for heading south it is a good spot

name: Flasher702 (Hitchwiki)
comment: I have repeatedly attempted to hitch hike from here to Mainz or Wiesbaden without much luck. Getting from here to the Airport is easy and I have successfully hitch hiked from the airport in all directions many times.

name: Dynamo (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Found a driver to Darmstadt Hbf (main station) in 5 minutes.
(friday)
Couldn't get to Saarbrücken or even Kaiserslautern for 3 hours, then accepted an offer towards Mannheim. There's a fair amount of local traffic here according to the driver.

name: Cha (Hitchwiki)
comment: OK for Radolfzell, if you need FN, Lindau, Munich it's not so good. Don't get stuck there at night/sunday morning, no cars! Seems like a very new rest stop with only a gas station (Tamoil? Never seen that one before).

april 2012 - actually a pretty good spot i found ; if you wish, you can sleep there as they have a hotel and breakfast buffet, but also if you feel like sleeping outside it's really good, as there is spacious green patches ; the view is great, it's a good place for young lovers to spend a night under the stars !

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: took me 30 min to get a ride to stuttgart. I asked many riders but most of them are going to Freiburg
During the weekdays in the afternoon many cars go to Czech Republic.

name: Couleurmate (Hitchwiki)
comment: It's indeed worthless to go further than the street mentioned above. You can try the bus stop in front of the student's cafetaria (there is really cheap coffee and stuff to eat). But I rather succeeded to get a ride at the next bus stop after the bridge and there is a even a sign "Praga". And I went directly to Brno !

name: Hillar (Hitchwiki)
comment:
good spot with a sign: munich
There a lot traffic but not much place to stop...
Good spot! got a lift to Augsburg after 5 minutes
Bad for hitching to France (Strasbourg).  Most traffic turned off further north.

name: Xume (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very good for the direction Karlsruhe (north)
Expect a long wait time if heading north (Munich)
Got a lift to Heidelberg early in the morning.

name: Mrm1985 (Hitchwiki)
comment:
depends a lot on direction and time: Karlsruhe - no problem. If you want to get onto the A8 to Stuttgart, expect to wait a bit longer. Use a banner for that purpose and try to ask drivers with PF (Pforzheim) number plate...

Checking the road signs, there appears to not be any other service station before the road split in front of Karlsruhe. So better get off here or try to find an on-ramp at the crossroads.

name: TheKylling (Hitchwiki)
comment: It seems fairly easy to get lifts too Karlsruhe. However I waited 1 hour for a direct lift to Frankfurt.

name: Yhtam (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got offered lifts to Karlsruhe, Frankfurt and Nürnberg within 30 mins. Got a lift to Pforzheim direction Stuttgart after one hour. Friday morning in June. Agree with Mrm1985, if you are coming from south and wanna go to Stuttgart and your driver drives north: This is the place to get off.

Direction South on the A5 towards Basel
Needed 10min to get a ride with two Australian guys who brought me to Freiburg.
It was a bit hard to get to Freiburg on a saturday afternoon. Many people going to Strasbourg, local traffic aswell. After one and a half hour got a lift from a german couple.

A good spot, to stop and to be seen.
There is also a bus going to Nuremberg from here.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Nice place. Not so crowded but at least all traffic goes in your direction and raststatte Siegerland on the connecting A45 is close!

Quite a nice spot If you're going north- or eastbound. Average waiting time was about 1hour30min (stood there twice). Be patient and it will go swimmingly. If you need to resupply there are two supermarkets on the other side of the highway (5-10min walk). Go through the tunnel and you should see them.
very good to go from west (Frankfurt) to east (Erfurt/Leipzig/Dresden/Berlin) on the A4. stood there a few times, never waited longer then 15mins!

name: CuleXus (Hitchwiki)
comment: Again just a dream for a hitchhiker (going east). Drank a beer, smoked a cigarette and got a ride directly to Jena. Perfect!

name: Kriechstrom (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a lift to Kassel easily. Much better than the other side!

name: Alice d25 (Hitchwiki)
comment:
coming from the A7 (goettingen, kassel - north) i wanted to turn to the A4 for going east on a monday afternoon in smmer. 
not soo many cars passed, most of them went north, very few went east. 
i waited for about an hour to find someone who took me 60 km further to eisenach. poor!

name: Licor007 (Hitchwiki)
comment: veeeeery difficult to go east in the evening, very easy to go north

name: Ebrithil (Hitchwiki)
comment: very difficult spot! very small. most foreign drivers who dont know german or english so more difficult to hitchhike

name: Postfrosch (Hitchwiki)
comment: ... very good spot to change direction to North or West. Allways good experiences if you ask the people at the gas station.

hitch hiked with a friend on a Saturday evening over there. we were 2guys. it was already dark. waited from 7:15 pm to 8:45 pm. which is not the best, but saturday evening, sun already got done and 2guys are not the best factors for hitch hiking.... so ok
Female, alone. Not too much traffic at the petrol station, but asking people I got a ride North in 15min. Many people were going east via A4

name: Fraughtwithsounds (Hitchwiki)
comment: easy to get a ride north on A7. to go east on A4 takes a little more patience
Most people went towards A4, seems like people have very different experiences here.
Good spot for going direction Dresden or Erfurt. Guess that's the best spot If you wanna leave Jena by the A4.
the one and only spot in Jena to get nearly everywhere (best for the A9 and A4 to Dresden) - used in dozens of times, waited there from 5min to 3h, direct lifts to Berlin and even Munich possible!
Good spot to go in the directions towards Dresden, and Frankfurt (A4) but also to Berlin and Munich (A9). At the gas station Hermsdorfer Kreuz is a tunnel which connects the 2sides.

name: Krassberd (Hitchwiki)
comment: I discovered the same experience. It seems to be impossible to go south. Most cars will use the A71 I guess. We walk to Hermsdorf West and got a lift in 5 min. Walking time is about 60 to 75 Minutes. You can try to catch a ride on the main road.

name: Krassberd (Hitchwiki)
comment: Great spot!
Nobody here late afternoon on a Saturday.
Ended up thumping it across the bushes on the Autobahn on ramp, way more cars there and plenty of place to stop
stood at the exit of the parking lot for a few minutes with a sign and was immediately offered a lift to bayreuth.
Needed to climb over a tence to get to the gas-station where more cars are available than at the "Rasthof" where the cross-walk tunnel is. At the gas-station it's quite easy to get a lift to Bavaria.
18.11.2011, got after 20min a lift to hermsdorfer kreuz (200km) - the sign: "a9, bt".

name: Julei (Hitchwiki)
comment: I waited for one hour to get a ride direction Regensburg.
ask drivers if can you pick you up just a few km to highway (doesnt matter which direction), and there is a good spot to catch.

name: Yooks (Hitchwiki)
comment: Like the last comment said, you should thumb without a sign and try to get to the highway a bit further ahead, the ramp there is a better spot as it narrows down your traffic.

name: Xavier (Hitchwiki)
comment: Hard to get a lift to Regensburg. Lot of local trafic.

name: Cha (Hitchwiki)
comment: If going north: Last reststop before Regensburg where A3 and A93 split - if you need to change cars, best get out here.

I've left Hamburg Direction A1 south (Dortmund) a couple of times from this spot. Very little space for you to stand and for the car driver to stop. You will have to decide quickly whether you hop in or not, otherwise you might block the traffic. Sometimes I waited less than 10 min, other times more than one hour.

name: Posiputt (Hitchwiki)
comment: i used this place once when the next on-ramp (othmarschen, about 1km walking distance) was closed. it was okay but not great, quite uncomfortable to stand and to stop. if possible, use othmarschen.
I live in Hamburg and use this place frequently. I'd say its average...as aforementioned there is little space to stop, but don't despair, somehow you will always get awy from from here!

name: Kwy1200 (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was waiting under the bridge on the ramp towards Hannover, and got a ride from a nice driver in 15 minutes to Lepzig.
Asked drivers at the gas-station. Found a driver who brought me almost directly to my home near Bielefeld (A2)

name: Krassberd (Hitchwiki)
comment: Easy to get a ride up north. Early afternoon on a Friday.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: We were still discussing where to stand without putting our thumbs out when sb already opened their window and asked us where we wanted to go, perfect! Really crowded on a friday afternoon.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: We stood even a little earlier at the roundabout close to the city centre. Worked fine.
For me it was a great point to get a ride to frankfurt!

took me 2h to get a lift to a place in thuringia. it was monday morning, many people just stopped before gooing to some places arround nuremberg.
 the point over there is again: u have traffic to nuremberg/würzburg and so on. you have traffic to highway direction frankfurt, ruhrarea, northern west germany, and u have traffic to leipzig... berlin... normal problems before big cities with many highways...

name: Redjo27 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Wanted to go to Berlin. After 90min I was taken to the next Rasthof Pegnitz (65km north)

name: Kidsam (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride to Berlin after 10 mins. I had a sign with 'B' on it and a smile, seems that was all that was needed.

name: NathanGardner (Hitchwiki)
comment: I had a sign saying Richtung A9 Nord. I stood near te Saturn V model rocket. There is a spotnear there where there is tramper graffiti written all over som signs. Stand exactly there!

name: Chris1337 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good spot, but it will be hard to find a ride to prague. All the other directions are perfect

name: Ivan Đogić (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good spot. I was there two times, both going to Berlin and for both getting a straight ride after about 1,5 hours. I like this spot a lot, very comfortable. A lot of forest and meadows around to pitch a tent if needed to stay overnight.

name: ESko (Hitchwiki)
comment: two guys having a sign CZ. Almost nobody goes to CZ, because they mostly go through Regensburg, it would be a great detour to go through here. I believe that someone waited here 13 hours to get to Prague. Anyway, a guy stopped after 45 mins and told us he's going close to CZ. I thought he was taking A 6, but he took A9 and left us close to Hof, so we had to go to Dresden and then finally to Prague. But maybe we were lucky, because we could have waited here 24 hours to get a lift to Prague.

name: Emanuele19956 (Hitchwiki)
comment: waited 45 mins for a ride to Wurzburg8
Aside of a Jet fuel station, so you can wait with a sign (cars can stop at the small intersection behind) or ask people. Still lots of local traffic, unfortunately.

name: Burmica (Hitchwiki)
comment:
I waited two times directly in front of the Jet gas station and both times I got a ride within 5 minutes. 
There is no better way to travel.

name: Coolf (Hitchwiki)
comment:
By asking person who are taking fuel at the petrol station.
It took me app. 20 min to get a ride torwards stuttgart.
most people i asked were from munic but still drove up north,
but still found a great ride ☺
Very good with a Sign. Asking People at the Petrol Station is not very helpful beause of much local traffic, but maybe you are lucky.

name: Burmica (Hitchwiki)
comment: Pretty good, jumped off the car and the third I asked took me directly to Munich
Also found a ride direct to Munich pretty quickly. And theres free wifi in the lofted cafe and burger king.

name: Emanuele19956 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very good to continue south on A9. I got a ride to Munich in 40 mins.

name: Tabea (Hitchwiki)
comment: good spot, took us a while though to get a ride to Munich as a couple

name: Khorporative (Hitchwiki)
comment: A big street with cars going all directions and autobahn starting right at the beginning of the ramp. There was almost no traffic at evening hours and I just quit after ~15-20 minutes.
this is a spot where I had easy times around weekend but hard times during the week and generally after sunset

name: Krassberd (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not a good spot for cars to pull over from city direction. For the other direction is a traffic light at least.

name: Maltoe (Hitchwiki)
comment: Average spot to get a ride to the circle autobahn (A10), if you're in a hurry. Not easy for cars to stop, you have to get in during the red phase of the traffic lights. Most of the cars will stay in town, but sometimes you get lucky and people will stay on the autobahn to get out of town, in which case you can ask them to take you to Michendorf (huge petrol station at the A10), from which you can go basically everywhere (south, west).

name: RazorSK (Hitchwiki)
comment:
2 guys, Saturday at 18 o'clock, to Dresden

we tried both sides and didn't managed to catch a ride, on the one side there's no sufficient place to stop cars and on the other one wasn't really much cars going event that direction, we then moved to spot in southwest direction
Good location to go east. Especially friday super easy to go to Poland. I used it on a Saturday early morning and got a lift all the way to wroclaw in 20 minutes .

name: Mrw.witteveen (Hitchwiki)
comment: Used it on a weekday in summer, going in direction of Dresden. It's a fairly good spot, but not too many people turn towards Dresden form here. Watch out for the cars in your back, the ramp you stand on is very slim. Took me 45 mins to get a ride.
Same as RazorSK - westood there for 1,5 h and didnt catch any ride at all (2 persons, saturday in august at 18:00). went back home when the sun got down.

name: Timsen (Hitchwiki)
comment: The spot is not too bad as people can stop in the entrance to the street turning right. However, you need to climb up from the bike path to the street.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Don't stand at the lights, walk up a bit to where the road goes left to the highway and right to the parking. Cars don't go that fast yet, see you perfectly and have plenty of space.
took some time but got a ride with three peolple towards fehmarn

Tried to catch  a car here without any result.But you can still try it because cars stop here on traffic lights or a bit further on the turn to the parking. Instead of doing this we went to the bus stop down the road (it's on A25 just before roundabout) and found a lift here to Fehmarn.
Great to get in westward direction (Aachen). For a lift onto the A3 you have to wait a while. Make clear if you want to hitch north- or southward!

name: DerZyklop (Hitchwiki)
comment: This was so bad, because the people were to fast to stop before they get to the autobahn. And the next gas-station around the corner hat very little traffic. So i decided to take the tram to Frechen

name: Ebrithil (Hitchwiki)
comment: The bad point about this spot is that the most of the people on this road are heading towards Hürth or Brühl so only a few people are going on the highway

name: Chirimuyu (Hitchwiki)
comment: I walked from the central station heading for the highway and it took me 1 hour walking out of the city trying to get a ride. Then somebody picked me up more or less at the marked spot and brought me to the gas station direction to Ulm.

name: Slodo (Hitchwiki)
comment: We (two guys) got picked quite fast to direction Munich
I gave up after 3 hours. My direction was Munich :(
We got a ride close to Ulm, thumbing with sign, maybe 20 to 30 minutes (=
Got offered a ride to cologne after 10 minutes when i wasn't even asking. a couple saw my sign laying beneath my stuff and asked me whether they could get me anywhere.. :)
very good spot to hannover or hamburg

Good spot for both directions.

To get here from Ulm take the train to Kellmünz (free for Ding-semester-ticket holders), walk over the track and river and take road "Sägeweg" before the Autobahn.
On winter weekends, the Raststätte on direction north sees thousands of Dutch&Belgian families returning from the Alps. Fewer cars than I expected were going all the way north on A7.
If someone ever is there with no place to sleep, i live only a few minutes away and i always have place in my hone

name: Cha (Hitchwiki)
comment: Hi anonymous - how do we contact you when we get stuck there?

It seems a bit more difficult to get from here towards Bodensee. Most cars went down the A7.
In the end I got a ride nearly all the way through Switzerland with a guy going to Northern Italy.

name: Yooks (Hitchwiki)
comment:
It's a large gas station with a restaurant and a parking lot. A very good place to hitchhike as you have the parking lot and the station to talk with drivers.

Directions: From Nuremberg take the S2 (mostly not controlled) train to Schwabach. Go through the Laubenhaid forest/park and towards the highway, follow the paths.
If you walk there from Schwabach you need to cross railways (there's no bridge or anything).

name: Achi (Hitchwiki)
comment: Doesn't work for going North or East (Frankfurt, Nuremberg..), don't waste your time standing there..
the cars are really fast but it works if you are reallaxed - i tried to go to freiburg from there
waited for a long time in direction to frankfurt. went then to the south entry of the central train station and asked people for a ride

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Lots of Polish traffic obviously. We got a truck to Poznań in 20min.
asking people in front of burger king following the number plates works well. three people asked, third took us.
started here several times. never had any problems getting on my way north.

name: Najuste (Hitchwiki)
comment: it really helps standing at the bus stop (just in front of the entrance to the gas st.), as then drivers can turn in the gas station and stop comfortably to pic you up!
Got a ride in less than 15 minutes towards NL. Great spot.

name: Pawel.wita (Hitchwiki)
comment: I think it place is actually better for going north and south than the official at the webpage (I mean these in Roxel)
Gtreat spot! I just got there and had no time to even raise my sign and the man offered a lift to Dusseldorf himself. I was heading north, so I turned the offer down.Next  lift in less than 15 min!
It took me about an hour to get a ride but that's probably because I had "Enschede" on my sign. When I changed it to "Steinfurt" I got a ride within 10 minutes. I would still say this is a good spot.

name: Alagosnir (Hitchwiki)
comment: After a while a ride came up directly to Prague.
It is a little, normaally frequented place. The people here are nice and usually go direction Dresden, you don't have to ask often. Once I had a good experience here
1 and half to dresden

name: Mrgnd (Hitchwiki)
comment: 10 minutes and to dresden, pretty sweet
its the last traffic light before the cars are taking the ramp to the highway.

name: Timsen (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very good spot to get in the direction of Berlin/Leipzig...however, many people drive only till Münchberg/Hof. Go to Münchberg or Frankenhöhe then...

name: RoteHosentreger (Hitchwiki)
comment: My standard spot. There is enough space on the right side to stop. Furthermore the road to the motorway has 2 lanes so cars are not blocking the traffic

name: Anninassi (Hitchwiki)
comment: jep. we did it to hamburg after waiting 45 minutes in the sun :D

name: Santa klaus (Hitchwiki)
comment: Okay for going south - standard rest area.

name: Zd1908 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited for one hour in the rain. For Hamburg ideal.

name: Binbash (Hitchwiki)
comment: the second person we asked took us with him. could wave at the people that took us with them before... good to get to hamburg

name: Adamiksen (Hitchwiki)
comment: got a ride to Münster in 15 min, very good spot especially in summer! Lots of Danes going to south.

name: Ewelinalucy (Hitchwiki)
comment: September 2014. As a group of 3, we camped there. The staff wasn't that friendly. We had to part ways here. We stumbled upon 3 other hitchhikers on that gas station (2 of them from Hitchgathering, going to Turkey). We were the last ones to get a ride after quite a long waiting time.

name: Cille (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride to Hamburg in 5 mins using a sign..
A lot of cars past by, but most of them are not going on the Autobahn

name: N0id (Hitchwiki)
comment: True. If you want to go further than Berlin try to get a driver going at least past Michendorf!

name: N0id (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got my second direct lift to Magdeburg in a row, despite a longer waiting time. Directly before the Schönefelder Kreuz is a parking space where you can get off if your driver is continuing in the wrong direction for you.

name: Mileagainst (Hitchwiki)
comment: I stood at the exit of Shell petrol station but already on the road and I got a ride by car waiting at the the traffic light, so i recommend standing on that piece of road just to collect all the traffic (from gas station and from the street coming from town)
It is not true! I´ve been hitch-hicking for many many years. And it happened very seldom what you were saying.It was just a lucky day. An angel just crossed your path.

name: Achi (Hitchwiki)
comment: The truck stop Rosenhof which used to be there is closed (and has been closed for years, judging by the vegetation overgrowing the former parking lot), therefore most cars passing aren't going on the Autobahn..

name: Cha (Hitchwiki)
comment: Bad. And yet, it worked for me within 15 minutes. Would NOT recommend it, though!
definively possible here, had lifts in 2 minutes, but also 90.
use this location relatively often, you can get a lift in 15 mins or 1hr. can be frustrating

name: Railway (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Août 2014. Seul, je n'ai jamais été pris après plus de 4 heures d'attente, pluie et froid au rendez-vous. Je me suis tristement résolu à prendre le train.

J'ai essayé avec un carton indiquant CHEMNITZ. Puis j'ai essayé sans carton. J'ai testé les deux bretelles d'accès (il y avait beaucoup de place pour s'arrêter sur cette autre bretelle mais presque pas de trafic)... Rien à faire. A croire que les gens ne comprenaient pas ce que je faisais là (d'après les signes qu'ils me faisaient en tout cas).
_________________________

August 2014. Alone, never pick-up and stay here for 4 hours with rain and cold. I took the train after this long time of wait.

I tried with CHEMNITZ sign. And after I try without sign. I tried the other entry (with more place to stop) but not possible. Nobody pick-up me. I felt I was like an alien who people look with interrogations.

name: Witowitold (Hitchwiki)
comment: God lift in direction of Nurnberg quite fast ~15 minutes
Never try to hitchhike here because cars can't stop for you
allways used this spot to escape - and it worked within 30 minutes in every direction - west, east, north, south
its a good spot..i use this location several times a month

name: Werner (Hitchwiki)
comment: Directly Leipzig within a minute.

waited here for a lift to nuremberg twice - one time on a holiday at 10 am (45 mins wait) and another time without much luck (saturday 3 pm - gave up after 2 hours). it still is a good spot though; especially leipzig and berlin are suposedly really easy.

name: Gangrelito (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was waiting for only 20 min, direction: Berlin, August, Sunday afternoon. You can catche drives from petrol station, but also from the road, on the same spot. I was picked up by Porsche driver, 270 km/h in one moment. Best drive ever. :)

Awesome for direction Leipzig. But shouldn't be hard to find someone heading further either. 

In my opinion eg. for going to Leipzig: don't bother with the petrol station and just thumb next to the road. ~Lukas

name: Meinhard (Hitchwiki)
comment: It might be wise to either walk to the A14 or take bus number 6 or 6A and get off at Raben-Steinfeld and walk the rest.

name: Meinhard (Hitchwiki)
comment: this is my home spot, i grew up in pinnow! :)

name: Krassberd (Hitchwiki)
comment: worked well on a sunday noon

actually it's not entirely impossible to get a lift to schwerin from here.. ;) either try right at the exit or walk to the petrol station 100 m down the road. i did it a few times, but i suppose being local helped a lot. :)

i came from Hamburg on the way to Lenzen (Elbe) - behind Ludwigslust.
At the exit 12 is a petrol station where you can get a lift but its good if you have a sign.

name: Krassberd (Hitchwiki)
comment: To get to Schwerin on a friday noon was not bad. A  sign will increase chances.
we arrived here on a Friday morning and it took more than an our to get a lift to Berlin.

name: Santa klaus (Hitchwiki)
comment: Often difficult to find somebody to Halle, Leipzig or Dresden since most people go to Berlin. Probably the best place around, though.
ask at the petrol station

name: Prochy (Hitchwiki)
comment: I got here around midnight on Saturday so I had to wait for a long time. A taekwondo team going to Nuremberg agreed to take me.

name: Adamiksen (Hitchwiki)
comment: according to my experience there is quite little traffic on this motorway saturday evening. was very lucky to get a ride to Karlsruhe in 10 min, though there were ca. 10-12 cars resting at the same time, not a lot...

name: AndyKay (Hitchwiki)
comment: we were lucky and at daytime a lot of people stopped there... there was traffic jam so they could leave the rest stop as quick as usually and we could get a ride after 5 minutes trying.

name: Flasher702 (Hitchwiki)
comment: I think this marker is obsolete as they have changed all the roads at the airport. A little further earlier on the road, right by the departure (upper level) or arrival (lower level) gates works fine.

name: Trt (Hitchwiki)
comment: Almost all cars were heading west. Took 30 min of asking until someone drove us to a rest stop north. Took 5 min from the rest stop to get a ride
There's a gas station where you can ask. No recommendation if you're heading north. Took me 3 hours.
Indeed not recommended for going north on the A3. Lots of local rides and some to Wiesbaden, Stuttgart, München etc.

name: TheKylling (Hitchwiki)
comment: Stand on the nearby bridge instead. More traffic!
took me a while to get north on the a3 because most are locals/ heading to the airport
Many people going south to Strasbourg and Switzerland but no one continuing on the A8 towards Stuttgart or Pforzheim.
Saturday evening, we were 2 people going to Karlsruhe and Stuttgart. Very low traffic (approx. 5 cars parked), nevertheless got a ride directly to our places in 10 minutes.
april 2012 - good spot for me, heading south (that day, ended in Konstanz am Bodensee)

I was lucky I think. I arrived around 10 am and it was very very calm although the station was quite big. Fortunately there was a car heading to Köln/Cologne which could took me a long end in my direction.
you can easily get to the raststätte sindelfinger wald from stuttgart büsnau or sindelfingen via landstraße. just cross the street and around the corner, no fences and no long distance
very good connection to the east (A8)

name: Tommy90 (Hitchwiki)
comment: got a lift directly to Munich. Had been dropped of by a car, and the second car driver I asked gave me that lift to Munich.

name: WholeKogan (Hitchwiki)
comment: No Use for a sign here! Just ask the Drivers at the Gas station. You should be picked up within 40 minutes, rather less!

name: Paczix (Hitchwiki)
comment: We were asking drivers to go to Munich, finally a girl offered us to take us close to Ulm.
First car I asked drove me to Munnich with an average speed of 180 km/h

name: Chenga (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very nice place. Waited max 5min in the rain until someone offered me a direct lift to Ulm. Perfect!

name: Makuc (Hitchwiki)
comment: Great place. Some lady took me my girlfriend in to the last service station before Ulm.

name: Fred57 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Was quite lucky, somebody offered us a direct lift to Salzburg!

name: Sattleryan (Hitchwiki)
comment: Two years ago, I got a direct lift to Oktoberfest from this place within just a few minutes
tried to get to Munich but people were rather just driving a few kilometres...For going further north it might be good but for going into the direction of Munich, prefer Sindelfinger Wald
difficult to get a ride to the north (Heilbronn)
5 min to get a car down the A14
after a lot of construction work, this spot is pretty good in direction of the A81. there's a pretty long interweaving lane, where cars can stop without problems.

name: Sam iam (Hitchwiki)
comment: If you're going to Italy, I guess it's an option (but won't take you much further than Rosenheim if going to Munich).
Good place to get out of Stuttgart to the north. It’s best to ask people at the gas station if they’re going up north on the A81 (look for license plates LB (Ludwigsburg) and HN (Heilbronn)).

name: Bence16 (Hitchwiki)
comment: We got a lift to the A81 after 10 minutes. It was a short ride, but helpful.

name: Pite (Hitchwiki)
comment: going to czech, got a ride after 20 mins, but they could take us to the a10.

name: Khorporative (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was standing at the ramp for about 4 hours with a sign with big DD letters trying to catch a ride to Dresden. No luck, but the place did not seem very good either.

going to prague alter
30 minutes waiting time 
but before us there were two hitchers for two hours without succes you just have to dance or something do a performance
booom!
