stood there for 2,5 hours on a very busy day. no cars going to dresden though - another hitchhiker came much earlier than me and wasnt lucky either. i would choose another spot
I tried this place for a lift to Dresden. It took 2 1/2 hours to get one. Cars cant stop here. I usually use the place at "Altglienicke" to Dresden, it isn't really good but works much better!

name: Davidkuski (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not a bad place. I got a car from here to Dresden.
I was standing not exactly on the ramp but 20-30 meters before. There was plenty of space for cars to hold, and got a ride all the way to Dresden within five min.

name: Choubidoowap (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was standing here for 4h hours, then the police came to say that i won't have any ride here. And the rain arrived, i left to take a bus to Praha.

name: Cfonteny (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not a good place to go in Poland, I've waited for 3h without results

name: Xkomczax (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good spot in the north direction - there are driving trough people going from south (Stuttgart, Switzerland, ...) and east (Heilbronn, Nürnberg, Czech republic, ...) to the north (Köln, Aachen, Netherlands).

name: RedFox (Hitchwiki)
comment: NIGHTMARE!!! Towards Netherlands, as of april 2014, there are construction cones before the entrance, nobody stops here. We have seen less than 10 cars an hour.

name: Reggae-girl (Hitchwiki)
comment: Lot's of cars going to Frankfurt or the Netherlands. Just a few cars to Kaiserslautern or Saarbrücken.
asked people at the petrol station with no result, after 15 minutes the staff send me away. waited about an hour more with hamburg sign near the street and go a lift to stolpe a111 petrol station..

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Better directly at the on-ramp :)

name: Thumb-up (Hitchwiki)
comment: you can also show your thumb to the passing by cars. Worked fine for me.
This spot is wrongly placed. It's the next station south from here.
wrongly placed!!

I find the spot after the crossroads, the entrance of the autobahn, much more successful than the actual bus stop. I'm not sure why, but waiting times there are around ten minutes, while at the bus stop i've waited for ages/hours.

name: Seeker126 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Really good spot to get onto the Autobahn. There is plenty of traffic at the crossroad and enuogh space on the side of the road for cars to stop.
apparently under construction (=closed) right now. i think I'll try Auestadion tomorrow morning.
I've waited more than 2 hours to get a car to Dortmund. But i think it's still the best spot.

name: Falko (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Absolutely no luck there after dark. The bus stop should be better than the crossing though, as it is the only opportunity for drivers to stop next to the street. Only cars from a little village have to pass the crossing in order to enter the Autobahn, drivers from Kassel already enter the Autobahn on-ramp  before.

Also the name of bus stop is BIRKENKOPF, and is reached via line 52.

A lot of local traffic going north. Ask the people at the Burger King parking lot or the gas station, that's where most of the people from the A8 go to in my experience. If you need any infos about the busses etc. go to the reception of the hotel. The two receptionists were pretty friendly and helpful and seemed to be used to the sight of hitchhikers.

name: Fverhart (Hitchwiki)
comment: Use Polish flag! LOL

name: Phidias81 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Long time waiting for a 10 km  ride that screwed us up, direction Netherlands

Not many cars, most are locals. It is possible to get to the Netherlands but I was told the on northern motorway entry it's easier since many Dutch people go there for shopping (not on Sunday though).
Very easy to get to Cologne

Sunday around 11:00,
direction Saarbrücken,
1 Car / 5 Minutes
took around 30minutes to get a lift
a bus station a little bit after the junction and red light. but it took a lot time to get a lift.

name: Poebbels (Hitchwiki)
comment: Going north is as easy as going south, stand on the on-ramp for the highway. But how do you go to Freiburg? I found that hard!
got rides to Prague two times in very short time

name: Rconnard (Hitchwiki)
comment: Practically no space for cars to stop. We got picked up around 9PM, after a 30 minute wait but didn't make it to Prague in one ride.

Tried directly to Prague with sign "Praha", didnt work for 1 hour: 99,9% of cars go only to Pirna. Then took ride to the resting place 500 meters further on the highway and after 10 seconds got a ride straight to Prague from there...
So I would suggest going to the P/resting place and you''ll be sure to leave straight to Prague from there
I got a ride at sunset in 15 minutes directly intro Prague

name: Feo (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very good for getting to Pirna. Waited for 1,5-2 hours with no luck using a Prague sign. Changed it to Pirna and within 10 minutes a car stopped and brought me to a gasstation nearby.

name: Davidkuski (Hitchwiki)
comment: If you are going to Praha i think try first go to Pirna. Everybody going there. Or try with CZ table.

name: Kralx15 (Hitchwiki)
comment: It's perfect spot in order to leave Dresden towards east. It's quite possible to find a car directly to Prague as well as to Pirna. We (two) wanted to go to Prague and waited just 3 mins with a Pirna sign. then, we left the car at the servis station just 1200 meters away from the spot. My suggestion is that firstly try to hitch Prague cars at least one hour. unless u hitch, show your Pirna sign and take a lift in 5 mins. It worths to try. It was 10th of August, 2012. Good luck ;)

name: Dynamo (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride to the next rest area - 15 minutes waiting time.
got a ride to the czech republic in 30 mins or so. the traffic is dense and there is a lot of space - an overall good spot. didn't get a direct ride to prague though

I have to admit that I didn't read all this stuff beforehand. However, I had a extremely bad experience with just using a "Prague" sign. I waited for 3 hours on a monday afternoon with temperatures around -10°C and just one car stopped during the entire time (and was just driving a few kilometres, didn't know there will be a resting place in a few more meters)...so, next time I would also do it with the Pirna sign.

name: Brunolimaam (Hitchwiki)
comment: Is it legal to go there? id doesn't seem like a pedestrian place

I can't choose option "bad" for this stop. So I will just describe by myself here. I had really bad expierence on this spot. I waited there more than 1 hour and nothing. was good traffic, but drivers don't stop. I yhink they can stop there. but it a little bit uncomfortable. In the end i diceded to change spot.

Very good spot to hitchhike to Scandinavia. Just take a look cars, which has Danish, Norwegian or Swedish registration plate and try ur luck. Heaps of cars stop this spot for rest and fill a tank. Got a ride after 1 hour waiting.

But it is very hard to reach this spot. First u have to take S21 from Hamburg citycenter to  Eidelstedt (to direction of Elbgaustraße),then take a train A1 to Quickborn sud (to direction of Kaltenkirchen) and finally walk 3-4 km in forest.

name: Santa klaus (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not easy to find a ride beyond Hamburg. But its worth the struggle, next station (Holmmoor) is worse.
NO cars to Berlin?? Not many Car to Berlin ...  is okey

name: Stumi (Hitchwiki)
comment: It's hard to Prague, but not impissible

name: Sorokin (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good to Poland

name: Kundrt (Hitchwiki)
comment: Quite OK to CZ, harder to Berlin

spring 2014; wanted to go from Berlin to Vienna; I waited 2,5 hours but no one to Prague/Czech or Austria. Very good for Poland but not going down south through Czech. Took finally a ride into Dresden to organize myself by bus....

name: AdrianB (Hitchwiki)
comment: we were standing here for 1 hour (boy+girl) and a Bulgarian truck driver took us to Prague, which was our final destination for that day. Hitch at the very and of this place! :]

name: Xkomczax (Hitchwiki)
comment: truck into Czech Republic after 15 minutes, but most of the cars heading into Poland

name: Propek (Hitchwiki)
comment: very good place to go Poland

name: Kovacspetyesz (Hitchwiki)
comment: great spot (lot trucks / personal cars) to CZ
Also easy to ask at the gas station. Best spot for North/East.
Very good place if you want to go north,Berlin etc.
Waited few houndred meters from the petrol station, the place seemed to be good, but there were two of us and the day was Easter Sunday, probably thats why it took us so long.
Best for Berlin

my fav in dd (i live around the corner)! i hitchhiked very often to berlin from here. i waited from 1 minute (sunny weather) til 30 minute (heavy snowing). i often stand before the shell petrol station, but asking the drivers direcly at the petrol station is also a good idea. it's also a good starting point for going to leipzig, chemnitz and further west and south (bavaria, austria, italy, france, spain). you should ask for the raststätte dresdner tor near wilsdruff. there you can change the car easily.
part 2: a link to the above mentioned raststätte dresdner tor/wilsdruff (to change for leipzig and chemnitz): http://hitchwiki.org/maps/?zoom=12&lat=51.062496853856&lon=13.575142621994
part 2: a link to the above mentioned raststätte dresdner tor/wilsdruff (to change for leipzig and chemnitz): <map lat="51.061383479751" lng="13.581996000365" zoom="16" view="0" float="right" />
Perfect to go north Berlin or Hamburg via Berlin. If you want to go west direction Chemnitz it's sometimes better to go to the access 78 "Dresden Altstadt".

name: Alice d25 (Hitchwiki)
comment: in winter 2012 i waited also one hour or more - surprising. one day it was about 15 degrees celsius under zero (maybe people didn't want to open the door because of the cold). the other day was the day after a huge antifascist demonstration but only local elderly people were around. maybe the berlin antifascists didn't start early enough for my plans (2 or 3 pm)
Waited for 25 minutes in the cold, and got a direct lift to berlin!
waited 10minutes on a sunday... 11 in the morning, got direct lift to berlin

well after waiting some weeks ago 10minutes on sunday... i made a not that good experience yesterday (tuesday) 1:30PM... waited for 2,5hours... my impression: there is much more traffic on working days... i saw also many cars with berlin licence plates... but every car on the wrong lane never had the chance to stop... met some guys who went to petrol station to HH 1h our after me and they already got their ride to berlin before i got my ride with the sign on that spot....
Friday morning starting 9.30 took me 30 minutes. One week later 7.30. I gave up after 2 hours. Way to little traffic going to Berlin in the morning. Try afternoon!

name: Pietari (Hitchwiki)
comment: We didn't get a ride at night time from here (two man) but in the morning about 7 o clock some german engineer took us to Berlin. Also we saw two other hitchikers there so it might be good to come early if u want the best spot ;)
we were waiting 1h until we got a lift to Bautzen for 3 people
Got a ride to Poland in 15 min, just standing a little before the gas station with a sign.

I waited here with sign"B"
only 1 min
I got a hike to Berlin
Great spot, but can get a bit crowded. I waited endlessly behind a scruffy looking character, but he finally gave up and I had a ride in 20 minutes
perfect spot with a sign B i was waiting just 5 minutes
Two Girl at 18:00,a sunday. We have waited 20 minutes with Berlin sign.
Waited for 5 minutes on a Tuesday at 12, direction Berlin

name: Jussuf (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited about 20 minutes direction Leipzig. Not the best place to start I suppose, to me it seems I just had luck not to wait longer.

name: RazorSK (Hitchwiki)
comment:
2 guys, Friday morning, 25 minutes, to Berlin

Found 2 cardboards with Berlin sign on them, very popular and great spot.

name: Kriechstrom (Hitchwiki)
comment: The standard hitchhiking spot towards Berlin. There are construction works at the moment but its still easy to get a ride. Waited 15 minutes once (one guy) and 15 seconds another time (couple).

Direction to Berlin, waited 30+minutes then I moved a bit behind the gastation and on my move a car stopped and asked me where i want to go and driver took me right in front of my hostel in Berlin :) good old pap
For Austria it's better to walk to the border where many cars have to stop to buy a wignette. For direction north this is okay, but unfortunately there's not a lot of place to stop. Bring a sign!
april 2012 - not a lot of space for cars to stop, but a good spot with trees to protect from the sun

name: Kidp3 (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Was headed to Munich, but got here at night. There's a streelight that should provide enough light to make you and your sign visible. Took an hour to get a ride, after a few people stopped/slowed down to see where I was heading.

Lots of cars headed north avoid using the highway in Austria, since they have to pay for a vignette. This is where they rejoin on the German side.

name: Slodo (Hitchwiki)
comment: Hitchhiked twice from this spot at night direction Munich. I waited just in front of the roundabout and used a sign. I would recommend it

name: Cha (Hitchwiki)
comment: Spot to get to Munich and Bregenz - right in front of the tree next to the exit of the roundabout. Cars go slow because of the roundabout, good visibility. Worked very well twice, far better than the gas station.

name: Cha (Hitchwiki)
comment: This spot works very well for me to get to Munich as well as  Friedrichshafen! Very short waiting times.
Started my journey with a sign "Zürich" and waited about 25-30 min. Got a ride till St. Gallen

name: Jmichele44 (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was trying to get onto the A7 going north, waited here for 30 mins had no luck. walk east and try from the 'B199'

name: Grinsolt (Hitchwiki)
comment: If you go a hunder mether further and turn right, there will be the junktion to the speedway, with a green ditch and some grass so people can stop. This is a better place to hitch.

name: Mistersunfield (Hitchwiki)
comment: This is a great place to go South (any direction!). I waited for fifteen minutes to get a ride home (Eindhoven, the Netherlands). Took the advice to stop here instead of later on, worked out great!

name: Grinsolt (Hitchwiki)
comment: Average rest area, you never wait long. Remember that there is no gas station on the other side of the highway, so dont plan with it when youre going north.

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: I waited 1 1/2 hours for a lift to A2, east (Berlin).

name: Wasserpflanze (Hitchwiki)
comment: Never waited more than 20 min here in any direction when asking people directly.

name: Grgrrp (Hitchwiki)
comment: Stood right at the entry (where trucks and cars split) with a sign and quickly found a car to go with - even more offers when my girlfriend was standing there alone. Mostly nice people.

Sunday afternoon:
Nearly everybody was going south here, but only a few people had 2 free seats for us. After 20 minutes we found a couple that gave us a lift to Göttingen.
Don't agree with the description, the petrol station here is pretty crowded. The disadvantage is that cars spread all over the place because of the restaurant 250m away.

name: Fverhart (Hitchwiki)
comment: Looking for a spot to pee, a Dutch car stopped behind me, the girl asking "do you want a ride?" =D

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: I had to climb over the fence because the door was closed.

name: Pite (Hitchwiki)
comment: OS sign is definitly useful!

name: Besto (Hitchwiki)
comment: Yes, i always have a sign!

name: Jansmax (Hitchwiki)
comment: This was spot was ok to get a ride to the next gas station between Bremen and Oldenburg, but not sure if it's suitable for long directions.
on-ramp towards Aachen is currently closed :/

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: I found a lift to Raststaette Lichtendorf on the A1 (next to Dortmund) immediately.

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: Most cars go to Cologne directly. I needed 1 1/2 hours for a lift onto A1 direction north.
if you are here you lost

name: Rivière (Hitchwiki)
comment: True, almost no space. But the frequency of traffic was ok, after 5 minutes I got a lift to Krefeld.

name: Efrolov (Hitchwiki)
comment: I met here one girl. She also wanted to go to Berlin. Together we got a car to Berlin. I was waiting here for 40 min. While we waited, three cars stopped, but they went to Lübeck.
we just got picked up and they took us all the way to Berlin :)
Met another guy there. We waited about 10 min, and got a car Lübeck.

name: Posiputt (Hitchwiki)
comment: good place to get to berlin or lübeck. use a sign for convenience.

name: Mikan (Hitchwiki)
comment: not so much space for the cars to stop and they arrive quite quickly. prefer the bus stop before the roundabout.
Very good place. There was even a stable hitchhiking sign to Berlin and Lübeck :)

name: Johann von Elszt (Hitchwiki)
comment: You're visible from far away and the side-strip is broad. Comfortable for car-drivers.
Great spot at the start of the motorway, cars can pull onto the hardshoulder. If the police pass by the will tell you to get away from there, but usually you will find a ride before that
On a monday afternoon with warm and sunny weather it took me about 15min to hitch a ride.

Medenbach West
I start my trip in the late evening to vienna at 22.30 and i´ve to wait only 45min. I think its a good place, besides its a short way to walk from the busstation "Wiesbaden-Medenbach Kirchenfeldstraße" (Bus 21 from Wiesbaden).

name: GuterMensch (Hitchwiki)
comment: many "business"-people. go around and ask them. many people going to bavaria or baden-württemberg.
Lots of business traffic, big fuel station with many people going through - recommended!

name: Gareth SA (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very good location. I was trying to get from Cologne to Nurnburg, my lift from Cologne was going south at Frankfurt towards Heidelberg so I got dropped off here at this station. I got a lift with a crazy lady in a peaugot 306 cc that drove +200km/h in the dark (got picked up at 4pm winter time) - drove me all the way to Nurnburg A3/A9 intersection
a lot of business people going into frankfurt or south to stuttgart/Karlsruhe, not so many that stay on the A3.

name: GregGM (Hitchwiki)
comment: 2 ppl, early August around midday. Lots of cars. Got lucky and found a ride to Munich within 3 minutes.

name: Fossilhitchhiker (Hitchwiki)
comment: had a ride from a trucker direction south within couple of minutes
Got a ride to Würzburg with ease

name: Maxim1110 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Around noon on a Monday in November, direct ride to Munich within 15 minutes, great!

Got stuck here twice for almost an hour or so but it was worth the wait, once i got a ride directly to Munich - my destination, once to Nürnberg, lots of people heading only to the airport or down to Switzerland, or at least they say so.
There is no place to hitch if you want to go to the north.

name: Robbel (Hitchwiki)
comment: A lot of local traffic. I asked several people to take me but they could/would not take me. In the end I got a ride after 1h15m waiting. It was worth it! They put the address of my friend in Hamburg in their GPS and dropped me directly at the right place. Also the ride was very fast, in an audi at 180kms/h

name: Xhikerx (Hitchwiki)
comment: got a ride to hamburg within two min, first person i asked.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Took us 30min with sign Hamburg.

name: Benworm (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a lift to Oslo from this spot!
I tried to get on the A27 from here. I waited for three hours and still didn't find anybody... But if your going to Hamburg or Bremen, it is gonna be easy!
Good spot
great spot! waited less than five minutes and two cars stopped. first only wanted to go to pirna, the next city. one minute later a czech car stopped and brought us right til prague!

Hey guys for me It's a great spot. Best ride I ever had,I was standing under the sign( mention in the description)saying "Prague" it is safe but a bit difficult to reach check weel the map. and if you are going there by bus tell the driver which  place you are going and make him understand you are hitchhiking, for me it helped. After 10 min. late in the afternoon, whether was not very good a car stopped and strait to Prague. The girl that was driving was caring two people that were carpooling and one was going to Prague and I when at the same hostel(I didm't have one) and the driver brought us AT the hostel in the center of Prague seriously she waled in the hostel with us!! But remember it can be luck!
But good luck and have a great hitch!!
after a hard walk i arrived finaly at this place=) just need 30 minutes to get a ride to CZ nice place but hard to go there=)

name: Nazaryan92 (Hitchwiki)
comment: worked really well for me to go to prag. you open the above mentioned door, easily cross the street and here you are. ten minutes and you have a car to prague! good luck!

this area is not as good as advertised. me and a few other hitchhikers spent about 3 hrs to find a ride in front of the shopping centre, at the gas stations and at the traaffic lights. VERY few cars to dresden. we didnt get a ride in the end

name: Michelemormino (Hitchwiki)
comment: Quite good, but traffic is very well organized and cars arrive just when it's green, so they don't stop usually. Be patient...
few vehicles going to dresden. no place for them to stop doesn't help either

name: Arno Nuem (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not a good spot for us, cars almost can't stop (most of the cars drive by when the traffic light is green). You should rather walk to the onramp of the motorway.
it is very much better to start from the city, this is a spot directly in the sun, and there are mostly locals, I waited 1 hour alone as a woman!

Good spot. Bus from potsdam take you only a short walk away. Used a sign to get to Hannover, as we did not speak any German. Seemed to be plenty of traffic. Truck driver the one to take us in the end. Waited around 1 hour.

Was here on a Wednesday around 11am. Even though traffic was really low I got a lift further than Bielefeld after approx. 1h. I guess chances are much higher earlier in the morning or later in the afternoon when traffic ramps up.

name: Danek (Hitchwiki)
comment: Just asked people at the petrol station and got lift after five minutes to Hannover. Great place with a lot of people.
got here on a Monday afternoon, got a lift to Leipzig within 5 min., threre were also several other people hitchhiking towards all directions. Very Good!

name: Muttafuri (Hitchwiki)
comment: got a lift from the first guy i asked to magdeburg at 10 pm at night. very good place with a lot of cars..

name: Median (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited for 15 hours. 4 people (could split up). Late October.
Useless for going to the north (Rostock), cars go only to A2 and A9

name: Grzesiek.1993 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Great spot, got a lift, in a middle of the night, to Breda, NL (3 people).

name: Maxim1110 (Hitchwiki)
comment: The famous Michendorf, great spot indeed! When I got dropped off here I was making myself a sandwich outside and got offered a ride to Krefeld in a matter of minutes (I was going to The Netherlands).

name: Masanfe (Hitchwiki)
comment: Great place!! Arrived Tuesday midday and got picked up in 10 mins, just standing at the exit with my thum up by a super speedy car to Munich! (if you are in a hurry I think there's so much traffic you could even avoid trucks and go for cars)

name: Yooks (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Might be a bit tricky to reach from Berlin, Hauptbanhof. To get there take S7 in the direction of Potsdam and either take E23/33 from "Wannsee" or take the bus (ask the information office which number you have to take) to Michendorf Banhof and exit two stations after that station, then walk for about two kilometers and you are there.

It's a great spot with many opportunities, I would definitely recommend this spot to everyone!
Due to construction side (10.2017) there are very few cars on this side, definitive not recommended until the construction is over

name: Astala27 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Terrible place to go to Czech Republic or Praha. We were two and we have waited more the 2 hours, and we hitch a truck (among may be 10000 cars we tried to stop).

A LOT of cars to Berlin. Fewer to Hamburg or south but still enough to find a ride easily enough.
Use this spot to change cars if you're coming from the west and want to go further than Hannover.
I even met two fellow hitch-hikers (one of them with a dog!) who found cars to Berlin really, really fast.
I was going to Hamburg and it was no problem at all.

name: Alexan (Hitchwiki)
comment: A nice spot with a lot of traffic. Take from Garbsen the bus 126 and stop to the last station (Am Blauen See).
We were waiting one hour to go to Hamburg. But it was at night.

name: Filip.bartek (Hitchwiki)
comment: Many drivers stop here to rest and can be asked for a ride. I asked around 15 drivers before I found one that would take me to Magdeburg. I never had to wait for new drivers to come, despite the fact it was a holiday so I had to rely on personal cars completely. 2016-03-25

name: Thumb-up (Hitchwiki)
comment: I had to wait 5,5 hours to get a ride in direction Hamburg, during that time I got a lot of rides offered in direction Berlin. First offer after 20 minutes round about.

name: Urbanekto (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not easy to get the ride to the south (direction Hildesheim) but I stopped the car coming from the town by the road beside this petrol station
Very easy to get from here to Berlin. For Hamburg I waited about an hour in the morning. Towards south rather difficult, at least when it's not rush hour
waited 2 hrs on saturday, guess its faster to ask people in the fuelstation
oh, and in google maps you can see hitchhikers on that exact spot
I stood at the light for seven hours trying to get to rostock before giving up, so I don't know if this is a good place anymore.
we waited in the eveningtime about an half an hour. so its still a cool spot for hamburg, rostock and polland

usually cars going to Hamburg are on the left side of the street so its kind of difficult to get the people going in this direction. we had a sign saying hamburg and found after 15min a really cool guy taking us. the traffic lights are really helpful, like this people can stop

berlin-hamburg (waited 1 hour)
i walked between the cars when they waited for the green traffic lights
waited after the traffic light for about 45 min - got a ride to Walsleben  gasstation, but the guy was going to Rostock.
waited for two traficlights to get a ride to hamburg...best spot!
waited for 30 minutes with a sign before i got a lift to hamburg. two times.

name: Guussjaak (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Theoretical good place, took a bit longer than expected to get a ride to Hamburg, but it's alright. 
Cars drive slowly. Make sure to stand on the biking path so cars see you.

name: Elokuu (Hitchwiki)
comment: not very busy, but most of the cars are going to puttgarden for the ferry to denmark.
Most of the cars go to Puttgarden and you should be able to find a car.

name: BadWolf (Hitchwiki)
comment: Me and my friend found a ride before the driver who dropped us there even leave the petrol station!

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Early morning and we did get a local ride, but after only 8 cars in 45min we were more than happy to get out ;)

name: Mikan (Hitchwiki)
comment: this is a little resting area so not so many cars. but we found a lift quite easily, maybe because it was lunch time.

name: Tulipalo (Hitchwiki)
comment: not very busy, but you will finally catch a ride to the boat to denmark.

As said before not very busy especially not on a morning, but never the less the best stop after Lübeck if your driver is not going all the way up north to the ferry. Asked a friendly trucker who got me to Puttgarden.

name: GregGM (Hitchwiki)
comment: I got dropped there at 15.00 a weekday. Not many cars, maybe 35-45 during the hour I waited. Several locals going only to Neustadt and many fully packed tourist cars. Some trucks come through here and finally a truck picked me up to Malmö.
stranded on a Sunday, lunch time. Bad choice :D <took an hour to get onto Fehmarn
i life here...never saw a hitchhiker on that spot..mazbe better take tram 4 to dierkow until last stop and try there behind the bridge over the A 19

name: Ausschliessi (Hitchwiki)
comment: Great spot for both directions!

name: Elokuu (Hitchwiki)
comment: Perfect spot for going either north or south.

name: Binbash (Hitchwiki)
comment: you can go there from göttingen hauptbahnhof by taking bus 130. it costs 3,20€ and takes you to "raseanger", which is the closest bus station near the roadhouse/gas station.

its a great spot for north and south. but for east its hard. i waited there for hours, then i went back and tried it directly on the a38. i don't have a good solution, its not easy to go in the east from here.
After I found a lift to Allertal service station, 2 more people asked me if they could take me along
Was dropped off here in the middle of the night, had a ride on its way to take us to Hamburg but while waiting a guy came up and asked us where we were going and gave us a lift all the way to Lübeck.
sign needed (saying for e.g. "north" "south" or "hamburg"...)

name: Alice d25 (Hitchwiki)
comment: very good spot! the bus ride with bus no. 32 from kassel is fast (15-20 min), the bus stop is called "dahlheimer str.", i waited for 10 min.

name: Dynamo (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Two times I hitchhiked from this place. To Frankfurt it took me ~40 minutes and to Leipzig ~
10 minutes waiting time.

name: LaZubi (Hitchwiki)
comment: Hitchhiked with a sign "A38 Leipzig" at 3 PM and got a ride even to Dresden after 2 minutes.

name: DerPicknicker (Hitchwiki)
comment: Living in Mainz I sometimes take the train to Bad Camberg (free with Student pass) and then walk up the hill to this rest stop. There's no proper sidewalk so you're kinda on the road a bit, but it's not too far of a walk.
A63 wasn´t working

name: Tawax (Hitchwiki)
comment: You have a tunnel if you want to go to the other side.
Perfect if you want to go to Leipzig, found a direct lift in less then a minute

name: Pete (Hitchwiki)
comment: It just took about 3 minutes to find a new lift. My destination was Dessau (the second and third next exit).
nach Berlin oder Rostock meist innerhalb von 5-10min weitergekommen.
got a ride toberlin on a saturday around noon within 10minutes.... a guy actually walked up to me and asked me where i was going
Just behind the crossing a bus stop makes it easy for cars to stop and take you.
well when i went to Poland coming south A9, i went off here, and fund a car to next small station called fichtenplan.... so i had more luck
also managed to find a car quite fast

name: Wolak (Hitchwiki)
comment: Do not use this place when trying to get Poland, only truck drivers (and not all) go there. It took us (2 boys) 3 hours to find 2 truckers going to Swiecko. Almost all normal cars are going to Berlin.

name: Wattouatt (Hitchwiki)
comment: We waited 30 min to get a ride to Poland, a nice polish guy dropped off near Poznan.

name: Fraughtwithsounds (Hitchwiki)
comment: easy to find a ride into Berlin. harder to find a ride to Poland. When coming from Berlin it's probably better to go to the next gas station called Am Fichtenplan.

name: Laurynas.notreal (Hitchwiki)
comment: It seemed like a wonderful place for me and my fiancee. We found a ride to North of Poland in about 15 min. Of course we had sigh "PL". There were some constructions happening (arround beginning of August 2016), but don't worry about them too much. just go at the exit next to Mcdonalds and you will be fine. Good luck :)

name: Laurynas.notreal (Hitchwiki)
comment: Also bunch of people going to Berlin from there, so sign is necessary in either way.
lots of cars, talked to some people, got a ride after 15min.

name: Brecht (Hitchwiki)
comment: it was really easy to find a ride to frankfurt

name: Soulclap (Hitchwiki)
comment: you can easily walk (5km) from HD to here. A lot of people on both sides (to the north: Frankfurt or south: Karlsruhe). You can switch sides via the tunnel a little bit north of the station!

name: Michinz (Hitchwiki)
comment: it took me 5 minutes to get a ride up north

It's very hard to hitch this local road towards Czech Republic. I waited one hour here, one hour a little further and a little further and in the end gave up and took a train. The road towards Czech Republic has no gas station whatsoever.

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: I came on Thursday at 7 am and waited less than 10 min for a lift to service station Ville.

name: Phidias81 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Senseless if you are going towards Dortmund. We had to eventually book a blablacar. I don't add our Experience since it was our bad choice - wrong direction

name: Frixge (Hitchwiki)
comment: Going to the south (A3) you should ask the driver to take you to the service area "Siegburg" - It is about 20min. Around 14pm I usually waited 5-15min. Once I tried to start at 8am and waited 2 plenty hours.

name: Zenit (Hitchwiki)
comment: got spot to get north up into the ruhrgebiet, doing some hops and bounces on rest areas in between.
Don't try it to hitchhike from there northwards the A7, waited like 3 hours to the next station at the A3 and after another 2.5 hours decided to go back to Nürnberg/Feucht

name: Fraughtwithsounds (Hitchwiki)
comment: it's hard to get to the A7 from here. try to convice people going into Würzburg to take you to the first small parking on the A7 and then go into Würzburg from the North (exit Würzburg Estenfeld)

name: Dan the man (Hitchwiki)
comment: Had to wait about 20min til I got my lift to Köln
how? on the motorway? a car going 130kmh should stop for you?

waiskirchen-würzburg 
just climbed the fence and a car was already waiting for me. didn't even have to show my sign.

name: Jurisso (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waiting time 3h = waiting for truck to Aachen.
half an hour walking from the train station "weiskirchen rodgau". no need to climb a fence. theres a bridge to the east if you need to change sides

name: Moritz0711 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited very long time to get a ride direction Kassel - it was impossible and I gave up and walked to the train station in Hainstadt which was screwed as well as trains pass only every two hours. Maybe on weekdays with trucks it's better.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Had to wait a bit longer on sunday, but still a ride to Koln in 1,5hrs.

name: Tomasmarc (Hitchwiki)
comment: I'm not fully sure this is the place I got a car towards Koln at, but it it's Rest-stop Weiskirchen, then it is :) I waited for two hours here with a sign that said "Koln-Nijmegen" and then a bunch of punks stopped for me. The place is good (2 hours is just my luck), lots of traffic to Belgium and the Netherlands, as well.

Direction Nürnberg, Passau, Wien/Vienna best spot in Rhein-Main. The BurgerKing help a lot, because a lot of people stop here. Sometimes I wait for max a hour, sometimes just seconds. But I look everytime for plates minimum to Nürnberg because there is a next perfect gas-station

name: Emanuele19956 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride to Koblenz pretty quick!

name: Wolak (Hitchwiki)
comment: Do not use this place when trying to get Poland, only truck drivers (and not all) go there. It took us (2 boys) 3 hours to find 2 truckers going to Swiecko. Almost all normal cars are going to Berlin.
tried to get to poland, just got a ride to lichtenplan (next station, from where i got a ride to poland)
Quite good spot :) But we 2 were waiting here for about 1 - 1,5 hour. Not the best place for cars to stop I gues,s but still I guess it is quite good place.
Waited 5 min, before i got a lift towards the dutch border.
Everytime I start at this place to go in the south and it work well everytime. Use a sign with A1 --> Münster
Took 3 hours to get a ride.
I wait there on a Monday from 10:00 to 13:00 a clock. There i find no lift to East
Started here on a calm sunday with not much traffic, but got a lift towards hannover in 20 minutes
easy to reach and lots of traffic pulling in

More traffic going direction Bremen from here, still you will also get rides down to Hanover. From metro-station "Willhelmsburg" you have to take bus 13 to Kirchdorf SÜD. When you get out of the bus just follow the sound and smell of the highway and the rest stop will appear.

name: Ausschliessi (Hitchwiki)
comment: Also experienced more folks going A1 Bremen, but still a good spot for going south.

name: Hartigan (Hitchwiki)
comment: this is always a good place to ask people for a jump. First time I got a jump to Erfurt after 20 min ...second time I only needed 10 minutes, but You have to ask the people ... and you have to be friendly hehe

Great Point to get a RIde to Erfurt.
I waite just 20min
instead the bus you can start from jena-ost at the bus and tram station jenzigweg

name: Chakula (Hitchwiki)
comment: You don't even need a sign. Perfect spot! Cars are slow and can stop easily at the busstop.
Straight to Berlin! Nice.

name: Juan.elmandez (Hitchwiki)
comment: perfect. gave me now ~20 times a save and quick start dir. north.
Best spot for direction north. often drivers directly to Berlin or Leipzig.

name: Onmyown (Hitchwiki)
comment: It took us about half an hour to find a person willing to take four hitchhikers at once. Good place, many cars, many trucks.

name: Redjo27 (Hitchwiki)
comment:
I got off the car, and was just about to find a place for my backpack, when a woman stopped and took me the whole way to Berlin.
But I guess, it was pure luck.
Better than Feucht, due to the additional traffice from A3 and A6

name: Chk one (Hitchwiki)
comment: Even though there is not too much traffic. I got a lift quite fast to Heidelberg via the A6.

name: Fraughtwithsounds (Hitchwiki)
comment: it was not possible to get a lift onto the A3 in direction Regensburg/Passau from here in two hours. We ended up going to Austria via Salzburg
nice spot to go north

name: Rokz (Hitchwiki)
comment: There ain't a kiosk anymore, but it's still busy and you can ask a lot of people!
best spot to go north, try to ask the drivers, most of them take you.

name: TheKylling (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got picked up walking towards the end of the gasstation. Lift towards Hamburg.

name: Phidias81 (Hitchwiki)
comment: There is a traffic light, I just went asking people, and the first persona picked me up! He wa not going far, to the airport, but it was something

name: Scarr86 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Just stand at the traffic light. I got lucky pretty quick.

i always hitch out from there and in my opinion it is the best place in munich to go north.i prefer to ask at the station but you can try the road too.average waiting time i put 15 minutes,it took me from 1 minute to 1 hour the at least 30 times i´ve been there...

name: Phidias81 (Hitchwiki)
comment: There are 3 gas station one after the other, and this is quite expensive, so there aren't too many people stopping. I tried also at metro gas station, lots of people but mainly local traffic. Better you try at the traffic light very close on the right
It was a holiday day, so not many cars were passing. I have a sign NORD and i took me an hour to get a ride out of Munchen, direction airport. Although that I think that is quite good spot.

we tried for 3 hors from 21 to 00, then slept in the motel in that gas - station, tried next morning, nothing!
We walked a lot till we find the s-bahn from Frecht to Nurnberg...

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a lift to Berlin after 2 hours.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: 20min for a ride to Frankfurt.

name: Dan the man (Hitchwiki)
comment: Had my next lift, after waiting for 5min, to Würzburg

We were two people on a saturday. Not so many cars so its possible to ask everyone who comes. Lots of cars coming only for the hostel nearby or the restaurant. We got a ride straight to Stuttgart in an hour.

I (27 years old, male) got a ride towards the south on the 5th of August at 2 am after 1 min! To reach the petrol station get a bus at the main train station towards Rosdorf, stop "Obere Strasse" and then 15 min walking.

name: Lenny (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good place to leave Stuttgart towards Karlsruhe. Takes some time to get there but than it is fairly easy to get a ride.

name: Flo.K (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good spot but not really for heading towards "Ulm". Waited for 1 hour with my sign out.

name: Mat (Hitchwiki)
comment: on my experience, only locals
Many short rides, waited for 40 mins to get on the highway

name: Marcel (Hitchwiki)
comment: Also a good place to go westwards, changing on the next highway cross to A46. Waited 30 Minutes on Sunday around  midday.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: On my map this petrol station seemed smaller, but it's actually quite big :)

name: Couleurmate (Hitchwiki)
comment: It's better to take bus 741 till 'Südfriedhof' and then walk 3 minutes. I tried unsuccessfully one hour to reach A46 and then A1. But most cars were going direction Nederland.

name: MrFranklin (Hitchwiki)
comment: UPDATE: There is a new road so there is much less traffic

name: Hendrik (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride to Stuttgart within 25 min from the busstop with a sign. Much traffic in the morning towards Stuttgart!

name: Jan (Hitchwiki)
comment: What do you mean by »the cars drive just too fast«? It’s an autobahn service station. :)

name: Bence16 (Hitchwiki)
comment: We got a lift to Stuttgart after 5 minutes on a sunday afternoon.
Couple with a panel indicating Ulm. Not so many cars but we get caught in 20 min.

They changed the way of traffic! There are no traffic lights anymore. But there is still the option to take a care which is coming from ehingen (the city) and is going on the streets.
There are traffic circles now!

name: Edgarwittgenstein (Hitchwiki)
comment: it a good point mfg ew

If your driver goes south it is best to get off at the next exit, called 'Großkugel'. There is an Aral petrol station from where you can hitch to the city center OR you can take the S-Bahn (goes 2 times per hour, takes about 30 minutes to the main station).

name: Phidias81 (Hitchwiki)
comment: I hadded a bad vote, but I was wrong, it was not this place, it's the gas station close by, so don't count on my judgment. I don't know how to delete the vote

name: KatinkaBu (Hitchwiki)
comment: We found like 2 min after we arrived at the station a direct ride to Cologne... Very lucky -.-

name: TheKylling (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Nice spot if you wanna go to Denmark/Flensburg. Not so easy to reach from Hamburg. Ended up taking the train to Quickborn and walking approx. 3 km, since the bus only leaves every hour.
Waited 25 min with a sign to Denmark, and got a ride to the border.

name: Pete (Hitchwiki)
comment: This is not true. The last rest area before Leizpig is the resting place Muldental (with a patrolstation and a fast food restaurant).

name: Platschi (Hitchwiki)
comment: 15min for a ride to Osnabrück in May 2010, though mainly traffic into Hannover city

name: European Ant (Hitchwiki)
comment: 55min wait for a ride to Göttingen. Mainly traffic into Hannover city and mainly no single drivers!
20 min for a ride to Hanover.

name: Leo.enroute (Hitchwiki)
comment: Brilliant for Berlin. A lot of people going that direction. Bit more tricky for westbound traffic towards Halle/Magdeburg. I tried the following: there is a tiny car park just with toilets before the Schkeuditzer Kreuz where everybody going to Berlin comes past. Getting a lift from there was also quite easy. Less than 15 mins to get the next lift.

name: Karossell (Hitchwiki)
comment: Ask drivers directly at the Aral Station (Maximilianallee 70). The first car I was asking was going to Berlin.

name: RobertoCarlos (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was offered numerous lifts to Berlin on this petrol station. Wanted to go in the direction of Hamburg, though. After 1h20min still nobody wanted to go there, so I took a lift to Berlin.
i tried to get to hamburg as well it was impossible from this location, i don't recommend it

name: Margooooa (Hitchwiki)
comment: It took me one hour to get away from this place, not because it's not a good one but because I started at 7pm on a week day... so the station was pretty empty and I needed to ask the drivers personnaly. But I did find someone who left me just before Berlin.
Very few cars stopped there, but we managed to get a ride to the A9 towards Berlin in 30 minutes

name: Elokuu (Hitchwiki)
comment: After we couldn't get any ride direction Hannover for 3 hours we decided to go direction Berlin where we goot a ride after 15 mins.

name: Yooks (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was skeptical at first, but hitchhiking on the actual road there is not a bad thing. Got a ride in 30 minutes. If you're bored of asking people around on the gas station then you can try this option.

before my rating this spot had a very good no it is only good ... i think it is an ok place and I got a lift within in 15minutes... but I think it is far from perfect mainly because there are not many cars stopping at the station and it is not legal to hitch on the road so if nobody pulls up you are screwed. but generally speaking I am sure you get a ride from here :) just not a 100% perfect spot

name: Reggae-girl (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not that easy to find somebody who goes to Magdeburg, but most times I found a car in between 1 hour.

name: ChrisPnct (Hitchwiki)
comment: Seems to be a popular place for hitchhikers (we ended being 5 persons asking people for a ride), though it isn't such a great place. Quite a lot of people are just locals and aren't going out of Leipzig. But in the end you always get a lift! :)
The first car took me to Berlin. Waiting time 20sec!
Changed here to get to Wismar and was lucky. But there are not many cars direction Schwerin/Wismar.

name: RobertoCarlos (Hitchwiki)
comment: Wednesday 5:30pm. Traffic relatively sparse, mostly company cars, but after 20 minutes I was taken to Hamburg.

name: AdrianB (Hitchwiki)
comment: It was Tuesday evening, after 7pm, when I was dropped out here a guy who was going to Schwerin, but then suddenly an awesome african guy took me to Hamburg! Nice spot, but not so much traffic!
Chances are that a truck will give you a lift.

name: Hydra supertramp (Hitchwiki)
comment: Towards Luxembourg: started rather late on a very rainy December afternoon, used a sign ("L") and got picked up and dropped at the gas station at the boarder after one other guy pulled over (but only went north). Probably the best spot in town, still!

name: Vin (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Im here on Sunday 30 November from 11 am to 2 pm nobody stop!
Truck is not operating on Sunday, and less car going to this place

name: Yooks (Hitchwiki)
comment: I tried hitchhiking here but had no luck. It takes a long time for people to come back to their cars from the Burger King so from my experience the gas stop looks like a better option.
Perfect to go to Erfurt

name: Bernardo (Hitchwiki)
comment: Wrong. Look for Eisenach-West instead.

name: Keek (Hitchwiki)
comment: go to the mcdonald's restaurant and ask the people. if you wanna go south, this is the best you can do. on ramp didn't work really well and they shut down the street lightning at some point so drivers can't see you
It's not a good spot for cars to pull over, but nevertheless I got a ride to Frankfurt am Main in about 20min at late evening

name: Bernardo (Hitchwiki)
comment: It's possible to change sides via the tunnel at the southern end of the parking area.
If you want to o far south on the A5 try to find a lift at least to service station "Bruchsal".

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was heading towards Kaiserslautern and made the mistake to take a lift just to next parking on A6 because I thought the parking was a good spot - it wasn't. Maybe better wait until someone takes you to the next gas station on A6, instead.
bad for heading towards saarbrücken / france, at least i had no luck around mid-day on a weekend (and that was although many people were going on vacation). lots of cars going south, though!

name: Restlessraul (Hitchwiki)
comment: waited here for my hitchhike buddy to meet up (he started his journey in munster - i started mine in leipzig). Meanwhile, had a nice chat with a guy from lorsch. Many trucks stopping here, but manageable within an hour to get a lift southbound.

name: Reggae-girl (Hitchwiki)
comment: I tried to find ar ride towards Kaiserslautern, but there were only cars going south to Pforzheim, Stuttgart, Basel.
april 2012 - bad ; it was freezing ! i was trying to get to trier, waited 2 hours, then i changed my sign to saarbrücken, and had a lift quickly ; but it was freezing

name: Niklas (Hitchwiki)
comment: been there twice the first time I had to wait about 20 minutes and the second time I have been there for about an hour. Both times my destination was Saarbrücken

name: Tommy90 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good spot for Saarbrücken (A6) and Trier/Luxembourg (A62)
Got there around 1630 trying to go South but everybody I talked to was local and only traveling in the area.  Probably not the best time to start in retrospect.

name: Mboschm (Hitchwiki)
comment: The same as above. Most people were just going to near neighbourhoods or villages (or maybe they tell you that as a polite way to say no). However, I got a direct ride to Baden Baden.

Definetely a really good place to get away from. I hitched away from here about 10 times and never waited more than 30 minutes. Almost all the cars stopping here will pass by the motorway gas station "Hardtwald" just one exit away, so you can also ask people to bring you there!

name: Chenga (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Nice place! 
A lot of local traffic (especially at 08:30 am), but it took me only 10min to catch a ride heading south (to Pforzheim).
With a sign it took me 1 hour to get a ride from here. It would be better to ask at the gas station.
We got a ride for two hitchhikers going past Karlsruhe after standing by the road for about 40 min with a sign saying "Süden" and a smiling melon
Great to go south, got after 5 min a car to Pforzheim tankstation, thought they actually had to go straight on the A35.
waited here for like 30 min. and finally got a lift straight to Kassel.
i live in nuremberg and use this station nearly everytime i want to get somewhere. usually it takes between 30min to 2h

name: Arno Nuem (Hitchwiki)
comment: been here several times. i've never waited longer than 30 mins at this station. very good spot towards berlin and also good if you want to go towards frankfurt/köln/NL
Perfect place to A9 north

name: Cigale (Hitchwiki)
comment:
I was waiting at the red light, not a very good spot because cars drive a bit fast, but it still work and I got a lift to the next gaz station on the A1 where I could ask people to go further.
To go there, I took the S-bahn 7 and stopped at Haus Vorst.

name: Thumb-up (Hitchwiki)
comment: Most of the the time, the on ramp is busier.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got lucky with a ride to Hamburg in 10min. Spot is not that nice; traffic is a bit fast and doesn't have much space to stop.

name: Jansmax (Hitchwiki)
comment: We got a tide here to the border with the Netherlands. At 17h there isn't a lot of traffic heading to the Netherlands

Better try to make it directly to the border! The station is tiny. So at some times and days hardly any car drives by. Most people heading for Austria don't want to stop before that because the gas is much cheaper there!

name: Hartigan (Hitchwiki)
comment: first comment is true. I waited around 10 minutes, asked a Driver to linz and she took me strait to Sattled,  but the station is really tiny. On the other hand its good for asking face to face. ..

name: Sourish banerjee (Hitchwiki)
comment: This gas station is ideal to get a ride towards Salzburg. My waiting time was around 15 mins. Lot of cars coming all times. And yes, since this gas station is small, it is easier to approach the drivers.

If you need go around Cologne (either north, east or south) this is probably a good stop to get off if you are coming from Maastricht. Once you get into Cologne it gets much harder to find people that need to go your direction.

Having hitchhiked via Frechen very often I don't like this place. There is always lots of local traffic going to the restaurant here. The fuel station is barely frequented. And it's just not a nice place. However it's the last petrol station before cologne when coming from west. If you can, try "Aachener Land" (60km west) instead.

name: Xkomczax (Hitchwiki)
comment: Maybe it is not the fastest hitchhiking spot, but still you can catch quite easily someone going into the east to the Frankfurt. And as a bonus there is wonderful view to the Köln ;-)

name: Kriechstrom (Hitchwiki)
comment: After getting through here a few more times I get the impression that the service station is good towards Frankfurt (A3), okay towards Hannover and Berlin (A1 and A2 later) but very bad towards Erfurt and Dresden (A4).

name: Upi4kumaterinu (Hitchwiki)
comment: Two of us needed to wait for 30 mins to get a lift towards Frankfurt (A3). A good spot

name: Fverhart (Hitchwiki)
comment: With a big city and several directions just ahead, it can take some patience at Frechen to find the right lift.

name: BadWolf (Hitchwiki)
comment: A lot of traffic, but half of locals. Be prepared to wait a lot of time and ask lots of drivers if you're heading to the A1.

name: Auflosgehtslos (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not too much traffic on a friday. Pretty bad if you want to go to Erfurt/Dresden.

name: Laurencebxl (Hitchwiki)
comment: When we came there, there was already two groups of hitch-hikers begin september. We waited for +/- 45 minutes and find a lift to Dortmund (our destination was Berlin).
Got a ride to a petrol station in Dortmund, after 1 hour.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Buh, I don't like this place. I'm stubborn and never use a sign, but at this place it would definitely help. Took me 2hrs of waiting in the evening and 3,5 hrs the next day to find a ride in direction Frankfurt that wasn't even that decent (60km)...

name: Fossilhitchhiker (Hitchwiki)
comment:
heading south, stood here two hours form 18-20h, to get on the A61 but then got a ride from a belgian spedcyclingfamily al the way to mannheim
 better to get out at Kerpen
After 25 minutes, I got offered a ride to Wiesbaden. After 30 minutes a ride to Kassel, this was more convenient for my trip to Poland :)
7 hours waiting with a dortmund hannover sign we finally took a ride for frankfurt...we were two of us..

name: Qrisss (Hitchwiki)
comment: Great Spot when heading towards Hamburg. In the back is some kind of restaurant, a lot of people stop over there.

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was even asked if I need a lift onto A27 to Bremen, I had not done anything, at 9 p.m.

name: Ewelinalucy (Hitchwiki)
comment: The 4th car stopped and give us a ride to Vejle, DK. Good place to camp in the nearby woods too.(June2014)
Allertal Ost/West

name: Talliknalli (Hitchwiki)
comment: without doing anything, I was asked if I need a lift to the A27...The guy took me to Bremen - nice spot.

name: Thumb-up (Hitchwiki)
comment: We wanted to go to Hamburg. people offered us plenty of rides to Bremen, but it took an hour to get a car to Hamburg. It´s a great spot though.

name: TheKylling (Hitchwiki)
comment: Direct lift to Bremen in just 3 min.
best fucking Raststätte in Germany. Never waitet more ten 10 minutes here. Perfecto for going to Hamburg/Kiel (A7) or Bremen (A27)
First person I asked drove me to a tram station in Bremen
As everyone else said, very good place to Hamburg or Bremen
but if u arrive go south u can cross the highway and get to bus 13 which will get u to the citytrain

name: Stk (Hitchwiki)
comment: Judging from left-behind signs, Berlin can be reached from here. Going north towards Luebeck or onto the A20, asking the drivers for a lift along the A1 to Buddikate station might be a better idea than hanging around here.

name: Rokz (Hitchwiki)
comment: Wasn't very busy, so you couldn't ask that many people!

name: Wolle (Hitchwiki)
comment: Dont try this Station at Easter-Sunday. very hard to get towards Lübeck!

name: Shmézon (Hitchwiki)
comment: Most drivers are taking the A24 towards Berlin or want to enter Hamburg. It is not easy to find people that are heading for Lübeck or want to take the A20

name: Pletter (Hitchwiki)
comment: Getting a car to Berlin from didn't work! Better to find a ride into Hamburg and hitch from the beginning of A24.

name: RobinT (Hitchwiki)
comment: I waited 40 minutes and found a lift straight to Berlin. Good place to go ask the drivers.

name: Bernardo (Hitchwiki)
comment: This is also reachable for cars going north, but not recommendable because the service station Renchtal is just a few km before this one.

name: Amb45 (Hitchwiki)
comment: To get there from Karlsruhe: take the train to Baden-Baden, then the bus 218. Get out at Autobahnkirche, it's just next to it.  ~40 min
Good to go to the south.

name: Hendrik (Hitchwiki)
comment: Awesome, within 1 minute asking at the petrol station, i could have had 3 rides :D to the south (switzerland)

name: Sipmester (Hitchwiki)
comment: We just dropped out a car then i asked a girl, she was very kind, probably we were extremely lucky and take us to Rosenheim. By the way the place was very empty.
very few cars, lots of full packed cars with families, pretty complicated to get a ride. waited over an hour and the finally someone gave me a ride...

name: Frixge (Hitchwiki)
comment: At 7.30am I tried to get a ride at the petrol station close to the fast food area. After 1,5hours I gove up, went to the traffic lights and got a ride to service area "Siegburg" within 10minutes.

name: European Ant (Hitchwiki)
comment: he/she is right! be prepared that the airport might be dead at times and all cars are either fully packed or too snobbish to pick you up! same goes with (all?) other airports. I stood here 1 1/2 hrs with no success! (and the cool hotdog stand was gone, so no fun!;))

name: Beatnickgr (Hitchwiki)
comment: Right after the parkings, there are many cars going in all directions. In the 15' that i've been there, i had 4 cars stopping, 2 going west to luxembourg, 1 going south, and 1 going to east to Frankfurt (my direction). Thursday 14:00

name: Nilok (Hitchwiki)
comment: Lot of cars passing here. Found one in 10 minutes who brought me via the national roads in Jena.
Wenn ihr an die Links-Abbiegespuren geht habt ihr durch die langen Ampelzeiten genug Möglichkeit ein Auto zu finden

name: Frixge (Hitchwiki)
comment: Before I reached the traffic island at the traffic light police stopped beside me and tried to convince me to not continue my walk because it is dangerous. Actually they are right, but this is the best spot in Kirchheim. Luckily the next car the driver worrying about me stopped and took me to Denkendorf.

name: Anninassi (Hitchwiki)
comment: i did it to würzburg from there for about 3 times now

name: Thejourneyramino (Hitchwiki)
comment: We tried without a big success. One of us was standing with a sign and one asking at the petrol station. Most of the cars were from the villages around. In the end we convinced one guy to take us to the first gas station on the highway direction to Arnhem. I don't know how long we would wait if he didn't take us. We took a train to Emmerich because we had the whole day ticket for the whole German region. There was a bus from the train station going close to this place but we found it out late. I think it was number 91 but I am not sure.
going north in the evening is close to impossible. everyone seems to be just going to Krefeld.
Really unfriendly staff and not a lot of traffic, try getting to the Berlin gas stations instead of going further in one ride.
I stand next to the gas station (shell) to get in direction north to Schweinfurt. Stand there early in the morning. Its a good place to get a hike, so it was to me.

name: Twentystep (Hitchwiki)
comment: after 11am this spot is not very helpfull

name: Bence16 (Hitchwiki)
comment: We were here at 4pm, we got a ride after 15 mins for a few kms just out of the city.

we arrived here at night so we were hanging out for like 4 h. First tried with a "Berlin Sign" but most of the people driving to Hamburg. Then we asked like 5 people stopping for petrol and within 10 min we got a lift to Magdeburg.

name: Krassberd (Hitchwiki)
comment: Well I have tried Hamburg and after asking 5 people I was off. No experience for Berlin.

name: N0id (Hitchwiki)
comment:
After having been here for the 3rd time trying to get a lift to the A2 towards Magdeburg I can confirm it is much harder than going north. While lots of people would have taken me towards Hannover, Hamburg or Bremen, there were few going towards Braunschweig in the first place. 
You can accept lifts to Braunschweig or Wolfsburg, there is a gas station at the A39 with almost no traffic, but better chances to get a lift further east.
Take Bus 1 from Gießen (somwhere in the center) and get off at Gießen/Heyerweg

maybe better to go to Reiskirchen by Bus or Train (only 2,70euro).
I'll try tomorrow :)

name: Timsen (Hitchwiki)
comment: I also made the mistake once to try to hitch here. Don't! Just go some meters further to the entrance to the motorway (direction: Berlin)...works very good there!

name: Niklas (Hitchwiki)
comment: Cannot recommend this spot as cars are going 70 km/h there and don't really have an option to stop. The roundabout farther down the road might me a better place to start.

name: Jupaty (Hitchwiki)
comment: Me and my friend took the metro station - Frankfurter Ring and walk a little through the Frankfurter Ring- till a bus stop and a signal. Is good because there are a lot of cars (but not very much trucks). It's a good way to go to cities like Frankfurt.- because the A9 road.

name: KevG (Hitchwiki)
comment: In direction of Prague, impossible for me. The only place from Lyon (France) to Varsow (Poland) I found nobody

name: Paczix (Hitchwiki)
comment: It's not a very good spot according to a space to stop for cars. There are traffic lights and this is a street straight to highway A9 going north. After 45 min a guy stopped here and took us to Nurnberg (but he was going to Frankfurt)

name: Morfcake (Hitchwiki)
comment:
I have to disagree. I was also going towards Leipzig, most cars do indeed continue to Berlin, you just have to spot the Czech, Slovak, Hungarian, or any car/truck that surely will go south, like Romanians and Bulgarians. I found a ride all the way to Prague.

There is no fast food place, but there are two restaurants behind the petrol station area, with a big parking lot.

name: Kriechstrom (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good spot to continue towards Berlin.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Why are there three markers for this one? Saw enough cars for direction Leipzig, but of course more towards Berlin and Poland.

name: EddieA (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a lift after 15 Minutes to Dresden. But there are more cars for direction Berlin, that's correct.

name: Koekjestrommel1 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride within minutes to Leipzig. I guess it's also very easy to find rides to Berlin from here.

name: Santa klaus (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not very crowded. I use to change cars here when heading to Dresden. Often it´s hard to find somebody not heading to Berlin.

Got a good ride there twice allready. once to dresden and once to berlin. 
works! :D

name: KleinesFeechen (Hitchwiki)
comment: Ich habe nicht lange gewartet. Etwa 10minuten dann habe ich ein Auto nach Berlin gefunden.

name: Filip.bartek (Hitchwiki)
comment: I changed car here on my way to Leipzig. I asked about 15 drivers before a kind driver asked me where I was trying to go and since he was going to pass Leipzig on his way, he offered to take me there.

well found a driver to Wroclaw (via Leipzig - Dresden) in 5min. 
so for direction Leipzig u also can look for Polish cars starting its licence plates with D (lower silesia, DW: Wroclaw), O (opole), S (silesia, SK: Katowice), K (Kraków), R (Rzeszów)

Not the best and not the worst place to get out of Hamburg. I went twice direction Hanover from here. Both times a truck drivers took me. Holding a sign or thumbing is not the way you will get a quick ride. Asking for a ride will do the job. This rest stop is easily reachable from metro-station "Harburg". Bus 443, 143 and 148 stop at "Sinstorfer Kirchweg". The rest stop is just half a click away.

name: Santa klaus (Hitchwiki)
comment: Okay spot. Few traffic.
Waited for about an hour or so in the early morning to catch a ride directly to Frankfurt. Lots of local traffic tho...

name: Lachim (Hitchwiki)
comment: It's a good place despite there's not much space to stop a a car. Anyway, we got a ride in about 15 min. I should emphasize that it was Sunday night, around 12 am and I was with a girl.

Really NOOO space for cars to stop and it is just a motorway access in the middle of nowhere, but traffic is okay (wednesday morning). Got a ride in less than 5 min as far as Braunschweig (on my way to Berlin). Maybe i was just lucky :).

name: Ilovefahrtwind (Hitchwiki)
comment: nice spot.. you can stand in a parking bay, from where the people in the cars waiting for the traffic light can already see you (and your sign). stood there a few times, never longer than 10 minutes.

name: Tulipalo (Hitchwiki)
comment: looked like a awsome spot but took over 1 hour to get a ride to the gas station on the highway, and thats with a sign BH (bremen)
first try i stood for about 90 minutes before getting a ride. second time i stood for about 3 hours and noone stopped.

I stand one and a half houer. A lot of People drive to Bremen..
When it is rainy the people dont want too stopped.!
Go BEYOND the traffic lights: there's a space where cars can stop on the ramp itself.

name: MlleLunatique (Hitchwiki)
comment:
1st: It's the bus 68 which goes to Harnischschlag.

2nd: It was a big problem to get to Stuttgart from there (I even wrote STUTTGART or HEILBRONN on my board). Only a trucker took me (female) to Stuttgart, because he lived there.

name: Longhaul (Hitchwiki)
comment: I hitchhiked from this gas station heading to München twice so far and both times I found a ride very quickly. The first time was around 22h in a late and cold September evening and the second time was around 10h30 in a rainy October morning. This is a good place.
worse to go north.

name: Cha (Hitchwiki)
comment: Easy to go South. Didn't even have time to finish writing my sign before I was approached by someone willing to take me.
That's my usual spot for going WEST and so far it (like 5 times) it always worked out very well.
but not always. I was two times there. Once, i stand for one hour, the other time I stand for 15min.
pretty good to get north in the direction of kassel (a7), fewer people taking the a71 to erfurt.

name: Twentystep (Hitchwiki)
comment: good spot for going north on a7. talk to people when refueling, best chance.

name: Kotlya (Hitchwiki)
comment: good place to stop cars to Netherlands
Rainy day, great place to Netherlands alot of young people. Got 2 cars at once hah, could have chosed which one I want to go with. youg german couple took me to Groningen, lovely

name: Paczix (Hitchwiki)
comment: We asked drivers to go to Munich and after few minutes we found a guy straight to the city.

name: Makuc (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Perfect place for going to Slovenia (if you are Slovenian :D), because there is a lot of slovenian trucks there!
Me and my girlfriend found a ride to SLO in the first minute there.

name: Coolf (Hitchwiki)
comment:
perfect spot to go to munich ... look for  the numberplate M like munich

But almost impossible to go Onto the A7 north. than hitch to the exit BURGAU (69) and walk to the petrol station torwards ULM. form there It took me about 15 minutes to get a lift up north.

name: Stk (Hitchwiki)
comment: „Lonetal“ gas station. Hamburg works perfectly standing with a sign at the exit; Berlin, too.

name: Micha (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was coming from north and wanted to go to Munich, what this is a bad spot for. Cars don't really go to munich from here, because they go via Nürnberg (Nuremburg) on A6 or A3
do not try this spot on monday-mornig. peoples are going to work and are in a hurry. waited 3 hours there. but on other time in the day it seems to be a good spot.

name: Muttafuri (Hitchwiki)
comment: after you get off from the train, you can also try to hitch hike till highway.

name: Julei (Hitchwiki)
comment:
It's a great place for getting to Berlin.
I always hitchhike to this spot from the center with a sign saying "Fischbach". Using public transport is a lot easier of course ;)

you have to catch a driver who can pick you to this spot. If a driver doesnt go your direction, but opposite is also good, you need just take a walk 80m (or he can easily turn back also). Dont try to get there from trian station by foot (its 2km, and no a sidewalk, nor bicycle path)
Girls be carefour, i heard from locals there is a meeting sex place.

name: Radu122 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Take the S-Bahn to Fischbach, then there is an easy walk (10 minutes) to get on the bridge. The cars are going pretty fast there, but someone picked me up before I showed my sign, and took me to Pegnitz (the way to Berlin).

name: Yooks (Hitchwiki)
comment: You can stand under the highway bridge and thumb when it's raining. Drivers who drop you off at this point can park and turn easily here.
it is easy to going to go to A9 Leipzig ...

name: Julei (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Tram 8 to Erlenstegen or S-Bahn or even Regionalbahn (if they are stopping there!).
I hitchhiked lokally (B14 to Lauf - Hersbruck - Sulzbach-Rosenberg) and it worked very well. I had a sign (Hersbruck) and was picked up within literally 10 seconds :)
The next time I'll go to Regensburg (A3) I'd try here.
Almost no cars stoping at petrol station, but there is a lot of truck drivers. The best thing to do is ask some truck driver for a ride to the next petrol station.
Just had to ask 1 guy who brings me to karlsruhe to go in the south on the A5
A truck took me to the next station in Worms after 30 min. Wasn't perfect but its okay.

name: Buskinpsychedelichobo (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited about 2 hours in the sun with fellow hitcher, got picked up to Heilbronn service station. We were spotted by a German businessman going to Stuttgart here, he went to take us on the next service station and gave us 80€ and took us to the Stuttgart train station to get to Nürnberg
Good place to go to Karlsruhe/further!

name: Rokz (Hitchwiki)
comment:
I was there at around 12am and there were maybe 5 cars on the parking lot. Got really lucky, that a trucker took me lose to Berlin!
Probably depends on the time, but I wouldn't recommend standing there!

name: Mileagainst (Hitchwiki)
comment: We didnt have luck to get a ride to Rostock, we waited more than one hour and finally gave up. Lots of local traffic and not so much space for cars to stop
We waited more than 2 hours with sign "Hamburg". Nobody stoped.

name: Wasserpflanze (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited for 1:30, then chose a different spot. There are much better spots in Bremen for any other direction.

name: NickBe (Hitchwiki)
comment: Awesome gas station! You'll get a ride immediately.

name: Chris1337 (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was there for 1 Min :)

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: We tried to hitchhike from there to Konstantz. Impossible. A friend of us took us close to the A81. Much easier

name: Quarim (Hitchwiki)
comment: directly at the ramp there is no space for cars to stop. but somebody still stopped for me within 2 min.

name: Yhtam (Hitchwiki)
comment: I also stood at the ramp. Some construction work made it easier for cars to stop. Else not too much space for cars, but ok. Got a ride after 20 mins to Stuttgart

name: Dunnobe (Hitchwiki)
comment: We tried to make it to Straatsburg via this spot as it looks OK on the map, but there's barely any place for cars to stop. Eventually took the train to Straatsburg.

name: Tabea (Hitchwiki)
comment: its actually a really bad spot because cars can´t stop. try to get a ride to the next gas station on the A5

name: Tigerente (Hitchwiki)
comment: Been here for two times to hitchhike in direction of freiburg. Both times i got taken at the traffic lights in less than five minutes but i guess i've been lucky :) Infront of the huge govermental building ( maybe bundesstaatsanwaltschaft?) there is a good place for cars to stop but the security guard will send you away. cheers

name: Kai (Hitchwiki)
comment: I made the same experience. Most of the cars are heading towards Hannover. Very few going southwards to Leipzig/Hermsdorfer Kreuz. Had to change my route to Frankfurt tremendously. Was shitty weather though and noone was willing to stop or a give me a lift.

name: N0id (Hitchwiki)
comment: There are some people going west, but it is indeed more difficult. Berlin is very easy.

name: Leo.enroute (Hitchwiki)
comment: This spot is good indeed for eastbound traffic towards berlin or into the northern periphery of Magdeburg. Please DO NOT TRY THIS SPOT FOR WESTBOUND TRAFFIC. That might seriously ruin your trip. I waited over 90 mins in peak outbound traffic but not a single car was going west on the A2. Try "Agip" petrol station on the Albert Vater Str. (B1). That worked much better for westbound traffic.
very popular spot, stood here with 4 other hikers one Friday afternoon. No bad experiences with the owner so far

name: N0id (Hitchwiki)
comment: Comment by n0id: I doubt that more cards go towards Berlin. Usually about the same amount of cars go each direction, but not necessarily far as most of the traffic is local. Also, as a golden rule, all drivers are going to whatever direction you are not hitching to ;-)
went to Berlin in december and waited for 1.5 hours, asking people directly. Most were locals, many went to the west, only 1 to Berlin

name: Liftegreven (Hitchwiki)
comment: An epic location towards the selfidentified-West: Magdeburg, Osna, Amsterdam, anywhere
Going towards Stuttgart/Frankfurt is also possible but a longer wait is needed (~1h).  Do not make the mistake to stand at the parking exit, go to the petrol pumps instead.
went west. Good spot for this direction. Many cars stop here and it s easy to reach. D recommend it to go west from Berlin
Great Location....really wait for somebody who gets you straight to where you actually want to end up...got a lift staright to amsterdam from there andwaited 15min

name: Evex (Hitchwiki)
comment: excellent spot, took me less then 15 min to be picked up by a lory, that assured rest of my way to be smooth as possible! was hiking towards belgium

name: Koekjestrommel1 (Hitchwiki)
comment: You can take the train and S-Bahn from Berlin to the Michendorf station for 3.20 euro, and then walk 25 minutes to this raststatte.

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: came here from a ride within berlin, in a gas station. I waited 5 min to go to düsseldorf (500 km) for me and my friend, although I met others hichhikers who said that they were waiting for 3 hours, because there were 10 others hitchhickers there before them. We met 6 people waiting there in total on a sunday at 13:00
Useless for going to the north (Rostock), cars go only to A2 and A9

name: Vulla (Hitchwiki)
comment: Despite there were 4 hitchhikers and despite they found a lift before me!!i found a ride in 20 minutes with a truck driver who brought me toward Leipzig!!

name: AGO (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Perfect to go to Hannover. Almost 6 hitchhikers were already waiting when I came.
I took a lift for the next gas station in order to have less competition.

name: Schworze (Hitchwiki)
comment:
you can get there with the bus 295 from erlangen central station to tennenlohe wetterkreuz
i was very lucky and got a ride after 5min towards munich
Not good to get a rid towards munich

name: Maxim1110 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not bad, but not very good either. Most traffic goes through to Poland and the first service station on the Polish side isn't far away, but I found it to be extremely quiet on a late Monday afternoon, probably about one car every 4-5 minutes.

name: Posiputt (Hitchwiki)
comment: richtung berlin oder lübeck bin ich hier ein paar mal mitgenommen worden, dauerte aber zuverlaessig immer ueber eine stunde.
wir musste nicht mal das schild aufklappen. auf dem weg zur bushaltestelle hat direkt einer gehalten

name: Santa klaus (Hitchwiki)
comment: Nice one for Berlin - easy to reach, good place to easy, good visibility, lot of traffic.

name: EggDestroyer (Hitchwiki)
comment:
We were 3 and a guy picked up us in 3mn to drop us in a gas station 20km north. 
However, the guy told us the place was good in former times but is not really anymore, tho I don't remember why.

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: after 2 min a guy took us (me and a girl at 14:00 on a cloudy sunday summer day) to a gas station direction köln. very easy and very busy, good place for cars to stop, good traffic. Totally recommend. Maybe I was lucky, but that's what hitchhiking is about, right? you have to be lucky and make your luck happen

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited almost 2 hours with a sign "A5 Süd" on Sunday afternoon. Many cars just drove by.

name: Quarim (Hitchwiki)
comment: if you want to stand safe, place yourself between mcDonalds and the petrol station. I always stand here and never waited to long.

name: Ilovefahrtwind (Hitchwiki)
comment: great spot to ask drivers for their destination. if you stand in front of the petrol station you see all cars arriving.

name: Simon28 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Many cars, most of them slow
stand 20 meters in front of the signal. the cars can stop on a small street. Or ask Trucks on the opposite site
you can get into both directions

if you go west ask for A1 motorway service area called "lichtendorf" / change the side via the tunnel a little bit south if you want to go A1 and A2 north because there aren´t many people in soest which drive straight up north. if you go east ask for "bühleck" or A7 motorway service area at kassel.
This place is ok if you want to go to Munich, but nobody was going to Austria for 1 hour.
Going to the Netherlands from here is indeed a bad idea

name: Benworm (Hitchwiki)
comment: We found it to be easy to get to NL from here.
I guess we got lucky, after 30 min we found a car going to Amsterdam from here.

name: Ewelinalucy (Hitchwiki)
comment: 1,5 h to get a ride going on A43 towards The Netherlands (west of Munster).

name: Clownp (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not a very good place for hitchhiking to Berlin, most of the cars are from Dresden

name: Phidias81 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very bad if you are heading to Prague, we had to wait hours and hours. While if you are heading to Poland you can probably get a ride within minutes

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Abundance of Polish cars on friday eve :) Still quite some Czech and Slovakian traffic too, though. I think anyway if you're coming from direction Leipzig and going to Prague this is your best chance.
Very bad if your are heading Berlin. I stood there from 9:20 pm till 00:20 am and nearly every car went to Poland.

name: Jeltje (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited 30 minutes for a ride to Prague on a thursday evening.

name: Palmer.Eldritch (Hitchwiki)
