comment: Not a best place to Prague, most of the cars go to Dresden or Poland

name: RobertoCarlos (Hitchwiki)
comment: I totally agree! Perfect for Frankfurt and the A3, but a desaster for the A9 north. Waited for 3h, then persuaded a driver going to Frankfurt to drop us off at the petrol station Nürnberg Feucht on A9.

name: TinFuchs (Hitchwiki)
comment: Agreed²! To go north on the A9 either convince someone to go out of their way to take you to Feucht or if you get really stuck, go onto the A6 and cross the motorway at the 1st petrol station after Nuremberg (Kammersteiner Land, to cross walk about 700m east) and continue from there, it's a detour of about one hour but has worked very well for me.

name: Erth Walker (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was heading for Amsterdam but got dropped here in the evening, Couldn't find a ride. Behind the shop I popped my tent in the Forest, The next morning I walked around the parking lot for cars where I approached a Dutch guy with a van. he took me to DE/NL border.

same as RobertoCarlos;
found someone who brought us to Nürnberg Feucht

Indeed perfect spot to continue on the A3 towards Frankfurt, but I needed to turn west on the A6 towards Mannheim... It took me 3 hours to finally find someone who was going in this direction and could take me. 
This gas station is quite busy so you can ask many people in a short time. I think the best is t stand at the main entrance of the shop/restaurant, almost everyone goes there.

name: Chocolate.peanuts (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited at the bus stop which is convenient for people to stop. Received quite a few offers but a lot going north on the A9 while i wanted to go south of A9 to Nürnberg. Took me 30 minutes to receive an offer going south. Good place. A lot hitchhikers were there as well  :)

name: Hartigan (Hitchwiki)
comment: was waiting 20min on a Friday at 12am. Good place ... when I was there last week I remembered the place while hiking two years ago in this area.

Perfect spot for drivers to see you and there´s enough space to stop.

I had to wait for 3h though to get a ride onto the highway to Nurnberg. (weekday, good weather)
bus station bus 131 one stop before Ikea; had some offers, but not going down south, then took a tide nearer to the A9, which turned out to be just the other side of the junction ; )

name: Az-alcmar (Hitchwiki)
comment: i waited 4 hours to get a ride to munich direction. mostly drivers was going to berlin

name: Quarim (Hitchwiki)
comment: waited 30 minutes, so its an upper average

name: Rokz (Hitchwiki)
comment: Didn't get a ride for an hour, went to the traffic light close to the trainstation and got a ride after 5 mins!

name: Janka (Hitchwiki)
comment:
- be careful of police patrols, never go out of the area of the parking!
- plenty of opportunities to ask drivers for a ride

Its not completely fair to compare to since we arrived at about 11 pm and it was just a few days before Christmas (almost no cars), but we waited here for almost 11 hours, my longest wait so far! So the blame doesn't go all the way to this place, but it is true that when people can, they get cheaper gas in Czech Republic and they wont stop her so fast...

name: Fossilhitchhiker (Hitchwiki)
comment:
oberpfälzer alb is a good spot, but not on fridayevening because truckers go to rest for the weekend
once I had to camp just on the personalentrance
the personal looks it bit distrustfull towards hitchhikers
I got once one ride to Heerlen Netherlands and one time I took a ride direction Heilbron to switch there direction Koblenz and afterwards to Holland
in front of the bridge, there's a bus station on B463, where cars can see you immediately and have enough time to think....got a ride to calw after 2min of waiting.

We both waited for an hour and every ten minutes did stop someone,  but they all wanted to drive to Stuttgart Mitte or Tübingen. Apparently not a good spot if you want to go to the direction of Ulm/Munich.  We changed the spot to Stuttgart Airport with the local trains.
There is a parking place behind petrol station where many truck drivers are resting. We came there in the evening and found some trucks going to Poland early next morning.

name: Emanuele19956 (Hitchwiki)
comment: The spot itself is good, but very shitty if you mean to go south. I had to wait 2 hours, many cars stopped but all of them were going further west. In the end I had to be content and go west.

name: Burmica (Hitchwiki)
comment: should be no problem to get to Munich

name: Kristian (Hitchwiki)
comment: No problem to get a ride if you ask drivers, especially on a workday.

name: H.stefan (Hitchwiki)
comment:
no Problem to get a ride to Munich - ask drivers at the gas station!

Harder to find a ride to get you passed Munich! But my experience shows me its better to wait the time to find a ride to pass Munich than get stuck inside Munich, with someone who only drives to there!

name: Pablo.gelato (Hitchwiki)
comment: waited 15min at the traffic light for a direct lift to Vienna, had "Salzburg" on the sign.

name: Vert5 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good for direction Salzburg, Wienna
I got a lift direct to Berlin
a little bit dangerous!

name: Schworze (Hitchwiki)
comment: i was just waiting here for about five seconds before i got a lift with a porsche 911 to wetterau;)
gas station on either side, so you can go both ways: Munich AND Memmingen / Lindau! If you ask people directly you should be able to get a lift within 30 minutes.

name: Burningpeanut (Hitchwiki)
comment: This is the best spot to pass munich to salzburg or up north. It is the last gas station before munich and a lot of people from the Bodensee Region are taking this way to Austria or the Balkan states. The route via Bregenz/Innsbruck is less popular. We needed 5min to get a lift to Salzburg and the guy who picked us up would have brought us even to vienna. The best way is to ask the people there.
We got here on a monday afternoon, 2 hit chers of différent genders, noone stopped And waited un t'il it was dark out
Im living in Mannheim and was hitchhiking to a friend living in Bayreuth. Since there´s no good spot close to the city centre I had to wait for almost 4h.
For going east and north it might be perfect, for going south it's pretty bad

name: Taxilof (Hitchwiki)
comment: Took me over one hour to find a ride going north, most cars were heading east.

name: Sorokin (Hitchwiki)
comment: A great place to change the car without checking in town and continued the trip.

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited 30 mins for a car to A3 direction Regensburg

name: Sorokin (Hitchwiki)
comment: good to Berlin but for Dresden is bad.
first car I asked took me north. It was raining pretty bad, so I guess I was lucky. Cars definetely go north

I waited 30 minutes for a ride to Vienna (1 female).
Almost everybody is heading north here.

name: Seminko (Hitchwiki)
comment:
me + Nicol

from Malaga,ES to Prague,CZ

19:45-22:20 12.8.2015

We went here in the evening and a parking lot was filled with trucks.
A lot of traffic on a station. Mostly going direction Bayreuth-Hof and than Berlin or Dresden and Poland. Quite a lot going Pasau-Graz-Maribor. Some going Pasau-Wien-Budapest. Few going to Prague.

We asked truckers about tomorrow morning. We found one going to Prague in 6am. But I was in a rush.
Than we tried the station. 40 minutes nothing and than three Czech cars at one time. After a fast fast ride with Tom, we were at Zličín station, Prague (288km in two hours). Great hike.

lot of cars going the direction in north and south. for car to czech republic I waited 2 hours. It's good to have a sign 'CZE' and wait for czechs. Tenth of czech cars picked me up, but it took a long time.
lot of cars going north. Some south, almost nobody east. If so, they don't stop, even if they are Czech. I waited there two hours for car to Czech.
it seemed pretty senseless for direction south, it was dark already and a few cars were coming but after 20min a guy took me to the suburbs of Munich.
sorry, i added this spot in mistake :-(

mickymaus: what do you mean?

I can mark to be removed at some point.

name: Miercoles.mittwoch (Hitchwiki)
comment: it can take a lot of time here allthough EVERYONE passing by drives at least to the next gas station. 30min. - 1 h

name: Amauryfraise (Hitchwiki)
comment: It took me 10 min to find a lift to frankfurt while asking directly driver in the petrol station

Sehr gut um auf die autobahn zu kommen. direkt ansprechen an der tankstelle und ggf schon an der ersten raststätte (richtung norden: "Wunnestein", kurz vor heilbronn) wieder rauslassen um weiter zu fahren.

name: Radi (Hitchwiki)
comment: there is a bus stop so possible space for cars to stop, direction to Lübeck or Berlin..after the roundabout is not possible to hitchhike legealy anymore since there is a a "highway" sign right on the roundabout...but this is also ok spot, (possible to reach with 161 bus)  good luck!:)
very good spot

name: Santa klaus (Hitchwiki)
comment: Nice one for Berlin - easy to reach, good place to easy, good visibility, lot of traffic.
We stood there for nearly 5 hours and decided to leave. nobody would stop for us. and we didn't even looked dirty or something.

name: Onioncat (Hitchwiki)
comment: approx. 1 hour of waiting in following conditions: winter, dark time of the day -- around 4pm, solo female.

name: Elokuu (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride all the way to Berlin after 15 mins. (2 persons (m/f), saturday noon)

name: Matmat (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Very good spot to Berlin & Lübeck (way to Copenhagen) 
I waited 15' to go to Berlin and less than 5 to get a car to CPH !
Heaps of cars driving past but hard to stop or slow down. I waited over 2 hours and nobody stopped. Then, I decided to took Flixbus to Berlin for 8 € in August 2015.

name: Ewelinalucy (Hitchwiki)
comment: The two of us tried to hitch a ride in this spot, with no success. There are a lot of cars and their speed is not very high, but the cars on the outer lane (the one closer to you) are turning to the local neighborhoods on the roundabout and the ones you want to catch going to Berlin are on the inner one. We gave up after more than two hours and moved to the Caspar Voght Str. spot, where it was much easier. Already in the car, we saw another hitchhiker there going to Lubeck. We hope she also managed to get a good ride.
Got a ride to Lubeck in 10 min, just stood on the bus stop (two guys). Highly recommend to use this place!

name: Johnjomowfen (Hitchwiki)
comment: good spot northbound

name: Tillmann (Hitchwiki)
comment: I`ve got the feeling that this place is better than the following gasoline stations on the A24 in direction to Hamburg. I waited not longer than 10min to get someone nearly to Hamburg.
Many people going to Rostock, not so many to Hamburg. Saturday afternoon.

This spot is suposed to be made for hitch-hiking. Cars always have to stop because of the zebra crossing. Just first hlod your hand out and ask friendly where they go, if they open the window. 45mins waiting was on a sunday morning 7:45...

name: Krassberd (Hitchwiki)
comment: I don't really agree with the spot made for hitchhikers. To much traffic and the pedeastian crossing is not really made for stopping cars. On the other hand I got of in 35 Minutes. A lot of cars from Winsen/Luhe drive past, so if you come up with a sign for the next gas station on the highway Harburger Berge it might increase your chances.
The best way is just go and ask drivers where are they going. We got a ride really fast.
Quite a small gas station, but people head to all kind of directions. Found a ride to Arnhem in 30 minutes.
However, it's not that small haha
Super Platz nach Süden

petrol station right next to exit, very convenient to be dropped off. was highly frequented because it was friday afternoon, and the begin of holidays in some german bundesländern. stood at the end of the parking lot, with a sign "salzburg(A)" found a ride to Linz(A) directly which was even better

name: Davies (Hitchwiki)
comment: Two of us got picked up after about an hour and were taken to Salzburg.
Really good spot, you can start here in direction Heilbronn really easy. Just hitchhike at the bridge of the motorway

name: Jansmax (Hitchwiki)
comment: We couldn't get a ride here for Leer after waiting 30 mins.

name: Licor007 (Hitchwiki)
comment: after 1,5 hour 1 guy finally pulled over and got us to Bremeh,
it is a good place for hitchhiking, you should go to the petrol station directly  i never waited more than 20 minutes

name: Redjo27 (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Aral petrol station. Got a direct ride to Karlsruhe within 10min,
but not many cars.

name: Lenny (Hitchwiki)
comment: Hitched a ride on Tuesday early afternoon to Stuttgart, took about 30 min. Should be easier earlier or later in the day.

name: Timsen (Hitchwiki)
comment: Worked very well for me...

name: Äntti (Hitchwiki)
comment: there's a pedestrian crossing where you can press the button to stop cars at the traffic lights. thee-hee. worked very well for me too

name: Ulrik (Hitchwiki)
comment:
I waited for 40minutes for a ride to Hamburg. Quite some cars passing but some might hesitate to stop because of the limited space for cars at the roadside...
All in all, a good hitching-spot :)

name: Artoha (Hitchwiki)
comment: Fast ride. Nuff place to stop.

Good for loca rides to Bochum, Essen, Gelsenkirchen...
Senseless for further destinations. Therefore you better walk to the Sozialakademie which is 1 km to the east.
good stop to get to Wolfsburg over the country road L290. Behind the traffic circle is a pocket, where people who are leaving it in the direction of Wolfsburg can stop.
A gas station with friendly employees, VERY few cars stopping and not useful at all to get onto the highway.
it´s good to get on the autobahn (north) to one of the next gasstations

name: Brecht (Hitchwiki)
comment: if there is not so many traffic, the cars can stop safe. in 30 minutes i took a ride to frankfurt. average to good spot.

name: Redjo27 (Hitchwiki)
comment:
to Bruchsal Rasthof within 15min (30.1.)
to Kehl (en route to Strasbourg) within 10min (9.3)
to Hof 45min (28.3)
good spot, although a few meters further down the road (just at the start of the ramp), seems better to me. 2 minutes on a saturday noon to frankfurt.

name: Babohead (Hitchwiki)
comment: It's very good place. Just walk a bit to East so you can get attentions of both drivers from Duracher Allee and Weinweg.

name: Cardinal (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Make sure you walk a bit East to catch cars from Weinweg and Durlacher Allee.

I waited 1h until somebody stopped to take me South on the A5. It was a sunny Friday around noon.

name: Pokulo (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good place. If you can stand the sun, go direct to the crossing, so the people can see you. The best thing about this Hitch-spot: there is a crocodile holding his thumb up ;)

name: Henryheineken (Hitchwiki)
comment: I chose that spot to hitchhike to Leipzig, waiting time: 4 minutes on a late friday afternoon. Good spot, but the sunlight will blind you at this time of the day.

name: Olmomp (Hitchwiki)
comment: Argh, misplaced the marker, obvioulsy it should be on the main road, don't venture off to this parking!:)

name: Phidias81 (Hitchwiki)
comment: I would never stop here on purpose. Minimal traffic and none to Netherland. If you are stuck here, I would rather try to reach the Port of Groningen gas station 5 km away passing through Bunde town

name: Launebaer (Hitchwiki)
comment: Easy to hitching in to Leipzig, best with a sign

name: Ocapito (Hitchwiki)
comment: waited and also walked around to ask people coming from the shopping malls but couldn't find anybody took the bus after about one hour. I think it is definitely better to get dropped off on the other side of the Highway on the B181when going into Leipzig.
just thumps up and got a ride to Ingolstadt = )

name: Cha (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got dropped there in the evening, trying to go South. Ended up walking all the way back along the B181 to the other side of the highway, to the traffic lights in Dölzig.

name: Kriechstrom (Hitchwiki)
comment: The place seems okay but it took me a long time to get a ride towards Belgium on a rainy friday morning.

name: Lipegon (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good spot. I was standing with sign for Liège and got 2 offers within 10 minutes. I decided to wait and after 10 minutes I accepted one to Verviers because of its starts snowing.
we were 2 guys and found a ride to liege within 30 mins.

name: Joschi (Hitchwiki)
comment: Okay to get eastwards (many cars but difficult to stop for you).

name: GuterMensch (Hitchwiki)
comment: The place is easy to reach via bus (1,80 Euro from Weimar main station) and there's a gas station where you can ask people.

name: Chimbo (Hitchwiki)
comment: on the other side of the street is a bus station just in front of traffic lights - good spot in direction to frankfurt - but as well a lot of local traffic...
It's also a good spot to go to the citycenter.
The bus stop is a good place to go into both directions on the A4. I waited for ~40 minutes to get a direct lift to Dresden.

name: Fraughtwithsounds (Hitchwiki)
comment: the gas station is perfect for getting onto Weimar if you've been dropped off at the highway exit.
perfect spot!

name: Alexan (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not the best, but a good spot

name: SuperRoger (Hitchwiki)
comment: Perfect spot in direction North

name: Ilovefahrtwind (Hitchwiki)
comment: Most People are going to Frankfurt Airport, so it takes some time to catch a ride somewhere else.

name: Dynamo (Hitchwiki)
comment: On weekend I only came by bus to the market (or post) of Gräfenhausen and had to walk maybe 30 minutes to the gas station (no big problem - its a nice walk).Got a ride from there to the next gas station (after Frankfurt) and then direct to Leipzig.

+1 on the frankfurt airport problem.
took about 45mins to get a ride to kassel

name: Micho (Hitchwiki)
comment: Almost everyone here is going to Frankfurt. There is a restaurant with very nice stuff, free boiled water if you ask and even I could sleep inside the building ;)
not so much traffic on a saturday afternoon but still found a ride towards gießen in about 15mins.
Good point to go to the neighberhood. also to get to the a71, but you'll have to be lucky.

We were two people trying to get to Stuttgart on a saturday. Mostly locals driving. Not so many cars stopping, those that did were heading for Frankfurt. Decided to hitch a ride towards frankfurt to a gas station after couple of hours

name: Jogoo (Hitchwiki)
comment: I've waiteted about 15 Minutes
Easy!

name: Cha (Hitchwiki)
comment: Between 7:30 and 8:15 at night, just before dark - no streetlights, no nothing, only local traffic, commuters. Pretty bad - or just unlucky.

name: Timsen (Hitchwiki)
comment: Go directly to the entrance of the motorway (direction Munich)...
slow driving, good place to stop, a lot of cars, !!but!! bad chance during week. (better friday and sunday)
well, it s a good spot, waiting time between 1min. and 2h. it depends on the day and time

name: SuperRoger (Hitchwiki)
comment: We asked 2h hours at the Gas Station..Quite impossible to go to Metz on a Monday Afternoon. In the End  the Raststätte "Goldene Bremm" with a Sign worked out (after 5h in total)

name: Rytis9 (Hitchwiki)
comment: This gas station is actually several hundred meters before (towards French border) than it's marked here!

name: Nbakalki (Hitchwiki)
comment: Definitely the best spot in Halle to hitchike East via A38, even though the spot is not perfect because you miss all cars comming from the North. But after the traffic light there is a bus stop where can easily stop and pic you up. I recommend to use a big sign so people can already see you when they stop at the red light.
Bad on a wednesday 15:00 in sommer. only 1 car every 5 min and most don´t leave Karlsruhe

Really good place to hitchhike to the south (direction Basel-Zurich). You can stay at the entrance of the petrol station and show to the car where you wanna go or simply ask the people who are filling.
I think its a good spot but there are only a few cars going south in the morning so I had to wait over an hour
Definitely a good place, lots of cars going past on a summer saturday around noon.

name: Hydra supertramp (Hitchwiki)
comment: Seems to be an average to good spot for heading out of Karlsruhe: we went North and got lucky with a young couple heading to IKEA in Walldorf (passing by at the next rest area north of KA on the A5).

name: Better dressed (Hitchwiki)
comment: found a ride after 15 minutes. weekday around 14:00. direction stuttgart. ask the drivers, they are shy!

name: Edj406 (Hitchwiki)
comment: GREAT for getting onto the A8- asked only two guys, the second said yes. Took me to a gas station on the A8.

I had to wait 1 hour 30 min. 
The most people dont drive to the Autobahn

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: I waited 40 min for a lift across the border to Luxembourg.

name: ZulZul (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Gas station "Eisenach".
Was tough to get a ride to the north but a lot of cars in the direction of Frankfurt.

name: Kriechstrom (Hitchwiki)
comment: Both fuel stations are north of the highway. I think people going from west to east are less likely to stop here than people going from east to west. Since you don't really have a nearby alternative from west to east it's still okay though.

name: Alice d25 (Hitchwiki)
comment: i wanted to go from west to east on a monday afternoon in summer. even though the rasthof and fuel station is accessible from both directions of the A4 most of the cars stopping there went from east to west - it's on the "wrong" side. some car-owners, who seemed to go east, spoke only polish and russian. this place is out in the sticks and it depressed me basically because i waited there for 1:30 hours. depressing was the decay of the former hotel there, now a fitness centre, the lonely old prostitute waiting for a job, the weathered former sex-shop, the fucked up local guys sitting there all day long on their plastic chairs. never again!

name: Fidel42 (Hitchwiki)
comment: I wanted to go to Kassel, which was not easy. Finally I was taken to the next highway exit and did it without the highway. Guess southwest (to Frankfurt, etc.) is much easier.

name: Bohua (Hitchwiki)
comment: Great spot. rainy day helped. nice multivan stoped for Frankfurt. many people stoped to ask, but they were going half the way, and we wanted a direct ride. So yes, finally got it easy. :)

name: Dynamo (Hitchwiki)
comment: I got a ride to Kassel (~15 minutes).

name: Fraughtwithsounds (Hitchwiki)
comment: my parents live close to this place and I always use it to go anywhere. if you want to go east you have to go to the lower gas station. unlike the previous commenters, I think this is a good place to go east.

name: ZulZul (Hitchwiki)
comment: The gas station is called "Auerswalder Blick"
Waited about a minute here, lots of Poles going east

Many cars were going to Frankfurt/Darmstadt/Heidelberg/Mannheim/Karlsruhe
Nearly none in the Direction of Cologne

name: Flasher702 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Roads have changed. This marker is now near a nice spot on the upper level at the end of the departure gates. There is a spot on the road just after this where people can stop or they often just stop right in the road as everyone is doing it to drop people off anyway. I have used successfully several times and often use Frankfurt Airport as a stopover point to get a new ride. No problems getting rides to Wiesbaden, Mainz, or east on the A3 during the day with 10minutes wating. Had trouble getting to Giessen at night.

name: Flasher702 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride to Giessen on a Friday late morning with a sign for "Giessen - A5 nord". I think a sign is important here as traffic goes in many directions from here. If you have multiple people one of them can also ask people in person as they come and go from the gate.

name: Frixge (Hitchwiki)
comment: The spot looked nice. Drivers can see you and they have the possiibility to stop. I had a sign saying K for Cologne. However after 2 hours waiting I got no ride and went by train. I guess most traffic was local or to the south
i got picked up by the departure gates (upper level) after 15 mins or so, heading south on A67.
Schöner Platz, jedoch auch sehr viele Leute mit Firmenwagen die einen nicht mitnehmen sollen/wollen. Aber nach 15 Mnuten gings weiter. Eing guter Platz zum starten.

name: Amines (Hitchwiki)
comment: I hitched here with my friend and a guy took us to france from here. But the police came here and warned us becouse of what is said in the description. Better hitchhiked on a place after the A6 joins the A63.

name: (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good spot to get a ride to France through the Trier area.

name: RemusR (Hitchwiki)
comment: Looks like a good place. Our problem was that we were 3 and tried to hitchhike on Easter Monday. Gave up after 1 hour of asking, as most rides only went few kms away.
good place with lots of slow moving traffic (weekday afternoon). Got a ride to aachen (2 ppl) in under 1 hour!

name: Elokuu (Hitchwiki)
comment: people can take you on the ferry "for free" as they pay per car and not per passenger. the danish and swedish cars are usually packed with beer and therefore don't have much space. make sure the people see you, as most of them are focusing on which terminal they should drive throu. be patient and wait, you'll get a ride :)

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: I didn't expect we wouldn't have a ride on the ferry, but turns out we didn't and had to hitch from here. Luckily only ~15min for us.

Got there in the morning and waited directly in front of the terminal with a sign for 'Copenhagen'. Not a single car stopped in three hours and the customs cops were making fun of me for around two hours. Not very funny actually. Then a truck driver convinced me that the cars would have to pay extra for me (which is NOT true!) So I bought a ticket and went to Denmark. There I found a driver after 1 h.

name: Pletter (Hitchwiki)
comment: Was waiting almost in the middle of the very wide road, between two of the many lanes. Took me around an hour.

At the beginning of the overhead signs, there is place to stop. We weren't successful on a quiet Sunday afternoon and went on the ferry as foot passengers (by asking arriving passengers for their leftover return ticket)
weren't successful on a quiet Sunday afternoon and went on the ferry as foot passengers as well

TIP: ask arriving passengers for the return-ticket, because ticket machine sells only two-ways tickets (have no idea why). If you'll not be successful you can by a ticket for children for redused price, nobody cares about it.

So, we were waiting here for an hour and a half without any result. We stood at the begging of the road to gates, i guess drivers at these moment only thought about what gate they have to choose, therefore they didn't stop. Maybe it's better to go futher right to the gates or conversely go back deeper to the island. Anyway good luck!

name: Posiputt (Hitchwiki)
comment: this place looks a little creepy but it worked for me quite well twice. use a sign.
The instructions in hitchwiki are very precise, good spot for HH or north!

name: Wolak (Hitchwiki)
comment: Most of the cars here are going towards Berlin. There's also great deal of locals. We wanted to get out of the city towards Rostock, and after 2,5h guy driving to Hamburg took us about 90km away.

name: AdrianB (Hitchwiki)
comment: To reach this spot through the forest is a big experience itself! :] It was a f*cking big thunderstorm while I tried to get here, then when I managed to find it a I deeply cut my thumb with a sharp can so everything was in blood, the storm was still terrible... then I was just walking with a HH (Hamburg) sign in this big empty parking lot when the HEAVY RAIN started to "sing" again... and I was almost full wet in 10 seconds, then a miracle happened... and a car with a great palestin guy stopped and took me halfway to Hamburg... Geee!! Nice spot anyway. :)

we got the heiligensee with the bus. then we walked through the forest and over the brigde to this pedrol station, so it took very long to get there, but then we found easily a lift direction hamburg/rostock at 1 am.

name: Alice d25 (Hitchwiki)
comment: i hitched there at a monday noon in summer, waited there for about an hour for going 100 km south to autobahnkreuz kirchheim.

name: Licor007 (Hitchwiki)
comment: amazing for Frankfurt, Kassel, Nurnberg, impossible for A 38

name: Krassberd (Hitchwiki)
comment: same as Licor007. South works great. eastbound is a bit tricky, but it is possible (single traveler asking around on a tuesday afternoon)

name: Emanuele19956 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Nice station. Quite crowded, so I found a ride 100km south on the highway after 30 mins :D

This is one of my favorite places! I tryed is 4 times: to Bremen twice (wait not longer 40 min), once to Amsterdam (we got a driver to Dortmund), and to Köln (and we got to Belgium ^_*). Also several times there stoped little tracks going to NL (Amsterdam and North NL). We stayed just before a turn to the sity. Yeah, a lot of trafic back to Hamburg, but it still works !!
As anyone else said, good place for Bremen and firther

name: Radu122 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Stood with a "B" sign for Berlin, a young couple took me in 1-2 minutes.

name: Julei (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Don't stand in the exact place which is marked here!! 
I waited for 40 minutes until I got a ride towards Oberhausen. Walk a little further to the bus stop and stand there, I think it's a lot better!

name: Sam iam (Hitchwiki)
comment: Almost all German traffic going towards Italy comes through here. But petrol on the other side of the border is usually cheaper, so many will wait for a station in Austria.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Bit harder in the dark, but pretty much every gas station along this piece of road is perfect.

name: Chocolate.peanuts (Hitchwiki)
comment: I would say this is a good place. Took me around 30 minutes for a car to stop but what's funny is three cars stop at the same time to offer me a ride. I wanted to go to Leipzig so took the offer that drove me there.
We stood just behind the rails there and it was perfect! Actually the first car stopped already!

name: Redjo27 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Used it two times (first time ride to Nürnberg, then Heilbronn) now, it's a good place.

name: Fverhart (Hitchwiki)
comment: Also very good for Hannover!
got a ride after 30 minutes to a petrol station on the A9 in the direction to Leipzig

name: Razdwatrzy (Hitchwiki)
comment:
direction: Gorlitz (Zgorzelec), Poland
Neither good nor bad place - there are traffic lights, holding cars for such a long time, and comfortable lawn to hitch just by the lane - but in fact it can be a problem to hitch if there is more than one person.

name: Deiflex (Hitchwiki)
comment: Although not legal, I don't think you'll see a cop car going by there anyhow. You could also stand just before the autobahn sign to argue with the cops. There is not a lot of space for cars to stop but still enough, and it's going straight to Munich. Use a sign.
as far as I remember, there is also a petrol station where drivers fill up their cars before going on the highway - it's next to the tram stop "Oberforsthaus" (line 21).
tried hitching a ride to munich here. don't do it - i gave up after 1 hour and a half. could be better if you're going some other way as the traffic is quite dense
this place is the best for going in direction south. the best is to wait for a car thats going to the city Borna or more far (because the places between Leipzig and Borna are not so good)
good if want to go south (borna, chemnitz), terrible place to reach the a9 (waited several times more than 2h) lot's of people stop through.

Wanted to get to the A38 and it was not good. Waited there twice, first time 2h no luck (Sunday 10-noon) second time 2h before I go a good ride.
Location seems very good though, lots of space to pull over, bridge to shelter from rain.

Depends on day and time. I often had good luck (<10min), but one time it took 3 hours (Tuesday around 11 o clock). But many cars stop and ask, sometimes they go just too short destinations). Good if you want to go south. Friday afternoon/ evening and Sunday evening is quiet good.
Waited only 10 minutes to get a ride to Kassel. It was a monday morning around 7:30 o clock. Sign saying A38 -> KS.

name: Reggae-girl (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Please, could somebody write the description of the spot by specifying what you mean by 'direction south'? 

I am confused because to me 'south' means Nürnberg/ Munich but I got the impression that you mean Borna or Chemnitz. 

What is right?

name: Baptiste (Hitchwiki)
comment:
direction Nürnberg
most of people are going to Munich
there is no place te stop a car
absolutly not a good place
maybe before just after ikea ?
cops control me, you can hichhicking but not on the Highway...
lots of car-pooling-trips start here on weekends, but it's to find a lift on weekdays

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: got a ride to outside of berlin within 20 min for me (a guy) and my friend (girl), although took another hour for our friends to get a ride, but it was till düsseldorf (500 km)

name: Sorokin (Hitchwiki)
comment: To the east do not stop

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Was here with two other hitchers. Quite a lot of traffic but still it took us a loooong time to get out. Many people go only to Karlsruhe it seems.

name: Sorokin (Hitchwiki)
comment: twice very successfully towards Nuremberg

name: Fossilhitchhiker (Hitchwiki)
comment:
stood here over about 1 1/2 hour in the night at 1h30
got a ride of a very nice German-Tunisian youngman al the way to Bonn Peppenhoven
talked about the Arabian Spring which sadly only worked well until now in Tunisia

name: Xavier (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very hard for Nurnberg or Heilbronn. Had to spend the night there.

name: F.arbolino (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was headed to Rostock to catch a ferry to Denmark. MANY cars headed to Hamburg, not so many north.  I would recommend getting dropped off at the station BEFORE this one on the A24 where there is also a gas station. This one is only a restaurant and is mostly families with a full car.

Small reststop, no petrol station.. not so many cars. When I was there, many people heading towards Hamburg, some going north but not so far. Still I was picked up by some old norwegian hippies. They were so sweet!

name: OrdnaS (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Most people driving here are from Karlsruhe just getting at the trainstation and the gas station.
We hitchhiked to the highway and got away more easily.

name: TravellSimon (Hitchwiki)
comment: Search for license-plates matching your destination when youre at the gas station. worked out pretty well.

name: Hendrik (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride to the motorway in the right directon (south) from three nice girls after 1:15 h of waiting and asking around at the gas station and the main station. It was tough, asked so many people, like 100... But in the end, you always get a ride.
good bus stop and a trafic light where the cars have to stop

name: Valle (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Hitchhiked to Neumünster and Hamburg from here.
Waited about 10-15min.
Good hitchhiking spot right before the roundabout next to the bus stop

name: Mikan (Hitchwiki)
comment: we waited 1h30 and noone stopped. then we decided to go at the very entrance of the highway and it worked in 5 minutes. might be too many people only leaving the commercial area (mcdo...).
waited for 40 min with my friend (two guys) and found a ride to Fehmarn. Some people go to Hamburg, so use a sign.

name: Palmer.Eldritch (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good place, a lot of space to stop for cars

A hopeless place for those, who want to catch a hike ACROSS Berlin. We were hitching from Poland towards Hannover and trying to pass Berlin, but everybody was just driving inside of it. We were forced to bypass the city from the north
Had better experience as the one above. But may take time... in my case, one hour.

name: Alagosnir (Hitchwiki)
comment: Low traffic. With luck you can get on highway in an hour or two.

name: EddieA (Hitchwiki)
comment: There are two options for asking: Petrol station or MC Donalds. I got a lift after 10 minutes direction Berlin.

name: Quitelost (Hitchwiki)
comment: Spot is in the forest, correction?
what a nonsense
good for direction Berlin, bad for the highway dir. south!
yep 3h for south
mainly local cars!

name: Mikael (Hitchwiki)
comment: ...after half an hour of hitchhiking we got a lift when we were just walking towards the motorway.
really good spot, usually, but construction works until nov 2012, thus now very bad spot!
actually it´s worse...waited nearly 10 hours!!!
Worse to go south.....
Exactally. Construction sucks right now. Within the first 5 minutes I got a ride to a park platz, then stuck for the remaining 3 hours.

construction work is done^^
got a lift in 2min :-D

name: Xume (Hitchwiki)
comment: Before the construction around 5min to 30min (dependant on the time of the day) direction Frankfurt. Ask at the gas station and/or at the restaurant

name: Ostkreuz (Hitchwiki)
comment: Construction is over, the onramp is open again (April 2013). Plenty of traffic to the Berliner Ring.
not a really good spot

name: AnsisMalins (Hitchwiki)
comment: Lots of people from France, etc. go through here to Poland and Ukraine.

name: Lachim (Hitchwiki)
comment: Dozen of lorries heading toward Poland, many of them offer us (me&girl) lift to Poland. Unfortunately that was a Sunday so lorries weren't allowed to drive that day, many cars were going to Berlin. Finally, after ca. 2h we found a van to first gas station on A30 in Świecko, Poland.

name: Witowitold (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got lift in direction of Wroclaw easily. Then I guess could be useful to go to Dresden as well.

name: Rytis9 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Shit loads of PL traffic. Easy.

name: Maxim1110 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Most people here go straight onto the A115 into Berlin, so I recommend trying to find a short ride to at least the next gas station, were more people are continuing towards Poznan, Dresden, or Wroclaw.

name: Emanuele19956 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Slow traffic, got a ride to Poznan after asking around for an hour.

name: Fanta-Rainer (Hitchwiki)
comment: very senseless!

name: Baptist (Hitchwiki)
comment: not possible to get away from this place!

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Preferred the exit over the petrol station for direction Munich, and got a quick ride to the next Raststatte. Not such a good spot though, cars dont have much place to stop.
Awful experience! Waited for over two hours to get a lift heading North towards Kassel without success! Only locals or people going North West towards Korbach... Got a train instead.

name: Vivianerose (Hitchwiki)
comment: Had luck with a truck, just before I wanted to walk to the Ausfart (exit), but rest, only local!

Rasthof Osterfeld.
I was hitching from Berlin to Frankfurt am Main on a Monday around 19:00.
Lots of people continuing on the A9. About 4 out of 20 asked were headed for the A4 but wouldn't lift.
After ~1,5 hours I found one taking me all the way to Frankfurt. :)

name: Chocolate.peanuts (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was dropped off here and was heading towards Nürnberg. People there seems to be used to hitchhikers. I was there around 11.30am and asked around 7 people and finally found someone to give me a lift to Nürnberg within 15 minutes. The driver was willing to go out of his way to drive me all the way to Nürnberg!!!

name: Krassberd (Hitchwiki)
comment: Went for a ride to Nuernberg, too. Asked 5 people on a Friday afternoon and off I went.

name: Muttafuri (Hitchwiki)
comment: i was there on friday about 12. heading to Nürnberg. i was picked up after 1 hour waiting next to the ausfahrt.
I do not know if I was just lucky. Stood there with a sign A2 Berlin. After 45 minutes a Mercedes S-Class picked me up directly to Berlin.
First driver whom we asked took us to A3, half way to Netherlands
Great spot for heading to Dortmund, Essen, Paderborn etc.
A woman  offered me a ride to Essen Hbf. Pay attention when you walk along the road, there's no pavement.

Great spot, got a ride to Dortmund within 10min and before three cars had already stopped.... 
there's no pavement at the road but you can get there from a gravel square from the back side...
Petrol station "Köschinger Forst", very good to head south.
there are  petrol stations  on both sides, you can head north(nürnberg) and south(munich). there is a undercrossing wher eyou can change or choose the direction

name: Longhaul (Hitchwiki)
comment: I hitchhiked from here to Nürnberg around 02h00 in the middle of the night; I found a ride in about 30 minutes.

name: Chris1337 (Hitchwiki)
comment: found a ride to Salzburg in 20 Min

Rest area "Köschinger Forst"! i stand here 30min and found a directly ride to Munich.

clue: stand at the roundabout
.
good place to be dropped off, found immediately a ride to Strasbourg! Ask people with green number plates :)

name: Tabea (Hitchwiki)
comment: good spot to get to Karlsruhe (we hitched further to Freiburg)

name: European Ant (Hitchwiki)
comment: Many Dresden, Czech, Polish and British (= Poland-bound) license plates. Got a ride to Zgorzelec (first town in Poland) via asking directly at the petrol station.

name: ZulZul (Hitchwiki)
comment:
The gasstaion is called "Dresdner Tor"
A lot of cars into different directions but found a car to Poland via asking in five minutes.

name: Pite (Hitchwiki)
comment: most of the cars going to poland, some in the direction of berlin. i got a ride to prague after two hours in the rain. uff.

name: Fverhart (Hitchwiki)
comment: Obviously OK to get further on the A4 > Gorlitz > Wroclaw.

name: Kkmm (Hitchwiki)
comment: Lot's of polish cars, waited 2.5h to get a ride to Prague.

name: Dynamo (Hitchwiki)
comment: Still many cars to Poland and Czech Republic. After 45 minutes I got a ride to Berlin.

name: Cardinal (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a car towards Wroclaw after asking people for 5 min.

name: AntonG (Hitchwiki)
comment: Just remembered: there are traffic lights before and after the place, so the cars aren't fast.

name: Teark (Hitchwiki)
comment: Great place. I just wait for about 10 minutes, and got a ride directly to Benediktbeuern (in south Germany), I was drop exactly at the door of the place I needed to go!

I was standing after second light where the road leads up to the A95. It's a good spot the cars can stop easily an not coming too fast. Many cars go also to the Starnberger See. I got a ride to Garmsich in about 30 min.

name: Alizcano (Hitchwiki)
comment: good spot! the 3 of us got a ride to garmisch in about 40 min!
There is also the bus 134 from Solln, (Station "Neurieder Straße"#

name: Johnjomowfen (Hitchwiki)
comment: mc donalds is not bad either!

name: Thejourneyramino (Hitchwiki)
comment: All of the cars we asked for a ride north, were more than pleasant and nice. We got a ride pretty fast to Munchen!

name: Luc (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was sitting on the bolder at the exit of the Autohof lazily putting up my sign and thumb, worked great :)
a really good spot, after some minutes a couple came to us and offered us a ride till Basel! really good place

name: Myryy (Hitchwiki)
comment: I guess its an outdated spot, i have no idea why somebody would take this road instead of just taking the A11 directly.

name: Myryy (Hitchwiki)
comment: please dont go there

name: Matt567 (Hitchwiki)
comment: A good spot for getting lifts to the autobahn. I was only waiting 10 minutes before a lift. Stand in the corner of the cross roads. safe, plenty of room and visible.

name: Craastad (Hitchwiki)
comment: Great spot! I was lucky and got a lift out here in 15 minutes to Nigelem (going to Utrecht).
I asked people on the plane, and some could drop me in Roosteren, almost at my destination!

I tried this spot to get an hike towards cologne using the A3 and stood there for more than one hour.. afterwards I drove by train to Limburg to the gasstation and got the hike within five minutes.
The spot has really a lot of travel, you haven't time to rest your arm for more than 10 seconds, But most of the cars are driving to locals like Mainz, Frankfurt or to the airport.. But maybe I just had bad luck

name: (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was around that gas station there trice. Once it took over one hour, another time just 40 min. but on a rainy sunday there was no car at all and I took the train (wich is not bad on a sunday because in GER there are weekendtickets for regional trains and you can ask for space on the ticket. It`s called surfing as i know :)

name: Better dressed (Hitchwiki)
comment: perfect, gas station, big buslane for cars to stop, cars come from two directions, there are trafficlights, so people don't drive so fast - it took me 10 minutes and i had two offers (to frankfurt airport and frankfurt).

name: Jupaty (Hitchwiki)
comment: Me and my friend left the airport and walk a little till a parking lot (near some hotels and stuffs) and then took a ride from there till the burguer king (Is not THAT close to the airport). From the bk we went to the road in front of it - pay attention to the right side) and took a ride to Frankfurt. Not that easy but not bad;
Nice spot. Two tries, two lifts within 10 min. Once directly to Stuttgart, once to Würzburg.
end of july 2011, with heavy rain, after trying out different areas, i went to grass patch and it worked quickly for me ; the dudes who wrote the first comment may have been my fellows on that day...

name: Sourish banerjee (Hitchwiki)
comment: I hanged around here for 30 mins, and then a lady picked me up who was going towards Salzburg on A8. An nice place overall for hitching.

name: Prino (Hitchwiki)
comment: January 2014 - cold,wet and very bad

name: Zenit (Hitchwiki)
comment: 10pm, and already dark, got a ride after 15 minutes to Recknitzniederung where we got stuck for the rest of the night.
I started my trip here to Jena very often.

name: Johnjomowfen (Hitchwiki)
comment: i was here twice at night and once it took me just thirty minutes towards Hamburg and once it took me 7 hours towards rostock... but it was on a night where berlins soccer team was playing so everyone was at home watching the game
I only have to wait 10 min to get a ride to Düsseldorf. it was a wednesday (17:00) in Sommer

name: Amauryfraise (Hitchwiki)
comment: Took me 10min to find a ride to koln on a wensday morning...

name: Xkomczax (Hitchwiki)
comment: 10 minutes as the guys above to get a lift to Koblenz

name: IsntThatIllegal? (Hitchwiki)
comment: really easy ride to Koln in early July, 6pmish, good spot.  Stood at the exit.
took about 10 minutes to get a  ride to frankfurt

name: Sorokin (Hitchwiki)
comment: to Kaiserslautern is pissible

name: LaZubi (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Oct 15 in the morning.
Good place to go Mainz/Wiesbaden/Frankfurt or even Cologne.
Just wait at the restaurant :)
Got a lift to Cologne after 40 minutes.

name: Blue.Day (Hitchwiki)
comment: Plenty of Driver going the direction of Frankfurt/Colonge. Don't expect to get into France this way. I ended up waiting many hours for a lift, and gave up getting into France. Got a ride to Belgium instead. :)
Had difficulties getting to direction Koblenz from here on a tuesday morning, took me 1h45
Got a ride to Holland in 15 minutes on a monday morning.
we (1f,1m) hitch-hiked from this spot to Prague and got a ride directly :) after 15 min waiting.
I never waited more than 15 minutes there:)
Also good spot for Dresden, ask the people for Cottbus too, because the Rasthof "Rüblingsheide" is good to catch another ride.

name: Liftegreven (Hitchwiki)
comment: Schöneweide: Doesn't always provide. Number of cars with Cottbus(C)+Dresden(DD) are 10-20 an hour, but in an inaccessible fast lane. On the station/gas+rastplatz side (to your right) 1-3 an hour. (Sunday, November 2011)

name: Incogitatus (Hitchwiki)
comment: There were 2 of us (1 guy 1 girl) with a sign that said "PL" for Poland.  We asked at the gas station a bit, but ended up hitching near Burger King as mentioned in the Hitchwiki article.  Visually, the spot is good, but sometimes the cars are driving too fast to stop.  However, a lorry stopped in the middle of the road and picked us up.  It took 39 minutes.

name: Hrabino (Hitchwiki)
comment: On Sunday around noon, the gas stations were rather empty, but we got a ride in about 30 seconds standing by the road just at the last exit from burger king.

name: Feo (Hitchwiki)
comment: A monday, just past noon, july. Waited about 20 minutes for a ride towards Dresden. Ended up getting a ride towards Meißen, which took me most of the way.

name: Kriechstrom (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited here with a sign for Dresden (DD) for about 20 minutes on a friday afternoon. Pro: Lots of cars driving by and using the two fuel stations. Con: Cars passing by are quite fast, most drivers stay in the city

name: Davidkuski (Hitchwiki)
comment: In morning it is a shit place... After 1 hour i changed to Schönefeld pots.

name: Phidias81 (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was hitchhiking with my girlfriend, and while I went to search for a cardboard she got a ride to Dresden without even asking, a man stopped because he saw the rucksacks!

name: Ulrik (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Waited mid day for 3 hours with a sign for Dresden and Prague. No luck. There were 3 other hitchhikers around and none of them got lucky.
This Place should be perfect for a ride, but i guess i was unlucky...

name: Muzelak (Hitchwiki)
comment: We (1 guy 1 girl) waited here for 30 minutes with a A13 sign and a car took us to petrol station near Dresden. It could have been faster, but we had to wait for our turn, other 3 hitchhikers were there as well.
Standing at the entrance of the JET petrol station with a PO sign, I got a ride close to the border with a truck withinin 10 minutes.

name: Djianfrev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Few cars but good place

name: Alice d25 (Hitchwiki)
comment: we wanted to find someone going to the A38 for ending up in kassel finally. even though we found someone in1 5 or 20 min that ride was not so easy. on the A38 there very few petrol stations, not so many cars and we had only short rides. really difficult, but it worked anyhow.

name: Dynamo (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride to a service area near Paderborn after ~1 hour waiting. It`s not so easy but possible to find somebody who want take you direction Göttingen.

name: Santa klaus (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very good for A14 (north) or A2 (northwest - Hannover e. g.). A9 is difficult. A38 is risky - nearly no traffic and/or gas stations here, consider a detour.

name: Kriechstrom (Hitchwiki)
comment: Hint: this is not a usual highway fuel station but an "Autohof" which means people have to leave the highway to refuel here and there is a lot of local traffic. Use the new highway fuel stop "Allstedt" 5km east if you can.

I was ear friday before easter and it was horrible. Only younng east german kids were enjoying their time at Mc Donalds. I waited a lot of time and then accepted a ride to the train station. A 38 is really difficult

name: Alice d25 (Hitchwiki)
comment: after missing the allstedt fuel stop we ended up here. it's the absolutely wrong spot for going from east to west on the A38, because it's the wrong side of the autobahn (even though it's accessible from both sides). only old and young locals were passing there. the only chance is to find a mercy mitfahrgelegenheit-car-driver picking you up. usually they stop at the parking area in front of the macdonalds, that's a spot for them.

name: Ripys (Hitchwiki)
comment: Hard to find a car, spend maybe 1 hour and move to some kilometers to way of Prag

name: ESko (Hitchwiki)
comment: two guys, saturday evening (people watching football) - the second car stopped, it was going only to the next exit, but it helped nonetheless

name: Naysayr (Hitchwiki)
comment: on sunday, I gotta ride until the Oberlausitz lkw rest stop

name: Makusq (Hitchwiki)
comment: It's the last petrol station before highway. Great place. Catch a car to Leipzig took us 7min, for my friends it's usually average 20min.
perfekt um nach berlin zu fahren

name: Elokuu (Hitchwiki)
comment: We arrived here at 10pm in November and there were not many cars stopping. We decided to camp (it's just a 1km walk to the sea) and tried it next morning again. We were standing with a sign around 50m in front of the petrol station (on the bicycle lane) and got a ride to Hamburg after 20mins.(2 persons (m/f), saturday morning)

april 2012 - i don't know ; i got there at 6.30 pm, and had no more ride until the next morning 6.30 am... i had to sleep there (station open 24hrs !) and it was really muddy because of the construction ; not nice, but i don't understand the wait
April 2013: I got there on a rainy monday evening. There weren't many people but nontheless I got a direct ride to Karlsruhe in about 20 mins.

name: Peymora (Hitchwiki)
comment: August 2013: early in the morning - lots of holiday traffic (full cars) - found a ride in about 30 minutes all the way to Bonn.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: 20min in the evening (23.00) for a ride to Aschaffenburg.

name: OrdnaS (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Saturday ~11am:
We have been dropped here from another hitchhike and continued to Karlsruhe from here.
Waiting time around 30 minutes.
Many people want to reach Stuttgart Airport or go to the north instead of west.

name: Hendrik (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride within 15 min to Karlsruhe. Good amount of traffic in the afternoon!
tried to go to the A1 direction north. After almost 2 hours just got a right to the next car park at A57
very little traffic here in direction of berlin

A lot of traffic on a Friday around 10am in August. Got a ride on the 57 to Dusseldorf within 10 min. There is a good place to stop for cars right at the entrance to the highway. We stood at the corner in the grass.
Good spot, there is a parking place nearby to approach people directly. We got a ride to the Netherlands in about 15 minutes.

name: Phidias81 (Hitchwiki)
comment: The ramp is curved, not great visibility and not much space to stop. We got a ride to Leer in around 40 minutes
arrived here at 10 pm, we asked like 3 people and got a lift to Kassel.

name: Micha (Hitchwiki)
comment: I arrived there jus before midnight and there came maybe 5 cars in 30 minutes. I still feel I got super lucky that someone came and took me to Bielefeld.

name: Zaphod (Hitchwiki)
comment: We arrived here at late night, and nobody gave us a lift, so we desided to sleep in that little village next to the motorway. It was too dark, and where we made our tent, we thought it's a field, but in morning we realised that we walked across someone's backgarden. But nobody saw us :P In morning we got a lift in a quarter hour near to Hann(g)over :P

name: Ewelinalucy (Hitchwiki)
comment:
We arrived there late at night and were already thinking of going to camp somewhere around, but a Polish driver accidentaly saw my sign and offered a ride north of Hamburg.
(June 2014)

We got here pretty late at night and was dark. After asking around for ~15 minutes someone came up to us and asked if a ride to Göttineng would help. It did and he even called a friend that was on husband way to Hamburg who would bring us along as well.
lot of cars, mostly direction Ulm, in direction north i waited almost 1 hour.

Not so much space for cars to pull over in direction of Ulm. In direction north you probably have to stand at the traffic light, which is not such a good spot but many cars and trucks going there in the morning

many driver in the direction of hamburg/bremen will pase by. there are also many truckdriver going belgium and the nederlands. a polnish truck drive took me to sittensen(between hamburg and bremen) after a few minutes of waiting
good for hamburg. even if its a big street cars can stop somehow
From Chemnitz to Köln, 15. wait, Pick my up a Audi a3 to Bonn, Nice Point

name: Joschi (Hitchwiki)
comment: Free ferry: The ferry charges by car not by passengers (max. 5 persons) so that your lift won't have to pay extra for you!

There is some traffic going to the Netherlands via the A4 from here. Two petrol stations, traffic lights and a bus stop for cars to pick you up. Take buses 27, 37, 47, 77 or 147 to stop "Jupp-Müller-Straße" from Aachen Bushof (main bus station).

name: Jurisso (Hitchwiki)
comment: The catch a car to Belgium is possible.

name: Fraughtwithsounds (Hitchwiki)
comment: most people are going to Maastricht or just across the border. better don't wait for someone going to Eindhoven or further north
Catched a ride to the tank station at the Dutch border.
Got a ride for two people to cologne after waiting for 5 minutes with ”frankfurt” sign, monday around noon

petrol station with the possibilty to go into erlangen or find lift going north-west or south-east on the A3. If you dont find anyone just walk up to the entrance of the A3 theres traffic lights and cars are going rather slowly
Gas station. Good to go to Trier, Liège, Maastricht etc. You can talk directly to the drivers. Got a ride to Liège in 5 minutes
We asked people at the gas station to give us a ride to Münster. In less than 20 minutes we got on our way.

lots of cars to cologne

i waited on a sunday from 11-12 o clock until someone took me to hannover

not the best place
Easy to get a ride to Köln

name: Savejais (Hitchwiki)
comment: Theoritically it`s possible for cars to stop there, but the visibiliy is bad, and cars like to speed there, and it felt also a bit dangerous because cars like to cut the corner and they drive very close. It`s better to ask in petrol station to hitchhike to Köln.
I was trying to get a ride towards Aachen and failed. When I changed the sign to Cologne, I've got a lift in a few minutes. Although I agree that it is not the best spot.

name: Kralx15 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Here is the part of Autobahn. Police came and warn us for that reason. And we had to left the Autobahn and went back to Stolpe Heide Petrol Station. That PS is perfect spot to go to Hamburg.

seems like a quite good spot. was hitching to Berlin a few Times, but everytime waiting for nearly 30 min.
Once on the highway, its a rush like it wasn't hitch-hiking :D.

name: Micha (Hitchwiki)
comment: I used this spot several times going to direction Hanover (Berlin, Leipzig) and direction Paderborn, Kassel (Weimar and Munich). Most times I had to ask around for less than 30 minutes, one time I had to ask (and thumb) almost 2 hours.. There's few cars only stopping to fuel up, it might help to have a sign and stand at the street when there's no car in the station.

name: Santa klaus (Hitchwiki)
comment: Small gas station, few traffic. Looking a little dirty and dark. Still, I had a lot of luck here and found somebody going to Würzburg very fast. Few cars stopped here!

i would say to munich is easy, everywhere else could be quite difficult. because there're drivers going to nuremberg, stuttgart, bodensee and munich, so many directions, difficult to find your exact direction.
when i arrived there on monday morning 1:30AM, i hat do wait til 5AM wait to get a ride to nuremberg. but that's no suprise as HH at petrol stations in the night is quite difficult

name: Fred57 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Weekday, end of august, noon. Not a lot of cars, many cars quite full and going in different directions. After 2 hours looking for a lift to Ulm/Stuttgart/Karlsruhe, we took a lift to the next petrostation (Vaterstetten) which seemed bigger.

name: Falcor (Hitchwiki)
comment: Ive hitched twice at this spot, both times from Salzburg to Munich during summer and both times got stuck here for 3HRS+!!!  Getting to Munich from this gas station SUCKS!! (in my experience). Most cars were full, but there were plenty of rides going to Nurembrrg and Berlin. It probably would have been easier to get dropped off at the gas station on the ring road then ride the s-bahn from Vaterstetten.

It was horrible...
I waite 1h 30min until i got a ride to the rest area Vaterstetten (A99) it was friday (9AM)

name: Burningpeanut (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Got a lift to the Bodensee after 30min. The traffic is going to every direction because everyone from austria and the balkan and even italy is taking this route. 
Look for car signs with:  OA, OAL, LI, STA, KE, WM, FN or KN, Swiss signs or Austrian signs with "B", to go to the Bodensee.

Huge station: filling station + resting area + restaurant, we tried at the exit on Saturday afternoon. A huge amount of cars passed by, mostly going to the North (we were heading to Stuttgart), mostly full-packed and Dutch. From here going North is OK, I think, but going West seemed impossible. After 3 hours we decided to hitch into Munich centre and get to the beginning of A8 highway by public transport, which is straight way th Stuttgart. It was a good idea! 2 persons (me and my girlfriend), Saturday, 3h
There is a construcition site (Baustelle) here on October 2015, barely any Traffic here.

name: Kriechstrom (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a lift towards the A2 thumbing on sunday noon within 15 minutes. Recommended!
Very good place, in 5 minutes a car to Chemnitz. But you can find here also dirrection Hannover.

name: Liftegreven (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Once saw two guys hitching, practically dieing here after weeks of waiting: They were trying to go East - (experienced East-German hitchers, coming from Spain)
I made it to Poland with family of deaf french zionists. Not a place to go South+East!

name: Wolak (Hitchwiki)
comment: Do not use this place when trying to get Poland, only truck drivers (and not all) go there. It took us (2 boys) 3 hours to find 2 truckers going to Swiecko. Almost all normal cars are going to Berlin.

name: Maxim1110 (Hitchwiki)
comment: I have a very different experience than those above. Not a very busy station, but still about 30% of traffic goes towards Poland. Waited about 30 minutes on a Monday afternoon for a ride to Frankfurt (Oder) on my own, but I got a ride together with a Polish hitchhiker I met at this station.

name: Licor007 (Hitchwiki)
comment: great for getting to the east, even in the night

good place, used it quite often, of course there're cases where you have to wait longer, for example i waited once nearly 2hourse, is was 7 in the morning, tuesday directly after easter weekend hitch hiking as 2guys... well but yes useally u wont wait longer than 30minutes..., well and u can get there by bus, if you go to Eichelborn, Abweig nach Utzbach or Bechderstedtstraß. from there u can walk, just a few meters east there's a way to cross. the petrol station is fenced, but at the end direction east the fence will stop. so it's very easy to get there, but busses are in the morning and one arround noon, you can get by bus from erfurt or from weimar. ticket from erfurt is 2,60€
were waiting with sign Dresden. After 30 minutes changed to Berlin and got lift in 5 minutes
if you want to change to A4 you gonna wait very long!!!

name: (Hitchwiki)
comment: wrong place >>> go to  the spot at the german side of the boarder

name: (Hitchwiki)
comment: from france to basel people use the german high way because u dont have to pay

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Direct ride to Freiburg.

name: Artoha (Hitchwiki)
comment: Was standing there for 45 mintutes, and after that got a direct lift to the Frankfurt on 260 km/h ;-)

name: Sam iam (Hitchwiki)
comment: Note: there is a Hitchhiking sticker from tramprennen.org at the pertol station. :)

name: Schworze (Hitchwiki)
comment: you can get the with the Sbahn and a 3km walk. quite long way to get there from munich, but you will get a ride pretty fast

name: Thumberino (Hitchwiki)
comment: Pretty good place to get a ride to Salzburg or in the direction of Vienna. From my point of view it's even easier to get a ride to places beyond Salzburg like Linz or Vienna.
This summer we got a lift after 30 min. directly to Ljubljana! Good spot!

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: was here on a tuesday afternoon and got a ride to Hungary!!! almost 900 km away!!!

name: Maxim1110 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Great spot to get to at least Salzburg and past Rosenheimer Dreieck, were the Autobahn splits with one direction to Innsbruck and the other to Salzburg.

name: AdrianB (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride after 30 minutes to Austria, Saint Pölten!

name: Rokz (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was asking the people turning left on the A19 to Berlin to get a ride. Most of them stay close to Rostock so it's hard to get to the next gas station. And the next won't isn't busy at all, so it might be better to get someone getting you further than that!

name: Eisberg (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not that easy to catch something, as traffic is not big at all, but worth trying. Try between station and traffic lights, cars stop on red quite often.

name: EddieA (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not good after 9 pm

name: Koekjestrommel1 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Last parking spot before the motorway is splitting. Too quiet to propery find a ride.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Since 21st of may 2014 there's now finally a petrol station and restaurant! Might become a very good spot :)

name: Maxim1110 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Ok spot. Very quiet on a Monday morning, but like everything along this road great for long distance rides. After about 1 and a half hour, I got a ride to Berlin.
perfect for heading East

name: Wattouatt (Hitchwiki)
comment: Difficult to find a car going towards Berlin

name: Upi4kumaterinu (Hitchwiki)
comment: Really good hitchhiking spot. The three of us(only guys) manage to get a ride within 2 hours. If you are alone you have perfect chances to get a ride immediately (direction Brno, Romania or Hungary)
Alright, you can pitch your tent in the nearby forest without problems should the need arise.
Got a ride to Dijon in 10minutes at 7am on sunday but i think it was just a single piece of luck.
I don't know but this place did not worked for me twice. :/ But it's not looking like a bad place...
On a monday in May not so much traffic but got a dutch car heading back from holiday who took me all the way to venlo.

name: Sorokin (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Waiting on dinner the next afternoon. Cars on the highway almost not I stop. Trucks remain overnight and ready to go in the morning. The French have come to purchase the fields and returned back to France. 
To travel in the direction of Mannheim, to go to town, or request drivers of freight cars.

name: AGO (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited 1h30 or more. Not a lot of cars. I moved to another spot a little bit further.
Terribly little traffic in either direction and mostly local, ended up taking local on-ramps to hop exits to the nearest highway rest areas

name: Pete (Hitchwiki)
comment: I asked and waited about 30-40 minutes. But it was on a saturday morning (9.00 am). My destination was Leipzig.

name: Naysayr (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was asking folks here at the gas station and it took a while, but they were very nice and took me for about a 500 km ride.

name: Krassberd (Hitchwiki)
comment: Thumbing and asking on a friday afternoon and after 20 min I was gone.

name: Santa klaus (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very little clients at the gas station on monday morning. If there is few traffic you can try using a sign on the sidewalk since cars can stop here well. Nice spot, a lot of cars direction Leipzig. Got spot to go north on A14.

name: Thejourneyramino (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Take tram #1 from the Old Town to the stop Cotta and after 10 min walking you are in the gas station. 
It was Saturday afternoon, there were all the time cars coming and the 4th one we asked gave us a ride. Waiting about 5 min. It is the last gas station before the highway. Very good spot!
Got a ride directly to Zwickau in no time.

name: Sunrise (Hitchwiki)
comment: This is not the aral gas station! But it is very close
asked and the first driver gave me a lift to Leverkusen

name: Kriechstrom (Hitchwiki)
comment: Lots of Belgian, Netherlands and British traffic going through here to vacation. Few German traffic as it's so close to the border.
good for lifts to Düsseldorf or Köln - further it's harder but possible, especially during holidays!

name: Spiritsxxi (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a lift here to Koln, standing on the roundabout just before the entry ramp, on a Sept Friday around mid-day - a lift from a woman with her kid in the back!

name: Jussuf (Hitchwiki)
comment: got a ride after short time waiting, though there wasn't a lot of traffic. Just one thing: following the instructions on aachen hitchwiki-page took me one station too far. get off the bus at eschweiler glücksburg; the station is next to the gas station.
Two young men gave me a ride all the way to the center of Frankfurt.

name: Michaeln (Hitchwiki)
comment: Almost all traffic goes to Koln, getting to the south required some asking but after a while we got a hitchhike all the way to Koblenz
There is a traffic light before the on-ramp and also enough space for the cars to stop safely on the side of the road.
actually it´s worse...waited nearly 10 hours!!!

construction work is done^^
got a lift within 2min :-D
True, construction is gone. Hitching by sign, asking people and changing locations, nothing helped! I ended up taking the train to Michendorf and got a lift in five minutes...
we (2 people) asked 3 people at the gasstations and two would take us. one guy took us for more than 500km..
We met a lot of hitchhikers there, waited ca 1 hour, by the traffic light and got a lift.

name: Thejourneyramino (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got ride to A44 after 15 min. Very small place.

people driving north will have to disturb the traffic to pick you, what may be a problem and explain why we had to wait more than one hour. 
Anyway on that spot you are hitchiking in the good direction and in a safe place close to a bus stop. 
furthermore we wait a long time but berfore being picked 2 cars stop and then realized they were not usefull to us. 
Not perfect but quite a good place anyway

The busstop does not existe anymore. WE stayed one hour and no one took us. The cars are going way too fast and even if there is a place for them to stop they dont usually have the Time to. 
WE dont recommand at all. It is easier to go to a rest area North of the city

Tried to get to Berlin from here on a Sunday afternoon. The place was almost deserted and almost everybody there was either heading south or into Hannover. I gave up after an hour and went to Garbsen, which was way more frequented, and got a ride there within 20 minutes.

name: Licor007 (Hitchwiki)
comment: for some reason people who come there all have cars packed with things with no free space

name: Thumb-up (Hitchwiki)
comment: A lot of the cars seem to stay in Hamburg. Too much trafic during the rush hours.
A lot of cars coming, however it's hard for them to stop.

name: Tksi (Hitchwiki)
comment: I tried many place in this area, most of them was hopeless. Finally I got a car here.
Here you find a big Autohof with gas station as well as a McDonalds. Many trucks parking here as well.
The last petrol station before Kassel, so a good spot if you are heading east. I got dropped here, asked the first car I saw (a yellow Porsche). He drove me to a petrol station 100 km before Dresden.
If you are heading east, you can get both rides from people going via the A4 and via the A7/A38

name: Dynamo (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride to Chemnitz in 10 minutes.

name: Maxim1110 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a direct ride to Prague in about 20 minutes, but we seemed to be exceptionally lucky. Probably a very good spot to go east to Dresden or farther into Poland.

It is a very good place to find rides north and south bound, but I was going to Halle (west) in that case you will have a lot of diffeculty. In two hours 1 car in that direction, but I guess I was unlucky

name: Pete (Hitchwiki)
comment: It just took about 3 minutes to find a lift to Dessau. The second person me and my friend asked picked us up.

name: Tillmann (Hitchwiki)
comment: Best spot in town to go up north in direction or to Berlin. Also Magdeburg -> Hannover -> Hamburg e.g.

Gas station with an ok amount of cars. Some going further, although you need some patience for going on the A9 towards Berlin etc.

If you want to go to Leipzig don't bother asking around on the petrol station, but write a sign and stand next to the road. ~Lukas

ok Reststop, but not much traffic. I've been there a few times, but once had trouble finding someone going west on the A4 towards Gera Erfurt... (2,5 h wait time). Most cars are heading south on the A72, some south. ~Lukas

it's a nice spot to go direction Berlin. i had waiting times from 3 to 60minutes....

if you r student in Thuringia you can go with your students ticket to hermsdorf and walk about 45min. to the station

name: Helmik (Hitchwiki)
comment: as somebody wrote here it's terrible when you want to go to dresden. i waited there for almost three hours in the middle of a day a NOONE even drove there. then i decided to go to berlin and got a lift in10min

name: Tzunami (Hitchwiki)
comment: I must confirm, that heading to Dresten, Wroclaw from there is impossible. I've waited 6 hours since i decided to go to Poznan.

name: Fidel42 (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Was a good place to go west (A4). Lots of cars to Frankfurt, etc.
Several other hitchhikers around, when I was there.

name: NathanGardner (Hitchwiki)
comment: I tried getting a lift to Berlin and was unlucky that everyone was returning from ski holidays--no one had space. A lift to Berlin did come though, and this place has great traffic. You can also wildcamp in the surrounding forest!
i confirm what tsunami said, waited for hours and a night trying dresden, we finally went to gera from outside the station,,,

name: Kriechstrom (Hitchwiki)
comment: Most people seem to go towards Frankfurt. Got unlucky going towards Cologne only once on a Monday noon. Still pretty decent.

Not good to get to the A45. I got also unlucky. I waited 3 hours and didn't get a ride to A45. It's better to get a lift to the gas station "Wetterau" at A5. You can change there the direction via a tunnel and then try to get a lift to A45. But for direction Frankfurt it's a realy good spot.

name: Quarim (Hitchwiki)
comment: It is always hard to find someone going on the B49 towards Limburg or Koblenz, but always fine for Frankfurt
You won't find anyone going towards Marburg. Better get off the highway at Beltershain/Grünberg and take the L 3127. I had to wait less than 5 min.

name: Micha (Hitchwiki)
comment: less than 10 cars in 1 hour and none of them continued onto A45 - which was my way. You can change to the other direction at the end, when u walk down the right street just before the lane enters A5 again. There's a tunnel.

name: Kriechstrom (Hitchwiki)
comment: Almost exclusively local traffic. On-ramps are not hitchhikeable easily. Avoid.

name: Travelrebel (Hitchwiki)
comment: We tried to get a ride to France from here but it turned out to be very difficult. There were a few people going this way but they didn't take us (a girl and me). The problem is that if you wanna go to France you need someone who's going directly since there is no gas station before people turn from the A5 to Switzerland towards Mulhouse. So what we did was taking a ride to the north until the second gas station near Appenweiher. There you can easily switch to the other side of the highway just crossing a bridge. We found a ride immediately to France and made it until Marseille at the same day.

it's a good spot. i wanted to get direction north and the second and third person (one came to me to ask where i need to go, while i was asking the other) offered to take me to karlsruhe/frankfurt (A5). you can take the tram or walk there easily.
addition: i was there at a saturday around 2pm and there were lots of cars, i got a ride in 2min
We got a ride within 5 minutes, started on Monday early in the morning. We had a sign "A5 Nord". Super easy!

name: Stk (Hitchwiki)
comment: You might strike luck with somebody going towards Rostock or Hamburg, traffic is very light, though, and mostly local.

name: Piratowski (Hitchwiki)
comment: Never stop there at night. There is like 2 cars per hour stopping. I waited 12 hours one night, and at daytime between 1 and 2 hours.

name: Santa klaus (Hitchwiki)
comment: Mostly locals and very little traffic. With a bit of luck you find somebody going to Hamburg. If you are coming from Puttgarden and are heading further south its probably better to get off in the first gas station after the ferry (Großenbrode) or change cars before/on the ferry than standing here. Probably the worst motorway resting area I ever experienced in Germany.

name: Kriechstrom (Hitchwiki)
comment: Medium traffic, mostly cars. Recommended.

name: Better dressed (Hitchwiki)
comment: really small gas station on the highway. if you get dropped there, you will meet mostly locals (if any). avoid being dropped there if you wanna continue on the a5...

name: (Hitchwiki)
comment: I got stuck there heading to A5. Not a good idea. After a goood long time someone was soo gentle to make a 30k detour for leaving me on the A5.
Have been droped here by a friend and had a right north to the nearest gasstation on the 3 in about 10 15 minutes.

name: Kriechstrom (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride to the A4 eastwards easily.
good spot for getting a lift on the A4 in direction to Frankfurt/Main - at least to go to the gas station "Eichelborn" - from there it should be easy to go further the A4 or A71

name: Santa klaus (Hitchwiki)
comment: I had quite some problems finding somebody to Cologne. Dortmund and others along A2 should'nt be a problem.

name: Willochrome (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got dropped off here at 01:30 from Michendorf near Berlin and stuck overnight during a thunderstorm. About half of all cars are headed towards the UK from Poland (at least in the summer) but most were full. In the end I gave up and walked to Rhynern (5 min), took the bus to Hamm and train from there to head westwards.

name: Adamiksen (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride luckily to Köln in 10 min. Loads of cars driving to/from Poland and Belgium, some to UK. A perfect spot to go to East-west!

name: Redjo27 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Friday, got a ride to Bottrop (wanted to go to Essen). Cars to all Ruhr area and south (Frankfurt etc)

name: Kriechstrom (Hitchwiki)
comment: Even though there is no fuel station here there is lots of traffic. Almost everybody is going further on the A2 so you should be a able to get a ride easily.
took me less then 30 sec to find a ride to berlin.
Got a ride to Berlin in less than 5 min! I was just standing at the end of the parking with my sign and the first person gave me a lift directly to Berlin.
arrived, rolled a cigarette, didnt even start the smoke and got a ride to berlin. less then 1 min... perfekt (friday afternoon)
Arrived on a thursday at 14.05 during the holidays, and it took about 30 min.
I hitch-hiked from here about three times, never had to wait more than 30 minutes towards Berlin/Poland

name: Kriechstrom (Hitchwiki)
comment: I usually do not recommend Autohofs but this one had lots of car traffic on sunday noon in both directions. Don't hesitate to start here.

name: Kriechstrom (Hitchwiki)
comment: Plenty of traffic on friday afternoon. Got a ride to Irxleben quickly.

name: Kriechstrom (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride to Magdeburg quickly.
