April 2013: Got there from the train station Auringen-Medenbach (there's a good description in the german wiki!). Got a direct lift to Düsseldorf-Airport from here in almost no time!

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: waited with a girl on a sunny sunday during summer for 1:30 hrs for a ride to düsseldorf, but a guy offered a ride to wupertall after 5 min we got there and we refused. We thought we were in a lucky day and somebody would take us directly to köln
Lots of cars going to Cologne and the Ruhr Area. Some Dutch cars and few Belgians.

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride in less than 5 min. I was asking people for a ride to Duisburg and we got it exactly to our destination.

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: A guy just left me here because I wanted to go to Nurmberg and he entered at this city. A truck driver told me that if I couldn't find any ride, he could take me on that direction at the end of the afternoon but I got a ride after 5 minutes waiting. It was drizzling and I use a funny chicken hat to call the attention.
found a ride in no time. following the A3 and A67 and A5, passing frankfurt and mannheim

I guess I was lucky. I arrived here around 23.30, the patrol station was almost empty, but than a car stopped and I saw on the licence plat they were coming from Magdeburg. I could join them to Magdeburg.

name: Emanuele19956 (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was lucky here. This guy volunteered to takeme out of the Berliner Ring to the highway I needed to hit!

name: Elokuu (Hitchwiki)
comment: We were standing around 20m in front of the Petrol station and got a ride after 15mins straight to Hamburg. (2 persons (m/f), Thursday afternoon)

name: Lu (Hitchwiki)
comment: We  had a sign saying "A24 -> HH" and just waited for 10 min. 2 persons(m/f) friday noon

name: RomanSmoll (Hitchwiki)
comment: were extremely lucky to get a straightride to Rostock. Driver came to us straight. sign E 26 probably.. m/f morning

name: Danielp (Hitchwiki)
comment: very good spot. However a lot of cars just turning to the gas station, there is a lot of place to stop. And mostly everyone who turns to the highway is going on the right line(there are 3 lines)

name: Wukk (Hitchwiki)
comment: try to hitch a ride directly to Berlin or at least to the motorway, otherwise you might get lost...

name: Reggae-girl (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Perfect spot: There is a traffic light and a lay-by. 

Stood there with a sign 'Bad Segeberg/ Berlin' on a Tuesday afternoon and found hitch in 15 minutes to Berlin.

name: Bodhin (Hitchwiki)
comment: This spot is good to get a ride to the A4 and A14
Direction Frankfurt. was waiting there in a working day around 5pm in february for 25-30 minutes. not a lot of cars passing by but its a good spot
If you have no luck, try the nearby petrol station (Alsfeld). It has a Autogas, so many cars from the Autobahn stop specifically at this Petrol station and then continue further on the A5. ~Lukas
Lots of cars, so statistically good. But traffic light is too short, you have no time to talk to people and ask, just hope that someone will see you and take you.
gas station/Tankstelle Aral und McD
the gas station is a perfect place. You wait 5-15minutes.
Got a lift to Koblenz in about 20mins on a Sunday morning at around 09:00
got an instant lift to mannheim on arrival

I got searched by the cops here. Apparently all people wirh longer hair and a cardboard sign sign use drugs... but eventually i got my ride after all the people left who had seen me getting searched. Good spot to get to Trier after all.
good spot to head south direction Mannheim. I always leave Bonn from that spot and never had to wait more than 30 minutes to get a lift.
Forgto to mention: Take the S23 from Bonn main station (direction Euskirchen). After 30 minutes youÄll reach the station "Rheinbach". From there you have to head north and walk for about 20 minutes.
very good for getting further on the A4 and good for getting on the A71

name: Dynamo (Hitchwiki)
comment: First I tried to get a ride directly to Kassel. I had no luck and decided to go to the last raststation before Bad Hersfeld.

name: Fraughtwithsounds (Hitchwiki)
comment: kinda tricky to get a ride into Erfurt from here but not impossible

name: Tommy90 (Hitchwiki)
comment: great to go east, actually illegal to stand there, but enough place to pull over. Waited about 20 minutes until I got a lift to the next service station HOMBURG.

name: Tommy90 (Hitchwiki)
comment: the service station Homburg is a quite good alternative for Goldene Bremm Süd in Saarbrücken, because there are more cars who take you till frankfurt or nürnberg (even Prag) but at least till Kaiserslautern and Mannheim. the waiting time really varies regularly. I waited from 10 minuts till 2 hours.
Got a lift to Frankfurt Airport as soon as we showed up

name: Peymora (Hitchwiki)
comment: Cars going to Mannheim, Frankfurt. Less so to Southern Germany
Saturday afternoon, 2 people, destination Karlruhe/Stuttgart. Got a ride to Neustadt a.d.W. in 10 min. Despite that, not much traffic on that day.

name: Davies (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a lift to Heidelberg in 15 minutes. Fun to walk to this station through the Forest too!

name: Hexe66 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Never again on a motorway junction

name: Thumberino (Hitchwiki)
comment: Never ever go there, I don't know who marked that spot, but I'am quite sure he or she has never been there because you just can't get on the motorway there wether it is the A8 to Munich/Stuttgart or the B10. There's no on ramp on the motorway its just a crossing for the A8 and the B10 without a possibilty to get on or off the motorway.

name: Hmmm 42 (Hitchwiki)
comment: probably the best spot to go north, going further up proved to be a complete waste of time.

name: Druding (Hitchwiki)
comment: It is a good spot! Not all cars might go the desired direction but others will! ;)
crasy but possible!

name: Bence16 (Hitchwiki)
comment: The cars drive fast, it isnt easy for them to stop, but at least all of them go in the right direction (north). Me and my girlfriend got a lift after 15 mins.

name: Pete (Hitchwiki)
comment: Just waited 5 minutes with a friend to get a lift directly to Berlin.

Not a good place to get a ride south. Also there were construction works going on, confusing the car drivers on the road. No one stopped. Did not ak at the gas station, not a lot of people filled up their cars there. Ended up walking 300 meters towards the highway.

name: Krassberd (Hitchwiki)
comment: I guess I just had a lucky day with less than 5 min right on the way to the highway.

name: Krassberd (Hitchwiki)
comment: Tried it again and within 15min I was gone (single traveller)

Best spot for the A8 to Salzburg or Vienna. With the combination of the traffic lights and the gas station the drivers have enough time to see you and decide to take you and then stop safely at the gas station.
got picked up after 10 minutes, although there weren´t many cars at the gas staition

name: ChrisPnct (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good spot to Salzburg, cars can easily stop at the gas station and drive slow thanks to the traffic light.
Perfect spot- waited 5 min between traffic light and gas station until 2 nice guys gave us a lift to Brixen/Italy
Waited about an hour on a rainy monday morning until a truck driver gave me a lift to Irschenberg
Maybe the best place in town to go to Salzburg/Innsbruck even if we waited 45 minutes.
It's a good spot to go west to A38 or to go south.

If you arrive here, walk directly until another exit or to the trainstation, because I wait 4 hours with different signs (North, DK, german cities and also without signs) and except insults nobody answer me (Hi hitchhike since 10 000km, worst spot of my trip).
First Car!!!
small petrolstation but enough cars passing through. Early morning is good to catch rides going far!

name: Binbash (Hitchwiki)
comment: depends on daytime. harder to get away from there in the evening or an night. when being there in the morning before noon, there's more cars than parking lots.

name: Guybrush (Hitchwiki)
comment: For my opinion it's the better place to leave HH towards south following A7. Better than Stillhorn, where most cars move to Bremen. You can get there by bus 143
Waited for about an hour around 3pm and got a ride to Munich

This is the last big resting place before the border with Czech republic. Although there is no gas station, there are enough cars to stop here who go straight to Prague (or even further; Bratislava).
To get here, hitch a ride from the on ramp 500 meters before.

name: Feo (Hitchwiki)
comment: Decent traffic going to the Czech republic and further. I got a ride with a Slovaki on her way home.

name: Ripys (Hitchwiki)
comment: 15 min to finnd a car to Prag! PERFECT! :)

3,5h waiting was nonsense on a usual day. sign to praha.we were 2 guys. even asking didnt help.
Wouldnt recommend

name: Vonbawherk (Hitchwiki)
comment: Resting area. Difficult to reach this point; you have to walk for a while on the motorway. I get a car to the next big petrol station (better point than this) in 45 minutes on Sunday.
i come here around 6 o clock pm ... and waited to 1 am and direction to Trnava -Slovakia. :))) abort78

name: Dynamo (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Not so much traffic there. The most people went to Pirna or Saxon Switzerland.

Got a ride after 45 minutes to Praha on friday morning.
We got a ride direct to center of Prague after 3h, but it was at night.

name: Aloyfletch (Hitchwiki)
comment: After arriving, I asked the first person I saw who took me to a petrol station on the czech border. From there to Prague.

the best spot to leave Dresden direction to Czech. 

*HOW TO REACH THIS PLACE : 
- From Gostritz go direction of Rosentiz and once you cross the highway you will find a door on your left ( it's always open) then you can reach this spot with 5 min walking
Very good spot. Almost no traffic. But 90% cars who came there - going to Prague. Just wait and asked driver about lift.
Not much traffic, mostly locals, I waited 2,5 hours without getting a ride. Friends of mine waited 1,5h before getting a ride.
Is a place where people meet to have sex, had a strange experience with a guy who wanted my number after giving me a lift
sorrry this commentar was for the spot above :(

name: Grinsolt (Hitchwiki)
comment: Works really fine here, visited this Spot probably around 10 Times in the last year, never waited longer than 15 Minutes.

name: Tawax (Hitchwiki)
comment: Update: it is better to hitchhike about 150 m before Lidl since the cars can better see you and also have the possibility to stop.

name: Micho (Hitchwiki)
comment: Some drovers are too fast here, but it is still the best place on this street to get an autostop to the A5. Don't listen to local grandma, who would tell you to go to the Shell Station ;p

name: Kralx15 (Hitchwiki)
comment: This is the main exit from Hamurg to Berlin. Monday evening we spent more than 2 hours to go to Berlin.but I think it doesn't work well in evenings. In my opininon, we didn't have luck. We had to stay one night in Hamburg.

name: Efim x (Hitchwiki)
comment: Great place. left for 5 minutes. stood with a sign in Berlin, is not taken, the plate was removed and left), a convenient place to stop!

name: Äntti (Hitchwiki)
comment: there were hitch hikers both here and at the beginning of the autobahn. the people at the bus stop got picked up, the ones at the autobahn didn't. just saying.

name: Hajk (Hitchwiki)
comment: Unbelievable good spot. Nothing more to say about it. Come and try!

name: Mikan (Hitchwiki)
comment: a good spot for the cars to stop. (they can stop at the bus stop.) they were two other hitchhikers who get a quick ride to berlin, while we waited longer to get one to lübeck.

Got picked up after 20 mins with a sign for 'Fehmarn' on my way to Copenhagen on a regular morning. There was another hitchhiker heading to Berlin who got picked up at the same time. 
Waited directly at the bus station, there's enough space for cars to pull over.

name: AdrianB (Hitchwiki)
comment: After 1 hour a girl from Kiel took me to the motorway (I was heading up north, Denmark). Safe spot and slow cars!

name: GregGM (Hitchwiki)
comment: I used a sign with "Lübeck/DK". After just 3 minutes I got a ride to "Raststätte Neustädter Bucht". Good spot, cars can stop both on the right and left side of the road, so you don't miss a lane.
good spot, make a sign to make sure you get to the right highway;)
Just in 10 minutes I got a lift to Berlin

name: Sattleryan (Hitchwiki)
comment: Used this place around 10-15 times for Berlin (average waiting time: 10min, notwithstanding day and time; even at night it works fantastically!), and one time to Lübeck (took me some 30min, even on a Friday afternoon!)
Great place to hitchhike. Try to use the bus stop so the cars have space to stop. In 25 min someone gave me a lift ;)

name: RomanSmoll (Hitchwiki)
comment: well there is too many spots in here.anyway this place work well indeed. we had a queue of 4 hitch-kers b4 us and they all got into the same car in the meanwhile the other car stopped and took us.happy day
The best place ever so fat 3 min , a cople from berlin pick me up and even offer me to sleep at their place ! 10 out of 5 :-)

name: Marouan ben (Hitchwiki)
comment: Previous comment mine , just forgot to log in !

name: StefanXsupertramp (Hitchwiki)
comment: Didn't get a lift there, but you can be lucky someday when people get there for refueling.

name: StefanXsupertramp (Hitchwiki)
comment: Did not worked. Most of people passing by are staying in the area and aren't going direction Berlin/Hamburg

name: StefanXsupertramp (Hitchwiki)
comment: Last gas station before motorway splits in the two direction Hamburg and Rostock, mostly people who aim Rostock or Schwerin stop there, but I also got a lift directly to Hamburg.

name: Wolak (Hitchwiki)
comment: We were trying to get to Rostock, but most of the cars were heading to Hamburg. After standing here for almost 3h we crossed the autobahn and the first driver we asked took us to the outskirts of Berlin.

name: Kovacspetyesz (Hitchwiki)
comment: It was easy 15 min. [with Rostock signal] a truck driver picked me up quickly

name: StefanXsupertramp (Hitchwiki)
comment: Easy to reach by metro. People refuel there before entering the motorway to Hamburg. Possible to get a direct lift to Hamburg.

name: RobertoCarlos (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a lift to a petrol station on A24 after 30min by standing on the side of the road with a sign "A24". Lots of space to pull over and good visibility. Might be better to ask drivers at the petrol station, though.

name: Suman Mircea (Hitchwiki)
comment: Wasted some time here because I was using Rostock sign. Most cars go to HH so if you're going to Rostock it's best to thumb or use A24 sign and ask the driver to drop you off at a further gas station (they're already marked).

name: Fahrtwindlukas (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very good place to leave Berlin towards Hamburg! Thank you for taking us dear audi driver with the great stories about hitchhiking around the world

name: Paczix (Hitchwiki)
comment: good spot, but not a lot of people are using it. Maybe because it was sunday and voting day, but finally after 50 minutes we caught a guy to Rostock with board "Hamburg"
I met two other hitchers here and we asked around for an hour before a driver took all three of us-- two to Hamburg and me all the way to Kiel.

name: N0id (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not that much far going traffic on a Saturday morning. We saw almost no HH cars passing by, mostly local number plates. We got a ride to the service station Stolper Heide in the end.

name: Tillmann (Hitchwiki)
comment: Tried this place several time. Best is to talk to the people at the gasoline station. You will not wait for more than 30min to catch a ride on the A24 in direction to Hamburg :)

name: Arbuuzs (Hitchwiki)
comment: After 30 minutes of waiting for a ride to Hamburg we started to ask people on petrol station. Eventually got a ride to Hamburg!

name: SimoneM (Hitchwiki)
comment: I have cached a ride all the way to Denmark twice, holding a DK sign. Go a little further down the road from the petrol station to the light right before the highway. I found that it helped. I went between 9 and 10 in the morning on weekends. Got a ride after 30 min.

name: Pletter (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not much traffic at 7 in the morning. I asked for a ride to Stolpen Heide gas station and found one in 5 minutes.

name: StefanXsupertramp (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a lift to Nuremberg directly after getting to that gas station.

name: AnsisMalins (Hitchwiki)
comment: Too much traffic for passing cars to see me or to stop, and most cars stopping at the gas station are local.

name: Amauryfraise (Hitchwiki)
comment:
This station doesnt exist anymore,
go to the next one 200 meter ahead direction highway

name: Jansmax (Hitchwiki)
comment: At 19h30 we couldnt get a ride into the Netherlands. There's very little traffic going by in the direction of the Netherlands.

name: Wolak (Hitchwiki)
comment: Most of the cars here are going towards Berlin. There's also great deal of locals. We wanted to get out of the city towards Rostock, and after 2,5h guy driving to Hamburg took us about 90km away.

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: A truck driver I asked just after my arrival took me to Hamburg.

name: Wasserpflanze (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Great spot to go south on to the A7. 
Started here several times and got rides quickly and easily by asking around. Never even needed a sign.

name: Hendrik (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride to Ulm from here from a very nice woman. Was easy to ask the people. Not that much traffic!
Tried this place before I knew about hitchwiki on my first hitchhiking trip to Berlin. This place is terrible, after a long try we just gave up and went to another place..
Its a good place, a lot of cars, but there are possible a short lift to suburb or gas station on A2, the best in Hanover on direction to Berlin.
Cool ride getting there on foot. Good spot for those who need to go westbound
nice place! the "long" way to get there was it worth for me.

name: Henryheineken (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good place to start hitch-hiking, when you have someone who can get you there. We got a ride in about 10 Minutes on a very low-traffic sunday afternoon.

name: LaZubi (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Waited there in the morning. 
Good places for long ways, so the 50 minutes of waiting paid off.
Most drivers wanted to go to Leipzig-South, but got a ride directly to Dortmund.

Took me quite a long time to get there from Hauptbahnhof (train main station), because I took S-Bahn 15, then Bus and walked about 30 min more. Nevertheless probably the best spot to get a ride towards West, I found a driver who took me to Rastplatz Rhonetal after some 15 min already.

For Chemnitz and the center of Leipzig, this is a very good spot. But for Kassel/ Göttingen we waited 1,5 hours. It was the thrid car to head this destination in this period of time. The journey from Leipzig took us very long as well. Pack some food and a good load of time for this one.
The landscape is awesome! You don´t have to drive away. We stayed there like 1 Hour before we start to try stopping cars because you know it was so .... romantic;)

name: Qriss (Hitchwiki)
comment: Easy if u want to go north
not very good spot in direktion to Berlin, most of people drive home to villages
Got a ride to Hamburg with "HH", took second car at ~1pm. It wasn't a direct ride so in retrospect should have given the spot more chance for a better ride.
30 min waiting for Osnabruck with a carton.

A good spot for rides north direction Hamburg. Get with the tram to "Alter Flughafen" from there follow the road north. There are plenty of spots a long the street where cars could stop easily and even a petrol station where you could ask directly. I and my girlfriend stayed with a sign HH (Hamburg) just 5 minutes and got a ride to the petrol station "Allertal" at the A7. From there it is super easy to go to Hamburg.

name: Philjgo (Hitchwiki)
comment: this is a station for locals not people heading to the autobahn. Try not to stop here.

name: Poucet (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Trying to go to Poznan from Berlin, I was dropped there by a well-intentioned guy who was going north after.

Not a good spot, maybe one car every 5-10 min.

I was asking people, mostly showing my sign saying Frankfurt - Poznan, after 1 h 30 i found somebody that dropped me at a highway exit further.

name: Julei (Hitchwiki)
comment: Difficult for going to Nürnberg. But I don't know another spot...

name: Yooks (Hitchwiki)
comment: This is a text book hitchhiking spot. It's right in front of the traffic lights and a four ways crossroad. Also there is plenty of space for rides to stop in a side-stop.

name: SuperFreaky (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good place, becaus there is a smal street, where cars can stop easily. Of course, the spot is good for going north or south.

name: Zviez (Hitchwiki)
comment: with a sign to get to Munich was very easy to get a lift

name: Zenit (Hitchwiki)
comment: Actually not good for stopping at all. But people are nice anyway, so it works...

name: Luc (Hitchwiki)
comment: Going to Munich worked. You can stand quite visible but the space for cars to stop is not very big, just the sidewalk and some green. Many cars did have local number plates (on a Monday around 15.00).

I disagree. This service area seems to be dying out, as there is a SA with a McDonalds just before and another with Burger King some kilometers East, while this has none of these. I'd rather avoid this place, not too much traffic. Still hitchable as an average service area in Germany but I guess this place won't have a bright future.
Tried hitching from here 4 days ago. Was a nightmare. 3 hours without anyone even taking a second glance! Go to service station before

name: Xkomczax (Hitchwiki)
comment: For me a good spot. Waited here two hours, but just because I try it in the night and afterward in the early morning. Still a lot of traffic passing by in the east direction and a lot of truck going eastwards
shit i waited 4 hours to get a ride to nurnberg, because there are not many cars stoping there

name: TravellSimon (Hitchwiki)
comment: Took me more time to write a sign then i actually waited :D
Not much traffic, but still enough to hop to another station since everyone goes south from here.
If you're planning to go to Rostock, this place is very bad to do so.
from village to village to alsfeld. there on pfefferhöhe right away a lift to kirchheim. works
wait 3 hours there, but no car stoped!

name: Hitchhannes (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was skeptical at first because not that much traffic, but the hitchhiking sign seams to work. Only used this one two times (1 and 5 minutes)

name: Laurad84 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Mh, wanted to go towards DK from there, on a Monday 2pm. the first car stopped after 1,5h. Very little non-local traffic. If you head to A7 I recommend to get a car to Rendsburg (i.e. don't hold a DK/FL sign) and get of after 13 km at the resting area [P]

name: Samsi (Hitchwiki)
comment: It's not very busy and sometimes cars park in a way on the sidewalk that drivers can't stop easily. That's why I decided after a short time to walk to the next spot (around two corners northwest), which I can recommend.

name: Mileagainst (Hitchwiki)
comment: I got a ride to Hoyerswerda, it took a while, I think most of the people are going to the highway

name: Nyca (Hitchwiki)
comment: Standard spot for going to Dresden, because most drivers pass here for the motorway.
Gasstation and busstop. Easy to get to Tübingen with a sign.

There's a gas station used by cars in both directions.
Easy to get towards Ulm in the morning.

name: Ilovefahrtwind (Hitchwiki)
comment: standing next to the traffic lights is no good option... go a few meters down rheinstrasse to make the drivers see you.

name: Samsi (Hitchwiki)
comment: The stop bay is a perfect place to get picked up for the A5 north and south. I always get rides in about 5 minutes. But you're unlucky when the stop bay is full - mostly there is space though.

name: Pawel.wita (Hitchwiki)
comment: I bet that it depends of the days, but mornings here can be hard. Especially when you are trying to get to A30

name: Rokz (Hitchwiki)
comment: First people I asked gave me a ride! Was very lucky!
horrible place if you want to go to hannover/berlin!

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: I always wait for a while on the exit and if it doesn't work, I start to ask people. It was a sunny day on the eastern holiday. There were more cars than I thought it would be. It took me 20 min waiting with the thumb up, but I gave up and started to ask people. After more 10 min I got a ride

name: Prochy (Hitchwiki)
comment: A local guy brought us to another place after 15 min of waiting.

name: Prochy (Hitchwiki)
comment: We got a lift to Deggendorf motorway from here.

name: Sourish banerjee (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was standing here in ankle-deep snow, trying to hitch to Passau, and it was 20:00h and dark and snowing. Not the best conditions you can expect. So I wouldn't rate this place as 'senseless'. But there is a difficulty in getting on to the (nearest gas-station on) A9.

name: Prochy (Hitchwiki)
comment: We asked a guy waiting in the parking lot.

name: Prochy (Hitchwiki)
comment: I used this place twice, once I walked here from the motorway exit. Soon it will be really difficult to stop cars going towards Grafenau.

name: Prochy (Hitchwiki)
comment: Around 8 pm, there were mostly only locals going to a party or something.

name: Prochy (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was lucky because I met a Czech guy here who brought me to České Budějovice.

name: Prochy (Hitchwiki)
comment: I had to wait a long time because all the people went for holiday to the Alps and I wanted to go to Passau.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Perfect if you don't want to get stuck in the Ruhr Area!

name: Ostkreuz (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride to center of Düsseldorf in about 20-30 min. Loads of traffic on a Friday evening (August '12).

name: Maxim1110 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Stop here if you want to cross the Ruhrgebiet, and try to get a direct ride across. On the A3 that means at least to Köln. I got a ride there after some 20 minutes, but the guy eventually took me all the way to Wiesbaden after his scheduled work meeting close to Köln had been cancelled.
Perfect place for going north to Denmark!
The bustop is a really good place to go north. We put a Kiel sign up and got a ride in less than a minute, though not to Kiel but at least to the nest reststop on E45.

name: Jmichele44 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Excellent spot. Bustop offers plenty of room for people to pull over. Got a ride to kiel in 5 minutes.
Excellent spot for going north towards Flensburg and Denmark! Almost no waiting time in early morning.
Did not see any bus stop there or any spot where cars could stop; luckily I was able to continue to another ramp

name: Danek (Hitchwiki)
comment: The second car took me to Kassel.

name: Alice d25 (Hitchwiki)
comment: shit, even though i placed the spot in the hitchwiki very carefully it's now at the wrong place. it must be placed directly at the A38 between berga 13 and rossla 14 at the "silberberg 221". you can see the parking spot driveway in the hitchwiki map.

name: NathanGardner (Hitchwiki)
comment: I waited for 2.5 hours for a lift to the A9 without success. I changed mz sign to Nürnberg and got a lift in 10mins. Ask your driver to take you to the Feucht Rasthof.
Got a ride to Amsterdam in less than 10 minutes. Just asked the people at the gas station.

name: Jsburgos (Hitchwiki)
comment: Asked the people at the gas station and after an hour a romanian truck brought picked us up. We were three people.

name: Dhudhb (Hitchwiki)
comment: Didn't have time to finish my sign as car stopped and gave us a ride directly to Amsterdam. We were two male. Awesome!

When we just came one guy offered a ride, but he was heading to different direction. After ~15min an old couple with a dog gave us a ride till Utrecht. We were male and female standing in a rain under one umbrella.

name: Bence16 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Me and my girlfriend wanted to go in direction to Stuttgart, we got a lift after 10 minutes. Calm and shady place, ideal for hitchhiking.

name: Denjoo4 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a lift to augsburg in 1 hour. Try to stay on the A8 instead of A96. Good spot!

name: LaZubi (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Oct 15; waited here for 2h to get a lift further than Munich. Many were going to Munich.
ask people on the restarea ;)

Huge station: filling station + resting area + restaurant, we tried at the exit on Saturday afternoon. A huge amount of cars passed by, mostly going to the North (we were heading to Stuttgart), mostly full-packed and Dutch. From here going North is OK, I think, but going West seemed impossible. After 3 hours we decided to hitch into Munich centre and get to the beginning of A8 highway by public transport, which is straight way th Stuttgart. It was a good idea! 2 persons (me and my girlfriend), Saturday, 3h
Couple with a panel indicating Ulm. Not so many cars but we get caught immediately :)

name: Tcehqui (Hitchwiki)
comment: 5 minutes waiting for direction Innsbruck, very good place.

name: OlivierD (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very good place. And there is a nice forest to sleep quiet if you have the chance to be there at night ;)

By far the best spot to go towards stuttgart. When hitchhiking to Munich I used a sign A8 even though a ride to the airport would have been enough. A lot of people go north on the A8 towards Karlsruhe.

name: Matematik (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very easy to go to Stuttgart there, even during the weekend
we wanted to go direction karlsruhe but there were so little cars that after some time we decided to try another spot.
After 2 hours during a night in summer (full cars) I got a ride all the way to Wiesbaden, near Frankfurt. I'm still grateful for the couple that took me with them.

I started two times from this place, first time it was very very difficult to find someone, we waited about 3 hours, second time was a little bit easier, but it took us also about 1 hour to get away from there. But it was both times on weekdays, so many people are on the way to work and don´t drive longer distances. Maybe on weekend its better...
bad place for berlin at least. somebody took me to hansa straße. there it was much easier. so go there and dont came here

name: Kundrt (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Seen lot of cars with B sign, some also with L. And got lift to Berlin in 5 mins with thumb at the exit from McDonald and petrol station.
For CZ and PL I guess it's possible to get ride to Dresdner Tor at the A4 and hitch from there

name: Hloza (Hitchwiki)
comment: Needed to get to Zittau and got a lift directly there after 5 mins, asking at McDonald´s.
Asked people around McDonald's and Jet gas station - got a ride to Breslau/Wrocław after 30 minutes.

name: Sorokin (Hitchwiki)
comment: just good luck

name: Sabinegoeshitching (Hitchwiki)
comment: the spot is on the other side of the road and more west, i dont know how to move the green circle, sorry! see description english hitchwiki.

name: Windsohn (Hitchwiki)
comment: I tried it but I didn't feel comfortable. Finally I changed to the other petrol station, where less people went longer distances.

name: C.zebitz (Hitchwiki)
comment: I came here from Nürnberg and by asking people at the gas station and the parking spaces, it took me 45 minutes to get a lift to Köln. In my opinion not the best spot, maybe try Weisheim!
plenty of traffic on a sunday night. got a lift to cologne within 20 minutes but the station is a bit hidden behind a wide turn so maybe not as much traffic as on nearby petrol stations...

A lot of cars that go to Lübeck or east towards Rostock.
I tried to get to Fehmarn though and it took me a long time to find a car to bring me to the next gas station at least. If you try to get onto the ferry in Fehmarn, your best bet is to get to the gasstation "Neustädter Bucht" first.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Agree with the above comment, made a mistake by standing with a sign saying "DK" and in the end accepted a ride to Lübeck. Got offer also for Rostock.
Got a ride from here to Göteborg!
took a really long time there is always more people hitching here but if you ask people in the end you will find somebody who goes to denmark most people go to lubeck/rostock

name: AdrianB (Hitchwiki)
comment: After 1 hour of hitchhiking a cool french guy stopped and took me to Malmö! (through Puttgarden - Rodby ferry, of course:) Enjoy the ride!

name: Elokuu (Hitchwiki)
comment: We were stuck here for 6 hours before an awesome canadian took us all the way to copenhagen.

name: Pletter (Hitchwiki)
comment: Asked a few cars and got a ride to Lubeck in 20 min.

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: It's kind of tricky to get to this petrol station but the taxi drivers gave me good directions and i had to ask several times for directions in the middle of the way. There was a guy on filthy clothes and he was waiting there for 1 hour and asking people if they could give him a ride. I stayed at the exit of the petrol station and it started to drizzle and after 15-20 min waiting a guy picked me up.
Can confirm. Went to the south once. Had to wait 1 hour, but only because many stuffed durch tourist cars. another time about 30 (?) minutes, but definately OK. Much traffic in both directions.
There is a bus, too, but it comes like once a day during the weekend. Walking to center Siegburg railway station is possible, but will take you at least 30 minutes. Did it onces.

name: Gareth SA (Hitchwiki)
comment: This is a great rest stop but quite hard to get to, Best to get a lift from one of the on ramps of the A3 and ask to be taken 15km to Siegburg Raststätte. this is well worth the effort as there is lots of traffic and I got a lift in 20 minutes to Wurzburg and then onwards to Nurnburg.

name: Gareth SA (Hitchwiki)
comment: ps, careful hitching to this rest stop, I mistakedly help up a board for Siegburg Bahnhof and got dropped off at the station about 3-4km away, a irritating walk through the town. I quickly learned that German word and also Raststätte means rest stop.

name: Adamiksen (Hitchwiki)
comment: got dropped here on a saturday late afternoon, there was almost no traffic. Was very lucky with a Polish guy in a van who gave me a lift close to Frankfurt.

name: GregGM (Hitchwiki)
comment: Two ppl, early August, 10 am. Lots and lots of cars, many dutch. People waiting in line at the petrol station. Got a ride to Frankfurt/Medenbach service station after 15 minutes of asking around.

This place for whatever reason gave me no luck at all. I got there late and camped overnight, the next day it was raining. In the morning (from 8am til 12.30) mostly business men, or older couples were passing by, and even the truck drivers I asked informed me they were turning of to a depo before the next stn on A3. Frustrated I crossed the bridge and got a ride North in 20mins

name: C.majalis (Hitchwiki)
comment: This place was very good. I came here with the last people that pickes me up. To continue my journey to Frankfurt I asked the people directly, the first try was successful and two guys from Heidelberg took me with to Frankfurt Airport.
really good

name: ChrisPnct (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Just believe the indications written here, toward West:
http://hitchwiki.org/en/Frankfurt_(Main)
Walk northwestwards from the train station, till you reach the highway, and then follow the footpath in woods, and walk until  you get to the rest area. Really worth it!
good spot! got a lift towards Cologne pretty fast
sry made a mistake...this one is wrong...of course there is no possibility to hitchhike in the middle of a field ;)....unfortunately I cant delete it!

Nice place to get a Car in direction to Nuernberg or A3 ( direction West).
Didn't even wait a minute, a lot of Netherlands, french and gents that want to got to Western parts of germany.

got here from Berlin on out way to Munich. Actually this could be a great place but this day was strange. We arrived at 6pm and within the next hour 3 people first agreed to give us a lift and then changed their minds! We didnt looked fucked up at all. Instead they gave us beer and some coins for food!? So we waited here for hours and another 5 people driving southern were acting extremely careful. In the end after 5! hours a nice guy from Luxemburg got us lift and it was great!

name: Stk (Hitchwiki)
comment: Lift for two persons after nightfall within 50 minutes -- got offers for just one person much earlier.

name: Hydra supertramp (Hitchwiki)
comment: Tried to go East towards Nürnberg (and eventually Berlin) - got hooked up by a car dropping me beyond Mannheim and Heidelberg. Perfect place!

name: (Hitchwiki)
comment: Came from Paris, got a ride to Frankfurt. Fairly good spot for this region.
only 6 cars in half an hour using this entrance going south, most going directly to Aachen, so its difficult to get to the next petrolstation on the A61
and no shade

Because of no cars got very fast a car to the first next tankstation from locals. I stood just after the traffic lights in the grass. Its a funny place where are bikers and old people in handicapped-cars on the middle of the road, and the owners of the cafe are dutch.
to hitch from Bad Hersfeld to the direction of Erfurt. Waited 5 minutes. Not so much place for the cars to stop, but the traffic frequence isn´t so high

name: White Fox (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Bad, but better than farther...
You just need to hope someone will stop to the gas station and can drop you on the highway...

name: Yarex (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got accidentally picked up with a sign on my back. Better to get with a bus till Paunsdorfer shopping center. Walking 4 km is not worth it.

my girlfriend and I were really lucky. We stood a few meters before the gas station with a sign for Dresden. After 5 minutes a guy picked us up and dropped us at the gas station Dresdener Tor. From there we could easily continue to Vienna via Prague!

name: Micho (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very good place, 50% of people here are going to NL. Good spot for Mainheim or Heidelberd as well.

name: AdrianB (Hitchwiki)
comment: Lots of people go to Stuttgart or direction Koblenz and Netherland. I waited 2 hours then a sweet girl saved me from this terrible place and took me to A6, which leads to France!  I was heading Paris, anyway. Good luck! :D

name: Jan (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Insa and Jan (and seemingly many cars) found this gas station confusing because the exit signage is a bit strange. Nevertheless, as Adrian described, it seems to be best to hitch with a sign from this curve.
One problem though is that we wanted to go south towards Freiburg and Switzerland, but most cars which stopped went either into Karlsruhe or north. In the end we took a car going north and switched at the Bruchsal service station, which is the first both-sided one north of Karlsruhe with a car bridge nearby making it possible to switch sides.

Waited for 5 hours with my friend. Most cars went to opposite direction (we tried to go to Karlsruhe). But when we started asking people, our first try was successful (actually, we got to the south, but it was eventually useful).

This exact spot, in the curve when two exits meet, is only for North! South exit is at the other end of the station. Walk around and read the boards carefully first! Huge resting area, filling station plus restaurant, but few cars stopped for us. Nearly impossible to get to France with one ride from here, none of the French drivers gave us a lift. Accept offers to Karlsruhe!
2 persons (me & my girlfriend), Sunday, dir. France, 2 hours.
It's not that small anymore. Today, there is a gas station and a coffee shop. Therefore it is a good spot to find a lift to Hamburg.

name: Flasher702 (Hitchwiki)
comment: I believe this is the smaller terminal. Try hitch hiking from Terminal 1.

name: Ebrithil (Hitchwiki)
comment: a great spot just i didn't go very well

name: SpearoBlau (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was waiting there with my girl for 30 minutes when we were hitchhiking to Würzburg

name: DerSchnecke (Hitchwiki)
comment: We tried to stand here and not at the traffic light. Took us (male-female couple) 2 minutes to get a direct lift to dresden.

name: Redjo27 (Hitchwiki)
comment: I didn't stand at the traffic lights. Cars can't stop there. So go a frew meters down the road. There are cars going anywhere in Germany (Hamburg, Hannover, Munich, Frankfurt, Offenbach). After one hour I got a ride to Stuttgart. It seems to be a good spot. In addition, you can easily take the train to Michendorf from here (takes about 90min), if it doesn't work out.

name: Thebohemian (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited around 30min in the morning. Works like a charm.

name: Megaemce (Hitchwiki)
comment: ATTENTION: We got problem with Police over here, so it's not a law-friendly spot at all. But, 2 hours after that accident we tried again, and we got the lift after 45 minut.

Made the trip in February, cold monday morning. took me around 45min to catch a ride (not directly to dresden), there was not that much traffic, the driver told me this road is not used to extensively anymore. i virtually didn t see any DD cars or Polish or Czech cars, mostly local...however, given the easy accessability of the spot, i would still recommend it. the lane is wide..

name: Hannes1993 (Hitchwiki)
comment:
After 20 Minutes the police come and send us away. 
Go to S-Bahnhof Schöneweide. There are two petrolstations. Very nice, got a ride after 5 Minutes
Got a ride to dresden after 40 min. This place is ok, but not the best
not legal (it is a kraftfahrstraße) to hitch here for sure and any other spot up and down the road (B96a) so be careful
Building site till 2021 - avoid this place

name: Erth Walker (Hitchwiki)
comment: Heading towards The Netherlands early August, Just stood with my Shield at the traffic lights, Then if i noticed an NL plate going for gas i approached him to talk. Got a ride all the way to NL fairly quick!

name: Soulclap (Hitchwiki)
comment: direct on the highway is a junction and a small parking lot. nice to stand here.

name: Licor007 (Hitchwiki)
comment: yes and don't even think about getting on the highway to the north, these locals never go there

If you want to travel in the direction of Oldenburg/Leer, just go to the crossing B322 where the cars have to turn left to get on the autobahn. I waited less than 10 minutes there. The Shell and McDonalds are really senseless, mostly local people there and some travelling in the direction of Hannover. (tried 1 hour there...)

name: SpearoBlau (Hitchwiki)
comment: This was not a very good spot to hitchhike. I often looked into frightened faces of the locals who may have thought I was a rapist/robber/other evil creature. I was mocked be young locals and some people lied to me about giving me a ride  ("I'll be back in 10 minutes.") To sum it up, hiking here made me feel really uncomfortable. After 2:30 hours (9 pm) a found a cool young guy who took me to Hannover.

name: ManuelW (Hitchwiki)
comment: It took quite some time to find somebody driving westwards on the A70

name: TeeTramp (Hitchwiki)
comment: its dont seems that bad that spot, but i waited on a saturday more then 3 hours for a lift behind dresden....

Thought it would be easy but still I had to wait quite a long time just to get to Dresden (Prague was the original idea). There was virtually nobody to ask, not even truck drivers and the fuel station was empty as hell...So I was glad to catch a ride to Dresden after 30min

name: Fverhart (Hitchwiki)
comment: OK to Swiecko!

name: Mateo (Hitchwiki)
comment: Just one more cooment: it was not under the bridge but a bit to the left (on the map), after the cross.

name: Mateo (Hitchwiki)
comment: Maybe some of you wont find this info so bad but this is where the police told us to catch a ride and we found one after an our and he took us to Augsberg. We felt like we could we wait for a lot more though...

name: Mateo (Hitchwiki)
comment: We waited for 30 minutes to get a small ride towards Stuttgart. If we were heading towards Munich it would have been faster, but it's almost impposible to get a direct ride to Stuttgart.

name: Fverhart (Hitchwiki)
comment: Fast traffic
Stood here at an entrance to a parking place direction to Karlsruhe (KA), got a car in 5 minutes.

name: JonParnell (Hitchwiki)
comment: Great spot! I was here for about 15 minutes before getting a ride to East to Ulm.

name: Yooks (Hitchwiki)
comment: Even though the traffic is not so dense, this is a very good spot to get on the highway. The cars are driving slow enough and the location is good. You should stand at the point where the lane splits on to the lane that goes to the highway.

name: ManuelW (Hitchwiki)
comment: not the best place to get southern (A7), but worked out!

name: Thejourneyramino (Hitchwiki)
comment: We were trying to get west but we got south. Big place with gas station anf McDonalds. It looks like there are many cars but there is not so big traffic.

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: not so many cars and trucks (1 or 2 per minute) on a sunny day of February, thursday, at midday. I gave up o waiting at the gas station and waled to here

name: Fverhart (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited here once 150 minutes for a 10 km ride, once 10 minutes for a lift to the A13... :P
It's a Servicestation on the motorway called Katzenfurt Süd

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: 50min waiting for a ride to Heidelberg. Seems like a good spot to me. Two cars already stopped before but both going to Frankfurt.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: 20min for Nürnberg :D

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Place is a bit tricky, cars have to stop where they're not allowed to. We still managed to catch a quick ride though, but more luck than skills ;)

name: Fverhart (Hitchwiki)
comment: Thumbed here two hours or so until giving up as it got dark.

name: DerZyklop (Hitchwiki)
comment: There are often traffic-jams at this place. So if you start at the rush-hour you probably have better changes to start here.

name: Ostkreuz (Hitchwiki)
comment: A lot of fairly local traffic. Many people going to Roermond and no one at all going to Venlo. We were asking people for ages.

name: Peymora (Hitchwiki)
comment: Rainy Sunday Afternoon - people going to Roermond (but not beyond) or staying in DE. Picked up by Dutch people driving towards Eindhoven via Venlo.

name: PavietranySzar (Hitchwiki)
comment: When I got there it took me half an hour to get a direct ride to Innsbruck. But I consider it was my luck as there was not that much traffic and what is more a road accident had happened nearby just before i got to the place.

name: Chris1337 (Hitchwiki)
comment: For me this spot can be good or bad. Note that it is a stop for both directions. During the day you can stand at both exits. this way it is quite easy to find a ride. At night it is too dark and you need to ask, which can also work. but it could also take a while...

name: Vert5 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Huge traffic. Car after car, but not effective. We ve  waited for 1 half hour, just to get a ride at least to Bad regenzhal..

name: Moryc (Hitchwiki)
comment: A lot of cars but better to just ask around than to stand with a sign.
Not such a good spot as it seems at the first sight.

name: MrBigCheese (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got picked up towards Salzburg after 20 mins. I tried the gas station but I found that waiting here was the best option. Walk down towards the parking lot and back to give people more time to see you. There's also wifi from the burger king.

name: Fraughtwithsounds (Hitchwiki)
comment: got a ride from here to the next big gastation on the A9 in direction Nurnberg
stand in the middle for dresden on the right to go west. best is asking for rides which you have time for as everybody is lining up in front of those two stupid streetlights.
was here twice. first time i waited 20 minutes (thumbs up with a sign), then a guy took me to rostock. second time i ask just one woman and she took me directly to hamburg.

name: Krassberd (Hitchwiki)
comment: Southbound works!

name: Corwohl (Hitchwiki)
comment: i got stuck here looking for somebody to take on my way to lindau (A96 east from munich). then i just got a ride into munich (easy to get) and went to the beginning of the A96, which worked out well
easy to get a ride to munich

name: Emanuele19956 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Southward works perfectly. I thumbed at the end of the gas station, when the road feeds back into the highway. Three people that were walking around the area even spontaneously offered me a ride. The third one was right for me, DIRECTLY to Rome, Italy.

name: Emanuele19956 (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was there again a couple of days ago and got a ride to south of Munich after 40 mins. Very busy place
Cars drive too fast (90 km/h) to pullover. Lots of people are from Düsseldorf or Neuss. Very few cars from Belgium or the Netherlands

name: Hypotenuse (Hitchwiki)
comment: I wouldn't agree that this spot is good !!! the flow is very weak and sensless !! the good thing is the people !! they stop for you and try to pick you to better places !!! I would suggest for you to keep going in this road till the first traffic light, that would be almost 1 KM a way, and then turn right and keep walking for almost 500 m. you will see the signs for the high way , ULM dirrction is when you need if you want to get to Zurich

name: Brunolimaam (Hitchwiki)
comment: got there by lunch time there were a lot of people stopping for lunch i got a ride to A2 pretty quickly

name: Mateo (Hitchwiki)
comment: On 21.9.2012 two backpackers got a ride here until the swiss border in 20 minutes using the thumb alone.

name: Jussuf (Hitchwiki)
comment: Easy to get here from Nufringen Trainstation (from Stuttgart) It took me less than 10 minutes to get a ride until the swiss border.
two people, we waited 5 minutes for a ride to Singen.
got a lift south after only 2 minutes! very good for going south
to trier
Correct spot with high traffic but unfortunately not useful for cars to stop.

name: Ilmer (Hitchwiki)
comment: This spot served us well when there was a problem with the trains between Herrenberg and Tübingen. We were immediately joined by another set of hitchhikers but all of us got a ride quickly (10 mins).

name: Kimmietaylor28 (Hitchwiki)
comment: 30 minute walk from either train station Raubling or Brannenburg

very good spot to hitchhike towards Ulm.

We waited not more than 5 mins to get a ride. 
For the other direction its not that perfect, because there is only a bus station on the right side going towards Ulm.

name: Ebrithil (Hitchwiki)
comment: I wanted to hitchhike south the A3 but after I waited like about an hour and a half i left the place and went to Königsforst. I really can't recommand this spot

name: Frixge (Hitchwiki)
comment: I got several rides there in direction of Frankfurt within 10 minutes. But once I waited there as well 1,5h and then got a ride to Konigsforst. I don't recommend this place during rush hour (local traffic) - e.g. 7am - About 10am it is fine.

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: a guy from solingen left us (guy and girl) here. She was standing at the entrance to the autobahn (there is a small place for cars to stop) and i was at the traffic lights more ahead. Got a ride to frankfurt in 5 min. it was 3 pm

name: AndyKay (Hitchwiki)
comment: We were 4 people and devided into 2x 2 people groups. the first group got a ride after 20 minutes, and we got one 40 minutes later so all in all 2 rides per hour. between 9 and 10 o'clock.

name: Thea for female travellers (Hitchwiki)
comment: I only waited like a vew seconds and got a ride to Dresden, even though it was really foggy and getting dark. I've been very lucky. and very nice and calm people especially those coming origanally from this region of Germany. they have nice stories to tell :)

name: Restlessraul (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very easy to find a ride to dresden. The more difficult part is to get to this petrolstation in the first place, my grandpa dropped me off here bc  nobody took me from paunsdorf center / leipzig.

name: Yarex (Hitchwiki)
comment: 1 min to Dresden!
ask people at the Aral station

name: Burmica (Hitchwiki)
comment: I started there twice, and twice I had a short lift taking me directly to the JET gas station before the A8 starts. But from there you get sth within 5 minutes. Or just take the bus further.

got a ride to Munich after 20 min of waiting on a Saturday around noon.
not very good place to stop for drivers but its absolutely possible.
Cars can stop pretty well, but traffic is usally poor. I hichted twice from there just to gas station "Gräfenhausen" (on A5) from where you can ask drivers for a lift very well.
Description: Getting on A5 direction South (Darmstadt, Karlsruhe, Basel) standing on Schwanheimer Ufer using your thumb. You can get here from S-Bahn station "Griesheim"
waited for more than 2 hours. 1000 cars  in hour and no one stoped to take me to the south. After changing my strategy couple of times, finally i changed my place :D
gas station on the Autobahn. Should be a very good spot due to lot of traffic, but I hitched twice from there, waiting as long as on no autobahn gas stations before. Maybe kind of coincidence...

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited 10 mins for the next gas station (Lorsch) on A67.
very good. we arrived and the first person we asked took us to heidelberg.

name: Davies (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited 3 minutes for a lift straight to Freiburg!!
Good place when there is less traffic.

Once, it took me 1:50h to get a lift to A24->Berlin. Maybe it's better to wait in Kiel for a direct lift, if you start from there.
For a lift to "Buddikate" (A1->HH, HB) I waited 50min.
Its god to hitchhik to Kiel you can ask the people they will wait of the ferry

this is the highway to Kiel.
Many people from the village around and the people they came from the supermarket drive there

Directly at the roundabout is a great spot to get on the A2 southwest or east. There’s a gas station, a McDonald’s and another restaurant so plenty of traffic. Plus they’ll already see you when driving into the Autohof so they might be more likely to pick you up when they’re done if you need to wait a bit longer.
is alright from that spot. got a lift within 10 minutes.

name: Zweifeln (Hitchwiki)
comment: I hitchhiked several times from the gas station (where I may talk to the drivers) towards Berlin. That worked always quite good for me.
Useless for going to the north (Rostock), cars go only to A2 and A9

name: Werner (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited 1 hour and 55 minutes to get to Chemnitz, 2/27/13 Wednesday at 17 clock

name: Reggae-girl (Hitchwiki)
comment: Which direction?

name: Micha (Hitchwiki)
comment:
I was heading to Paderborn, and then further on. Got lucky and the second person I was asking (8AM on a weekday) was a business woman going to bavaria, who took me for more than 2 hours.
Despite that I gave this spot an 'average' cause it's only one experience and I might just have been lucky.

name: Julei (Hitchwiki)
comment: You can take U2/U3 to Rothenburgerstraße and walk there. Stand after the last traffic light before the highway actually starts. There's some space for cars to pull over and people can see you while they are waiting for the traffic lights to turn green.
Today (early Sunday morning) it took me one hour, but normally this spot is really good!

name: Julei (Hitchwiki)
comment: This spot works very well for A3 (to Würzburg/Frankfurt/Köln) and OK for A73 towards Coburg (not a lot of traffic going further than Erlangen and also no gas stations on the highway).
Get a ride to Chemnitz

name: Flasher702 (Hitchwiki)
comment: You could just as easily hitch hike from INSIDE the parking garage where it is warm and you can talk to people. Direction of travel may also be limited from this point so be sure it's right for you before you stand here for too long.

name: Artgpereira (Hitchwiki)
comment: We were 3 people trying a ride to the north, direction Prag, we asked a few people, than we got a ride direct to Prag! Is a big and really good gas station!

name: Burmica (Hitchwiki)
comment: I waited like two hours at the gas station to get a lift up the A9 northwards...well it was a holiday, no buisiness people :/

name: Kkmm (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited about two hours until I found someone going to the A9 north. (Weekday evening)

name: Bence16 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Me and my girlfriend wanted to go to Stuttgart (A8) in a sunday afternoon, we had to wait for like 2 hours to get a lift to Augsburg. No shades, expensive water at the station... Not a good place to hike

name: Fred57 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Weekday, end of august, 3pm. Average traffic, lots of cars full, found a car to Augsburg after 30min (wanted to go to Stuttgart and then France).
I got a ride to Zwickau it was so lucky... but this rest area is perfekt to get a ride to northward (direction Regensburg or Nuremberg)

Waited 3 and a half hours to get a ride even two rest areas further (don't get dropped at Halledau West btw if you want to go north, it's just on one side of the A9 and less cars going north stop there), many people went just fairly locally or, and that depends on the season, were families returning from vacation and had no space

name: Achi (Hitchwiki)
comment: I wanted to go to Freiburg via Heilbronn from there, but not car whatsoever pulled over. A neat spot to be dropped of for Nuremburg though.
100 km lift towards berlin on a monday evening 6 pm after 15 mins or so.
imo best spot to Schweinfurt/Würzburg or north if you're dropped of in Bamberg.

name: Thejourneyramino (Hitchwiki)
comment: After 10 min we got ride to Dortmund. We asked at the gas station and the people were very polite.

name: Wasserpflanze (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited for 30min, but I guess it is still one of the best spots to get to East, North or South. (Hamburg/Berlin/Hannover)

I started hitch hiking direction Hannover from that petrol station twice.
once waiting 5minutes on a wednesday and once 3h on a monday. so i don't think what i should think about that place, but there were much more cars direction Osnabrück and direction Hamburg

I waited there for almost two hours to with a sing to Osnabrück. After that time, a couple take me five minutes away, to IKEA, they told me that there was a better spot. They were right. In IKEA busstop I waited 40min

name: Sattleryan (Hitchwiki)
comment: Having MUCH experience with this spot, I would say this is absolutely average. Once, I even had to give up when I wanted to travel to Berlin. Most often, I just got a ride for a couple of kilometers until the next fuel station, which is again just average. Usually have to wait here for 30min-1hour with my wife. Without her up to infinity haha. Close to the fuel station are some traffic lights. My personal opinion: It's better to stay behind the traffic lights!

name: Wasserpflanze (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Took that spot 4 or 5 times now, alone as a guy, during day time. 
Max waiting time was about an hour, min. about 5 min, avg. about 20-30min. 
Its a pretty good spot to get North and south on the A1, it is important though to ask people and be happy with being taken only to the next Gas station ON THE A1. 
It is ok but not perfect, dont know a better spot though.

Monday, ca. 15:00 o'clock. Many locals drive by to fill up fuel. Only a few cars leaving the city.
It took me 30 minutes to find a lift to the next gas station in direction to Hamburg on A1.

Be sure to approach the gasstation on the side of the traffic leaving the city, because it's nearly impossible to cross the road during rushour.

If you want to go to Hannover/A7 south, ask people from Verden (license plate VER) if they can take you to the service area "Goldbach" on the A27 at exit Langwedel. It's not far, but definitely a better place to find a lift to the south.

name: Corwohl (Hitchwiki)
comment: I think this is probably the best spot in Munich for going to Lindau. You can get there quite easily from the main trainstation. It took me about fifteen minutes (weekday 6pm) to find a ride to Wangen im Allgäu. Didn't find anyone going until Lindau.
got a lift until memmingen by a guy driving to france. first guy i asked

name: Tomtom (Hitchwiki)
comment: Aral petrol station. Very busy place with a lot of local traffic, but still a very good spot for rides going direction Memmingen, Lindau and further on to Switzerland. Just ask the drivers directly, don't stand on the road.

name: Cha (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Best spot in Munich to get to lake Constance! 
If not directly to Lindau you will find a ride to the first service station "Lechwiesen" very fast.

name: Masanfe (Hitchwiki)
comment: Didn't seem so busy surprisingly on a Friday 10 am, or just local traffic. However after 30 minutes I got a ride to Switzerland :)

name: Masanfe (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very easy to get to, Hitchwiki explains how. Although the bus no. is wrong, bus 63! Have to change it later in the wiki.

name: Witowitold (Hitchwiki)
comment: Place is ok. My mistake was that I agreed to get lift to exit 32 (Gilchin) where I got stuck for few hours. I'd rather wait there longer and wait for somebody going to Rasthof on A96 next to Landsberg.

name: Cha (Hitchwiki)
comment: Still works well aka fast every time. Usually directly to Lindau, sometimes a rest stop along the way.
In may opinion is the best place to get to Lidau. Not to far from city.

name: Csp (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was at the exit of the station, about 3 cars stopped before getting a direct ride to zurich, waited there about 30min.

name: Mrm1985 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Great spot to Lindau. Recommend taking lifts to Rasthof Landsberg.
Not even 15 min and a straight ride to Zurich
took us 20min to catch a car to Switzerland (boy and girl)
try to stay at the Autobahn, it is was more quiet in this Autohof since people are resting here
Got an instant lift to Flensburg by asking ferry passengers. You can either try directly on the ferry/at the pier, or at the big parking lot that is close.
No problem to get north, e.g. Ruhrpott region (Düsseldorf etc.)
Excellent spot for hitchhiking to France / northern Germany.Got ride early in the morning to Saarbrucken after 30 min waiting.
My friend arranged a ride from here to Budapest almost before I was back from the toilet!

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: I waited 30 mins for a car across the border to Austria. There were many cars going to Austria, but most of them were full.

name: ESko (Hitchwiki)
comment: me and my friend (two guys) waited here around 20 mins, than a guy stopped and took us around 80 km north. It's a good spot, but there's not so much space to stop

name: Muttafuri (Hitchwiki)
comment: i was dropped here. it's a good spot to find a lift to north.

name: Mrm1985 (Hitchwiki)
comment: was here at night (1 am) and still got a straight ride to berlin

name: Cardinal (Hitchwiki)
comment:
I got dropped here. The third person I asked for a ride, took me straight to Leipzig.

Talk to the people!
It's also a good place to head south direction Nürnberg/München
For going to the south you should only chose so who is directly going onto A9, stoppon in A4 will make it difficult to go to the south

name: Nilok (Hitchwiki)
comment: To go north (Berlin) you can also take a car going south on the A9 and stop at Hermsdorfer gas station. Then you cross the highway through the tunnel and are on the good direction with possibility to speak to people.
direct to dresden abort78
yep try along rostocker chaussee to get to rostock

name: Longhaul (Hitchwiki)
comment: I got a ride from here on a winter day with blowing snow in about 20 minutes, but I would not choose this spot again; instead, to go south the best is to walk on the other side of the bridge for about 1 km until the guardrail ends and there there will be plenty of space for the cars to stop.

name: Lukstier (Hitchwiki)
comment: Agree! Impossible to get a hike from here!

name: Longhaul (Hitchwiki)
comment: I have been here two times and both times this petrol station revealed not a good place where to switch drivers - fuel supplied by Total, it's a bit more expensive than other companies and this explains a bit why both times I have seen so few drivers in this spot. I recommend to avoid it if it's possible.
well not much traffic, but in these  cases there was also not that much traffic on highway, don't know what i should think about

name: Lukas (Hitchwiki)
comment: This place can be really lonely. It looks so huge, but there wasn't a lot of traffic coming through. I recommend asking people directly, not thumbing.

name: Kovacspetyesz (Hitchwiki)
comment: i think its a good place with thumbing too, just stand on the ramp

name: Flasher702 (Hitchwiki)
comment: drove through it once, looked pretty empty so I took the ride further to the airport instead.
Good possibility to go on the A4. There are two Gas stations in both directions at the A4 not far away, so you can get a lift there!
"A9 Leipzig" sign in the afternoon. People could see me from the roundabout like 'their' roadsign. And the cars are slow because of the roundabout.
I did start here few times.. it was nice! just wrote "A 65*
The spot is not perfect to stop but there were a immediatly 2 persons that stoped and one that whent on the direction of the highway.
its hard to go from here..

name: SuperRoger (Hitchwiki)
comment: We tried this place for about one Hour...afterward we went to the gas station nearby...way better!

name: Rytis9 (Hitchwiki)
comment: I suggest you try this spot http://hitchwiki.org/maps/?place=22635 nearby. Worked really well.

name: Emanuele19956 (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was there on a Monday together with two more hitchhikers, an American and a German. A woman picked us all up and got us straight to Munich!!!

name: Maxim1110 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Came here on a Thursday afternoon in January looking for a ride to Nijmegen (NL). Plenty of Dutch cars around to ask, got a ride to Kleve in about 15 minutes.

name: Maxim1110 (Hitchwiki)
comment: First car we asked on a Friday evening in July took us to Venlo, making sure we made it all the way from Krakow to the Netherlands in one day.
First car I asked to me the gas station of Hünxe. I wanted to go to Antwerp, but I made a detour via Arnhem :)

name: WhiteCinnamon (Hitchwiki)
comment: how is the hitchhiking in köln to go to berlin??
It's hard to find someone to take you on a longer trip but it's easy to get on a car.

name: Burmica (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good spot I you missed the train to Uelzen, just walk back to the main street and although there is just few traffic, I always got a ride within some minutes to Uelzen, once even directly to Hamburg. Recommended if you missed the train and don't want to wait

name: Burmica (Hitchwiki)
comment: haha, the first lift dropped me off some meters further at the bridge, unfortunately then police came and sent me back because of "Bundesstraße" and not allowed to hitchhike there... so rather stand at the  traffic light marked here. although not best spot...
Medium traffic on weekday morning. Most continue on A9 north.

name: Kristian (Hitchwiki)
comment: OK without sign.
august 2014; we were standing at the road, but cars are to fast; we asked then around at Mecces parking lot for a ride into town.

Stand an der Bushaltestelle mit Schild Richtung Frankfurt. Ging gut.
Die Tankstelle ist zu wenig frequentiert meiner Ansicht nach,

Stand on the bus station. Works good, Petrol station ist not enough frequented in my opinion.

name: Jan (Hitchwiki)
comment: Insa and Jan got a ride from here to Karlsruhe without even asking, just because we had a sign saying »Karlsruhe« when we got out of the car which took us there.
i waited 3 minutes and ambulance stop me :D abort78 direction to dresden
It felt dangerous,  The parking lot across the road would be a safer option
Building site till 2021 - avoid this place

name: Marcel from germany (Hitchwiki)
comment: was very lucky and first 'yes' I got was a lift straight to my destination Bielefeld :)

name: Marcel from germany (Hitchwiki)
comment: 15min for a lift to kassel

name: Ebrithil (Hitchwiki)
comment: This Time I was really lucky and could go of in just 15 minutes

name: Witowitold (Hitchwiki)
comment: I got immediate ride to the parking spot on A4 in direction of Dresden.

name: Fraughtwithsounds (Hitchwiki)
comment: First car stopped and took me to the border crossing with France @ Neuenburg am Rhein.

name: Thumb-up (Hitchwiki)
comment: Just a little percentage of the passing cars are heading onto the highway. Directly on the on-ramp it worked a lot better!

name: Adamiksen (Hitchwiki)
comment: I choose this spot to get out of the city, direction of Basel. After 30 min I got a lift to the parking place near A5 FR/Sued an early saturday morning.

name: Restlessraul (Hitchwiki)
comment: we waited for about 3h, asked around the gasstation and had a sign saying prague but we couldnt get a ride. At least a woman took us back to dresden and we tried our luck a second time.

name: Sorokin (Hitchwiki)
comment:
well to Hanover
bad in Hamburg

name: Maxim1110 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Perfect spot to get into Berlin, but other directions not so much. We were waiting for about three hours to catch a ride onto the A10 west, but eventually found someone all the way to Oberhausen. Still, not really recommended to go west.
People told me that they were either going to Poland or Hannover or inside the city. I finally found someone to give me a ride to the next gas station on motorway 10 around Berlin.

name: Amro (Hitchwiki)
comment: headed west and this is the perfect place for leaving Hannover

name: Bohua (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was going to Dortmund, but anything going west is fine. I think i was just unlucky that i didn't ger anything on my direction and finally i had to get whatever i could west instead of waiting for something to Dortmund

name: Moelie (Hitchwiki)
comment: It was a Sunday in February, so I guess that explains my long waiting time, too - - wanted to go to the Netherlands via Osnabrück, but it was extremely hard to find people not following the A2 but going the A30. It's a really perfect place to go to cities like Dortmund (other hitchhiker I met there had to wait for only 30min that day) also on a Sunday there were many many dutch and polish people passing going back to the Netherlands, if they are not full, they will take you! In this case it is a very good place for getting direct rides to the Netherlands! Wait for someone that can take you far! I was lucky enough to find some dutch people taking me to the doorstep!

name: Moody93 (Hitchwiki)
comment: It seems to be a good spot, but not so much traffic here on workday morning. Anyway we got lift in direction Dortmund. Be patient. :)
best spot for going east to hannover and berlin! took me 20 seconds to get a ride. make a big sign and stand directly at the beginning of the bus station.
I wait there on a Monday from 10:00 to 13:00 a clock. There i find no lift to East

name: Kamina (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very few people stop here, 200 metres towards the City is a better gas station, but most people in this area just go shopping.

name: Jan (Hitchwiki)
comment: In mid-May on a Wednesday late afternoon, Insa and Jan asked around at the service station. Got a ride fairly quickly, into Switzerland, near Olten (where the highway splits).

name: Davies (Hitchwiki)
comment: First guy I asked took me to Bern, Switzerland.

name: Tabea (Hitchwiki)
comment: For us it was quiet hard to find a ride to Bern (A2). All people went to Zürich/Luzern..

name: Adamiksen (Hitchwiki)
comment: got a ride to Freiburg on a saturday evening. good place quite a lot of cars
we sleeped in McDonald and got ride to Freiburg at 8 am on Sunday after 10 minutes, but I think we were lucky

name: Dynamo (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was very lucky and got a direct ride to my destination Wuppertal (5 minutes).

name: Benworm (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited a while to get a ride to the A1. Locals really keen to take you only short distances though.

It really depends on the day and the time. Sometimes you wait 5 minutes, sometimes 20. It is easy to get a lift to Lengenfeld (next town) and it is fairly easy to get a lift to Zwickau and the A72 (use a sign!)

name: Annieant (Hitchwiki)
comment: Stood there with a "Hanover" sign. Good place because of the nearby traffic signal and gas station. Also, small shoulder for people to stop.

name: Hrabino (Hitchwiki)
comment: Towards Netherlands all the truck in the right lane and cars can't see you. Better go further up the road or wait at the station. (My case because of the rain)

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride to Uelzen in 20min, after first turning down a ride going to Hannover!
Best place to ride south
Great spot!
found a ride to kassel after 20 min  late in the evening
Did not found any ride going north
The traffic light is a good place for going south. Most of the people coming from "Nürnbergerstraße" and turning left are directing to Nürnberg.
There is a huge spot, patrol station, eat, man cars and trucks stopped there. You can choose with who you wanna travel :)

name: Kkmm (Hitchwiki)
comment: Found a direct ride to berlin inn 25minutes

name: Radu122 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Car took me to Leipzig very fast (the way to Berlin).

name: Klarocka (Hitchwiki)
comment: There is a good place for cars to stop. And they can see you from far away. But most of the cars are driving fast. Having a sign with your destiny is a great advantage.

name: Restlessraul (Hitchwiki)
comment: didnt worked for us (2 guys). Asked around  on the aralstation on a rainy afternoon but only locals were stopping.
No one is going to Prague from this gas station I tried with my friend and we waited for more than 2hours

Many cars are stopping at the traffic light. You get easily in a conversation with people waiting for green to come. There I waited 20 minutes with success whereas at the zebra crossing on the other side 1 hour without... Many cars are going towards the north.

name: Emanuele19956 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very nice gas station. I slept there in my tent. Next day I packed up early and got a ride from a truck driver after 30 mins just standing at the exit of the gas station.
a good spot. found after 15 minutes a l lift to Leipzig

name: Bence16 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Excellent spot to Berlin, we got a ride after 1 minute.

name: Tillmann (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good spot to go to Berlin. Also possible to get a lift around the city. Took me about 45min to get a lift in direction to Hamburg.
Busstop

it is a busstop and it's also completely useless in my experience. me and three others waited there for 2.5 hrs this summer to no avail. barely any vehicles going towards dresden and traffc is not that dense either. seems everyone comes here only to shop
took me more than one hour to get into direction Dresden. don't know if i would try this spot again...

name: Fraughtwithsounds (Hitchwiki)
comment: within two hours 10 cars stopped and offered me rides to all over southern Germany. Unfortunately I had to go to the countryside but it shows that chances are good to get a lift further down south the A7 from here.

name: Yensn (Hitchwiki)
comment: Dont even think of trying to go towards east on A38...imposible :( going towards south however is easy from here :)

name: Sorokin (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good place to change the car before Hof
Monday evening, got a ride to Munich within 5 minutes. Place is small.

name: Xkomczax (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was lucky, because one car picked me up after some 30 minutes. But there was almost no traffic
* I was also asked for dokuments of four policeman in normal cloth.
we asked in the park to the drivers and in ten minutes we get a lift to cover 400 kms.
Useless for going to the north (Rostock), cars go only to A2 and A9
Due to construction side (10.2017) there are very few cars on this side, definitive not recommended until the construction is over
I just got my sign out of the backpack when a car stopped and took me with. Very good place to go west.

name: Dynamo (Hitchwiki)
comment: After 30 minutes I got a ride to the next gas station (Am Biggenkopf) in February 2015.

Many people going to Aachen, 
some belgian cars too.

Gas station: not much outbound traffic;
I found a ride to Berlin on the street, before the station. (Saturday noon)
I use this spot frequently to go to berlin for the weekend and my average is below 15 mins, max waiting time was half an hour

name: (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride to the motorway to Sttetin after 1h of waiting with a sign "PL"

name: Chiken213 (Hitchwiki)
comment: This place was the first one for us on our way to Kenig, and it was a great pleasant surprise when we just raised a sign and in a 15 seconds one nice polish man stopped and lifted us up to the Sttetin gas station. It's our record)

We (2 people) were heading towards France, direction Mulhouse => Lyon. Average traffic at Friday 7pm, but no ride possible for the rest of the evening. Got a ride the next day directly after breakfast directly to Burgundy, France, where we wanted to go. Best strategy here is probably asking people.

Good camping spot in the fields to the west (walk the small road between the restaurant and the gas station for 5 minutes).

name: Pletter (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride after 30 min at 2 AM in the night, all the way to Puttgarten. Great ramp.

name: Pletter (Hitchwiki)
comment: Roadworks on the highway made cars drive very slowly on the ramp in August 2015.
If you go north, don't take a car that does NOT go at least onto Fehmarn island! I t makes things a lot harder. Good spot

name: Tishead78 (Hitchwiki)
comment: cars cannot park easely and they go fast here. plus most of them go straight and not to Leipzig on the right: Waited 45min then chnage spot!
sometimes not much traffic...

name: Dynamo (Hitchwiki)
comment: On friday afternoon there wasn`t much traffic but still more then enough to hitchhike west. I got a ride to Erfurt after ~15 minutes.

name: CHK one (Hitchwiki)
comment:
As I arrived I was quite hopeless and thought that I won't get a lift from there because there wasn't much traffic and people just drove to places nearby. But after an hour or something I got a direct lift to Leipzig. So it worked out quite well anyway. The petrol stations stuff was quite funny and helpful, thanks for that!
Good luck, God bless you!

name: BulgarianJesus (Hitchwiki)
comment: A nice hitchhiking spot. cars are slowing down from the main street and cars leave the gas station on your other side. a good strategy for couples is for the girl to stand with a sign and finger, and the guy should ask around at the gas station. success guaranteed..

name: Soundhiker (Hitchwiki)
comment: I've waited one hour under the rain using a board to reach the A10 for Poland and got no ride! I was also asking people in the gaz station... I finally went to the other spot at the gaz sation on the highway!

Very good spot to get out of Berlin in dresden Direction,very easy to reach with the metro.
When I arrived there I meet another guy Hitchhiking to Dresden and started to ask for rides together, And at the same spot there where ashore two guys and another girl, in about half of an hour we were all gone!All the area is good and there even a gas station so is possible to ask directly.
