But remember some times is luck!

name: Lopotour (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good spot, took me about 30 mins to get a ride to Dresden, there was another guy here who said he uses this spot every week. I was here on a sunday morning,

name: AdrianB (Hitchwiki)
comment: We started to hitchhike at 7am (February, still darkness) and took us (boy+girl) 1 hour to get a ride towards Dresden. Nice spot! :]

name: Hannes1993 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Nice spot! Two gazstations, 5 Minutes to get a ride to Dresden and Praha

Me and my friend started to hitchhike around 9:30AM, we found someone already there and we were so lucky because we were in point to give up after 1 hour waiting then suddenly someone came and took us to Dresden
What does this have to do with hitchhiking?

name: Fraughtwithsounds (Hitchwiki)
comment: ask people at mcdonalds. got a ride to Gießen from the first person I asked.

name: Postfrosch (Hitchwiki)
comment: Ok, es war Sonntagmittag, nicht die beste Zeit zum Trampen, aber ich kam nach 20 min ganz gut weg Richtung Eisenach!

name: Bohua (Hitchwiki)
comment: Impossible to get a ride to the west, so a nice local took as to the petrol station at the west end of Eisenach . There it was easier

name: Postfrosch (Hitchwiki)
comment: Es war Sonntagmorgen um 9.00, dass ich einen Ride suchte, dafür bin ich mit 20-30 min sehr zufrieden!

name: Ivan Đogić (Hitchwiki)
comment: There's an extra lane by the road so cars can easily stop even though it's a fast road. Good spot to leave Berlin in direction east.

Very good point to catch rides to the A8 to go to Stuttgart or Munich or in the other direction to Reutlingen and Tübingen via the Bundesstraße. There are busstops on both sides of the crossroads where many cars pass by.
The gas station is a good point to get rides to Vaihingen / Enz.
I've once been there to hitchhike to Stuttgart with a friend and we had to ask several people until someone gave us a ride, but I think it's probably the best spot in Vaihingen to go to Stuttgart.

name: Yensn (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not very many cars, finally got picked up by a car to Nürnberg, after 3 hours. Someone already wrote on the barrier "have fun waiting, it took us 3,5 hours" lol

To go north, either you'd have to get the left-turners, they stop at some traffic-lights, next to their line is a slim, but secure area where you can stand. The right-turners can stop at a bus-stop. But i fear most people drive within Hamburg and wouldn't take hitchers going far north, although i saw plenty of plates from the cities along the A23 north.
We gave up.

Lot of traffic
Good for hitchhiking towards Switzerland

Very good towards Lindau/ Switzerland.
Not helpful to get on the B17 towards Augsburg. For Augsburg, wait at the parking space near the big roundabout (St 2054).

name: Mrm1985 (Hitchwiki)
comment:
For Switzerland I'd take any car to Bregenz, Lindau, Friedrichshafen, Konstanz (depends what side of Bodensee you want to chose).

Do not let drivers get you of the A96 into the Allgäu region (like Kempten). It's somewhat close, but you will have to take a lot of short rides from village to village to reach Bodensee eventually.

name: AdrianB (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good spot towards Switzerland, I was taken by a Czech couple to Bergenz!

Even 4 people  just asked me where they could take me, without holding up my sign - during I was just eating and making a smoking break :)
Got a ride to border Liechtenstein/Switzerland

name: Grinsolt (Hitchwiki)
comment: Best spot in Neumünster to get everywhere. Average 15 min.

name: Krassberd (Hitchwiki)
comment: If you are coming from Suhl to enter Gotha, maybe you try to skip that place. Petrol is to expensive so not many cars will stop to fill up. Keep asking the cars at Burger King. Alternative is go of at Schwabhausen Busstop and try to get a ride directly in to Gotha.

name: Hendrik (Hitchwiki)
comment: Just asked at the petrol station, took me 5 min. DIrection Bremen / Hannover. Awesome!

name: Frixge (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was there on Sunday afternoon and there was nearly no traffic. During the week it might be hard and dangerous to cross.
very good spot to go to the direction of stuttgart. don´t bother thumbing here, just ask people when they stop to tank.

name: LaZubi (Hitchwiki)
comment: Oct 15; good spot, unlucky mehad to wait in the dark which made it more difficult to get a hike. Had to wait for an hour to get a ride to Stuttgart and further.
Never had to wait that long for a lift (3h). Maybe just bad luck.
Not bad place, in 40 minutes a car direct to Berlin.

Not so a good Place...
The Cars coming very fast. 
Try it on the gas Station

name: Michaeln (Hitchwiki)
comment: (Friday 16:30) very busy, got a hitchike to Karlsruhe after ten minutes

name: Asdam (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very little traffic towards the highway but I got picked up in the rain to the next petrol station on the highway :D

name: Mat (Hitchwiki)
comment: waited 1hour for a direct ride to stuttgart.

name: Fred57 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Same as Mat, 1hour with a sign Stuttgart/München for a ride to Stuttgart

name: ChrisPnct (Hitchwiki)
comment: Local traffic, not many going toward Frankfurt, but I got a direct ride after about 25 minutes.
I was asking ppl at the gas station. Super nice spot
everybody just wanted to go to Offenburg, nearly nobody north the A5

name: Thumb-up (Hitchwiki)
comment: nearly no cars at the petrol station,

name: Soundhiker (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very good spot! In fact there are many polish trucks which are actually nice! Take care not to miss the bus in Königs, there is only a bus every hour and a half to reach Brüsendorf (i waited).

name: Starrider (Hitchwiki)
comment: Probably the only reasonable spot to get to Poland from Berlin. Yet it takes two hours to get here from the centre. Also, on weekdays there aren't too many cars going to Poland, but eventually you will find someone.
really good place. we stop car Sunday in 40 minute directly in poznan. but its hard to reach this place, we walked a lot, because of transport which isnt so often in sunday.

name: Radu122 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride to Poznan in 1 minute. Warning, the bus to Brusendorf does not work on weekends! If you get to Konigs, its a very long walk, maybe 2 h+. I hitchhiked while walking in Konigs for Brusendorf. I have added the place in Konigs where the guy picked me up.

name: Maxim1110 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Probably very easy for direction Poznan, but a bit more challenging for Wroclaw or Dresden. Took us about 50-60 minutes to get a ride all the way to Wroclaw from here.

name: Kwiatek t (Hitchwiki)
comment: We were there at 10 pm on sunday so it wasn't the best time to hitchiking. After 1.5h we got ride to Łódź

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: I waited 25 min for a lift direction to Koblenz, A61.
this motorway service area isn´t as good as the one called "soester börde" i guess.

name: Dynamo (Hitchwiki)
comment: waited 20 minutes for a car to muenster.

name: Fraughtwithsounds (Hitchwiki)
comment: quite easy to get on A1 south or North or into Dortmund. But getting on A44 towards Oberhausen/Arnhem(NL) is more tricky

going to the north/west was very easy from the side where the cars have to turn left. You can talk to the driver for a few secs and then have to get in fast as the traffic lights will be red just for about 60 seconds

name: Postfrosch (Hitchwiki)
comment: Als ich einmal die Strategie mit dem an der Ampel winken und fragen raushatte, war es sehr einfach, wen zu finden. Einfach stehen und warten würde wohl ewig dauern.

name: Postfrosch (Hitchwiki)
comment: Auf der immer weiter ausgebauten L1048 nach Arnstadt ist man auch super schnell unterwegs.

name: Postfrosch (Hitchwiki)
comment: Ich wurde auf dem Weg auf der A73 Richtung Norden hier herausgeschmissen und es war der ungünstigste Ort dafür - lieber eine Auffahrt früher oder eher. Wer hier strandet, sollte versuchen über Coburg - Bad Rodach auf der Landstraße weiterzukommen. So hab ich es am Ende nach Hildburghausen geschafft.
senseless try to go to berlin from this point, i waited 6 hours and then decided to walk to lehrte

name: Laurad84 (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Great if you go north or south, hard if you look for a car towards Berlin. In my opinion it's always better to talk to people infront of the restaurant instead of standing with sign or thump.

- If you want to go from here to Berlin I recommend you to take a car northwards north until you are north of A2. Shortly after exit 54, Großburgwedel at 52.504431, 9.824794, you can get off and go over a bridge to a resting area for cars going south. There it is easier to find a car heading towards east.

name: Emanuele19956 (Hitchwiki)
comment: I could find a ride toward south very as late at night as 11.30pm!

name: Burmica (Hitchwiki)
comment: Stood there for like half an hour on friday afternoon, just two cars passed by, but the second one took me to the next station

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: 2 guys took me and my friend up to Freudenstadt. They just finished their job at Baden-Baden and they would come back to Freudenstadt. We had to ask to get a ride.

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: some people stopped for us when, after 20 min, a couple took us to a place very close to the A81.

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: the very first car took us to Konstantz!! It was a hot summer day.

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: only one guy stopped for me and he took me to innsbruck after 20 min on a summer sunny day

We liked that place a lot. Wee took train+bus from Osnabrück Main Station to Lengerich Abzw. Tecklenburg, from there it was a 10 Minutes Walk. We got a lift to Duisborg after 15 minutes, without using a sign.

name: Chris GreenSoul (Hitchwiki)
comment: 2 people, weg got there from the center by foot to find a lift to Köln, were taken quite quickly on the A61 and dropped at another service station before Bonn.
Found a ride for two people in May 2018 from here towards the north on the A3, within 30 minutes

name: LaZubi (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Got the tram from city centre to "Nürnberger Platz" and walked to the Busstop. Within 2 minutes got a rid in the evening by a Czech couple heading directly to Praha.
In the night the place is fully illuminated, so you can hitchhike from that spot at any time without appearing myterious.
you should be lucky to find a car here because it's forbidden to stop here for Germans
easy to find someone to cross the border with

name: Gangrelito (Hitchwiki)
comment: After 45 minutes I found drive to NL (Tuesday afternoon, with sign). Two more hitchhikers on the same spot, they cought drive 5 min before me.

name: (Hitchwiki)
comment: Now I realise its very possible to go to other close spots which might be better

name: Ilovefahrtwind (Hitchwiki)
comment: Going to Göttingen/Hannover, better get off one place before, in Guxhagen.

name: Tawax (Hitchwiki)
comment: Perfect place to get from the A7 to the A38 (Leipzig) since many cars that come from the A44 (west) stops here to tank before going to east (for instance Poland).

name: Soshial (Hitchwiki)
comment: Many Polish cars and plying Polish buses stop here. All of them go through Leipzig in that direction.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Great place for east (A38) as well as north (A7) :)
I waited for about 3 hours to finally get a ride direction Leipzig. Most traffic is going north to Hannover or local. This was at the Aral gas station

name: Fraughtwithsounds (Hitchwiki)
comment:
in summer time you'll find many cars going to F, NL or DK. 

Be aware that gas prices in Germany are much higher than in Austria which means that Austrian cars coming from Salzburg and going to Insbruck are less likely to stop here. Better try truck drivers going to Italy.

name: ESko (Hitchwiki)
comment: two guys hitchhiked here a car to Munich after one hour of waiting. The place is not so bad, many trucks going a longer distance.
Good spot to go toward Munich, the first car stopped for us (boy,girl) was going to Stuttgart, but they were really nice they drop us in the centre of Munich
got dropped here and got a straight lift to stuttgart after half an hour. mostly local traffic though since it's not one of the gas stations comfortably situated right on the highway.
You can wait immediately at the drive-up, there's enough space for you to wait safely and for the driver to stop just behind you. The first person passing gave me a lift.

name: Cha (Hitchwiki)
comment: Or wait at the traffic light - you'll catch people turning from the road onto the A as well as cars leaving the gas station.

For us it didn't look like a good spot but eventually turned out to be a great one. We went in direction West and got a ride to Ulm. We waited behind the roundabout exit to the motorway, there's a little space to stop for the cars. By standing here you have cars within reach both from the gas station and from the road AIC10, which is a good amount. Several local people, they are very kind. Don't need a sign, accept rides even for just 50 km. 2 persons (me and my girlfriend), Saturday, 10 mins.
One hour waiting for a car directly to Prague.

name: Bunt (Hitchwiki)
comment:
I found an elderly couple driving to Velbert which is south of Bochum so they could drop me off at A40 -Bochum Zentrum from where you can walk /take the Subway to Bochum HBF.
Works in the region from Dortmund to Düsseldorf (VRR).
Students can take you on their ticket  on weekends or after 7PM

name: Adamiksen (Hitchwiki)
comment: found a nice driver with a nice Lexus in 2 min:)
I was looking for a ride to Strasbourg, but there were few cars here on a Friday evening.

name: Jmichele44 (Hitchwiki)
comment: got a ride into denmark after 5 mins waiting

Werid place : hunderds of cars where driving off the highway (people coming from work), almost nobody was going towards Holland. After 20 minutes, a guy drove me to Roosteren. 
Might be a good spot in the weekend, as a lot of Germans go shopping in Roermond
yeah...siechenstraße 22a, best tramp(hitchhike)hotspot!!! I love it!
Good spot to go east

name: Dadzios (Hitchwiki)
comment:
We were waiting here in frozing winter and the guy pick us from there to the border of Poland.
Good place because people must waited on the red lights.

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was on the other side of the road, please delete this spot!

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: Sorry about this mistake!

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a lift to Eggenfelden after 30 mins.

name: AdrianB (Hitchwiki)
comment: I wasnt even able to hitchhike because one girl from Berlin stopped immediately and took me to Berlin... nice spot!

as of march 2020 there's construction works going on at this particular spot and so you have to walk a bit further towards the ramp where there's not so much space to pull over.
after having hitched from there twice (both late morning towards noon (10-11:30ish) my experience is that there are not so many cars going towards passau and so i waited both times for about at least 1h.
Took us two minutes to get a ride from here. very good spot, it is directly on the slip road to the highway on the right side there is about a hundred meters sideway to stop.

name: ManuelW (Hitchwiki)
comment: I could hardly find somebody going southern on the A7 and then to A70...

nice spot. possible to ask people on the parking lot. Also all cars from the aiport are passing by and they have the chance to look at you for a longer time and also stop conviniently. Traffic speed is low.

name: Chris1337 (Hitchwiki)
comment: I usually wait 0-15 minutes to find a ride to Munich

name: Cardinal (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Good spot if you want to go to Leipzig.
After 5 minutes of waiting somebody stopped.

name: Cardinal (Hitchwiki)
comment: In 4 hours nobody stopped to take me on the the highway south.

name: Red-jo27 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Headed to Karlsruhe (A8) and got a ride after 15 minutes to Augsburg by a Bulgarian gangster.
Easy if you ask drivers at the well frequentated gas station.
mostly people returning rental cars. some people going to munich city. getting on A9 fro here is rather difficult.
Not at all senseless! We waited for about 30min on a rainy winter day (New Year's Eve 2017) and made it all the way to the Dutch boarder. Very recommendable - cars CAN hold (if they want to).

been droped off here twice already an both ways wrok really well. Got a ride to Hamburg after 15min and to Leer in no time (with 3 people). Don't stand at the petrol station put next to the street/drive on to the high way. Lost of Cars, sow because f the traffic lights. Drive on to Hamburg is a few meters behind that one to Leer! Keep that in mind

name: Cardinal (Hitchwiki)
comment:
The spot is well accessible for hitchhikers and also quite safe for cars to pull over.

We had to wait around 1h though until somebody took us to Hamburg.

Get a lift to zwickau very quick monday morning at 7am.
good Place

name: Junkiee (Hitchwiki)
comment: easy to get to metz.

name: Julei (Hitchwiki)
comment: We (2 girls) waited for 15 minutes before we got a ride to Nürnberg.

name: Rokz (Hitchwiki)
comment: Quickly got a ride, 'cause a lot of the people turning left are driving on the A115!
got a ride to someplace in the middle of the way to Freiburg, however I had to take a train to Gesingen Hausen and walk quiet a bit

I wanted to go to the autobahn direction Geisingen, but I gave up because there is no place for cars to stop and the traffic light is almost never red. I took a train to geisingen and got a ride from there

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: Caught a ride to the first petrol station going north on A5 (Malbach).

name: Talliknalli (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a lift on A5 southward. The spot isn't perfect but ok.

name: Koendev (Hitchwiki)
comment: I guess there's a reason this one wasn't added yes. It's shit. Mostly local traffic or only going to Frankfurt.

name: Fverhart (Hitchwiki)
comment: Mind your words Koen ;)

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: I don't agree with the first guy. I came to this place at 22:00 in the night and no cars were stoping here. I camped near the gas station with my tent and on the next day I got a ride with the very first guy that I asked. Got a ride after Frankfurt direction Köln (Cologne)
i came here by car aswell from the south and got a ride with the third person i asked direction cologne. it was saturday afternoon and the petrol station quite busy

name: Reggae-girl (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was waiting with a sign saying A9 and after 10 minutes somebody, who was going to Eisenach on the A4, stopped .
I have waited there in a saturday morning around one hour. There was not so much car. After that Police came and told me I cant wait on highway. For this reason I leave the spot.
I had to wait for just about 10 minutes to get a ride to Essen. Pretty lucky, I guess. The spot is really nice, as the other comment tells.
Building site till 2021 - avoid this place

name: Chk one (Hitchwiki)
comment: There is a lot of traffic. Anyway I spend a while at this place to get a lift southward bound. But finally I got one. I would recommend this place to start from Leipzig northward bound. To the south it's average.

took me almost an hour to get a ride south, on a thursday morning. so mainly local commuters going for work. there were other hitch hikers standing by the bus stop, they also waited for quite a while. still should be one of the most convenient places to get started!
Do not use this place to go north. Only the ppl coming from L98 can possibly pull over on the parking area.
there's a parking lot just right behind the roundabout. Lot's of traffic going to the A2

name: Soshial (Hitchwiki)
comment: There are very little amount of cars for such a big parking and gas station. Maybe it it because there was a WorldCup match Germany-France in 2014. Very few cars and those that arrived declined request to give a lift.
No way to hitchhike from here. Car traffic is not allowed in this area.
Great spot, just stand on the space between the two lanes. They are big enough for cars to stop and you can try the cars coming from Kulmbach and Bayreuth!
we got there a car to the airport Schoenefeld in 2 minutes
i got there a car to Praha. Good Place
We got a car at the traffic light very quickly
Good in direktion to Rostock or Hamburg
Bad for going south east
bad for hitchhiking to Berlin

name: MrBigCheese (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got picked up in like 15 mins by someone going towards Rosenheim and dropped off at Irschenberg where I found a ride to Salzburg.
Perfect spot to Bonn. Stand right at the exit of the gas station and got a ride in 10 mins. On a Thursday afternoon around 1pm

name: Phidias81 (Hitchwiki)
comment: We were politely kicked out of the gas station after a while

name: Emanuele19956 (Hitchwiki)
comment: I got a ride along the A9 highway to halfway between Berlin and Munich!

name: Emanuele19956 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Went through this gas station again, and it's just super easy to get a ride.

Not the best but nevertheless a good spot to go towards west direction (A2). Me and my friend (two guys) waited here for 1 hour. There is a parking here, you can ask drivers too. The only problem is lack of traffic sometimes.

name: Hitchhannes (Hitchwiki)
comment:
I take this spot at least once a month to get to Bad Segeberg, it always works fast. I used to take the spot at the traffic light but this one gives you three times as much traffic.
(For Berlin you could also use a Bad Segeberg sign and get out at the gas station 3km before the exit to B.S.)

name: Magnetar (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good spot, easy for cars to stop. I got a ride in around 50 minutes, 2 cars stopped and the first one wanted to take me only 10 km, second one took me almost to Berlin. No need for a sign since the direction is obvious!

name: Turemek (Hitchwiki)
comment: To east, but better go to Amberg and from there to Czech Republic

name: Phoeni.x ger (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Asked some swiss folks on the supermarkets parking lot to get a ride to the border to switzerland. About 4 km away.
Got lucky at the second car I asked.

name: Phoeni.x ger (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Stood their right beneath the custums und a roof :D lucky me. It just started raining. After a while some customs guys walked to me and asked me what I'm doing and checked my ID but since I'm from the neighbour town it was no problem. They asked me if I just bought any drugs but then realized this must be too stupid to do so. So no search :D
Well I stood their for quite a while with the allowance of the customs and at some point I was able to ask some guy whom they just controlled which took me to about Stuttgart.
Great to go up north the highway A81 probably also south to Switzerland.

name: Phoeni.x ger (Hitchwiki)
comment: Took a while but finally I found someone transfer a car to northern germany who took my all the way long to Osnabrück. :)

name: Phoeni.x ger (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got there by nightfall. So I tried my luck for a while but finally decided to pitch up my tent at a field near the station. Well rested and showered at the service station I got a ride close to Lübeck. Lots of traffic up north. Look for foreign number plates such as Sweden, Denmark and Norway if you wanna got there.

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: came here from my last stop. Many people going to Bremen, Hamburg and Denmark but almost nobody going to Clopenburg (my final destination, next exit to the left). Finally a guy offered me a ride and to make a detour to take me to Clopemburg.

name: Phoeni.x ger (Hitchwiki)
comment: Quickly got a ride torwards Putgarden which is the ferry port to Denmark. If you stay in the car or ask some people at the ferry port you can spare your money since the fee for the ferry is only per car not person :) Look out for foreing number plates such as Denmark, Sweden or Norway to get good rides.

name: Phoeni.x ger (Hitchwiki)
comment:
I've already been in a car so I didn't have to pay the fee for the ferry. It's per car not person.
In the waiting lanes I changed cars since I wanted to go to Copenhagen. I quickly found another lift straight to CPH.

name: Phoeni.x ger (Hitchwiki)
comment: After one hour trying my luck asking people at the resting area and having a sign made standing at the ramp I finally got a lift to Munich by asking again some ppl at the gas station.

name: Phoeni.x ger (Hitchwiki)
comment: While wandereing arround looking for non local number plates a guy just asked me from behind where I wanted to go. Well he took me all the way to Lindau.

name: Witowitold (Hitchwiki)
comment: God stuck in this place for 2h, to much local traffic.

name: Phoeni.x ger (Hitchwiki)
comment:
It's a bad place if you want to go direction west to highway A81, Konstanz or what so ever.
Well it maybe a good spot if you wanna go south because people leave the high way here to avoid toll in Bregenz. I then got a lift to station and took the train back home since it was my last 100 km :)
Ferry tickets for passengers are always return tickets. Just ask the arriving people on the upper level if they don't need it anymore.
Try nearby petrol station.

name: Nazaryan92 (Hitchwiki)
comment: waited for a while. around three hours. was heading to Kassel- Leipzig, but most of the cars leave autobahn after the station..

name: Dynamo (Hitchwiki)
comment: After 5 minutes I got a lift to Zwickau.

name: Thejourneyramino (Hitchwiki)
comment: Wrong spot, it should be the bus stop jus next to it. On the gas station we didnt have much luck. Not many cars, most of the people just came to have some snack there.

name: Ewelinalucy (Hitchwiki)
comment: Much better than the Horner Kreisel itself. Here the cars still have a way to go before they decide on which lane they should position themselves to go in the right direction. Would use it again definitely.

name: Odolany (Hitchwiki)
comment: (Illegal).

name: Thejourneyramino (Hitchwiki)
comment: You can try your luck on the gas station. We needed to get to Luxembourg and we saw a guy with a Lux. licence plate. Unfortunately he didn't go there but he told us he is going there next day so if we can't manage he can give us a lift. He left us his phone number :)
Two of us (males) waited 5 or 10 minutes on a hot summers day here and were taken half way to Salzburg. We opted to go a little further down the slip road.

Great spot !!!
walk 100m to the West to get both car lines. It’s almost on the highway but you have safe place to wait ant there is space for the cars to stop. Someone brought me to the next real gas station witch is about 25km away, from there i got a ride fo Salzburg in 5min.

Good Spot to hitch to Austria (A93-South-Innsbruck or A8-East-Salzburg) or to A8-West-Munich. If you arrive at Rosenheim main train station you can simply walk around 2 km to this place since there is no good public transport in Rosenheim. Leave the train station at the back entrance heading to Klepperstraße, turn left until you reach McDonalds (last place for a free toilet before you start hiching), turn right, cross the bridge over the river Mangfall, cross the huge junction straight and walk past the parking lot of huge supermarket Real. After the traffic light next to the church there is space for cars to spot. Because there are 3 different directions to go it'll be better you show a sign.

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: Better don't use this place. I waited 3h on Sunday afternoon for a lift just to next service area in Eisenberg, which is just 30 km away. Mostly locals are there and some people going north onto A61. Almost nobody continuing west on A6.
It's a good spot to get a quick ride to Hannover. Just keep pressing the traffic light. Shouldn't take to long. :-)

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a lift directly to Bremerhaven after 20 minutes.

name: Rytis9 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Terrible spot if you want to get on the highway. Either local traffic or truckers who just sleep there. Go to THIS spot instead http://hitchwiki.org/maps/?place=22635. Worked like a charm. You'll need a sign there so on your way there check the dumpsters for some cardboard.

Gut aus Saarbrücken heraus zu erreichen aber wenig Verkehr hält an dieser Tanke (nur noch Tanke, Imbiss ist geschlossen). 
Hatte Glück und hab Leute aus meiner Heimat getroffen nach ca, 45 Minuten Richtung Heidelberg.

Good to reach from Saarbrücken but not many traffic. There ist just a petrol station (no more Bistro).
I had luck and meet people from my home area after round 45 minutes in Direction Heidelberg.

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: I waited 10 mins for a lift up to Hanover.

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: I waited 45 mins for a lift up to Bremen.
Unsuccessful. After ±1-2 hours, we decided to go to Berliner Allee. Much better.
Cars can stop on the grass strip. Waited 10min to get on the A2 direction Berlin.

very easy to reach from bus/tram stop Wasserturm or about 15 minutes walk from Essen central station. There are usually free parking lots and space for the cars to stop in the street. Waited for about half an hour to go east on the A40. Wächtlerstraße on the other side of the big bridge should work fine for going east as well.
*Wächtlerstraße is for going west...

name: Redjo27 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited on a cold Monday at 9.30. Wanted to get to east (sign with A2 -> Hannover). After 30min ride to rest station Rhynern on A2
overall many cars, but few to the A8 direction Karlsruhe

name: Thea for female travellers (Hitchwiki)
comment: the spot is more on the right then it shows up on the map, directly on the B241, busstop Schützenhaus

name: Thea for female travellers (Hitchwiki)
comment: i would wait in front of the toilet cabin as everyone passes buy and germans sometimes need a second thought to take you with them, definately carry a sign, so you get there attention, but don't be invasive ;)

name: Tomtom (Hitchwiki)
comment: Lot's of local traffic here as this gas station is not exactly on the highway. Still, found a ride to Lindau within 20 minutes.

name: Railway (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Juillet 2014, seul, avec un carton CHAM / CZ, l'un des stop les plus rapide de ma vie.

Un semi-remorque tchèque m'a ramassé (c'est vous dire s'il y a de la place pour s'arrêter) alors que je venais à peine d'arriver sur le spot.

Super easy to get to Torfhaus/Braunlage very fast, on the other side it's also easy to get to Braunschweig and sometimes the A2 or further. A7 is more difficult, try to get to Goslar in the direction of Langelsheim for that.
Gute Stelle für Autos zum anhalten, aber dass ich tatsächlich Richtung Freiburg mitgenommen wurde, war wohl mehr Glück. Gewartet habe ich 45 Minuten, es war aber auch ein Sonntagnachmittag.

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited 20 mins for a lift into Bremen

name: Kolodez (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited 3 hours for a lift to the next service area on A27 (Goldbach).

Despite being off the highway and the fact i arrived there around 8pm i was lucky to find a ride to Nürnberg after only 15min (the second person i asked). The plus is that there is a McD there so i guess it attracts a lot of people.

name: Cha (Hitchwiki)
comment: 45 min, but it was dark already.

name: Zweifeln (Hitchwiki)
comment: I started here in the beginning of December around 7pm - so it was already dark. One guy stopped after 20 min but he went just to the next village. A woman stopped after one hour and took me to the "Rasthof" Porta Westfalica.
We have waited 40 minutes with a panel indicating Munich (to get a ride to Stuttgart).

name: Yooks (Hitchwiki)
comment: Not a lot of cars stop here as far as I've experienced, but is still a good option for going North from Basel. If you were planning on catching a ride with a truck, don't hope too much if you are trying this on Sunday or Saturday, they are all unavailable
at 1 am I and my girlfriend after 45 minutes got a lift to Karlsruhe

name: Prochy (Hitchwiki)
comment: traffic lights hithchhiking with no sign - Porsche Carrera GT directly to the airport :)
Holiday day, almost no cars. Although that I was picked up by a taxi driver in 5 minutes for free, who took me to the exit Nurnberg

name: Tishead78 (Hitchwiki)
comment: after 45 min approx a guy stopped : he was going to Potsdam and drop us on gasstation for Leipzig.

name: Tishead78 (Hitchwiki)
comment: a couple was doing an half-turn there so it was easy to stop, and they took me to Leipzig west, wich saved me 10km walk !!

name: Cha (Hitchwiki)
comment: Worked for me, but I wouldn't recommend it, at least not at night.
was quite alright on a rainy Sunday afternoon. Got stuck at the ferry anyway

name: Milan (Hitchwiki)
comment: Hitchhiking south (A3) seems to be slightly more easy then going north (A3, direct switch to A1).

name: Bohua (Hitchwiki)
comment: We were going to Eisenach to catch the main highway to Frankfurt. It was very easy, cause it was snowing and people fell pitty of us. hahaha. five minutes and got a ride. be careful of where they drop u off at Eisenach if you continue your trip, cause we got a shitty spot to keep on. Good luck.

name: Yooks (Hitchwiki)
comment: Used this spot to get to Dresden on a November's Monday afternoon. Waited for almost three hours before a cool music loving couple that was heading to see an indie concert in Dresden picked us up. This spot is not the best spot as it's not so easy (although not impossible) for cars to pull over. It's easily reachable by tram number 7, direction Sommerfeld

name: Jophro (Hitchwiki)
comment: Wouldn't bother with this one if going to Dresden.  It's awkward and dangerous. Walk a bit further to the on ramp and increase your chances and decrease driver stress :)

name: Thumb-up (Hitchwiki)
comment: Hitchhike from here with a bike. First caravan i asked took me. Lot of traffic here, so chances are good to find big vehicles.

name: TheKylling (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was lucky and got a ride directly to Amsterdam (sign to Bremen) after 30 min.

name: RazorSK (Hitchwiki)
comment:
2 guys, Saturday at 20 o'clock, to Dresden

we tried it from different side of the bridge in front of Aldi supermarket, hitchhiked for 2 hours and didn't catch a ride, we had to sleep in place nearby in tent, we continued here in Sunday morning at 8 o'clock, after hour and half we moved to advised side of bridge and waited on traffic lights, there were less cars and we managed to catch a ride in 30 minutes directly to Prague (we had Dresden A13 sign), but I thing it was luck and we would wait there for long time. It can be helpful to hitchhike to first gas station, but you would be probably able to speak German to quick agreement with driver.
towards Landsberg am Lech/ A96 Lindau-Munich

me and my friend waited more than one hour but no one stoped for us so we went to Gostritz and we putted our tentes to spend the night then in the morning we went to AM NOTHNITZGRUND 
HOW TO REACH THIS PLACE : from gostritz you can walk direction to Rosentitz and when you cross the highway there is a door who goes inside the A17 the door it's always open. Sometimes you can find Police in that station but don't worry they are not going to say anything even if you talk with the drivers. Good Luck
after 15 minutes i got a lift to Friedland (near Göttingen).

Good Place to go west!
A8 (Stuttgart) and A96 (Lindau)
going south to the A95
at the bus station going East A8 to Vienna.

Place near the Fuelstation, Cars have enough place to stop. Most People going to Albersloh. I tried to get on the A2 near Beckum to go east. It took me about one hour to get a lift in this direction.
To hitchhike from Münster it is better to take the bus to Roxel and than walk to the service station there.

Not a really good spot because you have to leave the highway. Drivers there where locals, still someone took me to Dresden. (It was late in the Night) 
But it is possible :)

name: Grinsolt (Hitchwiki)
comment: Didn't like this one, too narrow, to rushy, but wtf, I got a lift in like 15 Minutes. Wouldn't recommend it though.

this spot is in the wrong place, it was meant for the highway entrance to Nürnberg. People can stop here, because they have to drive slowly because of the bend. On a rainy day it took 30 min before a mother, who felt sorry for me, decided to bring me to the next Raststätte.

Perfect spot to get to Uelzen!
Hamburg and Soltau (A7) also possible but I never tried it.
Sign is useful so people know which of the direction after the roundabout.

Bus stop.
Very good to get fourther on the B4 direction to Uelzen.
Cars going relativly slow and have a lot of space to stop.

Easy to get to Lüneburg or at least Melbek.

15 min

Bust stop 
line 2104 Ketzendorf

Probably a good spot to get into Hamburg or Harburg to get on the AUTOBAHN. Cars don't go to fast and the can stop at the Bus Stop.

Good to get towards 
Buxtehude/Stade/Cuxhaven

Cars passing by relativly slow, and always truckers on the parking lot.

Worth a try to get on the A7.

Könnte geeignet sein um auf die A7 zu kommen.

Good to get out towards Buxtehude/Stade

Good to get tropped of from A7. Trainstaition is not too far, although you're still really on the outskirts of the city.
Hitchhiked from here to Stuttgart-Möhringen. Easy going.
Perfect spot to get to Garmisch-Partenkirchen.

Autohof nearby the Autobahn A7.
There's a gas station and a Burger King, so there are a lot of locals, but asking works good to get onto the Autobahn e.g. the next service area at least.
Good, if you want to go up north, Hamburg for example. Going south to Hannover you should go to "Autohof Soltau-Süd"
A rather big petrol station. Some cars are going to Aachen or anywhere else. Just read the license plates and ask drivers heading to your direction.
the only place to hitchhike in here seems to be the petrol station, as the other spots look quite dangerous

name: Shaun 04 (Hitchwiki)
comment:
With a sign to Munich, I got a ride after 20 minutes. 
Driver didn't care about stopping on slip road/cars approaching behind him, so spot seems ok.

name: Makusq (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waiting with "Dresden" on paper, but we catch a car going to town Cottbus on the half of the way.

name: Micho (Hitchwiki)
comment: "Dresden" card and one guy which was going to Budapest stopped ;). Best of that 3 spots here, becouse people stay on red light at 'L752 and B 96a' crossing and can see u from there + very safely place.

name: Wurzelkoch (Hitchwiki)
comment: Nice and comfortable spot, but few people stop. Still the best spot I tried at Hansastraße. I will try others, though.

summary: only gas station on almost highway B6 between A14 (Halle/Magdeburg) and A395 (Braunschweig), possibility to switch direction or to enter/exit the highway (but low and regional traffic).
Einzige Tankstelle direkt an der B6n zwischen A14 Dreieck Bernburg und A395 Dreieck Vienenburg, Möglichkeiten: Richtungswechsel Ost–West; Einstieg Ost A14 (Halle/Magdeburg), West (A395 Braunschweig) oder Ausstieg Quedlinburg → Harz.
Viel Regionalverkehr, aber auch überregionaler, in der Ferienzeit auch international, Wartezeiten liegen zwischen 30 - 45 Minuten.
To get to Soltau or A7, coming from Lüneburg

name: Trust (Hitchwiki)
comment:
This is NOT a good spot to hitchhike towards Dortmund via the A2.

Many people are driving towards Paderborn or take the 61 to Gütersloh.

I was lucky that after two hours a kind man going towards Gütersloh took a detour for me on the A2 to bring me to the first petrol station there.
great spot, found a ride to vienna within less than 10 minutes
Hot spot! Waited 2 min. and got a lift to Nürnberg. Several tags & stickers show you that you're not the first.

name: Arno Nuem (Hitchwiki)
comment: Best spot to go north out of München! I'm often standing here and my average waiting time is around 0-5 min!
Perfect spot to A9 north. Beware of the people going to the airport or Augsburg, then you will end up on a different Autobahn.

name: Cardinal (Hitchwiki)
comment:
Great spot! 
It is easily accessible and safe t stop for drivers.
I caugt a ride ater 7 minutes waiting.

name: MilanCes (Hitchwiki)
comment: Its nice city, I recommend take a rest here, small so 1 hrs. should be ok to see all of stuff here.

name: Windsohn (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was very lucky and picked a five hours trip to the other end of Germany within 15minutes.

name: Seminko (Hitchwiki)
comment:
me + Nicol

from Malaga,ES to Prague,CZ

15-16:40 12.8.2015

We got here on a way from Metz dir. Nürnberg.
Petrol station with a big parking for trucks, McDonald with parking for cars. A shop is nearby. All the complex is vast.
Not a best place, as there is a lot of locals and the station itself is a bit far away /2 roundabouts) from A6 highway.
A lot of locals and trucks going to Strasbourg (surprisingly).

In one hour a german driver Herbert agreed to take us to Nürnberg. He couldn t speak other language, so I had to practise german (good!). When he was having a shower, we talked, ate and drunk with Hamid, a Persian driver (with very few english he knew and few Turkish words I remember). It was a wonderful communication. He wanted to marry Nicol, but than we went away to Herbert's car.

name: Grgrrp (Hitchwiki)
comment: Waited here for 10 minutes around lunchtime on a Thursday to get to Hannover. Good spot.
Stood next to the road with the sign and no one stopped. After one hour got a lift to the highway by asking at the gas station.

name: Dan Vertígo (Hitchwiki)
comment: Gas station, waited 1 hour, asking people direction Munich. Many people told me they were going south, but after 1 hour I got ride direct to Munich. If you want to hitch-hike, there´s only a little bad place to stand, it´s better to ask cars on gas station I think.

name: Myryy (Hitchwiki)
comment: way better than B2, dont go there

name: Myryy (Hitchwiki)
comment: disadvantage is that u also catch the cars going inside the city with A114

name: Dynamo (Hitchwiki)
comment: The second driver took me to the Raststation Altenburger Land.
Not so nice to wait here in winter.
If going to Munich this is a perfect spot as all cars going there are driving this street. Waited less than 5 minutes and had 3 cars who would've taken me (2 went to the wrong place)
I tried to get over Munich in direction Nurnnberg, but it seems quite impossible. Approximately every 5 minutes stopped a car going to Munich, so in the end i went only to Munich.

Good spot if you want to go to the A9 (Nürnberg), as most people from the southern part of Munich use this road. Within 5 minutes, 2 people stopped and offered a ride.

Make shure you have a sign. The first gas station on A9 is "Fürholzen (Ost)", so make shure the driver is really going that direction. People going to the airport will leave A9 one exit before.

Ask people at McDonnalds. It´s a common meeting point for sharing rides (e.g. Blablacar etc). I was waiting 5 min to get a ride to the first service station on the motorway to Chemnitz and 10 min for a ride to Leipzig/Kassel
Good place and in walking distance from the center. There is a building on the right, so cars can turn right to stop and pick you up. Good time is in the morning or after work (around 5 pm)

name: Micho (Hitchwiki)
comment: Very quiet and safely place, we get a car to Imst (Austria) but it was going via Munich too.

Good --> Augsburg
Bad   --> Schongau
Not much traffic but got a lift to Schongau after a few minutes.

name: Emanuele19956 (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was here again in late July 2016. EXTREMELY busy all day and night long, but everyone is going on vacation, so most cars are simply fully packed. I had to wait 7 hours to get a ride to Italy!
Found a ride to Kufstein after less than 5 minutes of searching.
Good to go to Itzehoe or Schleswig. There is a Busstation so drivers can easily stop.

name: Laurad84 (Hitchwiki)
comment: I hitched towards west from here. There is a big wall around the whole place, so you better go the mc donalds and just behind it the wall ends so you can walk around  it easily. We spoke to the first woman that came for a pee  and she said yes.

name: Mrw.witteveen (Hitchwiki)
comment: Good place to hitch! We used it for getting to Dresden. Didn't get a direct lift but it brought us further.

name: Dynamo (Hitchwiki)
comment: I started twice from this place. Took me both times 10 minutes for a direct ride to Dresden.

name: Dynamo (Hitchwiki)
comment: With the sign "Dresden" I waited 5 minutes for a ride to the parking area Neukirchener Wald. From Zwickau to Berlin I traveled 4 hours.
soem parking cars but almost everybody takes you to berlin
(for direction Berlin, from the other side: super easy to find a lift, doesn't take more than 30min usually for a ride straight to Berlin)
Waited 30 minutes in the rain with signs Belgium, A3 Nord and just my thumb, but no one stopped. Buses stop there frequently, so you better stand on the grass.

Technically my favorite spot for leaving town, however I once had no luck at all getting a ride towards Gera A4. The spot is awesome for Stollberg, ok for Leipzig and Hof (A72) but when I was there nobody was going west on the A4. 

I eventually left and found someone to drop me at the Rest stop a few km further towards Dresden. It was the same problem there, but eventually I found someone.

name: Lukas (Hitchwiki)
comment: The were some kids driving around on their bikes looking at my like they had never seen a Hitchhiker before. (Erzgebirge -.-) but just before I left they came by and gave me some rolls "for the journey" that was really sweet. :)
Super Spot in the direction to Annaberg or further.

Great spot to find a ride to south or Annaberg Buchholz.
Take the tram C11 to "Chemnitz-Harthau" (2.20 € from "Chemnitz Zentralhaltestelle") than walk 100m to the street "Annaberger Straße", turn left and walk 200/250m you see the Bus Stop on the left side call "Alte Harth"
got a lift to Memmingen after 10 min
Can confirm that many people seem alienated by hitchhikers there, still better than Goldene Bremm

name: Brunolimaam (Hitchwiki)
comment: got a ride from here almost till osnerbrueck but not the best place
Stood here with a sign A5 Frankfurt at 7.15, away in 5 minutes!
Stood here monday at 9.50 got away in 15 minutes to gasstation Hockenheim with sign Mannheim

name: Hitchhannes (Hitchwiki)
comment: I use this spot at least once a month to go to Kiel, it always works fast.
Tramprennen 2015 <3 <3
Great indeed! Just as described, 2nd pole before the motorway sign, and there's decent place on the lawn for cars to pull over.

name: Thumb-up (Hitchwiki)
comment: There was a big car accident that lead to a full blocking of the A1 between Hamburg and Bremen. No cars were coming through. That is why it took 2 hours 40 minutes that day. Basically a good spot.

name: Thumb-up (Hitchwiki)
comment: Big sign or thumb. Small signs lead to irritation, because deivers do not have much time to read.

name: Laurad84 (Hitchwiki)
comment: Maybe we were extremely lucky but the second person we asked was heading all the way to Hannover.
cars going slow, space to pull over, got a lift to Heerlen, Netherlands pretty quick
You can go there by public bus which is going to Bissingheim from Hagen mein train station. From there it is a 10 Min. walk.

A lot of People in the direction Nürnberg or Erfurt and it is also possible to get a hitch on the A38 to Kassel. 

I used this spot a lot of times and usual waiting time is 30 minutes. 
Normally I use a sign with 'A9'.

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was alone on a cloudy friday in march. 3 cars stopped in 30 min, but just the last one was going direction bodensee. He left me near Stockach

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment:
A very simpathic woman took me to Überlingen (Bondensee). She said that her daughter does hitchhiking in South America and she thought that she should help me =D
I was alone on a friday at 14:00, trying to go to Lindau

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: I stayed just at the entrance of the parking place with the thumbs up. A car full of drunken germans picked me up to Lindau. They were singing and having a lot of fun! I got food, beer and a ride with them!

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was left 1 km before this place and I was walking alongside the road until I found this place. It was starting to get cold and dark and I didn't have a camping tend. After 30 min a girl picked me up to a small city more ahead and I took a train to my final destination. Remember: always bring a camping tend and sleeping bag with you.
I stood here during dusk with a sign Dortmund. After 10 minutes, some people picked me up.
To get out of the Ruhr Area, you can use your thumb and ask a ride to the gas station at the A2 in Gelsenkirchen.

name: Michaeln (Hitchwiki)
comment: Mostly local traffic, if possible you should rather get out at a gas station directly on the highway
Good place to Freiburg im Breisgau. 10 minutes waiting with "FR" sign.
There is a little cutout just before the roundabout. Ist short, but the cars are slow. Waitet here for 15 minutes with a sign for Göttingen.
Good place to hitchhike towards the Autobahn (A5)
got a car after 5 minutes to Frankfurt. But maybe it was just luck.
waited 15-20 minutes on a sunday midday going direction belgium/aachen

name: Ewelinalucy (Hitchwiki)
comment: Two or three drivers stopped for us here offering rides to Berlin while our destination was Poland. It took around 1 hour and we were approached by a driver who offered a ride straight to Słubice, the border.

name: Kovacspetyesz (Hitchwiki)
comment: All cars are going to Berlin, if you have luck like me you can get lifts further. (I got it to Leipzig)

Many Cars. most of them going to Berlin, Some going to wards Frankfurt(Oder), Dreseden or South towards Leipzig. Took me about 30 min to find someone going to Leipzig but it might take some more patience.
ok
A lot of peaple are going to Würzburg, so it's a good spot for a long-distance journey. Waiting time around 15 min, if you want to go to Coburg (A73) it's less

name: TheKylling (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride towards Giessen in under 10 min, and got dropped of at the Wetterau gasstation (A5 northbound).

Beautiful scenery and a good spot  just on the corner. All exiting cars from petrol station, shops, hotel and restaurant leave this way so everyone can see you. Good for hitchhiking in direction south. two people going towards zurich on a public holiday, rainy and cold but got a ride till the suburbs of zurich in half an hour.

name: Reggae-girl (Hitchwiki)
comment: I think it is a quite good spot because there is a bus stop which gives the cars the possibility to stop.

name: Jirkosak (Hitchwiki)
comment: we wait about 30 minutes because there are not much car but good visibility and place to stop

name: Reggae-girl (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was going to Kiel on a sunday afternoon and I waited about 20-30 minutes.

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: The Autobahn was blocked (under construction) and I tried my luck just here with my girlfriend. The very first car stopped for us and took us to Karslhuhe (I don't know how to write the name of the city). It was 17:00 during the summer

Good and crowded place, there are many options: stay by the road, ask drivers... It convenient to hitch-hike from here towards west and south directions. Also you can meet here a lot of other hitch-hikers in summer. The best option is to come here in the morning.

sept. 2019. 15 minutes waiting. Ride to the border with Poland.
@soymartanegro

name: Gustavobretz (Hitchwiki)
comment: Got a ride to Stuttgart while I was thumbing up in the exit. So many people here that it was easier to thumb up instead of asking. People were offering me a ride every 3 minutes but they were going mostly to or direction Freiburg
Good spot if you are going towards Freiburg/Basel
Got a ride towards Brunswick within 15 minutes.
super Spot, i had a ride until Plauen
Possible to get a ride to the Rest Area "Vogtland Nord"

My favourite Spot Place!
Its easy to get a ride to Plauen.
With a bit of luck you get a ride to the Rest Area Vogtland Nord.
IIt's easy to get a ride from here to Plauen. With a bit of luck further to rest area Vogtland Nord or Hof.

name: Samsi (Hitchwiki)
comment: We were two girls on a Sunday around 3pm heading to Darmstadt. We got a ride very fast to Dreieich where we could continue easily

name: Samsi (Hitchwiki)
comment: We were two girls on a Sunday around 3pm heading to Darmstadt. We got a ride pretty fast by someone actually driving to Langen but then he decided to drive us to Darmstadt first.
Good Spot Point,you have a good chance to get to the A72

Actually it seems to be a good spot. Many cars are passing, mainly coming from the parking spaces and going to the Highways. But I waited there 1 1/2 hours and nobody stopped. Finally I went to the gas station near the "briefzentrum" busstop by bus 365 and got a lift after 10min...
Not much traffic on a Saturday evening, waited for over an hour without getting a lift...

name: Kovacspetyesz (Hitchwiki)
comment: Okay, i had luck with my 10 min waiting time, but i think this place could be empty if you are standing here not on the good day.

name: Thumb-up (Hitchwiki)
comment: Getting to Kassel is super easy. If you want to get south, ask to get dropped at a small parking along the highway, because there is no more service area before Kassel. And freaking everybody is going to Kassel

name: Thumb-up (Hitchwiki)
comment: I was lucky and one of the cars that was on the parking could give me a ride on the A4 directly

Not a good lift point!
I waite 45min until i had ride.
Possible to get a ride to the A72.

On a saturday morning there wasn`t much traffic but still more then!
Had a ride to the A72
Senseless. Not easily accessible and no emergencylane: The cars can't stop to pick you up.
Still a good place in 2017 after the A95 was connected to „mittlerer Ring“ / B2R. We got to Garmisch-Partenkirchen easily.
Depending on the time of the day, you might find lots or few going in your direction. Weekday early afternoon seems to be a bad day for going to Berlin. Rather try from Greifswald.

name: Cardinal (Hitchwiki)
comment:
I waited around 10 minutes infront of the roudbout until somebody stopped and took me to the first gasstation on the way to Munich.

There´s lots of space and many cars were entering the highway.

---

In case you get dropped off here in the evening: There are some meadows behind the Bayern Muenchen fanshop where you can pitch a tent quite easily.

Great Sport Point! I got a ride to Piding (A8).
Try it!
Not many cars here (1 car per minute), but we were successful with "N" sign in 10 minutes.
We just asked - and our first try (Czech guy - we are also Czechs) was successful.
Many people use this road in the morning. Better than Brennerstraße. Waiting time: 5-10 minutes with "PF" sign.
Südrandstraße is much better.
Not many cars here, mostly trucks - just ask. Waiting time: first car, which stopped (10 minutes).
Cars can not stop here well (but one stopped after 5 minutes). Dögginger Straße (1km apart) is probably better, but by the time we were there, it was closed.
First night was unsuccessful, in the morning, there were many police cars (Polizeipräsidium Freiburg is nearby), but nobody had a problem with us. After 10 minutes, some car stopped us.
you can easily get there by tram No. 3 (Bissierstraße).

This stop is great if you want to go to A72!
Cars can stop on the long parking zones
I like this place!

name: C.majalis (Hitchwiki)
comment:
I stood here in the afternoon with a sign Frankfurt. After 45 minutes, some people picked me up.
This place is near to the fair (Messe Gruga).

name: C.majalis (Hitchwiki)
comment: I stood here in the afternoon with a sign Frankfurt. After 15 minutes, some people picked me up.
nice spot. waited 10 min for a ride directly to vienna.
great spot, found a ride within 10 minutes to vienna!

seems ideal, but I waited here cca 30 minutes. I was standing at the end of the gas station. if you want to get there from passau, you can go by bus number 10 to the stop "hochlandweg" and than go up on small road under the highway bridge. it takes like ten minutes of walk to get to the gas station

Good spot for going towards Chemnitz.
This Bus Stop is perfect and long to stop.

Nowadays there is a big construction work around the traffic lights, but it is still possible to stand at the last traffic light before the right-turn to the ramp. 
Waited here 15 min to cath a ride to Berlin.

name: Bob
comment: Nice spot to get to Kniebis!

Good amount of traffic, not only locals but many liscence plates with N, M, Reg, Braunau, Vienna. 
Wonderful spot, bus station and an entrance to a parking lot. Cars can see you from far and the traffic lights slow traffic down.
Saturday, 12:00, 2 People + Dog

name: Jurichezzbmx
comment: Terrible. Many delivery drivers that leave their warehouse. I was going direction reseinburg

name: Jurichezzbmx
comment: Arrived at the harbour, asked the staff on where I could hitchhike, a guy told me to go at the "toll", there I asked the cashier, he let me hitchhike. Very few cars so I went to ask people directly, got a ride in the 1st ferry straight to the next ferry in Denmark to Sweden!

name: Jurichezzbmx
comment: I didn't want tk take the public transport because I was only going to the harbor. I walked and hitchhiked and a guy took me and was kind enough to drive me to the harbour even though he wasn't going there.

name: Knytte
comment: Quite a common blablacar pickup spot in Dresden. we also managed to join a blabla group to Giessen

name: peter
comment: good

name: mikser572
comment: We were trying to get a ride to Poznań, got someone to drop us off at Wrocław. Just came up to some polish car (they didn’t speak english tho)
Took this spot sometimes to hitchhike to Berlin and one time to the South, worked always great. There's a bus stop where people can stop

name: Banane1312
comment: We found someone really fast! Maybe it was luck. He also had to go to Frankfurt. He dropped as at our home! There is quite some people because it is one of a few petrol stations in this area. But it is Highway 4 where many people go so good chances

name: Xvlu
comment:
I walked to the "toll" and tried to speak to people there. After one try the cashier send me away saying I was not allowed to hitch in the harbour area. I tried with thumbs further up the road then, but didn't get a lift. Bought a ticket for 13€ then. Check-in closes 30min before departure.
Maybe you could try to bypass the toll and speak to people when they are waiting in front of the ferry. But I didn't try that.

name: Xvlu
comment:
I walked to the "toll" and tried to speak to people there. After one try the cashier send me away saying I was not allowed to hitch in the harbour area. I tried with thumbs further up the road then, but didn't get a lift. Bought a ticket for 13€ then. Check-in closes 30min before departure.
Maybe you could try to bypass the toll and speak to people when they are waiting in front of the ferry. But I didn't try that.

comment:

name: Anonymous
comment: Direction Singen/Stuttgart or Freiburg.... there is some space where cars can stop. Even if they often are very fast you'll never have to wait more than half an hour!

name: Anonymous
comment: Ganz gut um nach Aschaffenburg und zur A3 zu kommen (Dieburg->Babenhausen->Vor Aschaffenburg bei dem zubringer Ã¼ber Selingenstadt absetzen lassen)

name: Anonymous
comment:
agip-tankstelle.
stand bisher immer direkt an der straÃŸe direkt hinter der tankstelle - gute haltemÃ¶glichkeit. wenn man zu zweit ist, macht es auch sinn, wenn einer die paar autos, die an der tanke halten abklappert. auf der straÃŸe fahren ca. 80% aller leute lang, die auf die autobahn mÃ¼ssen. die auffahrt selbst ist nicht empfehlenswert, kreisel dann schnellstraÃŸen-zubringer. wartezeit von geschÃ¤tzten 30 mal variiert zwischen 5 und 90 Minuten.

name: Anonymous
comment: good spot to the highway!

name: Anonymous
comment:
Bus Stop just after a red light, easy for the cars to stop.
East to Bayreuth, West to Wurzburg.

name: Anonymous
comment: I only waited 5 seconds for a lift dierctly to Vienna. There are wonderful traffic lights and with a nice board with your destination in your hand and a smile on your face its not difficult to get a good lift.

name: Anonymous
comment: A lot of people here were heading off to Augsburg not to Munich or Salzburg. When I asked an old man who was alone watching a map there I found a ride to Munich - unfortunately he just drove me to Allianz-Arena, which was not the perfect place to go on hitchhiking.

name: Anonymous
comment: For getting into Magdeburg if your driver goes along the A14 past the city. It is a high speed national road (Bundestraße), but there are traffic lights and with the right timing you can ask drivers to pick you up.

name: Anonymous
comment: Going into Magdeburg. Drivers going past can drop you here. There is a tram line running and a gas station a few hundred meters down the street where you can try to get a lift to the center.

name: Anonymous
comment: I (female) was standing there for two hours in a cold snowy winterafternoon and gave up, after my feet got nearly frozen. a really bad place if you wanna got onto A8. wihtin two hours only one guy wanted to pick me up, but unfortunately he was getting in the city, he also told me, that the A8 isnt used much on this entrance.

name: Anonymous
comment: Best place to hitch out of Pforzheim direction Calw. just in front of the bridge there is enough space for cars to stop. Works extremely well in the afternoon.

name: Anonymous
comment: There are 2 gas stations on the street towards A 96 (many also go from A 96 to A8 direction Stuttgart)... got a ride in 5 min.

name: Anonymous
comment: Really good HHspot. Found a ride to Belgium in only 5 minutes!

name: Anonymous
comment:
Either stay here where people turn right from the EschholzstraÃŸe, or you go to the middle of the bridge, there is a traffic light to turn left.
Possibilities to come to highway A5 in direction north and south

name: Anonymous
comment:
Direction A7, A70, A71 (North, East)
A small spot, enough for a car to stop.

name: Anonymous
comment: Took me 10 minutes to get jump to direction A4. There is a Bus station where somebody could stop

name: Anonymous
comment: Stood here 6.40h in the morning - no chance to get a ride direction Praha. just 2 cars not further then the border. later i also asked the trucks, also not easy. after 2.50h!!! i got damn truck to Praha.

name: Anonymous
comment:
To get a ride further an the A3, its perfect. 
But its just impossible to get a ride to the A9, north

name: Anonymous
comment: Good spot for going north!

name: Anonymous
comment: Good spot to catch traffic to the south, but its not a good idea to stop here for finding someone to drive to the netherlands :D

name: Anonymous
comment:
gut um nach mÃ¼nchen-city via A8 zu kommen. einfach daumen raushalten. altenativ menschen an der tankstelle anquatschen.

good to get to munich-city via A8. just spread yout thumb or ask people at the petrolstation.

name: Anonymous
comment: Anbindung quer durch das Ruhrgebiet Richtung Venlo/ vereinzelt auch EnglÃ¤nder und NiederlÃ¤nder

name: Anonymous
comment:
Not a perfect place, but it works. 

Direction: South (NÃ¼rnberg/MÃ¼nchen/...) South/West (WÃ¼rzburg/Frankfurt)

Wait a little bit ahead of the traffic lights. Behind it there is a little street to pick you up.

You can go there by bus (Line 5). Direction: Gereuth, Bus Station: MohnstraÃŸe.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good place to get to direction Aschaffenburg, just at the pedestrian traffic lights.

name: Anonymous

name: Anonymous

Sliproad to the motorway. Average waiting time maybe 2 hours. Once we (3 people) waited here for 7-8 hours, then gave up. Little space for cars to stop - much better spots elsewhere.
http://www.hitchwiki.org/KÃ¶ln

name: Anonymous
comment:
Great for Mayen, Trier, Luxemburg (A48).
A lot of traffic to Mayen, but not place for standing and cars can hardly stop. Very good place to ask at the traffic lights though.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bus stop. Well-known hitchhiking spot, good for all directions out of Frankfurt. Get here with StraÃŸenbahn line 16 or 17, or U-Bahn line U4. Stop is 'Festhalle/Messe' (50m away on the other side of the roundabout). You often find other hitchhikers here, especially in the morning. Waiting time 30-60 minutes. For more info, see http://www.hitchwiki.org/Frankfurt_am_Main

name: Anonymous
comment: Probably to Berlin this place works, but I was trying to go to Hannover (south) and had no luck.

name: Anonymous
comment: "Biegener Hellen" south. to Poland - ok. I'll give you 10 euro if you find somebody, from here to Frankfurt.

name: Anonymous
comment: Kinda good place, got a car in 2 minutes, but driver said that previous hitchhiker he took were waiting there for 2 hours.

name: Anonymous
comment: Autorasthof Tennenlohe with gasstation. But you need to talk to people.

name: Anonymous
comment:

name: Anonymous

name: Anonymous

name: Anonymous

name: Anonymous

name: Anonymous

name: Anonymous

name: Anonymous

name: Anonymous

in to the south (A5)

name: Anonymous
comment: The parking spaces on both sides of the Autobahn are great for short rides towards Stuttgart or MÃ¼nchen.

name: Anonymous
comment: A good spot to get out of KÃ¼hlungsborn towards the highway. A sign with "A20" might be helpful. Maybe a stopover in KrÃ¶plin is needed.

name: Anonymous
comment: This is a perfect place for any direction, because there is a tunnel underneath the freeway. So you can switch from one side to the either. It's easy to find cars going north (Bayreuth, Leipzig, Berlin), west (WÃ¼rzburg, Frankfurt) or south (MÃ¼nchen). You won't have trouble finding someone going in either of these directions...

name: Anonymous
comment: At this gas station you can try to find someone going South on the A9 towards MÃ¼nchen. But it can take some time...

name: Anonymous

direction Rostock

excellent spot to go at Berlin

name: Anonymous

comment:
A9 to BERLIN!!!not to MÃ¼nchen!
better if you have someone, who can bring you there by car. otherwise you need to take the train to NÃ¼rnberg-Fischbach(every 20min. from N.Mainstation) and take a walk there (20min. side of the road). stand (with sign) right afer bridge. --> in the curve is plenty of room to park! 4/5 when you need to walk there, otherwise 5/5

name: Anonymous
comment: Perfect place direction to Ulm, Munchen even north. Many cars and truck drivers stops in this big petrol station.

name: Anonymous
comment: A big gas station. It easy to find car which goes direction to Hamburg. I was waiting here just 2min.

name: Anonymous
comment: There is a gas station, Mcdonald, and some other buildings. You can stop the cars in the end of exit (do not afraid stop cars in oposite side), or ask the people in gas station or Mcdonalds restaurant.

name: Anonymous
comment: There is a little chance to go out of this city. The is enough place to stop the car, but not many cars go there. Direction to Oldenburg.

name: Anonymous
comment: Ask the persons directly at the traffic light to get off in direction of Stuttgart/Karlsruhe. They may give you a lift until the gas station at "roadhouse" Denkendorf. Good luck and smile :)

name: Anonymous

name: Anonymous
comment: Direction to Netherlands.Perfect place stop cars in this bus stop.

name: Anonymous
comment: There's a bus stop. Useless, nobody stopped in 3 hours!

name: Anonymous
comment: There is a traffic light and a lot of traffic towards the motorway. So you can easily ask. Perfect to get on the A29 in direction of north or south (First roadhouse is Huntetal) and as well you will find people going to Bremen.

name: Anonymous
comment: not a good place for cars to stop, but people will do!

name: Anonymous
comment: there is a petrol station and it is near a huge parking garage (if you arrived with the plane, people from your plane will notice you and pick you up)

name: Anonymous
comment: Also good if you're going to Poland.

name: Anonymous
comment: The other place mentioned (300m NE) is useless, roads were heavily changed. Try it here at the Shell gas station to get a hitch to the A5. If people go north and you want to go south, nevertheless grap the ride and get out at the next gas station on the autobahn (Renchtal). There you can go over a bridge to the opposite station and get a ride there. at least thats what we did.

name: Anonymous
comment: direct at the roundabout, after 5-10min got a lift on b30

name: Anonymous

name: Anonymous
comment:
This place can range from being a good spot to being a really bad spot, depending on which direction you want to go. Direction South, like France and Cologne is usually no Problem, once I waited only 5 min. to get a ride to Paris. Then again going direction north (I was going to Poland), it took me like an hour to get somebody to take me to a service station on the A2, only 60 km far.
Good luck!

name: Anonymous
comment: The exit from the parking lot, we had  a ride in 3 minutes to koln a3

name: Anonymous
comment: It is not that easy to get there, but it is worth it. Ask at the traffic light and you will definitely get a ride to the next gas station at "Denkendorf".

name: Anonymous
comment: You have to walk quite a while to get here, but the cars have the option to stop and all the traffic to the north goes by

name: Anonymous
comment:
Wait at this roundabout for a ride in the direction of Frankfurt.

name: Anonymous
comment:
The exit of this roundabout is a good place for rides towards Trier and Luxembourg, but there is very little traffic. You will get a ride - but it may not take you a long distance. You should probably get in anyway.
http://hitchwiki.org/en/Hahn_Airport

name: Anonymous
comment: VERY good, very fast spot for getting a direct ride to Traben-Trarbach.

name: Anonymous
comment:
The airport itself is not a fantastic place to get a ride - walk 15 or 20 minutes out along the main road (heading south) and try at the B50 junction.
Alternately, when you are on your plane, ask other passengers for a ride...
http://hitchwiki.org/en/Hahn_Airport

name: Anonymous
comment: As in many remote areas like this, you will look like an innocent long-distance walker. Very easy to stop a car, especially in winter.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Fast food area. Got a ride towards Frankfurt within one minute, but there was a thunderstorm so I had empathy on my side.

name: Anonymous
comment:
A quiet autobahn service station, but you will get a ride south eventually.

name: Anonymous

name: Anonymous
comment: Amazing place for finding rides to pretty much any place in Switzerland.

name: Anonymous

name: Anonymous
comment: Decent spot to get onto the A1 northbound, Lichtendorf for example

name: Anonymous
comment: Amazing spot to get north towards Hamburg. Even though it was dark, I was gone in less than five minutes. Advice: Don't get stuck in Stillhorn (last service station before Hamburg) after dark. It's dead.

name: Anonymous
comment: RaststÃ¤tte Samerberg - perfect for getting a quick ride down towards Salzburg.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very bad if you want to go towards Bremen, probably quite good if you want to go up North. If you want to go to Bremen, instead walk towards the Eisinghausener Strasse (south, see map), walk along it with your thumb up, and catch a ride to the autobahn on ramp on the west of Lehr.

name: Anonymous
comment: We got a ride (direction Oldenburg) here  very quickly (5 minutes or so), but since it's a bit dangerous place to stop for drivers, and most drivers don't go directly to Bremen, be prepared to be dropped of at a bad point (we got stuck at a rastplatz for 2 hours)

name: Anonymous
comment:
bus-line 13 from (s)Wilhelmsburg

time:20:00, not that much traffic:)

name: Anonymous

name: Anonymous

name: Anonymous

name: Anonymous

name: Anonymous

name: Anonymous

name: Anonymous

name: Anonymous
comment: a BURGER KING restaurant as well as an older ARAL petrol station make it easy to 'autostop' from here north on the german A5 (direction karlsruhe as well as frankfurt and hannover/hamburg). you reach this raststaette (called 'weil am rhein') where plenty of drivers pass through easy and within 30 minutes from the center of basel. take the 'DB regional express' (one stop)from 'badischer bahnhof' (kleinbasel). walk over the tracks, there is a large road bridge, follow the road and the signs to the 'burger king' restaurant. while the trainride takes only two minutes, walking takes you more than a half. the place is very safe + easy to find.

name: Anonymous
comment: To Bitburg, Belgium, Luxembourg .. stand on a busstop near Fachhochschule Trier

name: Anonymous
comment: in the city that connects with the ring highway and could take you anywhere west of Berlin. The cars have to stop for the lights.

name: Anonymous

name: Anonymous
comment:
Very good for Berlin, Hannover and Dresden.
ARAL Station (ask around).

name: Anonymous

Aachener Land:

name: Anonymous

name: Anonymous

name: Anonymous

name: Anonymous
comment:
Direction:
West to Zurich

Sign:
ZURICH

Date:
11 OCT '09

Time:
About 11h

Weather:
Cloudy with some sun, mild/cool temperature

HOW TO GET THERE:
Take the S-Bahn (S8) to Neugilching.  Walk along Landsberger Strasse about 400 meters to the entrance of the Autobahn.  There really isn't a place to stop on then eingang (entrance), so I just hopped the Autobahn gate and hitched directly on the road.  No police, since I got a ride in less than 10 minutes.

name: Anonymous
comment: the place is ok, the cars are fast but they have enough space to stop. we waited just 10min, but i think we had good luck.

name: Anonymous

comment: Good to go north from KÃ¶ln. You just have to calculate your rides so you don't go off on MÃ¼lheim or Dusseldorf, for example. You can take little rides between rest areas along Highway 3 so you can get out the "An der Ruhr" area!

comment: Very good to get started, because every car here goes to the service area ville west. There's a pedestrian light with which you can stop the cars going on the autobahn, and then ask!

name: Anonymous

name: Anonymous

name: Anonymous

direction berlin is ok all day, direction A4 westbound may take a while - esp. after 22:00 it's often better to go on until Osterfeld (25km) and change sides there (bridge provided) - especially if your lifter would stay on the A9 anyway.

name: Anonymous
comment: it#s a service station, great if you want to get to berlin quickly. and there's a free toilet. many trucks stopping by, just ask at the station.

name: Anonymous
comment: you can see which cars are going towards berlin and dresden, but staying here is quite dangerous, there's a police station nearby so you can get caught, and even if drivers want to help you, not many will stop since their speed is over 100km/h. if you end up here; you can always hope for a rescue from someone who feels sorry for you and is quick enough to stop before A13.
