comment: If u want to go to a very nice swimming place in Berlin u should take the S-train to heerstrasse station and start walking the road called teufelsseechaussee and while u walk just keep your thumb up and probably someone will take u there. (If not, u can still walk there it's not too far away =)

name: Anonymous
comment: On-ramp Lotte (13) on A30. Direction Osnabruck/A2. Spot is pretty ok, but people aren't so likely to stop.

name: Anonymous
comment: Auf der Straße vom Kaffeetrichter südwärts Richtung A4/Arnstadt fahren jede Menge Leute zur Autobahn, zu Fuß nur 10-15 Minuten vom Bahnhof oder mit der Straßenbahn bis zum Steigerwaldstadion kommt diese Kurve, was schon nach Ausfallstraße ausschaut - nicht perfekt zum Anhalten, aber viele Autos, die die Richtung fahren und sehr bald auch wer anhält!

name: Anonymous
comment: Im Grunde kommen viele Autos von Erfurt her und fahren auf die Autobahn Richtung Eisenach/Hessen, der Ort ist nen bisschen blöd zum Anhalten, aber es gibt ne lange Einfädelspur an dessen Anfang man stehen kann.

name: Anonymous
comment: Wirst du an der Ausfahrt Eisenach-Ost aus Richtung Erfurt rausgeschmissen, lauf gar nicht so weit, bleib an der Kreuzung stehen - sehr bald sollte ein Eisenacher kommen, der dich bis in die Innenstadt mitnehmen wird.

name: Anonymous
comment: Ein wirklich guter Spot um aus der Stadt herauszutrampen, viele Leute fahren auf die Autobahn und dann weiter Richtung Gotha/Erfurt, einmal auf der Piste kommst du dann eh gut voran. Du kannst an der Tankstelle herumfragen oder genauso gut am Rand stehen und mit dem Daumen winken. Es ist nicht viel Platz zum Anhalten, aber klappt trotzdem.

name: Anonymous
comment: Kurz hinter der Kreuzung von Eisenach-Mitte steht es sich super Richtung Mühlhausen/Eichsfeld weil im Grunde jeder zweite hier wenigstens bis Mihla oder Nazza fährt, so bist du einmal auf der Piste und kommst auch gut weiter - über die Woche sind aber auch viele Pendler aus MHL/UH/EIC unterwegs, die bei BOSCH oder Opel arbeiten und dich gern mitnehmen, bevorzugt zum Feierabend.

name: Anonymous
comment: If you come from the Autobahn and you want to reach Weimar, just stand at the side of the B85 direction Gelmeroda, there is a little dustroad and easy to stop for the cars, which will bring you in the center.

name: Anonymous
comment: There is a set of traffic lights right here if you sit just after them you can get all the traffic. My day here there was road works so I only got the merging traffic which is still sufficient enough.

name: Anonymous
comment: TRULY best spot for going towards Kiel. There is a bus stop.

name: Anonymous
comment: Perfect spot for those going to Kiel/Denmark. Emergency lane starts a bit before the beginning of the highway so stand there.

name: Anonymous
comment: Frequently used service station, restaurant and Burger King. To get a ride east bound seems to be easier. Be aware no public transport for this spot. To hitch out of Gotha to this place is okay , too.

name: Anonymous
comment: Summer sunday around midday a lot of people go for a free pee. Hitch up north towards Erfurt

name: Anonymous
comment:
Direction: east
A parkplatz on the highway.

name: Anonymous
comment: This spot is in a walkable distance to the central station. The Frankenschnellweg takes you onto the A73 which connects with every Autobahn in Nuremburg, therefore it is a perfect spot for every direction

name: Anonymous
comment: Best place to get to Kiel from Eckernförde. Just stay in front of the bus station. It took me 4-5 minutes.

name: Anonymous
comment: petrol station Hasbruch Süd on A28 towards Bremen. Good for rides direction Hamburg or Hannover.

name: Anonymous
comment: Petrol station Grossenmoor, A7 direction Wurzburg.

name: Anonymous
comment: Take the tram 50, 51, 52 from "Mainz Hauptbahnhof" to "Mainz-Hechtsheim, Kurmainz Kaserne". If you get out at "Kurmainz Kaserne" you can already see the motorway. Walk about 5 minutes along the main street. Directly before the drive-up there is a traffic light and a traffic island where you can stand and ask drivers to bring you to the A67 (close to Darmstadt there is a service station). To get on this traffic island you have to cross four lanes.

name: Anonymous
comment: from the city take the S2 direction to Petershausen and get off at Obermenzing, then just follow the Verdistraße to the end, it's a 10 minutes walk to get there, but you can already try hitchhiking during the walk...

name: Anonymous
comment: Esso gas station

name: Anonymous
comment: It was totally dark, and 5 minutes and we have luckliy lift to Dresden, try this place:)

name: Anonymous
comment:
Good Spot to hit the A60 going to Darmstadt. Most inner city people leave the city this way.
Walking time from the city center about 30 minutes.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Traffic Ligth before the city ends.
Few people go on to the highway. But they are likely to bring you closer to Eberstadt. Maybe better to tramp from the inner city.

name: Anonymous
comment: Petrol station Hunsrüst. Quite big, but doesn't seems to be very bussy (Tuesday evening). Direction to Mannheim and further.

name: Anonymous
comment: If you are heading do Baden Baden, Karlsruhe and Frankfurt, this gas station entrance is just great! Cars stopped at the previous traffic light can see you from far and stop for you (as there is plenty of place). Don't forget you sign and smiiiile!

name: Anonymous
comment:
Close to the centre, very walkable distance.
There's a bus stop just behind the junction. Many cars are still going slow due to the traffic light, I manage to go to Nuremberg from here, should be even better for Munich / Hof

name: Anonymous
comment: excellent place to go to poland. its a little complicated to get there from berlin, but i did this; from berlin you took the RE(train) with direction to cottbus, untill the station "Königs Wusterhausen" then you have to take the bus 730, and get out in the last stop"brusendorf"(you can see it on the map) and then walk throw a plantation like 10 or 15 min and jump a fence to get to the gas station

name: Anonymous
comment: Service station Ville, ask here for Euskirchen (A1) or Koblenz (A61).

name: Anonymous
comment: Service station Eifel, direction to Trier, Luxembourg (A64) and Saarbruecken (A1).

name: Anonymous
comment: Many truck drivers. They stop here for the night.

name: Anonymous
comment: As it's written on Hitchwiki, this gas station is a good spot to stop. I had been taken at this place exactly, just at the entrance of the station. Every car could see me, I waited 15 minutes.

name: Anonymous
comment: If you have to be left by a driver somewhere, don't stop here ! (especially if you want to go in the south-west)

name: Anonymous
comment: Going in the south west direction (with the A1) I waited a couple of hours here... People can see you thanks to the stop light, but if you get a lift, you have to get inside the car really fast, so not easy to check how is the guy driving...

name: Anonymous
comment:
Take the bus C or D. 
At the spot there are traffic lights because of a zebra crossing. If you keep pressing the zebra button, the lights will be red, the cars will stop and they'll take you. Good luck!

name: Anonymous
comment:
Richtung Ilmenau/Meiningen sehr gut, Richtung Sömmerda/Erfurt ausreichend, Richtung Ost oder West auf der A4 sehr schlecht.
- gut anzuhalten, Autobahnauffahrt auf die A71

Ich kam von Süden, A71 und musste Richtung Westen, A4 und dachte es wäre der beste Punkt, um ein Auto zu erwischen, was über die A71 auf die A4 fährt weil mein Ride vorher nach Erfurt reingegangen wäre - totaler Fehlschlag; lieber nach Erfurt-West (A4) oder Erfurt-Bindersleben (A71) mitfahren - von da aus ist der Anschluss nach Westen (Gotha, Eisenach und weiter) besser.

name: Anonymous
comment: Ist direkt an der Kreuzung blöde zum Anhalten, aber meist ist da nicht zu viel Verkehr, der auf die Autobahn auffährt, genug jedoch, um wegzukommen. Am besten hier mit Schild (EA, HEF, WAK, ESW), nahe Ziele (Eisenach, Hersfeld) sind am wahrscheinlichsten, schnell wen zu finden - ansonsten ist es einfacher am südlicher gelegenen Autohof.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Aus Saalfeld heraus Richtung Rudolstadt laufe bis zum McDonalds am Ortsausgang/B281oder nimm den Bus bis zum Marktkauf und frag dich dann während der längeren Rotphase bei den die Stadt verlassenden Autos durch, wer nach Rudolstadt (oder weiter) fährt. Der Verkehr ist meist sehr dicht und es ist relativ leicht jemanden zu finden um zumindest aus der Stadt herauszukommen.
Zum Stehen und Daumen-Raushalten ein bisschen blöd zum Anhalten...

name: Anonymous
comment: Von Saalfeld/Rudolstadt Richtung Stadtilm, A71, Erfurt, und weiter auf der A4 ist das ein super Punkt. Die Autofahrer sind durch die nahe Kreuzung noch nicht zu schnell, haben eine längere Anfahrphase um dich zu sehen und fahren hauptsächlich alle auf der L1048 über Stadtilm Richtung Arnstadt, Erfurt und A71/A4. Es lässt sich auf der Kreuzung auch super anhalten.

name: Anonymous
comment: Lass dich - wenn du auf dem Weg nach Eisenach bist - von Westen auf der A4 her einfach an der Ausfahrt Eisenach West an diesem Kreisel rausschmeißen und warte (optional mit einem EA-Schild) an der Auffahrt zur alten Autobahn. Die Allermeisten fahren in die Stadt hinein und sollten bereit sein, dich mitzunehmen. Klare Richtung, aber schlecht anzuhalten. Viertelstunde und du solltest jemanden haben!

name: Anonymous
comment: Ein blöder Punkt, maximal um nach Coburg hineinzutrampen. Hoffe nicht zu viel auf einen Ride auf die A73. Oder habe viel Geduld. Hier ist nicht viel Verkehr.

name: Anonymous
comment: Surprising good opportunity to get further North on the A73. Much traffic.

name: Anonymous
comment: Surprising good opportunity to get further South or even West via A70 Bamberg-Würzburg. There is quite much traffic.

name: Anonymous
comment: Not the worst spot to start heading North through the Allgäu to everywhere. There are locals as well as tourist for short- or long-distant-rides.

name: Anonymous
comment: Even on the on-ramp it is quite fine to find a ride up North. The Allgäuer are nice people.

name: Anonymous
comment: big rest area but not very much cars around 11 in the morning, hard to talk with everybody so its better to stand here before the cars go on the highway.

name: Anonymous
comment: Heading South to Eisenach/A4 just start walking from the big junction in direction Eisenach. There are a lot of cars going this way, especially in the morning.

name: Anonymous
comment: low traffic, nearly no cars driving to the highway

name: Anonymous
comment: On-ramp Ochtrup, B54 towards Gronau/Enschede (NL). No shoulder, but traffic isn't that fast so they can still stop. Not much traffic and people don't seem to friendly around here, so you might wait a bit longer ;)

name: Anonymous
comment: On-ramp Ochtrup, B54 towards Gronau/Enschede (NL). No shoulder, but traffic isn't that fast so they can still stop. Not much traffic and people don't seem to friendly around here, so you might wait a bit longer ;)

name: Anonymous
comment: On-ramp Ochtrup, B54 towards Gronau/Enschede (NL). No shoulder, but traffic isn't that fast so they can still stop. Not much traffic and people don't seem to friendly around here, so you might wait a bit longer ;)

name: Anonymous
comment: Roundabout just outside Schöppingen, on the L579. Good for rides in direction Heek/Ochtrup.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bus stop near Havixbeck with hard shoulder on the L550 towards Laer. Traffic a bit faster, but they see you from very far.

name: Anonymous
comment: Hard shoulder on the L581 towards Billerbeck.

name: Anonymous
comment: Crossing of L580 and L579 near Horstmar, direction Schöppingen/Ahaus. Fast traffic here, but along the whole road is a hard shoulder where they can stop.

name: Anonymous
comment: small gas station. not good for people to see you but it's ok to ask them when they stop to fill the tank. there is a water-fall close to it and a small store to buy some food

name: Anonymous
comment: There is asmall area for cars to park direction Horb am Neckar. There is basically nothing there, just a Casino on the other side of the road. Cars slow down at this part before the turn and they can see you from a far distance.

name: Anonymous
comment: Not sure if this is the right place, but it is on the right road. There is a place for cars to park but nothing else. Good place to go to A81.

name: Anonymous
comment: just before the roundabout, close to the Agip gas station, you can see a place for cars to stop direction B31 (munich, garmisch-partenkirche). Not so much space for cars to stop, they don't see you from a far distance, but very busy and the best place to hitchhike from Konstantz to that direction.

name: Anonymous
comment: just a parking place with nothing else.

name: Anonymous
comment: L597 towards Osnabruck. Quite some traffic here, good spot.

name: Anonymous
comment: Roundabout on L95 towards Hagen a. TW. Even though it's at the beginning of the village, cars will stop :) Stand at the bus stop.

name: Anonymous
comment: L96 from Hagen towards Bad Iburg. Bus stop in a long bend.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bus stop on the B51 in Bad Iburg. Direction Munster as well as Lengerich on the L98.

name: Anonymous
comment: On-ramp 73 Lengerich, A1 direction Dortmund. Not that much traffic here, but the spot is great with a lot of space for cars to stop.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bus stop on L579 towards Laer/Ahaus. Enough traffic here coming off the B54.

name: Anonymous
comment: On-ramp 31 Heek on the A31 towards Emden. Not much traffic, no hard shoulder and fucked up people, great combination!

name: Anonymous
comment: Roundabout, direction Nordhorn/A30.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bus stop on B403 towards Nordhorn. Traffic fortunately not so fast here :)

name: Anonymous
comment: Bus stop on B213 towards Lingen. Just behind the traffic lights. No need to walk further out of town, this spot is good. Waiting might take a while though, people don't seem to eager to pick you up.

name: Anonymous
comment: On-ramp 25 Lingen, A31 towards Emden. Less traffic than expected, no hard shoulder. People not so friendly here, so hard to get away! The raststatte is a 6km walk along the L45 and then K33!

name: Anonymous
comment: Raststatte Ems-Vechte Ost, A31 towards Emden. Not so crowded as other ones on busier highways, but still fine for getting rides north or into NL.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very good! You can simply hitchhike to Cologne (north) or to Mainz/ Frankfurt (south). There is a lot of business traffic. From this patrol station you can take the following motorways: A 48, A 3 or sometimes to A61

name: Anonymous
comment: Petrol Station where you can ask drivers directly. We caught a ride here from polish truck driver to Hagen.

name: Anonymous
comment: there's a bus stop right after the intersection. it has the advantage of cars coming from 3 directions and just after the red light, so the traffic isn't that fast. still, i waited an hour to get a ride to prague.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good spot to Munster from A2

name: Anonymous
comment: Just a fairly small parking lot with no gas station nor a place to get food. Still managed to get a ride here to the netherlands in a short time. Quite some people stopping here because there aren't a lot of parking spots direcly along the autobanh at this part of the A30. I'd give it a shot.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Was accidentally droppen off here instead of Auental Nord (my mistake), but still managed to get a ride here within 30 minutes to Hamm. It's just a smaller parking place, but enough traffic going by to get a ride further down the A2.

But if you can, go to Auental Nord, way more traffic over there.

name: Anonymous
comment: It's a parkinglot. Some cars and trucks around. I got a ride there pretty fast by a friendly trucker.

name: Anonymous
comment: This is an awful spot. Its pretty off the highway and has connection to north, south AND west. After over one hour of having no chance we got a ride in the wrong direction and took a trian wich was a really big mistake. Anyway let them not drop you off there!

name: Anonymous
comment: Vivid spot, easy to get far rides. I got a lift to Frankfurt from there

name: Anonymous
comment: Reconstructed traffic intersection

name: Anonymous
comment: Fuel station and a large parking lot

name: Anonymous
comment: If you don´t feel like walking along the highway. Easily accesable from Schwabach.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good to stay on A6. Rest station, not a petrol station. Outside the city center.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good spot for heading northwards (Augsburg)

name: Anonymous
comment: There's enough space for cars to stop on the ramp. I got a lift easily after a few minutes to the next gas station. Direction west (Lindau, Austria, Switzerland)

name: Anonymous
comment: Lot's of cars stop at this gas station which are heading to Munich or Stuttgart. One time I also got a lift from here directly to Berlin.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great spot for heading to the north (Nürnberg). There's a Parking where the cars can stop safely.

name: Anonymous
comment: pentling is a big resting station with a lot of traffic coming through towards the north (maybe the traffic to the south is always stopping here) you can take a bus to "Hohengebraching" from the central station (should take you about 15min) and then you have to walk for 10min til you are there. very easy to find a ride

name: Anonymous
comment:
Petrolstation Grundbergsee.

Easy to reach from Hamburg as it is before Bremen. 

You should ask the people while fueling up or  before they go to the restrooms. 
Restrooms are free :)

name: Anonymous
comment:
Petrol Station Wildeshausen.

Easy to reach from Grundbergsee/Bremen

A lot of cars going to the Ruhr-Area. Bring a Map/Smartphone with you so you can check if they'll pass your destination.

as usual just ask the people  while fueling up.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Last traffic light before the highway.

Impossible to get a ride north, I only got offered rides to Mühlheim (MH license Plate). You would want to have someone with a RE, BOT or HER or something further north License Plate to get on the A2.

It might be an OK spot to get a ride to Düsseldorf or Cologne.

name: Anonymous
comment: Waited one minute for a ride to Strasbourg after another friendly driver dropped us there on his way to Freiburg.

name: Anonymous
comment:
A great place to get to Eckernförde. Let yourself be dropped here by guys takin you along the A7. 

This parking spot is used by many commuters.

name: Anonymous
comment: Probably best place to leave Nordstrand towards Husum.

name: Anonymous
comment: Lot of Czech cars. Good place to get lift towards Prague.

name: Anonymous
comment: eine große Shell Tankstelle, an der paar Leute tanken , die von der Autobahn kurz abfahren. Problem ist nur, dass es in beide Richtungen erstmal keine Raststätten gibt und man entweder einen weiten Lift bekommen muss oder sich nur bis zu einem Prakplatz bringen lässt, was ich gemacht habe und was super funktioniert hat.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good spot to hitch to Allershausen, from there you can continue north or south the A9

name: Anonymous
comment: Stand just before the traffic lights and wait till it turns red or the cars are standing and ask the drivers with the non local number plates (not BA) for a lift. Some people drive south towards Nürnberg and further. worked really good for us many times. easy option to hitchhike in the center of Bamberrg.

name: Anonymous
comment: All cars coming from the A3 going to the B388 have to cross this place and to slow down at the stop sign, so it's a good place for the whole B388 up to Taufkirchen.

name: Anonymous
comment: To get south/onshore this spot is fine. There is a parking lane. I would prefer this spot to the busy ramp off the ferry in Puttgarden.

name: Anonymous
comment: There is a gas station. Within 5 minutes I found a ride to Berlin. I guess lot of luck ;)

name: Anonymous
comment: traffic light at the street to a 643 twoards a66 (frankfurt). friend recommended it to me, but don't go there! there's no chance you finde someone to take you - no traffic, only locals...

name: Anonymous
comment: I was waiting there 10 min with my sign driving from the village towards the entrance A565 taking the next ride on the Highway.

name: Anonymous
comment: Petrol station Rasthof Berstetal

name: Anonymous
comment: Asked people who stopped at the gas station, second person to ask was already taking me to Bielefeld.

name: Anonymous
comment: Was on the way from the Aral gas station to the entry of the highway, going backwards and holding my sign. Got picked up after 5 minutes and got to Kiel in one hour. Driver stopped at a bus stop close to this point.

name: Anonymous
comment: We spend almost whole day trying to get out of here. We tried every possible spot around Ikea and petrol station and parking lots. But the cars  were full with furniture and had no place for us or going different direction. The bus stop on Franktufter Strasse saved us.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very easy to ask drivers leaving the ferry.Almost every car goes in direction of hamburg during vacation time.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bus station. Easy for cars to stop. Nice place to leave A9 for Jena.

name: Anonymous
comment: I waited at the traffic light to get a ride to the next petrol station on the Autobahn direction south

name: Anonymous
comment: No place for cars to stop and too much traffic

name: Anonymous
comment: B54 Gronau, West towards Enschede. Not that much traffic but still a reasonably good on-ramp.

name: Anonymous
comment: Autohof next to the autobahn.

name: Anonymous
comment: I once made the mistake of standing here for direction east. Traffic is already too fast and the spot is illegal. Just stand inside the city and you'll do much better.

name: Anonymous
comment: Seems the most logical option for direction east out of Porta Westfalica, but there's very very little traffic (5 cars in 20min for us, luckily the 5th one stopped).

name: Anonymous
comment: A good place to get out of the city to hitchhiking spots. I always use a sign saying "Fischbach" or with the highway I need to get on.

name: Anonymous
comment: It took me less then 15 minuts to get  out of this place. is a great place if u are landing or departing from lubeck/hamburg airport. the way to arrive to this place from the airport is simple, turn left at teh exit of the airport , fallow  K8 you will walk wulsdorf, turn left at the kindergarden and keep walking untill you reachthe overpass, on the top of the over pass you can choose directions you need to jump the fence.!!there  is a bus stop in Wulfsdorf. i manage to get in to poland from here., berlin also good.

name: Anonymous
comment: Perfect place for going east! There's plenty of space for cars to pull over. The police passed once and they didn't have a problem, so it should be fine.

name: Anonymous
comment: Terribly dangerous for cars to stop and probably illegal, but I didn't have another choice because I only got until here with the ride before. Thankfully somebody took me after only a few minutes.

name: Anonymous
comment: It didn't take 30 minutes to get a ride to Dortmund.

name: Anonymous
comment: It was difficult to get southern on the A7 from here...

name: Anonymous
comment: I could hardly find somebody going southern on the A7 and then to A70...

name: Anonymous
comment: Always a good spot to get a ride to munich.

name: Anonymous
comment: The old boarder check point - seemed like a good place, but I didnt have time to look around for the first truck took me.

name: Anonymous
comment: Seems like a nice place.

name: Anonymous
comment: You can go there by bus (for free) from the Terminal. I think it was bus 365 (somewhere to the Deutsche Post Centre or one behind Besucherpark and then walk 10miin). There a gas station and some space next to the road for cars to stop.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Right in front of the yellow city sign of "Himmelkron".
Cars go south and north on the A9.

(You can also ask people at the parking lots of the supermarkets but I made the experience that most of the people are locals and won´t use the highway.)

name: Anonymous
comment: It was my first day in Germany, and I was lost a little bit. I waited here for 1 hour.

name: Anonymous
comment: Junction. Just in front of Autobahn sign. Senseless.

name: Anonymous
comment: Petrol station and Burger King. After few tries I found a car going to Leer. Look for number plates starting with LER.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good place to start hitchhiking from nürnberg in direction to berlin.

name: Anonymous
comment: Added this spot, not very good. Didn't know where to go so went here, got a ride after about 2 hours, better to walk further to the spots down the road.

name: Anonymous
comment: Stood there for ca. 20 minutes, then someone took me to a gasstation. There's enough place to stop at the entry to the gardening center

name: Anonymous
comment: At the traffic lights. A girl standing next to me got a ride to Halle in about 20mins.

name: Anonymous
comment: No traffic lights, but you are well visible and there's enough space to stop. Direction Dresden. I waited for 10 min. without sign.

name: Anonymous
comment: Ich bin von dieser Kreuzung aus mit einem KIEL-Schild nach Süden gegangen, dem Verkehr entgegen. Nach 5-10 Minuten wurde ich mitgenommen. Die Fahrerin ist sogar eine extra Runde gefahren, um mich einzusammeln, weil sie zu erst bei zu schnellem Verkehr zu spät reagiert hatte. Es war Sonntagabend ca 20:30 Uhr. Es ging direkt in die Kieler Innenstadt und hat ca 50 Minuten gedauert.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Good spot right in front of the ramp onto the highway to Hamburg.
Traffic lights slow the cars down and there´s enough space to stop.

name: Anonymous
comment: when you get off the highway at altwarmbüchen, there is a bus stop down where cars can easily stop. got a ride into hannover in 10 minutes.

name: Anonymous
comment:
I started a 3KM walk from Hauptbahnhof DB. 
In 5 minutes I had got into a car heading to Prague.

name: Anonymous
comment: Highway exit, was heading north. Not so easy, as there is another highway exit for Hof a bit further north.

name: Anonymous
comment: Gas station "Eisenach". Close to the former border between east and west.

name: Anonymous
comment: Highway exit. Went from here to Kassel. Quite easy, because a lot of drivers take this distance-wise short country road instead of the highway.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good stop on the way to Kassel. Friendly people, a lot of cars stopped.

name: Anonymous
comment: I (male, alone) was standing next to the bushes with a sign "A5 Nord". The cars are slow as there is a speed bump just before and there is alse a good spot to stop (next to the bushes). It was a Thursday around noon and there we mainly "high class" cars and Taxis. I got a ride after 7 mins 100km up north.

name: Anonymous
comment: good to est

name: Anonymous
comment: it is possible to Metz

name: Anonymous
comment: Nobody stopped to Hombourg

name: Anonymous
comment:
Nice spot for going to Nürnberg!
There's a bus stop where cars can pull over. Stand between that and the traffic lights, so people can see you.

name: Anonymous
comment: You can ask the people turing left if they can give you a ride to the next gas station.

name: Anonymous
comment: Easy to get here but not so much traffic.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Perfect place to get to Freiburg.
All the Cars which come from Lake Constance and follow the B31 leave the highway at this junktion. Just wait for a direct-lift to Freiburg. It never took me more than 5-10 Minutes

name: Anonymous
comment: If you want to get to Tuttlingen it is a really bad spot (Most cars prefer to go via Tuningen or Stockach). Don't get out there, just go to Junktion Tuningen (one Junktion in the north)

name: Anonymous
comment:
Good spot to get to Canstance (Konstanz) or to the next gasstation.
If you want to get to Friedrichshaven you have to wait (and reject a frew cars going to Constance)

name: Anonymous
comment:
Good spot to get to Meßkirch, Sigmaringen or further east (Ulm, ...).
Because of the roundabout the cars have to slow down and the possibility to stop is not too bad (last time even a truck stopped :) )
ATTENTION: Last good spot before Messkirch (don't accept a Lift to Neuhausen or Worndorf)

name: Anonymous
comment: If you want to pass Tuttlingen just ask the drivers for a lift at least to the Aesculap-Kreisverkehr (Roundabout) or tell them that you need to get to the other side of the tunnel (Both are the same places). Don't accept a lift into the citycenter of Tuttlingen.

name: Anonymous
comment: There is a traffic-light and it is quite long red. So this is a good spot to get a lift to the highway (A81) or to Schwenningen (Villingen-Schwenningen). Ask for direct lifts because there aren't any villages between.

name: Anonymous
comment: Not very good to get to the West (B311), but there aren't any good spots to hitchhike West. So just walk there (not through the tunnel) and try your luck.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very bad spot. It is just not possible to stop and give you a lift to the West (B311)

name: Anonymous
comment: If you want to get East (B311) you need to wait at the traffic-lights. Most will just go into the city-centre of Tuttlingen but there are still cars going East.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good place to get to Singen or Switzerland.

name: Anonymous
comment: NOT so good to get to the north (Stuttgart) but if you need to get north it is the only spot and you have to wait there.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bus stop on B31 towards the A5. Not perfect but it'll do.

name: Anonymous
comment: Petrol station Mahlberg, A5 towards Karlsruhe.

name: Anonymous
comment: Petrol station Pfungstadt. North to Frankfurt or northwest to Köln.

name: Anonymous
comment: Don't try to get a lift in the centre of Peißenberg because that will be absolutely senseless. It's much better to walk towards the end of town (10 minutes after the hospital) and wait there for a car to Weilheim or Penzberg

name: Anonymous
comment: Searching for a lift from Schongau to Weilheim, Garmisch-Partenkirchen or Oberammergau, it's recommendable to wait directly after the traffic light close to the UPM factory.

name: Anonymous
comment: A good spot to find a car to Landsberg, Munich or Augsburg.

name: Anonymous
comment: Nice spot 'cause there are a lot of cars going to Weilheim and Peißenberg.

name: Anonymous
comment: Got a ride Eastward to Kohlen in 10 minutes

name: Anonymous
comment: Hamburg was my destination, but had a sign for Stade. Got a rRide in 15 minutes and the driver was luckily driving to Hamburg. Was really helpful in explaining Hamburgs free ;) transport system aswell

name: Anonymous
comment: Ride to Bremervorde in 20 mins

name: Anonymous
comment: Intersection before the B76 hitching in the direction of Flensburg. Pretty bad spot with no legal place to pull over, but very few options in the general area. Stood at the intersection with a sign. Someone pulled over illegally in the less used northern road in 20 mins. Just goes to prove, if someone wants to pick you up, they will make it happen!

name: Anonymous
comment: Good to get on the A5 or A67. At the Maritim Hotel is a parking lot for taxis, stand there with a sign so cars can see you already while waiting on the traffic lights.

name: Anonymous
comment: to Dresden or Frankfurt

name: Anonymous
comment: Ochtrup-west direction Muenster. Shit in this direction, almost no traffic. Also not the easiest area to hitchhike anyway.

name: Anonymous
comment: On-ramp at Burgsteinfurt, B54 towards Enschede. Very little traffic here...

name: Anonymous
comment: Better to walk a bit more towards Munster/stay in the city if you want to hitch out. Cars can't stop here.

name: Anonymous
comment: Not such a great spot direction Forchheim or Hochstadt. Better try and stay in the villages where traffic is slower.

name: Anonymous
comment: Aral Gasstation right at the beginning of the A96 - good for hitchhiking towards Lindau and Switzerland

name: Anonymous
comment: Raststatte Langen-Bergheim on A45 towards Siegen/Dortmund. Not the most frequented highway, so it might take longer. Most is long distance traffic though.

name: Anonymous
comment: go spot to get onto the A7. bus stop gives plenty of space to pull over

name: Anonymous
comment: A bus top immediately behind a traffic light, so drivers see you pretty soon. On a saturday morning I waited 15 minutes for a lift to the next gas station. A very good alternative for Autobahn 623 direction Trier.

name: Anonymous
comment:
good plae direction A9 to berlin and further! 
never waited more then half an hour!

name: Anonymous
comment: Only a few cars per hour, but a resting place for trucks in the back of the petrol station.

name: Anonymous
comment: good place for west, example hamburg, cars come slowly after the roundabout and have a good place to stop, waited maximum 20min.

name: Anonymous
comment: took me 10min to get a ride to oldenburg, a bus stop makes it easy for cars to stop. also easy to get here with the tram

name: Anonymous
comment: I've spend 2 hours here, without any success. However, I've seen a lot of plates from UK, NL and eastern germany.

name: Anonymous
comment:
3 lane street and only place to stop was a bus lane. Nevertheless, a lots of cars with PL, UK, NL, all-german plates. 
Got direct hitch to Drezden after 15min.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good place to stop, but very few cars.

name: Anonymous
comment: Towards A9 (North/South). Space at roadside right after the traffic lights. Nicer than bus stop before lights in a way that you'll get also turning traffic.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great spot to hitch towards the city. If you get dropped at Ikea, walk cross the Autobahn bridge and hitch here. Loads of space even for trucks to stop.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very close place to stand

name: Anonymous
comment: At a bus station in front of the police building

name: Anonymous
comment: It's near the trainstation and the best spot to go south towards Marburg/Gießen. There's a spot where cars can stop so it's not too dangerous to hitchhike from here.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Süderschmedebyfeld (Altes Motel)

Von Süderschmedeby sind es ca. 1,5km. Von hier kommt man gut nach Flensburg. Falls jemand nicht ganz nach Flensburg fährt, dann lohnt es sich bis nach Sankelmark oder Oeversee zu fahren. Von Jarplund ist es aber schwer nach Flensburg zu trampen. Das Bushaltehäusschen wurde leider abgerissen. Man wird von weitem gesehen und die Autos können gut halten. Von "Balbek" kommen auch manchmal Autos, die man gut anquatschen kann.

name: Anonymous
comment:
two parking sites. waited there for 5 minutes to get a ride to freiburg. parking space directly behind traffic lights. 
should be similar for other direction

name: Anonymous
comment: ther is a busstop and is perfekt to stutgartt or freiburg

name: Anonymous
comment:
tempolimit 30km/h
busstation
gasstation
wait 15min

name: Anonymous
comment:
Worst place ever, if trying to get onto the 4/A 553. Have been waiting for about 3 hours before anyone got away from there.

Got offered a couple of local hikes though.

name: Anonymous
comment: It's place at the end of the city, a lot of cars passing by to go to the highway, both directions

name: Anonymous
comment: tried to get away from there for about 1,5 hours one day, had to sleep in lüneburg and tried again on the next day. took us 2h to find somebody. you need a sign. around the corner is a shell gas station, where only local people hang around.

name: Anonymous
comment: lots of local people. senseless to stand there with a sign. you have to ask people. we tried to get onto a7 and it took us about 1,5h.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good spot for A31 towards north. Not soo busy but thanks to the McDonalds there are some cars going trough.

name: Anonymous
comment: Senseless, if you are on the way from Prague to Berlin. A tiny reststation with not so many cars passing by, mostly local traffic. Have to hitch into Dresden and use public transport through the city anyway in case to reach better spot.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Quite a crazy bad spot for stopping. But lot's of cars going B7 direction Eisenach/Eschwege.
Maybe try to signal with a sign to the cars coming from the highway and the center to pick you up at the parking place south of the junction.

name: Anonymous
comment: Rasthof Flaeming

name: Anonymous
comment: Hitchhiked from here after spending after deciding the petrol stations further north were too empty. When you come from the Ramersdorf junction, follow the path on the right hand side through the park and you'll come to this place. No fence to climb, decent traffic, and good area for cars to stop. Was picked up in 2 minutes, although maybe that was because everyone was in high spirit after Germany winning the World Cup.

name: Anonymous
comment: Busy gas station in walkable distance from Eschwege. It's a good spot if you want to go further east to Wanfried, Mühlhausen or Treffurt.

name: Anonymous
comment: bus stop. good for A4 in direction Erfurt, Leipzig, Dresden.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good Spot to cath a ride to A7 direction Hannover or Hamburg, poeple come down from the hill so they see you and there is a petrolstation where they can stop over cars also dont go that fast there

name: Anonymous
comment:
-> A4 / EAST (Dresden)
I got dropped off in this exact location by a local guy who always uses this place for hitchhiking himself.
Not a perfect place - the side of the road didn't seem wide enough for car to pull over at first glance, but as I didn't see a more suitable spot I stayed in this place, and eventually got a ride to Dresden.

name: Anonymous
comment:
The place itself is perfect - there's more than enough space for pulling over, and as it's the exit of one of the parking lots the cars aren't going fast. In addition, there's a traffic light!
If only the airport-people were interested in picking up hitchhikers...

name: Anonymous
comment: Not many cars are stopping there, but you can get a ride on A 555 or A 59 road.

name: Anonymous
comment: A big petrol station, cars are stopping very often. Had a bad experience with getting to Bonn, I guess it depends from good timing. For Bonn you should look for cars with ''BN-...'' number plate, ''K-...'' usually stays in Köln. People often going to Aachen.

name: Anonymous
comment: Can ask for a lift to the center of Koln.

name: Anonymous
comment: Right after the traffic lights there's a place for cars to stop

name: Anonymous
comment: Many parking lots where cars can stop, slow traffic because there's still a speed limit of 50. Good to get in direction of Oldenburg/Meppen/B401.

name: Anonymous
comment: Speed limit of 50 here, but no one cares and only a small bay for cars to stop. But probably one of the best spots nearby, because before and after this spot cars are very fast and nearly no place to stop.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Entweder an der Tankstelle fragen oder an der Straße den Daumen raus.
Sonnntag, 30 Min.(Richtung Hannover) 
viele Autofahrer Richtung A2 - Dortmund! weniger Richtung Hannover

name: Anonymous
comment: We hitchhiked to Prague from this spot. It tooked a 2 and half hour to stop a car went directly to Prague. Most cars are locals (who will not take you very far) or truckers (who can´t take you anyway) I think a better way to go to Prague is to hitchhike to the petrol station "Oberpfälzer Alb South" (use sign "Amberg") from here and then from the petrol station to Prague.

name: Anonymous
comment: One of the better spots to hitchike North or South via A9 from Halle (I couldn't find a good spot....). Lots of cars in this spot, but it's not a good place to stop for cars and pick you up - you will have to wait for a driver who doesn't care that he basically blocks the freeway entrance ramp if he/she picks you up :) Anyways, it has always worked out!

name: Anonymous
comment: Very good spot to hitchhike East to Leipzig or to the freeway entrance ramp of A9 (North and South). There are lots of cars and they can easily stop at the bus station and pick you up. You can walk there in 5-10 min from the main station.

name: Anonymous
comment: Last shell gas station before you go to the autobahn. the nice guy that drove me to this spot said it was a very good place for hitch-hiking. But there were mostly people from nbg.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Am Haarstrang.

Good place to go east.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Perfect to get to the A 20, irrelevant which direction you`re heading for. 
There`s a little parking lot, you can`t miss it.

name: Anonymous
comment: small space to stop but cars turn and are slow. Have a sign with ESW to go to Eschwege

name: Anonymous
comment: You can get here with bus #130 or #131 from the city centre (Dölzig, B 181/Südstr.). We were hitch-hiking on the bus stop where we got out. Direction to the west with a sign of highway #9 and #38 to Dortmund worked well. After few minutes car stopped and took us all the was to Kassel.

name: Anonymous
comment: You can get here with bus #130 or #131 from the city centre (Dölzig, B 181/Südstr.). We were hitch-hiking on the bus stop where we got out. Direction to the west with a sign of highway #9 and #38 to Dortmund worked well. After few minutes car stopped and took us all the was to Kassel.

name: Anonymous
comment: We met very nice people. One woman even gave us cappucino because it was cold and she wanted to help us at least somehow. Most of the people were locals so they didnt go out of Dortmund but we managed to get ride to our destination Duisburg

name: Anonymous
comment:
10 min of walking from train station.
Stay with sign. 
There are traffic lights to highway.

name: Anonymous
comment: Too much traffic, driving too fast, not enough room to stop.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bus stop "Caspar-Voght-Straße". Same cars as at the bus stop "BAB Auffahrt Horn" a bit further down the road (just in front of the "Horner Kreisel"). Only difference is that it is a bit closer to S-Bahn station "Hasselbrook" and that cars potentially drive a bit slower here because there is a red light.

name: Anonymous
comment: Stałam tam w piątek o godzinie 10-11. Jechałam do Łodzi. Po 10 minutach zatrzymał się kierowca TIRa, który jechał do domu osobówką. Da się złapać stopa. Jest miejsce na postój samochodu, jednak mało samochodów tam przejeżdża.

name: Anonymous
comment: Possible spot for hitching towards Berchtesgaden. Cars have space to stop, but they come a bit fast and you'll miss cars coming from the other direction.

name: Anonymous
comment: Towards Bad Reichenhall/Berchtesgaden. Not a super-good spot, but might still be worth the 20 minutes nice walk from the motorway through Piding.

name: Anonymous
comment: You can enter the Petrolstation through a small path from behind the big walls. I think it's a ok spot to get a ride to at least the next big rest area "Dresdener Tor" direction Leipzig.

name: Anonymous
comment: Ramp with no sidespace to A10 motorway.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Good place to get to the motorway A81. We got a lift directly to Würzburg after 5 mins.

Gute stelle um auf die Autobahn A81 zu kommen. Wir wurden nach ca 5 Minuten direkt nach Würzburg mitgenommen.

name: Anonymous
comment: We wanted to go in northern direction, we got a lift to Coburg after 15 mins. Its a good place, but DO NOT hitchhike to Coburg!!

name: Anonymous
comment: We got out of the previous car here at the OMV, we tried to hitch for like 5 mins and saw that its a very bad place. So we tried to walk around in Coburg looking for a better place but we didnt really find one, so after a couple hours we came back. We waited there from 11pm to 2.30 am at the night in time of the Samba Festival in Coburg. It was cold and dark, all people went to the festival. It was a very bad place, because there is almost no traffic in the A73 motorway. Do NOT hitchhike to Coburg if you can!

name: Anonymous
comment: We spent the night sleeping somewhere behind the Aral petrol station, we got up early in the morning and walked here to the ramp. We were here at 6.30am and we got a ride to the A9 after 10 mins. Its a perfect place in the morning if you want to go to Erfurt/Gera/Leipzig...

name: Anonymous
comment:
Direction to Blegium A3 -> Liege. Stand on the bus stop. There are cars coming from 3 directions and they have to stop on the traffic light so they are going very slow. Perfect place. We went there 2 times and every time a car stopped after 5 min of waiting. The only problem was that most of the cars went just few km far and we needed to go to Liege.
Much better place than the gas station down the road close to the highway!

name: Anonymous
comment: Probably your best shot at getting on the A8 in this area, though we didn't try for long since it was getting dark and we decided to take a train to Salzburg.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Take the tram to Volbedingstraße, from there the underpass.

We didn't stand longer than 15 minutes

name: Anonymous
comment:
Hitchhiking South:
A gas station where a lot of people have to stop to get a vignette for the Austrian motorway. 
Talking helps more than signs.
Easy connection to Innsbruck and the Brenner motorway, which is a major connection between Germany and Northern Italy.

name: Anonymous
comment: I hitchhiked to Brusendorf because the bus to Brusendorf is not working on the weekends. A very nice guy took me in about 5 minutes, even though it was not on his way, and actually took me very close to the gas station where I hitchhiked to Poland.

name: Anonymous
comment: PLEASE DELETE

name: Anonymous
comment: A good place to get into conversation with Polish drivers who will take you west

name: Anonymous
comment: If you ever get stucked in Mellendorf and you want to go west you better wait at this very spot and not at the nearby gas station. At the gas station there are mostly locals who commute between the city and their homes, at the given spot there are soldiers passing from the close military bases and some of them go with their private cars onto the a2

name: Anonymous
comment:
Parking Rennschlag (no WC): direction north/west (Koblenz, Kaiserslautern, Saarbrücken, Mannheim, Ludwigshafen)
This is a meeting place for gay men. Cars are there, but mostly locals. Note that most cars coming from east on A6 going north onto A61 or west onto A6 don't use this part of A6 and use the A61 between Hockenheim and Frankenthal, instead. They save approx. 2 km by that.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Service area Goldbach

Direction Bremen, Bremerhaven, Cuxhaven

name: Anonymous
comment:
There is a bus stop, Good spot for getting out from the town, Cars are driving to Munchen or Regensburg. 
We have been waiting here for an hour with sign (boy+girl)

name: Anonymous
comment: Rest place with restauration, but no gas station. The first place on the higway south from Munchen. A lot of Truck drivers there. Guud spod for going to austria. Waiting there for two hours (boy+girl)

name: Anonymous
comment: we stayed 3 hours. There is not so much cars. if you want go to Heidleberg and stuttgart, it's a good way !

name: Anonymous
comment: Very good spot to hitchhike to Kranenburg or even further to Nijmegen (NL). Stand in the bus stop so people can pull over.

name: Anonymous
comment: Parking with WC, direction Bremen. As all the other parkings in this area are without WC, many people stop there.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good spot for Vallendar or even Koblenz. It is the best place for drivers to drop you, if you come from A3 or A61

name: Anonymous
comment: At Busstop good spot for cars to stop. Direction Schluchsee, Freiburg. Likely to get only short distance lifts.

name: Anonymous
comment: You can get there by taking the S5 until 'Oberursel' station  (20 minutes walking) https://goo.gl/maps/kxUON

name: Anonymous
comment: acutally not the best place for cars to since heres the on-ramp and the beginning of the acceleration line, but we managed to get a ride within 15 minutes to frankfurt. sign needed!

name: Anonymous
comment: nice spot quickborn and the restaurant "alter friedrich" where its easy to find lifts going on the A7, both directions (north/south)

name: Anonymous
comment:
haven't seen or even searched for the place mentioned above. 
this place here really is not a good choice: cars can hardly stop or speeding up. wanted to go up north to hamburg, decliend to lifts to bochum and got lucky with the 3rd car that stopped. try to get on the A1 somehow, if you wanna go really north. cologne, i guess, is easy also from this spot.

name: Anonymous
comment: This Aral gas station is a good spot for direction Dortmund (A3/A1). The Tram 4 brings you to Berliner Straße station, then walk the Rixdorfer Straße in north-west direction. At the end you´ll find this gas station.

name: Anonymous
comment: There is a bus stop!  perfect to get out of Memmingen towards the west. I was aiming for Weingarten and had no difficulties.  happy hitching

name: Anonymous
comment:
Gasstation that works well for getting lifts along the B31 - to Lindau, Bregenz, Munich. 
Waiting times 2 min to half an hour, tried 4 times so far.

name: Anonymous
comment: Small gas station in eastern/outward direction (to Meersburg, Überlingen etc.). Experienced waiting time to Freiburg: 10 min.

name: Anonymous
comment: Tried to ge a ride in front of the mall to Munich because i missed the busstop "Dölzig, B 181/Südstr.". Bad attempt, people were really mocking about me. At least after 30min of waiting a guy felt pity about me and dropped me off at the next roadhouse.

name: Anonymous
comment: Got dropped off 2 times here to hitchhike southbound and waited no longer than 15min. Just go for it and ask the drivers! One time i got a direct ride to Mannheim and the other one was going in direction of Munich. Not much traffic but you will be busy with talking to people anyway.

name: Anonymous
comment: good spot to catch a ride to Osterode, there is a bus station where cars can pull over .

name: Anonymous
comment:
it is a good spot to get to Herzberg and from there on father on the B241 or 243 I guess. I went from there up to A38 going to Dresden. Anything is possible :)
Take a sign and write Herzberg on it and get out at the last traffic light before you get out of the city and should be able to catch a ride further on.

name: Anonymous
comment:
good place to get on to the B243 going to Nordhausen and on to the A38.
Traffic light gets red really frequently, so many cars are stopping.
Best if you right direction (Richtung) Nordhausen on your sign :)

name: Anonymous
comment: there is a small gasstation somewhere around here, it is a good spot to get to Nordhausen or better yet on to the highway 38, I found it very nice hitchhiking on countryroads like this on.

name: Anonymous
comment: there are not as many parking lots at the A38. I waited about an hour, but then I got a right directly to Leipzig, and there are trucks pulling over, too. So if you go around and ask, I think it is definetly possible to get away.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Many different options to try here, but not very quick (direction Münster). You can try talking to people at the Aral service station, but many of them will be local traffic. Also, the Dutch cars all seemed pretty senseless, as the only reason for them to go there was for cheap gas, after which they would drive back to The Netherlands.

I eventually got a ride to Münster after about 1,5 hours standing next to the B67 close to the traffic lights (not at the exit/onramp, but the crossing of Bocholter Strasse/Im Geer). People are driving slowly because of the lights and there is a reasonably sized hard shoulder for them to stop on. All in all a pretty decent spot, but with a lot of local traffic.

name: Anonymous
comment: Gas station and a Burger King. Spot for both directions - towards Munich and Lindau.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Direction CHAM - PLZEN.

Bretelle d'entrée du 22 voies.
Trafic calme.
Place suffisante pour s'arrêter.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bus stop on B6. Seems like a decent spot in direction east (Bad Harzburg, Vienenburg, Wernigerode). Most traffic only goes to Goslar though.

name: Anonymous
comment: On-ramp on B6 in direction Bad Harzburg/Vienenburg. Not so much traffic but nice place to stand.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bus stop, direction Bad Harzburg.

name: Anonymous
comment: Towards Torfhaus/Braunlage. Hard shoulder.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bus stop. Towards Torfhaus/Braunlage.

name: Anonymous
comment: B4 towards Braunschweig/Goslar. No hard shoulder, but people will stop. Sign might be useful. Lots of local traffic to Goslar.

name: Anonymous
comment: On-ramp 57, Braunschweig-east. Direction Hannover. No hard shoulder, but autohof nearby should give some long distance traffic.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Bretelle d'acces a une 2X2 voies.

Trafic local. Il vous sera facil de vous faire prendre pour ULM.

En revanche, pour aller direction STTUTGART ou MUNICH par l'A8, ce sera fort difficile.

name: Anonymous
comment: At the junction. Fast traffic and no space. Terrible spot.

name: Anonymous
comment: A group of 3 got a ride almost to Redensburg here. (09.2014)

name: Anonymous
comment: I am always hitchhiking from this spot, never waited longer than 30 min., even when I had a berad and it was a rainy evening

name: Anonymous
comment: nice spot to get to schopfheim; never waited longer than 5 min.

name: Anonymous
comment: good spot to get to schopfheim. my shortcut for not taking the train via basel...

name: Anonymous
comment:
Direction Bremen, Hanover, Hamburg, Osnabrück

Most cars go into Bremen, however.

name: Anonymous
comment: Petrol station. Got a lift northwards within 10 minutes (after waiting for 30 minutes on the spot with the traffic lights.)

name: Anonymous
comment: You have to go with thumb. Traffic is average. This place is a good option to get on the highway but not for getting a long distance ride.

name: Anonymous
comment: This is the Authof Aurach, the resting place further east is called Frankenhöhe and seems like a much better place, as the big resting places usually are better than any "Authof" some way off the highway. Haven't tried it though!

name: Anonymous
comment: Maybe not the safest, but the roundabout has enough room on the side to let cars and even trucks pull over to let you get in. If you stand before the exit you need to take the ones going in your direction (Autobahn) will be slow. Works even in the dark, though that certainly is not advisable!

name: Anonymous
comment:
Okay if you want to go east along the lake (Überlingen, Highway to Stuttgart etc.). 
Most people are locals, so having a sign and standing at the entrance to the station can help to get the attention of people going further.

name: Anonymous
comment: Trying to hitch South I finally got a car going to the next gas station (Ellwangen). It's not perfect,m mostly locals, but it'll do.

name: Anonymous
comment: Just before the bridge, B220 direction Kleve. Hard shoulder.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Standing next to the traffic lights where the cars need to stop.
The red light is pretty short so I guess it's better to stay a little before where there are still 3 lanes instead of just the two. Either way it worked after around 35 min …

name: Anonymous
comment:
It felt like the best spot in the direction of Berlin.
The roundabout has quite some light, so hitching from here works even when it's already dark.

name: Anonymous
comment: There is a large area where that forms a bus stop, easy for cars to see you and pullover.

name: Anonymous
comment: Large and very busy service station. Obviously, a lot of traffic here is local and stays in the Ruhr area. Nonetheless, there is a fair amount of Dutch cars and others heading for The Netherlands.

name: Anonymous
comment: This is a small gas station on the A5 highway that is the main road to north from Basel. Everyone that wants to get north fast and needs gas starting from Basel will stop here.

name: Anonymous
comment: Here's a petrol station near the road. Not many cars, so talk to any people you see, especially if you want to go east. Because of the speed limit of 70 here, it's also a good option to stand next to the road, but only if you want to go west.

name: Anonymous
comment: Here's a good spot to talk to people to get out of the city, just ask people at the petrol station, most of them are going on the highway in any direction. If you're not succesful, just go a few meters west to one of the next spots.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Very good spot to hitch out of the town and to go south towards Dortmund/ Düsseldorf or to go further south.
Took me around 10 minutes the first time and for the second try, it was the first guy I asked!

name: Anonymous
comment: Sieg - monument, Richtung Flughafen

name: Anonymous
comment: This spot is very difficult to reach (we were dropped off here from the airport), it's quite loud because it's next to the highway and it might not be ideal for drivers to make a stop. There is not a lot of cars coming from Nürtingen, but a lot of them coming from the other lane. It's possible for drivers to stop because the place you will be standing on is a reserved area for cars to pull over marked with white paint, but the problem is that the busy lane will have a lot of cars driving quite fast. All in all this spot should be used only in need.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Towards Ulm/B30 
Place yourself in front of the Shell gas station - it never takes more than 10-15 minutes.

name: Anonymous
comment:
know some people who got a hike within 30 minutes. 
It´s better during the week due to commuting students and university stuff.

name: Anonymous
comment: well, it worked. eventually.

name: Anonymous
comment: well, the problem is all these danish cars were totally filled with beers and sodas. otherwise would be good

name: Anonymous
comment: gas station, a lot of trucks

name: Anonymous
comment: gas station, not far from the airport

name: Anonymous
comment: This is a good spot to get western on the A70. You can walk to this parking lot within 15Min from "Unterbrücklein" - that's a bus station that you can reach from Kulmbach and Bayreuth.

name: Anonymous
comment: This is a good spot to get western from Bamberg. You can go by bus (907) to Drosendorf and walk to this parking lot from there. It took me 1h in total to get here from Bamberg - quite fair I think.

name: Anonymous
comment: There aren't many cars stopping on the parking and I waited for almost two hours. When holding a shield 100m before the parking I got picked up within 10 min.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Autohof Apen-Remels. Lots of locals.
There is a big truck parking and a restaurant.
In case you can't get away at all, there is also busses going towards Leer/Groningen and Oldenburg/Bremen who stop here.

name: Anonymous
comment:
at the red light: To go to Potsdam, Leipzig( A115) or A100 for exemple. 
you have to a bit quick because the light is not very long but , there is a lot of cars:

name: Anonymous
comment: a little bit before the line entering to mc donalds place, you can stay on the side of the road. there is a lighta bit before so if you have a big sign they can already see you and decide. plus it is a place where the metal barrier stop and some people turn around   so they go very slow at that point: good to go into Leipzig

name: Anonymous
comment: Nach

name: Anonymous
comment:
By the side of the road on the on-ramp to the B2R / bridge. Not a very good place for cars to stop! 
It still worked for me, even in the dark - but that's not recommended.

name: Anonymous
comment: "Rasthof Lechwiesen", a highway service station.

name: Anonymous
comment: Last Aral gas station out of Kehl.

name: Anonymous
comment: Roundabout, forests and fields. No lights at night!

name: Anonymous
comment: Turn-off lane seems to be the only place in Villingen, where cars on the B33 have the option of stopping. Not perfect, traffic is very fast, but at least cars can exit to pick you up.

name: Anonymous
comment: Turning lane and traffic lights - cars stop. Visibility is pretty good.

name: Anonymous
comment: Naja

name: Anonymous
comment: Tanke ist ganz ok

name: Anonymous
comment: Directly at the ramp. In both directions not much space for cars to pullover. Lots of traffic, though.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Directly on the bridge/ramp onto highway A3. Both directions possible. West easier then east, because cars can pullover more easily. Much traffic, not muc space to pullover.

Also two police cars went past but did not bother me.

name: Anonymous
comment: the gas station Shell. didn't really worked for me... i waited for an our to get a lift to A44.. may be it was just bad luck

name: Anonymous
comment: Very nice place for hitchhiking to Dresden. waited just for 15 minutes. you are visible for cars coming from every side. there is a distance between you and street light, so cars can stop for a couple of minutes. worked well for me

name: Anonymous
comment: Cars coming down the B482 could stop here at the intersection to pick you up. The cars are driving quite fast (50 - 70 km/h). Cars can see you very early. I don't have any experience with this place myself, a guy who was going to the train station saw us, and then decided to go by car rather than train, to help us

name: Anonymous
comment: On a Wednesday morning there are not a lot of cars, but some. They are slow, have place to stop, and you can be seen from far. Good Conditions.

name: Anonymous
comment: Classic Service Area. Good Conditions.

name: Anonymous
comment: Found someone to take us to the netherlands in a reasonable time. Traffic was low on a wednesday morning. Close case whether average or good.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good spot to hit the road to the west!!!

name: Anonymous
comment: B27 towards Herzberg (and Duderstadt). Bus stop with place for people to stop, just after the traffic lights.

name: Anonymous
comment: L530 towards Herzberg. Slow traffic, but seemed hard to catch a ride.

name: Anonymous
comment: L85 towards B6/Bad Harzburg. Bus stop.

name: Anonymous
comment: B6 on-ramp Stapelburg, direction Goslar/Braunschweig. Not so much traffic at this on-ramp.

name: Anonymous
comment: On-ramp 66 on A7. Good for rides direction Hildesheim, to the next petrol station.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good description on the site to reach this gasstation. Good place to hitchhike. I waited for 20 minutes on a rainy monday before I found a ride to Frankfurt.

name: Anonymous
comment: petrol station ESSO. Lot of locals but still some people going to hamburg. I got away after 20 minutes.

name: Anonymous
comment: In the wiki Grenzallee is mentioned but it seems really hard for the car to slow down and see you, so by walking through the highway (some part are kinda tricky) it's possible to reach this place. (if there are any other ways please add it). there is a red light on the bridge which is perfect place to hitch a ride!!

name: Anonymous
comment: big stop for cars with restaurant and gas station

name: Anonymous
comment: Quite good spot to go in Direction of Uelzen, but we poorly failed in direction Soltau (Motorway). After 1h we took a lift to Uelzen.

name: Anonymous
comment: A good spot in direction to Dresden. We stayed there only 5-10 minutes and got a ride directly to Dresden. A lot of cars are passing by, even on holidays. Just don't forget to stay before the gas station as it's better for drivers to stop there.

name: Anonymous
comment: Dresden can become a real challenge for those of us who are trying to get to Berlin from  Prague or vice versa. You need to be really lucky and positive to get a ride from here. There is a bus stop just after the Technical University, so you can stand there with a sign. Fortunately we got a ride after 10 minutes even though it was rainy and there were three of us. Stay strong, guys! And good luck!

name: Anonymous
comment: To get out of Dresden in direction to Berlin, you should definitely try this spot. You need to take a train from Dresden-Neustadt to Dresden-Trachau and to walk for 15 minutes (streets An der Durren Heide and Heulander Strase). There is a traffic light and cars come in waves. They can easily see you and it's easy to make eye contact with drivers. We got  a ride after 10 minutes.

name: Anonymous
comment: That's your spot, when you want to go to the Autobahn in Soltau. Not that many cars as the Bus stop at Scharnhorststrasse, but it works.

name: Anonymous
comment: Raststatte Rohnetal Nord

name: Anonymous
comment: Exit on the A6. Really easy to go to Hersbruck and join the B14,

name: Anonymous
comment: A lot of local cars. Hard to know wich one take the A9 or not. Most of the people don't drive far, so don't use a sign.

name: Anonymous
comment: For A3 direction Würzburg/Frankurt. A little place to stop. A lot of people go on the A3. But few stop. Ask direct the driver who are waiting at the light.

name: Anonymous
comment: A3 direction Würzburg / Frankfurt. Few cars. Mostly locals. Ask the drivers waiting at the red light to drop you off at the next rest area on the hightway.

name: Anonymous
comment:
A good spot to go direction Würzburg / Frankfurt.
My lift took me even up North to Wuppertal.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bus Stop. Spot to go to the citycenter

name: Anonymous
comment:
I was willing to go south. It was very easy by asking people at the patrol station. Where they are going. Once I got a lift directly to Bremen and an other time it took me app. 15 min to get a lift to Hannover.

I also tried it with a sign at the close by traffic light. This seems to be a wast of time (app 45 min and than I gave up because it is not so easy for cars to stop directly afterwards)

name: Anonymous
comment: Good spot to go to A96 via B17. Waited 5 min. for a hitch to A96!

name: Anonymous
comment: Good spot to Benediktbeuern - then to Bad Tölz or Weilheim. Shady place and lots of cars!

name: Anonymous
comment: Slow cars after roundabout. good for Eschwege, Treffurt, Kassel, Goettingen

name: Anonymous
comment:
Petrolstation Fuchsberg

Good place if you want to go to Stralsund or Greifswald. If you want to go there this is the last place with a little bit more traffic and a petrol station.

name: Anonymous
comment:
There is a Shell-gastation, with cars going to A2 direction west and east.
500 meters forward is another aral-gasstation.

name: Anonymous
comment: On-ramp at Tegel airport. Not a good spot, but high up on the on-ramp is a hard shoulder and with all the traffic passing there must be someone stopping.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Bus stop close to main train station and university for applied sciences.
Very good spot to hitchhike South towards the A73. I got a ride to Nuremberg within 10 minutes.

name: Anonymous
comment: Opposite the Gas station is a pedestrian walk along the road. Cars can pull in at the entrance to a parking area. If you don't want to ask people at the station, this spot is perfect. Mainly local traffic, getting to Bad Tölz works quite well, probably Miesbach,too.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Outside the graveyard on the pedestrian path. 
Maybe just luck, but we waited less than 5 minutes for a ride.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Ok to get to the A8 at Irschenberg, or to Miesbach. 
There is a lane for cars turning right that allows pulling over, and drivers waiting at the light some way back can already see you.

name: Anonymous
comment: After the roundabout exit towards Weyarn is  a gravelroad that allows cars to pull over. Not perfect, but works. If you're trying to get to the A8 it might be better to find a spot before the roundabout as it is hard to stop after.

name: Anonymous
comment: Rest Stop "Jura".

name: Anonymous
comment: I tried to get to Berlin from Aarhus and here I got lift directly to Berlin after some 45 mins.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bus stop after a round about. Perfect for getting longer rides with a sign.

name: Anonymous
comment: Not the best spot to get to Dresden, but we wait just 20 min.

name: Anonymous
comment: Rest stop "Ellwanger Berge".

name: Anonymous
comment: Good place to hitchhike to Poland, a the entrance of a gas station

name: Anonymous
comment: An dieser Stelle kann man wunderbar Richtung Döbeln los trampen! Die Autos sind durch ein 30er-Schild und einen Blitzer gebremst und können gut halten.

name: Anonymous
comment: There is a little bus stop next to a crossing with traffic lights. Cars have to slow down and there is space to stop the car. Relatively good chances to get a lift for direction Coesfeld

name: Anonymous
comment: Best spot in the area towards Mannheim. Stand right at the "no pedestrians" sign. Make a sign here. There is only a small area to stop just behind the sign, so not a fantastic spot, but it will work. A campervan stopped within a few minutes for me. I had a sign "M'Heim''.

name: Anonymous
comment:
there is a peterol station where i find someone to hitch directly in the direction to anklam but the position form the station looks more easy in the direction southside. 

p.s. the countryside is very nice to be with a longboard ;)

name: Anonymous
comment: You got to be very lucky to catch here, but sometimes it works!

name: Anonymous
comment:
Very good place. I Waited 15 min to go to Dortmund. 
When I came at this place, I met another person who wants to go to Hamburg and she wanted just 10min

name: Anonymous
comment: Good place if you want to go Essen or to the West. I wanted 20min. This exactly place is very secure.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Good place if you want to go to the direction of the Netherlands. Cars drive not fast and there are a place to stop. I recommand this place who's secure ;)
I waited 20min on Monday

name: Anonymous
comment: Senseless spot for going north. Not much traffic at this gasoline station.

name: Anonymous
comment:
If you come from this or the other side of the Rhine(Rhein), you can use this place to go to the A3. You can walk from the ferry in the direction to A3 up to the mountain in the direction 'Aegidienberger Wald' or 'Rottbitze', and you can stay at all places on the way. Walk and take your thumb up or better your carton if you pass by a car.

The farry cost 0,90€ for one person. If you sitting in the car as a co-driver, you pay, too. 
http://www.rheinfaehre-linz-remagen.de/
the first goes at 6am and the last at 12pm.

maybe you can ask the people in the cars on the ferry of they going in the near to A3.

In the other directiion, you can arrive from the A3 and go to the other side of the river or the places in the near but you can't find a biger freeway in the near. just federal-roads.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Walk past the traffic lights and round the entry road. It's not perfect as some cars accelerate hard but it's possible.

As traffic coming from nearby towns is very light, you need to be here so you get all traffic combined together otherwise you risk waiting ages if you wait at traffic lights.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Spot for the direction of Dresden or Cottbus. 
As our driver said it's not a main route to Dresden.
Rather good place to stop for cars.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Route to Berlin.
Cars could stop in the little lay-by here or on the lane for turning.

name: Anonymous
comment: Just behind the Campus of the University. People see you at the traffic light. Not much place to stop, but some driveways, for those who don't want to stop at the road.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bus stop just behind a traffic light. 2 lanes, cars are going fast.

name: Anonymous
comment: After 30 minutes of waiting, got a ride to  Nurnberg

name: Anonymous
comment: This is the entrance for some companies with a relative good place for cars to stop, but it might be better to try to find another place. The cars are relatively fast, the place is not soo big to park but it took me 15 min to get out of there.

name: Anonymous
comment: This is the entrance for some companies with a relative good place for cars to stop, but it might be better to try to find another place. The cars are relatively fast, the place is not soo big to park but it took me 15 min to get out of there.

name: Anonymous
comment: Not bad to hitchhike towards Osnabrück and Paderborn (A33) or Direction Hannover or Dortmund (A2). A lot of Cars are not driving towards the highway but some do. Enough space to stop.

name: Anonymous
comment: Traffic lights. Not the best but fine.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bus stop for lazy hitchhikers.

name: Anonymous
comment: Shitty place.

name: Anonymous
comment: Not the best place direction North.

name: Anonymous
comment: Roundabout. Probably the best direction CZ.

name: Anonymous
comment: Of course not the best place (drivers come through that curve, so they see you late...many go to Ingolstadt) - try to take the first one who brings you to a service area.

name: Anonymous
comment: Saturday morning destination Netherlands. Few cars avaible when it is red and no space to stop when it is green. And many cars stay in Cologne.

name: Anonymous
comment: Towards Linz (Austria) along the Danube valley. Waited less than 5'.

name: Anonymous
comment: To Passau. Still slow trafic.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very good spot! Never waited more than 15 minutes. I hitchhiked from here to Dortmund several times and most times I got a direct lift to my destination. :-)

name: Anonymous
comment:
There's already a path through the bushes ...and on the pole of the street light/sign (can't remember) is a sticker which sais "official hitchhiking spot" :D
If you've read the hitchwiki article option 2 is a very good choice :-)
The ants are still there, so be nice to them ;)

name: Anonymous
comment:
probably this spot was meant to be at the nearby parking which is on the other side of the motorway.It's called Kolberg and even so there's no service or gas station it is a good point to hitchhike. If you're coming from this area it's best to ask a friend to drive you there to start hitchhiking. A lot of people stop there due to traffic which is always high in this area.
It will not be a problem to find a direct lift to the ring of Berlin or even further to poland etc.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good spot to get started or continue on the a2! There's no gas station or service station but due to high traffic it's no problem at all. A lot of people stop there and you will easily find a lift to the ring of Berlin or even further on to Poland etc.

name: Anonymous
comment: Nice spot with moderate car traffic and theres a place to stop. Some CZE drivers driving to home from work (Plzeň) and some of GER drivers drive out for cheap alcohol and cigarettes near borders presumably, so I recommend someone who will take you directly in some bigger city. Its nice city, I recommend take a rest here, small so 1 hrs. should be ok to see all of stuff here.

name: Anonymous
comment: You can get here by BUS n.10 (get out in the Cranachweg/Kowe station, price 2.30E) Theres place where a car can stop and when red come on lights, safely can return back on slip road. Stay near sidewalk cos cars coming from both sides so you can better show your paper-signs.

name: Anonymous
comment: Cars are not too fast yet, you are visible and there is enough space to pull over. Lifts are going at least  to the next service station WATTENHEIM (7km), and if not rides to Kaiserslautern/Saarbrücken/France are possible. Sign is not necessary at all. So far, my waiting time varied from 5 - 30 minutes.

name: Anonymous
comment: You can ask in the gasstation and also wait next the big street. Good place for travel on the B169/168 in direction Frankfurt (Oder)

name: Anonymous
comment: Quit a lot of speace for hold, we traveled from this spot directly to Frankfurt (Oder)

name: Anonymous
comment: Tried to get to the centre. But nobody just stopped.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great place for traveling direction to Munich. Got a ride in 15 minutes.

name: Anonymous
comment: Worked for me while hitchhiking to Stettin. Long traffic lights before entering the motorway, shitload of cars (1pm)

name: Anonymous
comment: might be good, because of being already on the motorway, I guess any parking by the berliner ring is busy. haven't be there though

name: Anonymous
comment: A good spot for finding somebody going past the gas station Dammer Berge West. Cars have enough space to stop on the right side before entering the highway ramp.

name: Anonymous
comment: Not a lot of people park here, and the traffic on the motorway is going too fast. Your best bet is to find somebody who will bring you to the highway entries towards Hamburg or Osnabrück

name: Anonymous
comment:
we found a car for 30 km to Netherlands.
there is a small place but cars see you from far away and have some place to stop.

name: Anonymous
comment: If you're heading towards Salzburg this spot is better than the petrol station because many locals use it. There isn't much room for cars to pull over but in the space of one hour two cars stopped and offered us a lift. (The second of which we took)

name: Anonymous
comment: Parking bay close to the main trainstation. People can pull into the entrance of the parking spot to let you in. Good to get towards the A81

name: Anonymous
comment: Room to stop because of the parking lot.

name: Anonymous
comment: People can pull in at the gas station.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Neckarburg-West

Good to get to Singen, harder to find someone going to Constance or Lindau.

name: Anonymous
comment: Esso station. Maybe a sign helps here, a lot of local commuters.

name: Anonymous
comment: End up in this village totally randomly after walking few kilometers from the gas station at the south, and finally got a lift pretty quickly.

name: Anonymous
comment: Perfect spot to get out of Zwickau towards the A4 highway as the traffic light is red for a long time. Stand at the space next to the turn-left-lane with a sign that says A4.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bus stop in front of round-about. OK for getting on the A4 highway or into Zwickau if you've been dropped off at the highway exit. Having a sign with A4 and DD (east), EF (west), or Z (Zwickau) helps.

name: Anonymous
comment: Don't let yourself be dropped off at this highway exit. Cars turning left onto the A4 might be easier than hose turning right.

name: Anonymous
comment: I was waiting at the bus stop with a sign LUX, good spot in my opinion

name: Anonymous
comment: Grünstreifen ganz ok aber sehr Zeiten abhänig die ganze Gegend

name: Anonymous
comment:
Maybe it is better to try out the gas station first - tried this spot one time and it took me nearly an hour. Only two guys stopped.
There is a lot of traffic coming from the city. Just stand at the crosswalk near the traffic lights. Behind you, there is a bus station where the cars can stop without any danger.

name: Anonymous
comment: Truck Stop, so maybe not the best on sunday.

name: Anonymous
comment: Fairly good place, visible.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Direction Ramersbach/Kempenich.

Very few cars passing but it's the most visible spot with slow traffic.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Direction Kempenich.

Very few cars but a clear, visible spot. Locals are very helpful.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Direction Nürburg.

Good traffic, cars going quite fast but the spot is very visible (use a sign!).

name: Anonymous
comment:
Direction Munich.

Enough place for cars to pull over, very visible, good traffic.

name: Anonymous
comment: Direction Ga-Pa.

name: Anonymous
comment: Direction Munich.

name: Anonymous
