comment: Good place for the south Germany, good place to Oberstdorf.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good place for Oberstdorf.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good place to Oberstdorf

name: Anonymous
comment: Aral gas station a pretty good spot to get out to one of the rest stops south of Munich.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Good to very good spot to leave the island.
2 times hiked there, first time only waited 1 min. second time 10 min.

name: Anonymous
comment: Here you will get all cars and tracks leaving the parking. You can even sit on the grass, becouse there are not many cars here but all of them are going for minimun +100 km distance.

name: Anonymous
comment: The spot is a bus line where lots of cars pass by. Ideal for hitchhiking on A81 that close to the city crosses with A8 (Karlsruhe / München) and goes on to Stuttgart. I've checked for Karlsruhe and it went very well (<15min).

name: Anonymous
comment: I hitchhiked here towards France, then an guy from the Airbase took me for 15 kilometers to the next petrol station, which was a great choice! :)

name: Anonymous
comment: Very good place towards FRANCE or Saarbrücken. I got a ride directly to PARIS after 1 hour waiting time! :]

name: Anonymous
comment: This place is REALLY good. First off, I was dropped off there pretty late at night and I could find plenty of room to sleep. If it's raining, you can explore the motel area, where you can find a nice pedestrian bridge linking two buildings one to another, and I slept just beneath it. The next day, it took me 10 mins to find a direct ride to Verona, in Italy.

name: Anonymous
comment: just a few meters from the aral and jet station there is a traffic light where most cars wanting to go north on the A1 have to spot. The spot is a little creepy, bcos there is a gap in the bridge and you can see the cars passing underneath you :) but its the best spot going north, in my opinion!

name: Anonymous
comment: Shell station on Heidenkampsweg. You can stand just before the station (couple of driveways there). Very good spot (almost THE spot) for A1, A7, A25 south- or eastbound.

name: Anonymous
comment: There's plenty of space for cars to pull over, but not much traffic, waited about 1.5 hours to get a ride to the A9

name: Anonymous
comment: Small commuters parking next to the motorway's on-ramp. Easy for people waiting at the light to see you. Not much room to stop, though, just the on ramp itself.

name: Anonymous
comment: Shell Gas station

name: Anonymous
comment: This is a great spot if you need a ride to wards nuremberg. Been there for a couple of times and it has always been a good spot.  You can also walk toward the parking spot from the local super market and try your luck there.

name: Anonymous
comment: Quite good spot, but be aware that there are probably not as many cars driving by.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very good going north, senseless going south.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bus Stop direct after an intersection, average but probably the best option for getting out of Sonthofen.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good to get to the autobahn.

name: Anonymous
comment:
I always send my guests to this place (Parkplatz Varrelheide) and they all said it was great. 

To reach it take a tram to Noltemeyerbrücke and from there Bus 631 until "An den Deichwiesen" if you travel eastwards or a stop further until "Franz-Steineke-Weg" if you want to travel towards west.

name: Anonymous
comment: A place on the Debkauer Strasse in the direction of Senftenberg/Dresden. Plenty of space for drivers to pull over.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bus stop: Härtensdorfer Weg; Take Bus Nr. 141 from Zwickau Zentrum (Price 1 Zone 2€).

name: Anonymous
comment: Big gas station with restaurants and other facilities. Big traffic. Going to Hamburg or north to Schlezwig- Holstein.

name: Anonymous
comment: Not so good for hitchhiking because of no place to stop the car. Risky.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Really good spot for A4 traffic, not so great for A72. There is a lot of space to pull over, but most traffic isn't going very far.

And as much as I love my Heimat.. (I don't) :D People can be quite dickish towards foreigners here...

name: Anonymous
comment: stand at the traffic light with a sign Citycenter ("Stadtmitte"or "Zentrum") Walk up to the cars while they wait.. Worked for me :) I'm lazy. You could just walk :D

name: Anonymous
comment: Nice spot towards Annaberg. There is a bus stop and the traffic is fairly slow. Only problem is that a lot of the cars are not going very far. Who the fuck want's to go to Annaberg anyway? :D

name: Anonymous
comment: Bus stop at the B95. Pretty good towards Chemnitz. Takes a while still, but that's because it's Erzgebirge. People around here are quite... isolated :D

name: Anonymous
comment: For direction Friedrichshafen you can either try right after roundabout or walk a bit further to the straight road before it meets the highway. Was there on two occasions and both spots were successful after about 30 minutes. I'm thinking it's the best road spot to leave Meersburg. Maybe hitching right off the ferry could work too...

name: Anonymous
comment: Great spot to leave Friedrichshafen in direction Lindau. After the bent and before the tunnel cars go slow and have lots of space to pull over  on an empty lane.

name: Anonymous
comment: Probably the best Spot in the Rendsburg Area. Parking lot and perfect highway approach will get you fast north and south (A7 to DK or Hamburg). The rual road (B203) works fine too, it brings you to the baltic sea (Eckernförde) or Rendsburg. Negative is the fact, that its pretty far out, about 6k from Rendsburg.

name: Anonymous
comment: Yust ask on the ferry or hitch on the dam... It will take you 5 seconds :)

name: Anonymous
comment: Good place to hitchike in the direction Bischofswerda & Dresden via road B6. The tempo is limited to 50 km/h and cars have the opportunity to stop at a Bus stop behind you. I was standing there for about 20 minutes till a driver gave me a ride to Dresden.

name: Anonymous
comment: Lots of shopping tourists that come just from the big Globus marked opposit the street. Most of the cars going home after shopping, not far away. I tried it but I didn't feel comfortable. Finally I changed to the other petrol station, where less people went longer distances.

name: Anonymous
comment: Definitely the better choice than the other petrol station. Less people than the other station, but at least it's not just the desperate shopping housewifes who also need to fuel their car. If you pass by this area, I'd recommend you that petrol statin, maybe even mixed with an handwritten panel.

name: Anonymous
comment: Small road, make a sign since many drivers don't go far from here. A lady going to Reken took a pity on us, seeing the empty road, and took us to our destination, Borken.

name: Anonymous
comment: A lay-by for the cars to stop. Lots of local traffic, only managed to get a ride to nearby Bocholt while trying to go to NL.

name: Anonymous
comment: Lots of space for the cars to stop. Not a good solution though if you want to head to NL from here.

name: Anonymous
comment: Fine amount of traffic heading towards the border. The cars can stop on the grass by the bike lane.

name: Anonymous
comment:
After waiting 1h30 to the gas station we decided to move to that place because everybody there goes on the highway leading east. Wait on the zebras, there is also a lot of place for the cars to stop and people see you for far away
Waited a little bit less that 1h. A lots of people but not really opened to take hitchhikers, they looked astonished to see hitchhikers there.

name: Anonymous
comment: service area next to the motorway called "Shell Autohof Haiger" with affordable food and a lot of trucks plus other traffic from B54 and B277, good.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great spot for those who try to switch autobahn to go south. Just stand there with a sign on which you wrote the name of the city you are trying to get to. At first we tried to ask around but standing with the sign is better idea.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good spot to continue your road south. In my opinion Rasthof and Ratstatte are the two most important words in German for a hitchhiker

name: Anonymous
comment: not so many cars but not the worst place ever

name: Anonymous
comment:
A good spot if you want hitch on the A6. The cars are slow here.
To stand direct on the traffic light is not a good idea because the cars have no possibility to stop there.

name: Anonymous
comment:
There is lot of cars on this road.
But becarfull, in the evening, no cars will stop. We have to spend the night in the park on the other side.
But there is lot of space for the car to stop. And the next morning we found someone very quickly !

Morning : Very good
Evening : Bad

name: Anonymous
comment: Ok, I confess that I gave up after 30 mins, but there were absolutely no cars hitting the highway on a Thursday morning. Like a car every 5 mins or so, and no one stopped.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very good, but only as of November 13, 2015. The highway is being renovated here, so cars have to come to a complete stop before actually hitting the highway. There's a gas station 3 km down the highway, so I stood with a "3 KM" sign and a truck stopped, and actually drove me further than the gas station. I don't think such roadwork will last long, so think twice before hitchhiking here.

name: Anonymous
comment: Somewhat nice but kinda dangerous stop that will get you from highway 7 to 6. I meant to go east, but 90% of cars actually go west. Cars are really fast here, and pretty much everyone totally ignored me, so I ended up standing with a HELP sign, that worked after 40 mins. I got a direct ride to Munich

name: Anonymous
comment:
Good spot to go to Munich but also to A96 in direction of Lindau. There is a lot of space for cars to stop along the parking place. 

Best times to go to Munich are with the commuters in the morning and the returning weekend guests on Sunday evening. Many people can drop you at some S-Bahn or U-Bahn station in Munich so you can go to your final destination.

If you go in the direction of Lindau try to go at least a little further than Landsberg. (the gas station and Rastplatz "Lechwiesen" is shortly after Landsberg).

Try to avoid holidays or Sunday during the day as there might be no or little relevant traffic.

name: Anonymous
comment: There's an unused lane where cars (going 30-50 km/h) can stop easily. They drive towards Bad Segeberg, Lübeck or even Berlin.

name: Anonymous
comment: There's an unused lane where the cars (they drive 50 km/h) can stop easily. With a Kiel sign very easy. I have not tried the surrounding villages or Neumünster, but it should work.

name: Anonymous
comment: The Spot to go to Eckernförde (Eck). Stand in front of the bus station and waiting cars from all traffic lights will already see you.

name: Anonymous
comment: If you're going towards Dresden, this is the best spot in my experience. I tried the other spots before this, and there is nowhere for people to stop. Here, 6 cars stopped for me in 15 mins. I didn't have a sign, and one of these took me to Dresden - the rest were just going to the next town. The trick is to put your bags against the second pole/stake from the motorway sign, then stand to the left and in front of your bags. It's non threatening and people can see you. I tried other positions (behind pole) and it didn't work.

name: Anonymous
comment: Almost no car stops here because this isn't a gas station it's just a parking place.

name: Anonymous
comment: Most of the cars are locals and won't bring you to the highway

name: Anonymous
comment: Stood here on a Tuesday morning around 10 AM, trying to go towards Bremen on the A1. Not too much traffic, yet I only had to wait for 15min. Gas station gives excellent space for cars to stop, of course.

name: Anonymous
comment: Super spot, to get out of Freising! From here you can go to Allershausen and then hitch a lift on the A9 (Nürnberg/München). There are traffic lights and its good for cars to stop there.

name: Anonymous
comment: Best spot to get out of Teisendorf

name: Anonymous
comment: You can easily hitch at the entrance of the petrol station if you want to go to Passau. There are not many people stoping at the petrol station but if they do, you can go and ask them for a ride.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Great pleace direction to Bielefeld.
Traffic lght before the bridge. Waiting time to Detlmold was 40 min.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bus stop. Easy to get to Bielefeld.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great spot to get to Osnabrück. Traffic is slow after the roundabout. Not suitable to get Trucks.

name: Anonymous
comment: Rothenburg is a very beautiful village and accessible in hitch-hiking because it's touristic.

name: Anonymous
comment: Don't expect to be able to get a ride easily from here. Although there's a traffic light where cars coming from Wittenberg are actually able to reduce their speed, there's no space for them to stop and pick you up.

name: Anonymous
comment: January 2016: Although the B2 starts right next to Wittenberg's Old Town, it's nearly impossible to get a ride from there, as the driving speed starts already at 100km/h. There are not any crossings, roundabouts or bus stops where the drivers could possibly reduce the speed to pick you up. The first actual place where you could stand with your thumb up would be Eutzch, a little village 9km south from Wittenberg. You can walk there (it's a long walk and there's a sidewalk only in the first 5km) or take the bus 306, which runs from Wittenberg Hauptbahnhof once every hour.

name: Anonymous
comment: A ggod place to get a ride towards south (Leipzig). I just needed to wait a few minutes, even though it was already dark. The cars drive slowly, specially by the traffic light. You can walk here from Wittenberg (about 10km) or take the bus 306, which runs hourly.

name: Anonymous
comment: Easy to get a ride to Wittenberg. 5 min waiting time.

name: Anonymous
comment: Cars are coming of two directions. good amount of trafic. Enough space to pull over, but not too much.

name: Anonymous
comment: End of the service area. Cars are slow enough. Average amount of trafic.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Not legal. Police stopped me. Did not have too pay luckily. 
Enough space to pull over. People looked at me very confused. Should work out if Police does not interfere.

name: Anonymous
comment: Not too much space to pull over. Good amount of trafic.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Towards Rhynern. There you can enter the highway in direction east and west. 
Enough space. A lot of cars.

name: Anonymous
comment: In front of the hotel Maritim is a stop bay for cabs etc. Cars can stop safely. The road leads to the A5 and A67 both North and South and most drivers use this way to get onto the autobahn.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bus stop ca. 50 meters before the official hitchhiking spot. A lot of people do not go to Hamburg I guess. Good spot though.

name: Anonymous
comment: Opposite to a busy parking and enough time and space for cars to pull over! A lot of trafic to Kiel I guess, also enough to Hamburg.

name: Anonymous
comment:
well I think I were lucky, i got a lift in 5 min southwards!

this spot isn't so easy to reach as well. This parking place has no toilet. People won't stop there if it is urgent ;-)

name: Anonymous
comment:
great place to be dropped off, found immediately a ride to Munic :) 

(was on a Sunday)

name: Anonymous
comment: Directly in front of a bus stop. A lot of traffic, very busy. Maybe too busy.

name: Anonymous
comment: Basically a great spot. A lot of space, a good amount of traffic ... but the cars do not seem to realize how to pull over there.

name: Anonymous
comment: Sometimes not enough traffic, but a great spot though. Lot of space too pull over. Plus: In summertime you can pick pears.

name: Anonymous
comment: Tipical highway service area. Gas station, fast food and a restaurant. Good amount of traffic.

name: Anonymous
comment: A good amount of traffic to Werl and further. Enough space not it is not perfect.

name: Anonymous
comment: Enough space to pull over. Sometimes not a lot of cars. In summertime you can pick pears there.

name: Anonymous
comment: People will be confused to see you there, but other than that it is a fairly good spot.

name: Anonymous
comment: A lot of traffic, not too much space to pull over. People are not used to hitchhikers here.

name: Anonymous
comment: Fairly good amount of traffic, enough space to pull over. Most people will not go far.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good spot to go north towards Nürnberg, cars are really slow here and can stop easily. We waited 15 min, during this time 4 cars stopped going towards Regensburg. Number 5 took us to Nürnberg-Feucht.

name: Anonymous
comment: Waited on a cold Monday at 9.30. Wanted to get to east (sign with A2 -> Hannover). After 30min ride to rest station Rhynern on A2

name: Anonymous
comment: On ramp to the ring around Bochum (which is about to be turned into a highway). Not ideal to stop but it is possible and it does happen. Most drivers don't go far but they might take you to some gas station, for example Beverbach at A40 on the way to Dortmund.

name: Anonymous
comment: On ramp to A40 for people heading east, north or west. Lots of local traffic, but just ask your driver to drop you at the next gas station, for example Beverbach on the way to Dortmund.

name: Anonymous
comment: Gas station on A40 heading towards east.

name: Anonymous
comment: Rest station. JANUARY 2016 no way to get out of here.

name: Anonymous
comment: Not enough space to pull over. A lot of traffic.

name: Anonymous
comment: Slow cars, a good amount of vehicles.

name: Anonymous
comment: just local traffic, bad spot

name: Anonymous
comment: bus station, good amount of cars, a lot of taxis

name: Anonymous
comment: Theoretically enough space to pull over, but it seems that car driver do not realize that. traffic amount and pace are probably too high

name: Anonymous
comment: Busstop Direction Trier - Hitchhiking possible - direct lift to Trier very likely

name: Anonymous
comment: Well i choose this new spot as i already went to the parking of mac donald and speak to everyone with no luck , so basicky anyone who is going to the petrol station or mac donald can see me , just buy the grass standing with a sign , 1h30 min of wait to go to poznan , so i guess not bad !

name: Anonymous
comment: really really really bad if you get here late. restaurant closes at 9 pm...no gas station. better chose the Autohof some 60 km before.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bus stop direction Stockach / Bodensee or Ulm. Many cars were passing here on Friday 13:00. I recommend you to walk a bit in the opposit direction of the roundabout, just before the bus stop so cars can see you from afar (there is a turn right before the bus station and the cars can't see you very well)

name: Anonymous
comment: there is a place for cars to park under the bridge, not really the best place but it worked for me. Not so many cars, not so many friendly faces, cars are a bit too fast but they see you from a big distance. I was left here by another car.

name: Anonymous
comment: Parking place just after Überlingen. Not many cars stop here but there were loads of cars passing by, direction Lindau. I was left here by another car.

name: Anonymous
comment: Not the best place for cars to stop but, well, why not?

name: Anonymous
comment: Parking lot direction Immenstadt. Not many cars on friday afternoon but they are not really fast and they can see you from a big distance

name: Anonymous
comment: waited around 15 minutes by thumbeling and without any sign and got a lift directly to Munich. Pretty good spot, cars do not come so fast and can stop easily at subways restaurant.

name: Anonymous
comment: Autohof Koblenz

name: Anonymous
comment: Nimweger Straße, hard shoulder on the right side; dir. West to Nijmegen

name: Anonymous
comment: On-ramp for the highway 33 in direction Paderborn, Kassel. It was very unbusy when we tried it on a thursday evening. but that made it possible for the cars to stop on the on-ramp. It is rather spacious, but I do not think that it will work in the morning, when a lot of people use it to get to work.

name: Anonymous
comment: Enough space for cars to pull over. Might be less easy when it is busy. We tried it on  a Sunday morning and it worked sufficiently.

name: Anonymous
comment: Space is all right, but mostly local traffic.

name: Anonymous
comment: There is a little bay to pull over and enough traffic to get a ride in an acceptable time. A lot of local traffic as well though.

name: Anonymous
comment: If there is not too much traffic you should easily get a ride from here to Witzenhausen. People are friendly and open minded for hitchhiking here.

name: Anonymous
comment: A lot of traffic and a lot of space to pull over. Great spot. Will bring you to Göttingen on a federal road instead of the highway. Should not be more than 25 min. anyway.

name: Anonymous
comment: Not a lot of traffic. Space is all right, but far away from perfect.Better do not get off here.

name: Anonymous
comment: Not a lot of stopping space and low traffic. People are friendly, though.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good shoulder to pull over, but small town Bavarian people like to give weird looks rather than lifts.

name: Anonymous
comment: Hard place to pull over, and the local people aren't that bent on giving rides. Still by far not impossible.

name: Anonymous
comment: There's a really nice lay-by just before a non-pedestrian kind of road starts.

name: Anonymous
comment: there's a bit of a shoulder before the bridge, can't really stand at the on-ramp proper.

name: Anonymous
comment: not a great spot to stop, got a lucky ride to Berlin after about three minutes

name: Anonymous
comment: Hardly any stopping space and lots of traffic. A sign is a very good idea, maybe in Polish :-)

name: Anonymous
comment: The last station before Polish-German border. The are some Polish cars but we didnt have a luck trying get ride to Poland. There is also a few mostly Polish trucks but they all going west. In the end we get a ride to Zgorzelec while standing on the crossroads with a sign.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great place to go north. A gas station at the road leading to the highway. You can easily reach it by taking the tram untill the station "Bensheimer Straße". Most of the cars are leaving the station towards the north in the direction of Frankfurt or Darmstadt. Just ask for that direction. There are highway gas stations on the A67 and the A5 just 20 km away.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Not too much traffic so people have time to stop. If the drivers know what they are doing it should not be a big problem to stop. 
Mostly local traffic.

name: Anonymous
comment: Huge amount of traffic, a high percentage will not stay on the B1 though. This spot worked once and never since. The driver probably do not feel safe enough pulling over at this spot.

name: Anonymous
comment: Huge amount of traffic, a high percentage will not stay on the B1 though. This spot worked once and never since. The driver probably do not feel safe enough pulling over at this spot.

name: Anonymous
comment: Huge amount of traffic, a high percentage will not stay on the B1 though. This spot worked once and never since. The driver probably do not feel safe enough pulling over at this spot.

name: Anonymous
comment: A great spot. You can show a sign to the cars that are coming from the highway. The cars that are coming from direction Dortmund have to stop at the traffic lights. They can let you in while it is red, or the can drive on the parking of the fire fighters house.

name: Anonymous
comment: this is the road in direction of the B27 which you want to take if you want to go North towards Göttingen and the A7 or East towards Halle/Leipzig on the A38. Have a sign that says AUTOBAHN =)

name: Anonymous
comment: Here is a bus stop a couple meters before the highway entrance towards south.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bus stop near the hoghway entrance

name: Anonymous
comment: Most traffic heading to Berlin, but with some patience a ride going in a different direction can be found.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Spot for north, south, east. 
Some traffic and space to pick up.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good spot in the direction of Hamburg. Most cars go to Lüneburg, but some change here to the B4. Only 10 minutes of waiting next to the bus stop.

name: Anonymous
comment: very good spot to stop car to strasburg

name: Anonymous
comment: A lot of space to pull over. A lot of traffic, mostly local though. Good way to get to Werl.

name: Anonymous
comment: A good spot to get to Möhnesee and on the highway direction Dortmund. Nearly nobody will go in direction Kassel.

name: Anonymous
comment: Big on-ramp. Not a lot of traffic to Kassel though. Better spot would be further east.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great spot to get to Paderborn. A lot space to pull over and a good amount of traffic as well.

name: Anonymous
comment: A lot of space to pull over, most cars are rather fast. People seem not to feel very secure pulling over.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good spot to get to Erwitte. Also longer rides are possible, but there is a lot of local traffic.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good spot, lot of space to pull over and also a lot of traffic.

name: Anonymous
comment: On weekdays a great spot, on federal holidays not to recommend. A lot of old couples on the road then.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Direction Hamburg OR Kiel/Flensburg:
It is definitely not the best spot, because the cars are going quite fast but there is a lay-by where cars can stop easyly if they want to.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Good place if you want to go south or west in the direction of Nürnberg/München OR Erfurt/ Frankfurt/ Dortmund. 

Cars can stop easily in Ferdinand-Rhode-Straße.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Direction Dresden.

There are parking lots next to the street where cars can stop quite easily.

name: Anonymous
comment: This is just an intersection between a road and a local street. Not really much space for cars to park but they were pretty slow here.

name: Anonymous
comment: 2-6-2016, around waited around 20 minutes in a sunny day. I left around 15:00 and got a straight right to Amsterdam. Some intercity traffic, but the traffic light made it a perfect in between of a hitch-spot and parking-place/gas-station.

name: Anonymous
comment: 13-5-2016, Sunny day, me and my friend(young guys mid 20), we walked next to the trafic with a 'PL'-sign. Got a 200 km ride into Poland, the A2 direction to Poznań. No wait.

name: Anonymous
comment: Big gas station with loads of cars. This is a very famous place between the germans. There's a big gas station, big restaurant, big parking place.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good place to catch a car to leipzig

name: Anonymous
comment: Gas station just before Magdeburg on the A2 towards Berlin, just before the start of the A14 towards Halle and Leipzig

name: Anonymous
comment: Good place to catch a car to schongau in the evening. in that time not possible to get a lift from aral gas station  (no cars)

name: Anonymous
comment: Good traffic at night to get a ride from schongau.

name: Anonymous
comment: Small roads, easy hitchhiking.

name: Anonymous
comment: In bavarian small roads easy to get a lift

name: Anonymous
comment: It is easy to hitch in bayern

name: Anonymous
comment: was picked up on the crossroad while walking to the gas station (holding a sign) got directly to göttingen

name: Anonymous
comment:
when someone dropped you off the autobahn here, you can hitchhike here towards Ulm/City!

Just go with every car which brings you closer to the city. Maybe you need two short rides.

name: Anonymous
comment: A good spot to get to Trier, but a bad one to get on the motorway and further.

name: Anonymous
comment: There is a small space for cars to pull over before the on-ramp. But there are not too many cars entering the higway.

name: Anonymous
comment: bus station, cars passed by in direction of Langen

name: Anonymous
comment: bus station, cars pass by in the direction of Langen and Darmstadt

name: Anonymous
comment: Not that good place for hitch direction Freiberg. There is no place at the road shoulder, we had to stand at the side street. Anyway, a car pulled over after approx. 25 min. and the driver took us at least to next village.

name: Anonymous
comment: After 5 min. a driver took us directly to Freiberg.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Good spot to get out of Freiburg towards Neustadt-Titisee, Donaueschingen and perhaps even Konstanz. I had to go to Tübingen and people stopped offering a ride for part of the way, which was great!
Didn't wait 5 min to get a ride!

name: Anonymous
comment: You might be lucky to find someone heading towards Stuttgart (North) or towards Freiburg (South). I talked directly to a driver who was fueling his car and was heading towards Stuttgart.

name: Anonymous
comment: There is a bus stop (first bus stop when you walk from the airport). I waited there for 2 minutes and car stopped to take me north (towards Dusseldorf). But I would recommend making a sign becase cars can go from there to many directions. good luck!

name: Anonymous
comment: Saturday 19:00 (football night) almost no cars going to CZ. dont waste time here and walk straight to the rest place on the highway, it's only 2 km. there we hitchhike the first car passing by and went straight to Prague.

name: Anonymous
comment: The last place where you can a highway stamp for the Czech highways. Even on Saturday, football evening there were a lot of cars, and the first car stopped for us and took us all the way to Prague.

name: Anonymous
comment: Two guys waited here about 20 mins, and got a ride to a gas station to Rosenheim. Most of the cars here go only to Rosenheim. You might walk 2.5 km to a gas staion along the highway, but I think there's no need.

name: Anonymous
comment: On-ramp to the A7. Nearly no cars from the north of the K206, but enough from the south/ronud-a-bout. There is a cherry tree!

name: Anonymous
comment: If you are heading to Göttingen via the countryroad or want to go to the nearby villages this is a good spot.

name: Anonymous
comment: People can stop, but they are quite fast.

name: Anonymous
comment: Not a great amount of traffic, but still okay to get away.

name: Anonymous
comment: Standing at the bus parking on the side of the road works fine for getting to the highway. I guess chances are higher here than at the gas station, because there are a lot of cars on the road, but just little on the gas station.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very small parking and most of the people will continue on the A71.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good spot to get to Kassel as many cars head in that direction. For going further south, north or west it is more difficult. If you want to go west ask for a ride to the Exit Wilhelmshöhe on the A44. That spot is basically still in Kassel. From there you can easily hitchhike to Dortmund and further.

name: Anonymous
comment: There is small area right after the traffic light where cars are able to stop. The area is actually ment for trucks to turn around, but is not frequently used.

name: Anonymous
comment: Past the bridge in rua do Catete, right by the lane where cars slow down. Usual spot for locals hitching Ouro_Preto

name: Anonymous
comment: Many people are going south and north, not just to Saarbrucken, but it's the last restaurant before Kaiserslautern. After some 45 minutes a girl brought us to the spot on the exit number 10 - Aral station from where a guy took us directly to Paris.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great spot if you are hitchhiking to Paris. After a little snack we were walking to the spot and a guy called us and took us to Paris.

name: Anonymous
comment: Not so frequented gas station (not on sundays at least .)) but one of the best spots from Mannheim in direction to Saarbrucken - Paris.

name: Anonymous
comment: Stucked heading Netherlands

name: Anonymous
comment: Great place to hitchhike toward Heide. Me and my friend were waiting maybe 30 minutes maybe not.

name: Anonymous
comment: It is easy to get into Essen or other Ruhrgebiet-Cities, but everything further than that is pretty tough. Traffic is okay, but no great.

name: Anonymous
comment: Not a lot of space to pull over - would not recommend this spot.

name: Anonymous
comment: As on the other side not a lot of space, but we managed to get away. Caused a small traffic jam though. Better not get off here.

name: Anonymous
comment: Nice-sized on-ramp. People can stopp. Problem is rather that there is a lot of local traffic.

name: Anonymous
comment: Not a good spot to get to Trier or further. Easy to get on the A8 in both directions.

name: Anonymous
comment: At the moment (July 2016) there are big construction works, therefore it is not used as it would without. Normally it should be a decent service area.

name: Anonymous
comment: Not too much space for pulling over, but it is fine. Works best if there is not too much traffic.

name: Anonymous
comment: bus stop on B7 towards Kassel or Eschwege. Also works for going to Treffurt if you have a sign.

name: Anonymous
comment: Took me like 15 minutes to get a lift to Bad Hersfeld. The street is straight and the passing cars are not too fast and many cars also come from the side streets. So a good spot to get seen and cars can easily pull over on the "ramp" without disturbing other cars.

name: Anonymous
comment: The cars are passing by very fast on the street and it's curved, so no chance to get a lift from driving cars. But you can talk to the drivers who stop there or stand at the end of the parking place to catch them after parking. Still took me 45 minutes to get a lift to Bebra.

name: Anonymous
comment: Maybe I was lucky, but I got a lift after 5 minutes! :D

name: Anonymous
comment: Not the best spot for cars to stop but in the morning it wasn't very busy so a car was able to stop on the ramp for me to jump in without disrupting the traffic. It took me about 20 minutes to get a lift eastwards to Magdeburg and Berlin.

name: Anonymous
comment: Most cars come from Helmstedt to go on the A2 westwards and you can see it by which line they choose. They are also slow enough and the beginning of the ramp is wide enough for a normal car to pick you up next to the "island", while others could still pass. Waited about 25 minutes.

name: Anonymous
comment: Most cars are not too fast, because of the traffic light before. Many go to the Rasthof and saw you already and might pick you up when getting back on the road. With the parking slot they can easily pull over. Took me about 40 minutes, though.

name: Anonymous
comment: Got a ride to Berlin after a little while, it has more space for people to pull over than at the bus stop just across the street, since its also a turning lane.

name: Anonymous
comment: Lots of space for cars to pull over, we stood just after the start of the turn with a Berlin sign. Police drove by, so its okay. We got a ride to Berlin after 10 minutes.

name: Anonymous
comment: bus stop, very good to get to the A8 or A7, especially direction Aalen. never took me more than 30 min.

name: Anonymous
comment:
bus stop, good place to get a ride to ulm.
Or, in the other direction, to the A7

name: Anonymous
comment: I wait single male and 20 ming I get ride

name: Anonymous
comment: Cars, which picked me up here, usually went to Grünstadt, Mannheim or Darmstadt. It should not be a problem, to get at least to the next "Rasthof" (Grünstadt, Pfalz). Enough space to stop

name: Anonymous
comment: Not too far to get to here by foot from city center. I've spoken to a local girl who told me she has seen hitchhikers standing here a few times, so I came here to give it a try. Hitchhiking to Stockholm, I got a direct ride in around 15min. I'd recommend to only accept rides going direct to Stockholm from here, there should be many drivers doing this route and this seems to be always really a good spot. You should stand right at the corner so that people coming from both your left and right side can see you. There's a good space for them to pull over right at this corner, just make sure you don't block it with your backpack and make sure you stand right at the corner so that they have time enough to think and pull over for you safely!

name: Anonymous
comment: Parking lot right behind the roundabout exit going North to A2. Two lanes but lots of traffic going through. Supermarket, kiosk and bank nearby

name: Anonymous
comment: Good place, low speed, but we try stop a car 1 hour no one stopped :(

name: Anonymous
comment: after 30 min we was in a car. low speed in red signal and high speed in green signal. We go from Dusseldorf to Cologne

name: Anonymous
comment: very hight traffic, dangerous.One man saw us, but can't to stop. He did a round (!!!) and take us, it was awesome. Thanks him.

name: Anonymous
comment: Quite good direction to get out of the castle, we stayed there abour 30-40 minutes and were picked up directly no Munich. If you don't want to walk or take any buses it's perfect place for you towards Munich

name: Anonymous
comment: Cars are not too fast and can pull over at the bus stop. A lot of cars will probably go onto the highway. So you´d have good chances to get to Dortmund or Soest.

name: Anonymous
comment: fair amount of traffic, not too much though. Average.

name: Anonymous
comment: Rather little traffic to Welver, okay to Hilbeck.

name: Anonymous
comment: Small amount of traffic.

name: Anonymous
comment: Big shoulder, most people head in direction Sauerland. One offered me a ride to brussels though.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Might be a decent starting point to get on the A7. This spot is close to the terminal stop "Anderten" of tram #5. To get to the southern gas station follow the narrow path coming from the bridge across the Mittelland Canal.
Not much traffic though. If it takes to long you can still walk to the Wülferode Service Area (A7) in the south, which might take another half an hour.
I got a lucky ride to Berlin (via A2) after waiting there 30 min.

name: Anonymous
comment:
This sercice area "Demminer Land" opend in July 2016 and is the only gas station at the A20 between Rostock an Prenzlau. It is only located at the western lane but traffic going north can excess it via a bridge. There are not many reasons why you should end up here but if you do, you can choose between going to Berlin or Rostock.
For going to Greifswald find soneone going directly there or let them drop you either at exit 27 (Gützkow) or exit 25 (Greifswald).

name: Anonymous
comment: I was searching for a direct ride towards the A96 to avoid Munich. Worked out after ca 45 minutes. Entrance of a parking place, so its good to stop there.

name: Anonymous
comment: Waited for Hike towards Friedrichshafe. A lot of traffic and no problems

name: Anonymous
comment: There is a small parking, but the cars are relatively fast and coming off a curve. Better chances with the people from the parking.

name: Anonymous
comment: Lots of space. Traffic on a sunday was rather bad, but in general it should not be a problem to get to either Werl or Soest.

name: Anonymous
comment: After the bridge there is a small stopping bay. Cars are rather fast, but it is all right.

name: Anonymous
comment: Local hitch hiking spot good for the direction Schleiden and further on the B265.

name: Anonymous
comment: A small parking spot. Direction north-west. Mostly trucks stopping here, very few cars.

name: Anonymous
comment: Direction Nürburg. Pros: very visible spot, enough place to stop. Cons: most cars going quite fast.

name: Anonymous
comment: Direction Kempenich / Mayen. Very visible spot but cars going often quite fast. Mostly local traffic but enough to get a lift closer to the motorway.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bus stop. Direction Luxembourg. Mostly local traffic but some cars go to Dasburg, near the border.

name: Anonymous
comment: There is a huge amount of traffic and the cars are not even to fast.

name: Anonymous
comment: Heading to Clausthal Zellefeld, got there by 2 lifts.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good spot to get a drive in direction Paderborn (and most likely Höxter and Detmold as well) especially in the rush hours.

name: Anonymous
comment: Nice spot right before the gas station. Cars leave from Paderborn towards Münster passing Delbrück and Rheda-Wiedenbrück. Since the street is still in the city and there are many traffic lights, cars don't go too fast here and drivers can spot you easily. One can easily walk here from the city center (20-30 min).

name: Anonymous
comment: Eaited on a fryday morning directly at the traffic light for approximatly 10 minutes with a sign "A81". Jumping into the car needed to be very quick. Just remember to ask whether they go at least to Rasthof Hegau.

name: Anonymous
comment: Going to direction Karsruhe (north) via A8 always works perfectly for me. Getting a ride depended on daytime between 10 an 20 Minutes.

name: Anonymous
comment: We thought this might be a good spot, as it is a big Autohof with McDonalds and stuff. But we were very mistaken; horrible place with only local traffic...Better go to Elwanger höhe, ca. 3km north...

name: Anonymous
comment: Not a perfect spot. We were really lucky and got a ride in a short time. Mostly local traffic!

name: Anonymous
comment:
We tried to go direction Munich from here. Did not work out and we changed our spot for the bus stop in Beethovenstr. after a while. 
There it was way better!

name: Anonymous
comment:
Not much traffic here but we waited only about 25 minutes for a ride to Konstanz.
You can stand directly on besides the ramp.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Not much traffic here but we waited only about 25 minutes for a ride to Konstanz.
You can stand directly besides the ramp.

name: Anonymous
comment: A52 direction Dusseldorf and feeder for the A3 towards Frankfurt / Main. Driveway with second lane, so that cars can stop briefly to pick you up.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Slip road onto the A52 shortly before Breitscheid.
Cars drive from both directions on the highway, and on a Sunday afternoon it is a lot. 
There is enough space for a short stop to pick you up. 
This spot is good because you can choose between different directions: Frankfurt / Main, Dusseldorf, Essen, Duisburg and direction Netherlands and Belgium.

name: Anonymous
comment: Entrance to the Autobahn, good spot because there's room for cars to stop while others can still pass. First car stopped but that guy was going the wrong direction. Waited around 20 minutes before a German guy picked me up and gave me a ride to Münich.

name: Anonymous
comment: good spot, bus stop, a lot of cars to Berlin or Hamburg

name: Anonymous
comment:
From here its possible to hitch to Stuttgard or Munich (two different exits of the roundabout), but there is mostly local traffic (should be easy to hitch to Ulm).
We tried to get to Munich and had a sign, but it took us a while. Try to find somebody who takes you to the next gas sation on the A8 in direction of Munich or better don´t get dropped here if you want to go to Munich :)

name: Anonymous
comment:
Good Spot to get a ride because there is the sign "last reststop before austria" so a lot of people want to buy the highway vignet.

We arrived in the late evening with 3 people and stood in a tent on a field behind a sound wall. Was nice to sleep. We might have got another lift but not all three at the time so we decided to start the next morning... So we did and we needed to wait around 15 minutes for a ride for all 3 of us.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Got off the Autobahn here after coming from Hamburg.
I asked people that came from IKEA if they head to the city centre of Hannover. But most IKEA visitors are from around the area (e.g. Celle) and not directly from Hannover. (There is another bigger and more modern IKEA at Hannover-Messe where Hannover people would rather go to.)
After 30 min I found a lift to Langenhagen (north of Hannover) where the tram (line 1) got me to the city centre.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Stood here with a sign "Hamburg".
Some traffic enter the Autobahn heading north on the A7. But bad spot for cars to stop.
Still got a lucky lift after 20 min, that brought us (2 ppl) to the service area Allertal (30 km).

name: Anonymous
comment: There is a bus stop, very easy to hitch-hike to Tübingen or in this direction. Maybe also possible to HH to A81 Highway. I waited 30 seconds for a lift.

name: Anonymous
comment: No space to pull over so cars have to stop on the hard shoulder. But you are easily visible.

name: Anonymous
comment: There is a small spot to pull over just after the Autobahn sign. So technically you can stand here legally (before the Autobahn sign). Advantage: Only cars going north on the A96 pass by :)

name: Anonymous
comment: Aral gas station. Good for going on B4 to Nordhausen/Bad Langensalza or A71 towards Sömmerda/Sangerhausen.

name: Anonymous
comment: super small spot to stop but the locals are friendly and don't see hitchhikers often =)

name: Anonymous
comment: small space to stop but cars are slow.

name: Anonymous
comment: just walk along this road and stick out your thump if you want to cross the Thüringer Wald

name: Anonymous
comment: A lot of people from Konstanz and Switzerland are taking the ferry and the route via Friedrichshafen to go to Munich. My girlfriend an I were standing there in the morning with a sign "Munich". A guy on the  first ferry after ours took us from there to the gas station "Landsberg am Lech". So we waited about 15min.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great place to get a ride to Denmark.. Got a ride by asking around..

name: Anonymous
comment: Cars have to stop due to the traffic light and can easily pickyou up for a ride to Güstrow or even further.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good place to stop for cars. Didn't wait more than 15 min.

name: Anonymous
comment: Should be easy to catch a ride to Witzenhausen. Shoulder is big enough. Also a lot of slow cars are coming from the highway.

name: Niko
comment: Got taken to central Munich after short wait.

name: chris8
comment: The second car stopped and took me to Bayreuth

name: chris8
comment: First car I asked took me north

name: chris8
comment: Got to Chemnitz very quickly

name: chris8
comment: Good place to get a ride to Dresden
Good spot towards the east. Got a ride until Poland, first time I used it until Dresden, never had to wait long

name: abcdefg
comment: Got a ride towards north in less than 15 minutes

name: abcdefg
comment: Left the car and got 2 lifts to Erfurt within minutes

name: Windig
comment:
Direction: Berlin

I waited there with a sign, the street leads to the motorway witch goes to berlin. The street has several entrances to stop as a driver. I am not sure how many people are intending to use the motorway thats why I rated the spot with 3 stars

name: Windig
comment:
2018
I waited there an hour, but I think the spot is okay you can talk to the people directly at the gas station or get a sign. A lot of people are going there towards north.

name: mikser572
comment: waited for a couple of hours, didn’t get a ride, only grumpy germans here, they ignore you when you go up to them
Great spot after the ferry! The road isn't a highway, so you can stand on the shoulder and hitch a ride.
Great spot after the ferry! The road isn't a highway, so you can stand on the shoulder and hitch a ride.
Great spot after the ferry! The road isn't a highway, so you can stand on the shoulder and hitch a ride.

I got offered a decent ride after 45 minutes but I passed on it because I have limited knowledge of German geography. After that it took more than two hours to get south to Hannover. Got a few offers though to go west and east.

I got offered a decent ride after 45 minutes but I passed on it because I have limited knowledge of German geography. After that it took more than two hours to get south to Hannover. Got a few offers though to go west and east.
Good spot in my opinion, on the highway and lots of traffic heading south
Great spot, got three offers in 25 minutes.
Great spot, got three offers in 25 minutes.
Unless you want to go to Fulda this is absolute shit.
No traffic at this spot, I went in desperation and managed to beg the first car for a ride though.,but only that one car came in the 25 minutes I there.
No traffic at this spot, I went in desperation and managed to beg the first car for a ride though.,but only that one car came in the 25 minutes I there.
Got one (very good) offer in 25 minutes in the dark.

Wanted to get to Soltau to the A7 - the signs didn't work. Went to that spot because cars going direction of Soltau use this way - made a sign which said "B 209" and got a ride to Amlinghausen from whereon I easily caught a ride to the A7
Onto A7 coming from Lunenburg
Not too many cars on that Sanifair... Maybe the "Autohof" in Soltau is a better spot. Most cars there are going to Hannover, eventually you will find a ride
Got a lift to the motorway A7
Got a lift to Ulm
Wanted to go to munich but most of the cars here just drive to Ulm, so we walked to another spot
We got a lift to vienna directly, the spot is better than it seems

name: Anonymous
comment:
There are not that many cars on Saturday afternoon. I couldn't get a ride to Berlin after ~2 hours waiting.
The next gas station 350 m north is more popular due to lower prices. It might be a better option.

name: Anonymous
comment: There are quite a lot of drivers using this gas station but it still took me ~1.5 hours to get a ride to Berlin.

name: Anonymous
comment: It felt like not that many drivers use this gas station. But after 2 mins waiting I asked at the arrived car with DD-plates and they gave me a ride all the way to Dresden. I guess I was lucky that day!
